choices: Remain Human & Be blessed with Light.
Remain Human & have the Power of Darkness & Cloak of Invisibility.
Become a good elf with mental powers and nature's aid.
Become a dark elf with mental powers and dark spirits' aid.
1.content:
The last thing you remember was lying in bed staring at the ceiling. You were thinking about your life, all that you wish you would have accomplished by now, and your need for a little excitement. You drifted off to sleep and entered the world of dreams.
Or did you?
You are now in a dark forest. The trees are as ancient as time and moan as the wind tickles the leaves.
In the distance you see a bright, white light and are summoned to it.
A wizard, dressed in a flowing white robe speaks to you.

"You have been chosen, my friend, for a journey."

"Why have I been chosen?" you ask.

"There are great forces in the spiritual realm that are beyond your comprehension. They have chosen you because of the courage and wisdom you have displayed in your life thus far. You hold the key to the resolution."

Hoping you are not sounding too silly, you ask, "Is there a conflict?"

"Oh, yes," replies the wizard. "And you will learn of it as you journey forward. There are others that have been chosen as well, but not all will choose the same path as you. You will face many decisions and the first is now before you."

You wish the wizard would be more clear, but you can see he is not disclosing any more information at this time. Besides, it's a dream so you just go with it.

He hands you a scroll, listing your choices.

1. You will remain human and be blessed with the power of light. You will be able to cause temporary blindness to your enemies, and create large amounts of piercing light. You also have the ability to control light sources: from blowing out candles to illuminating torches.

2. You will remain human and have the power of darkness. You will be able to create complete darkness as far as a 1 mile around you on all sides. You will have a magical cloak that when the hood is worn, you will become invisible, but beware of using it too often, as it will have dire consequences!

3. You will be transformed into a good elf. You will gain mental powers and insights, able to send telepathic messages and images. You will be close to nature, respecting it, befriending it; therefore nature will befriend you and come to your aid when needed.

4. You will be transformed into a dark elf. You will gain mental powers and insights, able to send confusion and chaos to the minds of your enemies. You will be close to the spirits of the dark forest and swamps, and they will serve you upon command.

5. Remain exactly as you are.

The wizard awaits your decision.
1.title: Beginnings

11.content:
"You have made a wise choice."

The wizard raises his wand, and in a flash of light you are transformed. You can feel the difference as new strength and clarity of mind comes to you. You notice your hands are glowing white.

The wizard smiles and says, "There is one more choice you have to make, and I'm sure it will be an easy one! Would you prefer to be male or female? This will have no bearing on your abilities, but may give you certain advantages or disadvantages in the long run!"
11.title: Gender Smender - Human/Light

choices: You decide to test out your new found powers.
You decide to start your journey North.
111.content:
Immediatley your wish is granted and the wizard says, "Be cautious on your journey. The Mystical Forest holds powers unknown to you. You have been lightly equipped in your transformation, and before you reach the edge of the forest will have opportunities to increase your skills and gain weapons. Beware of the one called Domarion, for his power is great and he seeks to destroy you."

"Before you go great wizard, I implore you, please tell me more of my mission."

"Alright, but quickly," he says, drawing closer.
Continuing in a low voice he shares, "A great conflict is brewing between the forces of good, which are to the North and South, and the forces of evil which are to the East and West. This forest has always been considered neutral ground, and for this moment still is. But soon it will be a bloody battleground."
The wizard pauses with a sorrowful look in his eye, as if he is seeing the future.
"You have been brought here alone and in secret, chosen because of your exceptional abilities - your sharp mind, able body, and strong personality. The fate of the forest and this realm will rest in your hands, and the hands of others just like yourself, who have also been chosen."

"What is causing the conflict?" you ask, still confused.

"I don't have time to go into this now. You will learn as you travel. Be careful who you befriend. Some can give you invaluable insight and help, and others live only to decieve and destroy you."

Then the wizard, in a flash of light, disappears from sight, leaving you alone in the forest.
You can hear his voice in the wind saying, "You need to journey to the Empire of Light, far to the North. There you will gain perfection in your new craft and complete understanding and direction."
111.title: Your Mission - Empire of Light (M)

1111.content:
You are alone now. You look down and notice you are wearing different clothing, in the colors of the dawn. A small orb is hidden in a pouch on your belt.
You have developed an excellent sensitivty to light (or lack of). Even though the forest is dark, you know exactly where the sun is and from that, the time of day.
You feel different - feeling the power coursing through your veins and confidence to start your journey.

Your hands are glowing white and you decide to test your powers. Raising your hands, you wish light upon the forest. The forest, for as far as you can see is illuminated, and you are impressed with your own abilities.
But the light is not wanted in this dark forest, and you hear an unusual scream not far, to the west.
1111.title: Illumination (M)

choices: Use your magic to blind them
11111.content:
You head towards the scream,
wondering if your new powers
can help whoever or whatever
is in danger. The glowing of
your blessedness illuminates
the forest around you, which
is a large help.

You make it to a large opening,
where you see a girl running
through. Behind her are three
shadowy figures, which seem to
be chasing the girl. You feel
that this is the perfect chance
to test your skills.

You run into the opening, the
light of your blessedness
frightening the shadowy figures.
11111.title: A Girl In Peril (M)

111112.content:
You choose to blind them quickly with your illumination. They, off guard, are knocked to the rocky soil and the girl quickly flee past you into the forest further.

The beasts are revealed to be knocked out, so you had no worry. You realize that light can be used as a weapon as well, if you put your mind to it...

You glance back at where the girl had run off to, but the night grows much darker than your usual darkness.

You wonder if you should check what these foul beings have in possession or if you should follow the girl to make sure if she's all right by herself.
111112.title: Light Barrier

choices: Take the knife and try to use your powers to determine what the face on the knif
Leave the knife and try to catch up with the girl
1111121.content: You examine the bodies of the dark creatures, they almost seem to be made of the darkness, a strange knife is lying next to them. There are strange glowing runes written on the side. As you look more closely you see an image of what looks to be a human face etched into the glass, it is moving, the mouth is opening and closing as if to tell you something, but what...
1111121.title: The Creatures and the Knife

is it going too kill me . before i could do anything, it spoke too me it sounded like a females voice. come with me she said . the wizard ask me too watch over you.i will help you. come now , she said we don't have much time, the evil one has felt your presence in the forest, and has sent some of his creatures too kill you. i took hold of her hand, she lead me too a hill, with her other hand she streched it towards the hill ,and uttered something in a strange language. a opening appered we walked in and it shut. you will be safe here, she said. the place was beautiful, it was illumanated by magic , i could see that she was a elfin lady, she glissened in the light like a diamond. i've never seen such beauty in my life. i will hide you here untill the danger has past, she said. but then you must go, time is short, i will always be close. just utter the word elfra and i will appear she said too me. the danger has past you must hurry. i stepped out of the hill, and back onto the trail. i started going north again, soon i came too a place where the trail split. which way should i go?

You choose the spring with bare ground.

Walking along the pathway, you begin to feel hungry and thirsty. Feeling around in your pockets, you realize that when that "DANG" Wizard said "Lightly equipped" he meant that you were provided with no food or drink. You find a water pouch (empty) in one of the pockets, and look around for a water source. Walking toward a rushing sound, you encounter two springs. One has plenty of plants growing around it, the other has just a bare ground. You have a choice to make.
111122.title: Choices, Choices.

1111221.content:
You crouch down and drink from the spring with a lot of plants. You take a couple of sips until you're nourished enough to continue on your journey. You stand up and stretch your relaxed body while you gaze and stare at the breathtaking tall mountains that lie in front of you. You turn your back around and see the green lush forest that you have somehow exited out of. You turn your head to your left next and see that the sun is slowly setting down.

You close your eyes and you listen to surroundings as well. The faint gust of the wind catches your attention the most and you can' t hear anything else. You open your eyes and you decide to make another decision.

You wonder if you should continue your journey when night falls. You can arrive at your destination quicker but your fatigue can disadvantage in any terrible situation.

You also wonder if you should just stay out here for the night. You'll feel refreshed in the morning if you are lucky enough to not get ambushed during your stay.

What' s your choice?
1111221.title: The Heavenly Spring (M)

1111222.content: You drink from the spring absent of plants. You feel weak all of a sudden, and fall to the ground. A burning pain begins in your stomach and spreads outward. The last thing you ever think is: "oops". The spring you drank from had passed through certain mineral beds, turning it into a quick-acting, powerful poison. You die.

You are alone now. You look down and notice you are wearing different clothing, in the colors of the dawn. A small orb is hidden in a pouch on your belt.
You have developed an excellent sensitivty to light (or lack of). Even though the forest is dark, you know exactly where the sun is and from that, the time of day.

1112.title: On Your Way? (M)

choices: Attempt to go around the swamp.
11121.content:
You trek forward, quietly and swiftly, through the dense forest. A light breeze tickles your face and sends lifeless leaves swirling to the earthen floor. The terrain is becoming softer and flatter, and large patches of mushrooms abound. The trees are slowly changing to grey skelectons as you enter a swampy section of the forest. You hear the eerie song of frogs and the occassional disturbance of the water. The breeze has stopped and the air is as stagnant as the swamp before you, stale and lifeless.
You stop short of liquid earth as your eyes scan the surroundings. The swap goes for as far as you can see both to your left and right, nor can you see the end in front of you. But it must end - of course it must. And your destiny lies on the other side.
11121.title: Approaching the Swamp (M)

choices: Use your branch to block the creature.
111211.content:
You determine their is but one logical course, and that is straight through the murky waters. You grab a long branch off the ground, which will come in handy determining the waters depth, and help you push forward over the soggy ground.
You step foward, your first step into the filmy water. The water is lukewarm as it soaks through your shoes. Your steps are heavy as your feet long to sink into the bottoms slush. The branch is before you always, testing the depths. As you walk farther, the water is becoming deeper. It has now risen to a small height above your knees.
You scan the swamp and can see patchy places where it appears to be more shallow. Patches of water lilies and moss float on the surface, but mostly the water is filmy and thick on the surface.
You stop, listening. You heard a disturbance in the water, and it was not you. Scanning the water, you see nothing, as you wait, listening and watching.
Suddenly a large splash behind you! You jump and turn just in time to see a hideous creature, jaws open wide, nearly upon you! If you do not act fast you will certainley be destroyed!
111211.title: Crossing Over (M)

1112111.content:
You stand your ground. Your branch blocks the creatures blow. The branch snaps as the creatures jaws bear down. The jaw stabs his gums and only angers him.
You try to get away from the creature, but your feet have sank in the muddy floor from standing in one place for so long. Your hesitation is just enough time for the creature to rid himself of the branch and come towards you again.
You duck down, going beneath the water as your feet slip out of your shoes. With your feet free, you begin to swim.
The creature is much too quick, and with one turn of his scaly long neck he spies you. His powerful jaws open and come crushing in. You feel something take hold as you are lifted out of the water. With a flip of the neck, the creature has tossed you in the air, opening his mouth wide to catch you.
You try to blind him with your light, but it is too late, as you slide down his throat.
You are now swamp monster food.

Meanwhile, back in your realm, your body twitches and jerks, then lays still. You just died in your sleep. Hope your dreams are better next time!
1112111.title: Ah, No (M)

1112112.content:
You try to dodge the creature, but have stood too long in one place! Your feet have been surrounded in muck, making quick movement extremely difficult! Your body tries to move but your feet will not, and the creature comes down upon you, jaws sinking deep into your flesh. With an agonizing cry, you hit the water, sinking underneath it. Finally, your feet are loosed from the muck as the creature releases his jaws to get a better grip.
Instinctively kicking and flailing your arms, causes you to change position enough that the creatures regrip is unsucessful. You begin to swim as fast as you can, despite the pain in your torso. The splashing of the confused creature behind you alerts that he is giving chase. Swimming with every ounce of energy within towards dry ground, you leave a river of blood in your wake.
You reach a portion of water too shallow to swim, just as the creature is upon you again. But this time it's the swamp creature who is out of luck, for the water is too shallow and he cannot survive on land.
Dragging yourself upon the soft dirt, you are panting, bleeding and exhausted - but alive.
1112112.title: Attack of the Swamp Creature (M)

11121121.content:
Some time has passed as you rest on the banks of the Swamp of the Ghost River. Waves of exhaustion flood over you as you bleed and struggle to remian conscious.
A warmth comes over your body as you are made aware of a presence. Perhaps you have stumbled upon a dream, you think, as you see a bright light. Emmerging from the light, a beautiful woman, dressed in white and shades of blue. Her eyes a deep blue, her hair a golden blonde. Large, silver wings flow gracefully from her back. Her movements are delicate and beautiful; she must be a dream.
The world fades to black and your eyes close.
When you awake you are in a strange room. Everything has a soft glow, as if you are still in a dream.
"I must have died," you think.
The woman you saw earlier enters the room. She is an angel. Helping you sit up, she hands you a cup containing steaming liquid. It smells minty and taste like tea. The warmness of the liquid flows down your throat, into your belly, and your entire body begins to feel warm and relaxed.

You try to speak but the angel stops you, "Sshhh. You are healing and need your rest."
11121121.title: The Room (M)

111211211.content:
"Where am I?" you ask anyway. "Have I died?"

The angles smiles softly with a kind look on her face. Her voice is very sweet as she answers, "You have not died, my dear. You are in the city of angels up in the clouds, where you will stay until you are fully healed."

You let out a sigh of relief. "How long until I am healed?"

"You will find your wounds will heal very quickly here. You are already half way there. I brought you here, for you would have surely been devoured by the evilness of the forest had you been left lying there helpless."

"Thank you," you respond, mustering a slight smile. "What is your name?"

"My name is Annika."

Your eyes are soon too heavy to keep open and you once again drift off to sleep.
111211211.title: City of Angels (M)

1112112111.content:
As you drift off to sleep, you are visited by dreams...

You are back home, lying in your bed. The morning light is streaming in through your mini blinds. Looking at the clock you realize it is 7:45am. Rubbing your eyes you arise.
Shuffling out your bedroom door, the house is quiet and you are alone. Walkin into the kitchen and open the refridgerator, you are surprised by a blindingly bright light and a burst of hot air. You quickly slam the door shut.
Hearing a noise from behind, you spin around. It's the wizard who brought you to the forest!
He stands there in your kitchen in his white flowing robe holding his magical staff. His beard stark white, eye brows protruding from his narrow face.

"All I wanted was a glass of milk," you think outloud, "but instead I get the wizard."

On the end of his wand is a dark glass ball. He lowers it as you look closely. Inside you see a group of people in a circle, arguing. In the middle are large papers with sketches. Upon further inspection, it looks to be battle plans. The scene changes as dark elves, both beautiful and hideous at the same time, slit the throats of the woodland elves. They have ambushed them in the forest. Orcs are destroying the forest to fuel their fires for weapons: horrible, terrbile weapons of steel and granite. Ugly, evil goblins attack dwarves in the mountins, slaughtering entire families. Then a castle, black and twisted in the twilight, appears. A dark cloud looms over it and it shoots a lightning bolt, illuminating the face of a giant red goblin. He grins evily, lusting for blood.
You pull back and stare at the wizard, who then turns and directs your gaze to the living room. Hearing angry voices, you inch closer to see. It is the voices of your father and uncle, and suddenly you are a young child again.
You look around the corner just in time to see your uncle lob a punch, hitting your father directly in the face. Blood spills from his nose and runs down his white shirt. Your father tries to defend himself, but your uncle has grabbed something in his coat. His cruel expression is like a knife in your soul. You watch and listen as your father begs for mercy. There is no mercy in his brother's eyes or the cold blue steel. Time freezes as you hear a loud bang...
In an instant they are gone and you are looking at the wizard again. Tears well up in your eyes as you shake your head in disbelief.

"You were young," says the wizard softly. "It was a shame you saw those things. Even now, your only memory is in dreams, because your conscious mind refuses to remember such horrid times. Your mother had a mental breakdown and you were taken by the state, soon adopted."

Wiping a tear you ask, "Why did he do it?"

The wizard continued, a sorrowful expression on his face. "Jealousy perhaps. He had been harboring it for years, for he was in love with your mother. Your father and uncle were in business together. I'm not sure what set your uncle off, but he was looking for a reason. Your father did no wrong. He was honest and held in high regards."

Your shoulders shake uncontrollably as you sob.....and awake.
1112112111.title: The Dream (M)

choices: Ask for instruction on how to complete the quest.
Ask to explore the city - you need time alone to think.
11121121111.content:
"What have your dreams told you?"

The sweet voice of Annika comes to your mind as you slowly open your eyes. She wipes a tear that has made a path down your cheek.

"I dreamt of this world and then of mine. I saw the past and the present. I may have seen the future, although I'm not certain."

"Do you understand how they connect?" The angel sits beside the bed, a warm glow around her.

"I...I'm not really sure."

Handing you some mint tea, the angel explains, "The things you saw in this realm were the past, present, and potential future if we do not win this war. The things you saw in your life are true and the reason you have been chosen."

Sipping the warm healing tea you say, "I don't understand. What does that have to do with me coming here?"

"You have not dealt with the tradgedy life has handed you. Things that are not dealt with refuse to be ignored. You harbor an intense desire to see justice served and peace reign. But you will never find peace until you face the turmoil that came to you so early in life. This world, this realm; this is your chance to face the ugliness and hatred and turn it around, serving justice."

"Even if I face these things here, that does nothing for the world I have to return to!"

"On the contrary," Annika continues, "You will find that things will change if you suceed."

"It won't bring my father back! And it won't heal my mother's mind!"

Annika's eyes speak to your soul. Not in words, but a feeling deep inside. Somehow you understand that this quest you have been chosen for is worthwhile. If you accomplish it, things in your world will come together. The need to fulfill this mission is now burning in your soul like a blazing fire. You must finish this. It is your destiny and your world. It is your life if you do not.
11121121111.title: Interpretation (M)

choices: do you take the path of the star
do you take the path of the feather
111211211111.content:
the beautiful angel looks at you as you ask her for the directions.
"follow your instincts, they will not lead you afowl. you have been granted powers beyond that which you know. use this power. get to the empire of light. there you will find what you truly and unknowingly seek."
you go to ask the angel another question, but everything turns to mist and disappears before your eyes. suddenly you are back in the swamp. you look around and see a white star carved into a tree. as you look around, you also see a white feather also carved into a different tree.

choices: a meeting room or a hall
11121121211.content:
" But how?", you wonder out loud.

Annika turns to you and, with a small smile, says, " Ahh, if I told you straight out, you would not be able to think for yourself what you need to do."

As you think through this, she walks toward the door.

"Wait!" you cry. She turns, one of her perfect eyebrows raised. You were going to ask many questions, but in the end, you say weakly, " Am I healed?"

She gives you a sad smile. " Physically." With that, she firmly shuts the door. You can barely hear her footsteps go farther and farther away.

"Thanks for the help." you mutter. Getting out of bed, you change into a nice blue tunic and some dark pants. You are about to see what books could be on the bookshelf in the room, but then think of something that you could ask her. You quickly open the door, and...fall flat on your face. The threshold is slightly raised, and it is pitch black outside the room. You mutter to yourself, then use your hands, held arm-length in front of you, to light the way. The walls and spiral stairs that you cross in your journey out of this building are covered with huge murals that either glow in the dark, can be switched on or off, or are sparkly. Glimpses provide you with very strange adventure stories. As you pass a flying elf swinging a rainbow colored triangular prism at a huge swimming ant with a pitchfork, you realize that the triangular prism is a door. You open the door and find...
11121121211.title: Ask for wisdom on how to complete the quest.

choices: Pack and leave on the journey now
111211212112.content:
Somehow you seemed to have bypassed the swamp, for you are now at the foot of large, majestic mountains. A cold breeze sweeps off the slopes, causing you to shiver. You take a step out onto hard ground. There is hardly any vegetation here. Another step, and a buffet of the wind sends a shiver up your spine. There are still a few hours left before the sun sets according to your senses, but the day is already dark; the sunlight blocked by the mountains. Looking down, you realize that you are in no way equipped to start on a journey when you have no idea how long it'll be.

Quickly, you step back inside the doorway to get away from the strong wind. You mutter again to light your hands and return through the building the way you came until you reach your room. There you find that someone has brought some food and set it upon a table- a large loaf of bread, some meat, fruit and a flask of some liquid. Realizing that you hadn't eaten in a while, you sit down to the simple meal.

As you sit in a chair after the meal, you consider what you should do. It would be almost dark outside once you found your way there again, and all you would have to bring with you would be the remains of the meal you just ate. However, it seemed imperative to continue on your quest as soon as possible. But perhaps it would be better to stay the night and wait till morning to leave. Perhaps then you could also find more food somewhere.
111211212112.title: Past the Swamp

1112112121122.content:
You decide, after a judicious sweep of the area, to stay for a night. You're confident that no predators will bother you.

But you really should know better by now...

At night banging awakes you. You slip into some clothes and move towards the door. There's a soft yellow light outlining your bedroom door. This means that the living room on the other side was illuminated.

Hesitant - but remember this is an adventure right? You're protagonist powers shouldn't vanish until you do something REALLY profound - you open the door.

The living room is lit with candles in the shape of curvaceous women, and the bare floors and walls have been replaced with silk cushions, plush carpets, and tapestries beautifully woven. On the table is a platter of food, piled high. On one end, a man dressed in a black suit is dining quietly.

You catch a glimpse of sharp teeth in the man. A vampire. No doubt what that red liquid in those wine cups are then.

"Care to join me?" asked the vampire, not looking up from his food. "I have a side-job that I like to offer to anyone intrepid enough to take it. Feel free to decline of course. Just go back to bed and when you wake up, it'll have have seemed like a dream."

What do you do?
1112112121122.title: Stay at least the night

111212.content:
You carefully trudge through the swampy terrain. Your light boots are beneficial, you move easily across the sludge.
You pass dead trees and terrifying creatures inside them. The sky; ever darkening, is now grey, but as far north as you can see there is a range of mountains.

From behind the mountains a ray of light shines towards you, as if to guide you.

You consider your choices:
111212.title: Attempt to go around the swamp.

choices: Follow the child to the village.
Try to press on to the Mountains before dawn.
1112121.content:
Abruptly you come to a ridge that rises from the murky water, covered with bushes. The sun has long sank beneath the tops of the trees, beginning to dip below the horizon. The trees cast long shadows that billow with the wind, dancing around you like the worshipers in some unspeakable rite. The forest becomes silent abruptly, just as a new third eye deep in your being loses sight of the sun completely.

"Who are you?"

You're not entirely surprised. This is exactly what would happen in one of those stories you used to read as a little kid. You turn around. The voice belongs to an adolescent in a dark red cloak. The child's face seems almost too pretty to be a boy, but at the same time his little body seems a bit too broad to be a girl. The icy blue gaze below the hood regard you without fear, only some suspicion.

"My name is not important," you reply. "I am passing on my way north. How far to the edge of the forest?"

The child seems to consider it for a moment, but the eyes never leave yours. You feel a bit lightheaded suddenly, but you don't let it show.

"You'll never make it there. Not in the dark," the child says. Before you can argue, he marches past. "Come. You will stay at my village."

You follow, but there is still one thing stuck in the back of your mind: how did the child approach without stepping on a single branch, or even a dead leaf?
1112121.title: Slight Detour

11121211.content:
Your mind feels a bonfire to the northwest, about a mile, before your eyes see it. The child steps nimbly onto rocks and over roots; you, meanwhile, just manage to keep up without making too much noise.

"I never asked for your name," you say. "If you don't care to tell me, that's fine."

"No, that's quite alright. My name's Samuel," he says. "I don't like secrets." he adds accusingly.

You can't help but feel a little guilty, but the words of the Wizard echo through your mind, and you stick to your decision. Another thought forms in your mind, more a dim feeling like deja vu than anything else, but still--

"I was to understand that no one lived in the Swamp of the Ghost River."

Samuel chuckles. "No one's been to the Swamp in three centuries to find out if that was true."

Something deep inside tells you that this isn't exactly true, but still you press on. The orb in your pocket feels suddenly warm, but you know that this is just your mind reasserting its presence rather than a spell.

The next mile passes in the deathly silence of the Swamp. You follow Samuel on top of the ridge, keeping the stagnant water to your left and the forest to your right. Soon you can make out the fire with your eyes. Not long after you can make out the dark, solid shapes of houses. When you pass through the gate, you can see that the village is indeed trapped in an era that must have passed. Several of the houses seem ancient and decrepit. The stones of the structures are covered with moss, the doors rotting on their hinges. The roofs were once thatched, but now old wood is nailed to a few places where the grass seems to have rotten out or blown away by unruly wind. The only other uniform feature of the houses is that the windows are completely shuttered. The boards covering the windows are new, and do not seem to open.

You notice a group of people, around fifteen, standing around the fire. At the sound of footsteps, they all turn. Their cloaks are all exact copies (fit to each person's size, of course) of Samuel's.

A taller man steps forward. "You've been gone three nights, Samuel Oakvale!"

"Aye, sir, trapped by the irregular movements of the Sun these past few days."

The man regards you. A woman steps forward, passing the man and approaching you.

"Who this be? Who this be?"

"A traveller I found trying to route the Swamp. Says he's going to yon Mountains."

"His name, Samuel." five of them groan in unisom. "What is his name?"

"Didn't say." Samuel glances at you.

"Is he human?" The man asks.

"Yesss." The woman touches your cheek.

The man approaches you. You are struck by his handsome face, which seems without age.

"Forgive our eccentricities, my good fellow. We here in the Wild Wood have seen few in several centuries. Allow us to house you for the night. The forest is a dangerous place at night, and the foothills of the Mountains are far from here."

You don't know much, but you know the Great Dark Forest hasn't been called the Wild Wood in a milenium.
11121211.title: The Village in the Swamp

111212111.content:
"Thank you. I would be most honored," you reply. They don't seem to be threatening in any way, and you didn't want to offend them. Besides, if they meant you any harm, you'd prefer to it to be while you were on your guard, instead of somewhere out there in the swamp.

"Good. Perhaps you would care to join us for some nourishment?" He indicated a large cauldron on the fire. You hesitate. They could be trying to drug or poison you- you dare not trust anyone, after what the wizard said. But then again, if everyone ate out of the same pot... but they seemed strange- not quite normal. Perhaps it wouldn't affect them. But the man was still politely waiting for an answer.
111212111.title: Housing, but food?

1112121111.content:
"Yes, I will have some food," you say. They begin to smile, but you add, "But, I insist, let someone get food before me. Tis the custom in my land."

The man's smile widens. "Of course, my good man. My name is Jedidaiah Broomsmith. I'm the mayor of Sunset Point. My kinsmen have lived here in solitude for centuries, ever since Father River was swallowed by the Wild Wood. We've seen so few."

The other villagers had begun to make a line. You file in somewhere in the first half. When you finally reach the cauldron, you are met by a striking beauty with dark hair and piercing green eyes. But she smiles and pours some soup in a small bowl. It is purple, with a few red and green herbs mixed in.

"Made from the crushed flowers of a nightshade lavender," the beauty says. "Makes a soup of deepest purple, but tis delightful."

You look at her, and sip from the bowl. The taste is exquisite, somewhere between cheddar cheese and peanut butter. You take a bigger gulp.

The beauty laughs. "The visitor enjoys the nightshade soup!"

The other villagers laugh heartily. You hold your empty bowl out to the beauty, who graciously fills it up again.

"You need not have too much, lad," she says. "Makes you sick if you have too much."

You nod and try to savor the soup as you walk away. Samuel smiles at you with some of the most perfect teeth you've ever seen. You can't help but smile back. You look around at everyone's smiling faces and it makes you so very happy. You laugh, and seven people laugh with you. Samuel wraps an arm around your shoulders. Your body sings a symphony of wonderful sensation as he touches you.

"Are you enjoying yourself?"

You laugh. "That feels amazing."

"What?" His voice seems to come after an eternity, which is strange. You know it hasn't been more than a second. "What feels amazing? This?"

He rubs your shoulder a little bit. The sensations are incredible, delightful. You chuckle bashfully. Your eyes close a bit. An hour passes in fifteen seconds.

"Ah..."

"You like this, do you?"

You feel a little weird, but respond truthfully. "Yeah, kinda."

"Mind if I help?" The beautiful soup girl steps over. She rubs your back. Your eyes roll back in your head. You make a noise in your throat. She giggles.

You hear some drums start up a lively beat. You feel the beat in your being. You want to dance to it, and find yourself doing so, albeit sloppily. The girl dances with you, her elegance more than compensating for your awful dancing. She stares into your eyes, her hands roaming, pausing to rub your chest and stomach, and the smallest touch almost brings you to your knees. She kisses you, and you kiss her back, barely aware that you are doing so, reality is a dream, nothing you do really matters anyway. Your hands find her hips, marveling at the soft linen of her robe. Behind her, the villagers have begun a sort of line dance, all standing in a group. Jedidiah starts up a song in a strange language. The villagers respond in the same tongue. Another girl joins you and the three of you start to move toward the group. The soup girl kisses your neck, her hand disappears underneath your robe and rubs your chest. Samuel approaches you. You feel a bit optimistic, thinking that he might join in.

At this thought, your wits return. Revulsion washes over you as you analyze his slight frame, the frame of a child. But you spot the athame, old and encrusted with rubies, in his hand and are overcome by a completely different emotion. You're still under the drug's influence, however, and your motor skills might not be up to the task of helping you out of this.
1112121111.title: Agree to eat with them

choices: Try and run-you don't know them.
11121211112.content:
You watch him carefully, trying to keep up appearances and go along with the two girls sucking on your ear and chest. You carefully watch as he approaches with the blade, smiling that beautiful smile, and the soup girl picks it up and raises it high.

A ray of blinding white-blue light shoots across the village into the soup girl's temple. When your eyes adjust (rather quickly) you see it is an arrow. The girl crumbles to dust. The athame falls to the ground and gets stuck in the ground. Samuel's eyes darken.

"AMBUSH!" he screams. Several more light arrows dash across the village, killing the other girl and several of the other villagers. You step back, shakily, and try to run. Jedidaiah grabs you by your hair and begins to pull you back into the village.

Another arrow shoots into him and he disintegrates.

"NOOOOO!" Samuel shrieks.

You hear several light voices, almost bell-like in resonance, and you see the archers running into the village. There are only seven of them, all fair, tall, and lean. Their faces were painted and/or tattooed in intricate designs in bright colors. Their ears all have a high point on the top of their ears.

The villagers shriek and disappear into the shadows. Samuel alone remained. He stares at you. The piercing look in his eyes unnerves you.

"You will pay for the calamity that has befallen my home."

With that, he vanishes into the night.

You turn carefully and face the others.
11121211112.title: Wait and think first.

choices: Go with them (really, what chance do you have of surviving alone?)
111212111121.content:
You stand there on unsteady legs and analyze the elves. There are five males, all of them glaring intensly into the darkness around the village. One of the females, a bit shorter than the other, looked disinterested verging on bored. The other has her eyes trained on you and steps over. You open your mouth to thank her, but she slaps you.

"You IDIOT!" she yells. "How could you be so stupid as to take food from these things?! Have you never been in the forest at night?"

"No," you mutter. "I haven't." With this, you sink to the ground. The world slides unsteadily. You feel that you might be sick.

The elf girl pales a bit (which you find remarkable; did she have color in her face to lose?). She grabs your arm and pulls you up, propping you on her shoulder. "We might need to get him to the camp."

"I'll say," one of the males, the most attractive, says from the cauldron. "Nightshade lavender. Even more potent for humans. I'll bet he's had an interesting evening."

"I thought that if everyone ate some before me..."

"You wouldn't be poisoned," the other elf girl finishes. "Poor guy."

"No time to sit and chat," another of the males, this one in a white robe, interjects. "We've got to move. If he's to survive, we need to move for the foothills and soon."

The male by the cauldron pulls a jar from his pack and fills it with nightshade soup. "This stuff will go for a fine price back home."

"Hurry, Jak." the robed one says. "We need to leave as soon as possible."

"They won't come back if we're here," Jak says. "Just relax, Master Oakstaff."

"They will if they bring more monsters from the swamp!" the other elf-girl snaps. "We have to move! Now!"

Another male, this one a bit ruddy in complexion, steps over and swoops you into his arms. "I'll take him, Nelumba."

"Wait," you say. The elves stop and look at you.
111212111121.title: Thank them.

11121212.content:
You turn around the other way while the child isn`t looking, thinking it`s a trap. You trek toward the mountains.

As you near the mountains, the murky, muddy, damp earth turns into rock, gravel, and dirt. You finally make it to the mountain`s base, darkness already surronding you. You continue up the mountains. You notice that it gets colder and colder as you climb up. Not a good sign, considering how far you have left. After making it 1/3 up the mountain, you spot a cave and decide to spent the night in there. However, as you peek inside the cave you notice seven or so goblins performing a strange ritual by a fire, with ominous skulls and various bones laying around.

It would be dangerous to confrot the goblins, you`ve been traveling the whole day, but if you keep going you may freeze to death. You check the weapon in your sheath to find a dagger, the handle is made out of pure platinum, along with a silver blade. You think over your options...
11121212.title: Freezing Mountain

111212122.content:
With all seven of those goblins fighting against a very tired you, there's no doubt in your mind it wouldn't end well. Sheathing the dagger and wrapping your arms around yourself in an attempt to stop shivering, you forge onward, up the mountain. The path ahead of you is nearly swallowed by darkness, but then you suddenly are reminded of your new powers. Curiously, you hold up your palm to experiment.

It starts to glow a bright, white light, and from it a small, floating ball of light arises. It hovers a few feet above your head, providing an illuminated circle around you. Things are bright in every direction around you for about twenty feet. As you take another few steps, the ball of light follows you.

"This is conveinent," you smile to yourself, although the light does not provide any additional warmth. Still, you've got to be thankful for what you've got. Now that the mountainside is visible to you again, you continue to make your way up the steep terrain.
111212122.title: An Orb of Light

choices: You decide to begin your journey to the Empire of Light.
You decide to test out your new found powers.
112.content:
Immediatley your wish is granted and the wizard warns, "Be cautious on your journey. The Mystical Forest holds powers unknown to you. You have been lightly equipped in your transformation, and before you reach the edge of the forest will have opportunities to increase your skills and gain weapons. Beware of the one called Domarion, for his power is great and he seeks to destroy you."

"Before you go great wizard, I implore you, please tell me more of my mission."

"Alright, but quickly," he says as he draws closer to you.
Continuing in a low voice he shares, "A great conflict is brewing between the forces of good, which are to the North and South, and the forces of evil, which are to the East and West. This forest has always been considered neutral ground, and for this moment still is. But soon it will be a bloody battleground."
The wizard pauses with a sorrowful look in his eyes, as if he is seeing the future.
"You have been brought here alone and in secret, chosen because of your exceptional abilities - your sharp mind, able body, and strong personality. The fate of the forest and this realm will rest in your hands, and the hands of others just like yourself, who have also been chosen."

"What is causing the conflict?" you ask, still confused.

"I don't have time to go into this now. You will learn as you travel. Be careful who you befriend in this forest. Some can give you invaluable insight and help, and others live only to decieve and destroy you," the wizard informs.

The wizard, in a flash of light, disappears from sight, leaving you alone in the forest.
You can hear his voice in the wind saying, "You need to journey to the Empire of Light, far to the North. There you will gain perfection in your new craft and complete understanding and direction."
112.title: Your Mission (F)

choices: You decide to walk through the swamp.
You decide to walk around the swamp.
1121.content:
You are alone now. You look down and notice you are wearing different clothing, in the colors of the dawn. A small orb is hidden in a pouch on your belt.
You have developed an excellent sensitivty to light (or lack of). Even though the forest is dark and the trees block the sun, you instictively know exactly where the sun is and from that, the time of day.
You feel different - you can feel power coursing through your veins and confidence to start your journey.

From your research, you conclude that the Wizard would most likely retire to the North section of the forest, so you follow his voice and the faint path of light that deminishes almost instantly.

Your journey takes you to a very large swampy section. The depth of the murky, grey, water, cannot be determined, neither cen you see the ending of the swamp from either side. You can see a clearing straight ahead in the distance, and conclude that the swap was once a river, now stagnant with the stentch of death. You must cross or go around.

Recalling a story you once read of a swap; It used to be a mighty river, powerful and great, until the evilness of the Forest dammed it up at two ends. The Forest wanted the Great River all to itself. The River could not overcome the dams, and despite all efforts became stagnant and dead. But the River is bitter, poisonous, and will try to kill anyone or anything who comes near.
1121.title: Going North (F)

11211.content:
Going around the swamp may take days, and will throw you off course. You can see the other side, and assume the depth is reasonable to cross.

As you stare across, two men come in your vision. They are identical in looks, wearing long cloaks of glistening silver. Their hair is a ghostly white, as well as their skin, save a light flush of pink on their cheeks. Their eyes shine as saphire jewels.

One of them calls out, "My name is Fil. I will help you cross! I have powers that can make you fly across this abyss!"

The other one calls out, "My name is Gid, and I can help you cross! I can build tunnels underground instantly, and you can cross in safety!"

You stand, considering who to choose, as a light fog floats slowly across the still silence.
11211.title: The Men (F)

112111.content:
You stare at the one who calls himself Fil. His eyes shine a bit brighter than Gid's.

You raise a hand to him saying, "Yes Fil. I choose to rise over the swamp. Will you assist me?"

A broad smile crosses Fil's face as he says, "Of course."

But a dark shadow replaces the fog, crossing over the swampy river. Evil lurks in the air as stagnant as the swamp. A darkness grows in the eyes of the man you rejected - Gid. You are certain you see his eyes glow red before he disappears underneath the stagnant death pool.
Fil stretches forth his hands towards you, and you feel your body begin to rise, as your feet lift off the ground. Your eyes grow wide with wonder and amazement - you have never flown before! He lifts you until you are 6' over the stagnant waters and you slowly begin to cross over. But the filmy waters begin to stir as you are crossing over. Mid-way the waters open up - a whirlpool begins to circle madly, swiftly, creating a suction. You feel it pulling you down, wanting to swallow you up. In fear and terror you cry out, "Fil!"

Fil is working harder now, trying to keep you in the air, but there is a greater force than he, pulling you down. You are going straight into the mirky swamp, and there's nothing to be done about it!
You plumet into the waters as Fil's powers give way. The rushing whirlpool surrounds you, covering you in the slimy waters. You hold your breath instinctively as you are sucked down to depths unknown.

When you open your eyes you are in complete darkness. You are not in water any longer, and the ground is solid and hard. You search for the orb that was given you, but find it not. Not even a glint of light is seen, and you wonder if you are blind - for you cannot imagine a darkness so intense.
112111.title: Crossing the Swamp (F)

1121111.content:
"Hello? Is any one here?"

Your voice echoes eerily in the silence.

"Someone help me! Fil!"

A noise, in the distance, comes from all directions at once. Faint at first, gradually building. Unidentifiable and terrifying.
What have you done?
In the darkness you grope for walls, doors, holes, but disoriented and confused you walk in circles.
You never see anything in the blackness. You speak no more. Whatever you awoke in the cave by yelling has come for you. In the darkness you remain, as you meet death face to face.

Back at home in your bed, you awake. Was it a dream? Maybe you should go back to sleep and make better choices!
1121111.title: Echoes and Death

choices: you reach through the small hole.
you keep walking and ignore the hole.
1121112.content:
You rise to your feet and grope blindly around. Your eyes are wide open but nothing is visible, in the thick darkness. Your shuffling feet make a scraping noise on the hard floor, but the echo is short. You determind the room must be rather small.
Suddenly your hand encounters what seems to be a solid wall. It is smooth and cool like marble. You place your hand flat on the wall and begin to walk following the wall, hoping that you might eventually find a way out of wherever you are. A few steps further you feel a change in the surface beneath your hand. A perfectly formed, circular hole is in the wall, just big enough to get your hand through.
1121112.title: In the dark (F)

choices: Stick your head into the hole
Sit back and try to find out where you are
11211121.content: You reach through the hole tentatively. All of a sudden, your hand encounters something repulsively oozy and slimy, and you withdraw it in a flash, heart pounding. You peer into the hole but it is too dark to see...hmmm. What is that? You can hear something that seems to be shifting slowly in the hole. You can fit most of your head into the hole, and are very curious, but is it prudent? You hesistate, though only for a second.
11211121.title: In the hole (F)

112111211.content:
You stick most of your head through the hole, staring your eyes out. The slimy thing looks, in the dimness, like a pile of swamp mud. But swamp mud doesn't move. does it? Your question is answered as the thing oozes and rolls with surprising speed toward you. You attempt to remove your head, but fail-it is stuck! The mud-creature slimes over your head, slowly suffocating you. Not a pleasant end!!!

Back at home you awake with a start. Was it all a dream? Maybe so. Try again with better choices, and don't go sticking your head where it doesn't belong!
112111211.title: Slime of the ages

choices: Try to run away from Gid and explore the mines by yourself.
112112.content: Gid takes you by the hand and says, "Follow me." You tentatively offer your right hand and when he clasps his hand in yours you look back at Fil. He is no longer there. You frown but keep your cool. "We are going to head west to the mines." Gid says, although you pay little attention to him because of the oddity of Fil's sudden disappearance. With each step you and Gid take the ground seems to descend. When you reach the mines, you are about to try out your light powers when Gid says, "No need for that." Although you had not mentioned anything to him about trying your powers. Gid narrows his eyes and light magically appears as a path leading to the mines in front of you. You enter and it is dark and dank. You hear something like the sound of tumbling rocks above you. Gid still has a hold of your hand. You...
112112.title: Go with Gid the underground guy

11212.content:
You fear it might be a great distance you'll have to travel to go around, but if the rumors are true, you would rather make the long hike than risk almost certain death.
You look at the sun's position and determine you have about 4 good hours of light left. That is not long to travel, and you hope you can get around the swamp before then. You cannot determine which direction would be shortest - the left or right. The forest looks the same in both directions, and maybe it does not matter which way you choose. Then again, maybe it does.
You sit on a rock, thinking hard about all the books you've read. This is not exactly like anything you've read, but isn't evil usually in the east? Or is that the west? Whichever the case - you do not want to go the direction of evil.
So which direction do you choose?

(If I told you which direction to take - that would ruin all the fun!!! *evil laugh* And YES, it does make a difference!!)
11212.title: Travelling East or West? (F)

112121.content:
After quite a bit of time goes by, used up by your thoughts, you decide to go east.
"The sun rises in the East. That can't be a bad thing," you say outloud to no one but yourself. "That is the way of good.....I think," crossing your fingers in hopes that you have made a wise decision.
You journey quite a distance, staying in eye view of the edge of the swampy river. You have learned to block out the stagnant stinch of the swamp, and focus on making good time around it!
Hours later, you are still not in sight of the edge of the swamp. The sun is orange and low in the sky and the colors of the forest are starting to change. A place to camp now becomes a priority. Camping near the swamp doesn't sound like such a good idea. The stories of foul play near the swamps echo in your head.
You could continue going east. You don't have to camp now, as your orb can put off light, allowing you to travel in the dark. But do you trust this forest and the unknown inhabitants of it?
112121.title: Going East (F)

choices: You wait to see if someone comes out.
1121211.content:
You decide to keep walking though you're growing more and more weary with each step you take. The exhaustion is creeping over you in waves and playing tricks with your mind. You hear strange sounds all around you that could only belong to an animal of some sort and you fear the worst. Your eyes begin to droop and your feet feel as though they are filled with lead.
Even while your eyes are drooping you suddenly see what appears to be smoke rising in the distance. Your eyes grow wide. Could this smoke be from a campfire? And where there is a campfire there is most likely a person who has started it. How can you know if this person would welcome you? You feel more awake now but have decided to take your steps slowly, not wanting to make your presence known before reaching the source of the smoke.
After what seems like hours you reach what appears to be a break in the trees and you stop in your tracks apprehensively. You peer through the trees and are stunned to see a small house amidst a clearing. This was the source of the smoke! You realize as you gaze at the chimney atop the house. Relief floods over you aas you imagine a warm fire to curl up in front of. You begin walking towards the house but stop suddenly. You realize you have no idea who this house belongs to. Should you knock after all?
1121211.title: Smoke Rising (F)

11212111.content:
The warning words of the wizard are in your mind,that you must be weary of people you meet in the forest.You have no way of knowing who inhabits this house but your longing to be near the fire inside overpowers you.
Hesitantly you step into the clearing and quietly make your way to the house.It stands before you,the darkness of the forest making it difficult to see all its details.But the light from your orb gives you a clear view of the door before you.Pulling in a sharp breath to summon your courage you come to the door and knock lightly.You wait a moment and when there is no response you decide the knock had been a little too light and you try again,with more force this time.Still after a moment there is no answer and you back away from the door,unsure of your next move.
You decide to look around the house to see if there is a window you could look into.On one side of the house is a small window,no light shining through.Either noone is at home or they have gone to bed.You feel slightly despaired not wishing to continue on through the forest in the thick of night as tired as you are.
Just as you turn from the window a voice from nowhere stops you cold.
" Have you found what you're looking for child?" The voice seems to be coming from a woman but you see no one in front of you.
" I-I wasn't,well,i-is this your house?" You say to the air.
The woman appears from nowhere making you jump back.She is the most beautiful woman you have ever seen.Her ebony hair cascades in soft waves to her waist.Her skin is like cream with wide emerald color eyes gleaming in the moonlight.Her long black dress trails slightly behind her.
" I live here yes.Would you like to join me inside or do you prefer the view from my window"
Again you are reminded of the wizards warning.And you hesitate knowing how crucial this decision could be.
11212111.title: A Mysterious Stranger (F)

112121111.content:
"Oh, I would like to join you, Miss, just for a night. Tomorrow I must be going." You replied shyly, looking at the woman's pale and chiselled face, her golden brown luminous eyes looking at you back. Her eyebrows were graceful and her thick wavy brown hair cascaded down. Her head was going to a side. Seemed like she was just an ordinary and good woman, after all.
The woman smiled. "Wonderful. Glad you could join us. And just in time for dinner too! I am Layla, by the way, do call me that. What's your name?"
You bit your lip. What should you do? If you did not tell about yourself, Layla might be suspicious of you and even shoo you out of her house. On the other hand, if you told, and if she was a dark creature in disguise, you could be spied by it. Besides, you needed rest.
"My name is Meredith." You replied warily, thankful that you still had your hood on to conceal your face.
Layla, opened the door and led you to the extravagant dining room. On one of the seats was a boy your age, fifteen. He looked at you curiously with his piercing green eyes, trying to figure you out. His red curls gleamed under the lights, making it look like his hair was flickering with flames, which you thought was hot. One of his eyebrows was arched, he did'nt look pleased.
You took a seat, looking at the floor, your cheeks burning in fear, excitement, curiosity and shyness. The boy looked at you and asked, "Hello Miss. My mother is accustomed to accepting travellers into the house. May I know where you are travelling to?"
Your heart skipped a beat when he addressed you. You mumbled, for you intended to keep it secret.
"Sorry. I can't hear what you said."
" I must'nt. I know it's rude, but I cannot trust you yet." You replied stronger now, looking at him in the eye, even if his gaze was practically making your heart explode. Yet you loved the way he looked at you, whichever way actually.
"My mother has trusted you. At least, show me your face. Do you think me a disguised monster?"
"No!" You exclaimed. You stood up abruptly and went for the door, fear beating inside you like a drum. You must'nt get your identity revealed to strangers ever. Nevermind rest. You will make do.
You hurriedly walked back to the door, thinking which way to go while giving an apologetic glance at Layla. But just when you were in the doorway, a lean arm hugged you in the waist strongly, digging into your firm belly. You recoiled and wriggled, panicking if there was a monster behind you, but it was of little use. You felt vulnerable and you were pulled back and faced to the boy. He gripped your hands and took of the hood and stared at you.
"Okay. It's Meredith. Chill."
He looked at your hands, which were holding the orb, and said, "I happen to know the forest and I can help you go to the Lights Empire. I trust you after seeing the orb and knowing your name."
Let him join?
112121111.title: Follow her inside

choices: Go in with the beauty and risk being trapped
Decline her invitation and risk her possible anger
112121112.content:
You turn to the woman and ask, "Are you an elf?"
Surprised the woman replies, "Why yes, How could a mere human such as yourself know that?"
You laugh, "You are immortalized in our imaginations and bedtimes stories, little children dream about good elves saving them."
The woman, slightly wide-eyed responds, "I can see you have many questions about your mystical journey, won't you come in and sit by the fire?"
112121112.title: The Mysterious Beauty

choices: Do you trust her and follow her
Do you still not trust her (the globe might be lying) and say that you need fres
1121211121.content:
You follow the elf inside. A crackling fire is in the fireplace. A worn out wooden table is in the middle of the room. The elf motions for you to sit down with her in front of the fire. You do.
The elf closes her eyes and breathes deeply. "I see you have met my friend the wizard, Tanquin. He gave you a chose didn't he? Why did you choose what you are?"
You ponder her question. Then ask, "How do I know if you're lying?"
"Look into your glass globe, and you will find the answer you are looking for," the elf said.
You lift the glass globe out of the pouch. It glows with vibrant white light, blinding you. When the light settles down and your eyesight comes back, you see the old wizard. Although he is not old in the globe. He is youger. A pretty elf maiden in war clothes stands beside him, talking. You recognize her as the elf that sits across from you. The wizard and elf in your globe turn, and walk away. A thick white fog fills the globe.
You look up at the elf. "You see, I am good," the elf said.
You are convinced. Nodding you say, "I trust you."
The elf smiled. "Good. Now come, and I will show yo the way." She stood up.
"The way where?" You ask.
"The way to your destination," the elf said. "Come." She turns and walks toward a door.
1121211121.title: Mystery Globe

choices: Do you go with the elf
Do you try to find a way out yourself
11212111212.content:
"perhaps i did go with you," you say, "but how do i know that you can be trusted. All the globe showed was you with the wizard. I still can't say that you are a friend of his. Don't you have any more proof?"
The elf's eyebrows raised. "And what is it that i could possibly do to make you believe me? Either way you are stuck by this awful swamp. I could show you a way out. I could show you have to get to your destination."
"Ok then, tell me," you say, daring her. You have no idea of the elf's powers and no longer wish you were in her house. You start to feel and erie feeling, as if she can not be trusted.
"If you want to get past the swamp, you either need to trust me and let me guide you, or find it yourself."
You sat there stricken. You still didn't know if she was to be trusted. The wizard's words were deep within your head, but you had to decide fast or the elf could get angry.
11212111212.title: To trust or not to trust

choices: You find yourself on a clear path to the West
You find yourself surrounded by trees of silver
112121112122.content:
How can I trust her? This feeling kept overcoming you, as if you sensed danger if you followed her to anywhere. Your new power within you, began to glow and burn within you. As you heart began to beat faster, you felt as if the earth was breathing and each breathe you held back was another moment taken from the sun.

The woman looked at you with her narrowed mysterious eyes as she watched waiting for an answer. Reaching into you thoughts she caught only a glimpse of your thoughts, before you placed a barrier keeping her from entering farther into your mind.

Your heart spread faster and you power grew stronger. Suddenly you were blinded by a light that was not your own.
A form stood in this silver light, holding his hands out, and spoke,

"Come to me....Stay in the light....Come to me...."
The silver light began to dance and twist along with golden streams. Reaching his hands farther to you, he repeated his words.

"Trust not darkness...."

The light began to fade.

"How?" You whisper.

Just then he raised his hand thrashing a light through the air towards you.
Feeling his power combine with your, you fell back unable to control where you were falling too.
You feel his power leave you and the light fade away.

You find yourself....
112121112122.title: Another Light

choices: You pretend to pass out again and see what happens.
You open your eyes wide and demand to know where you are.
11212112.content:
As the sun lowers beneath the western horizon, you settle into a group of thick bushes. From this hiding spot, you have a good view of the house. You closely watch the entranceway for a couple of hours without any sign of movement from the house. You begin to wonder if any indication of who lives here will ever come, and at the same time, you grow even more tired. Despite the occasional startle from some passing animal, your head begins to droop, and your eyes begin to shut.

A dream of what awaits you to the north begins to play in your head, when, all of a sudden, you're awoken and pinned to the ground by some great weight. As you frantically try to escape, you glimpse the face of the offensive creature that has tackled you. You feel a sharp pain by your left ear, and the distorted, dark green face is burned into your memory as you lose all consciousness.

You awaken feeling cold and wet. As you come to, you realize that your arms and legs are bound. Slowly, you open your eyes to a bright light. The light flickers and, for a moment, you once again, see the face of your captor... smiling wickedly at you.
11212112.title: An Unwise Decision (F)

112121121.content:
You fake passing out again, but you peep through half closed lids to try and see your captor. He's a hidious beast with a sickening green complection and pus yellow eyes.

"Juicy little morsol" The creature mutteres to himself, his voice grating upon your nerves and making you slightly naucious.

You see that the beast has a torch in his hand and you almost scream for joy. You don't want to kill anything but it seems this creature is either preparing to drown you, or eat you, so you draw your will and prepare to attack.

Just as you're about to liven the flame, hopefully engulfing your captor in it as well, a sword is run through the green menace and you're cut free.

The night is dark as you look up at your savior so you can't really make out thier face.

"Come with me. Quickly!" a slightly rough, obviously masculine voice commands. His tone is deep and has a sharp edge to it, but holds an underlaying soft warmness that reminds you of hotchocolate drunk still steaming.

You are compelled to go with this stranger, but your mind tells you to be wary. You saw this stranger kill that beast without a second thought.

What will you do?
Trust the man with the wild silken voice,
or run for it. You never know who could try to kill you.

choices: Climb the tree and risk the jumb across.
Try and run around the goblins and the river.
1121211211.content:
After a quick debate with yourself you decide to go with the strange man. If for no other reason then to find out who he is, and what side he's on. you check your pocket to make sure your orb is safe and find it warm as if pleased. The man looks at you and bows. " Lady at your feet lies a sword the goblin had stolen from me. Please take it and follow me!" You look toward your feet and see a beautiful sword the handle was lined with rubies and dimonds. "First answer me a few questions," you say stubbornly. " who are you and why do I need to go with you?"
"I am Barrak of the North and you must follow me for the goblins are chasing you" this startles you because you had no idea tht you had been followed. Suddenly your orb heats up as if saying TRUTH! You take the orb out and look into Barrak's dark, mysterious, brown eyes and say, " lead the way"
He takes you to a tree near the river and beconds you to climb. "You do not have to climb, but to run may be foolish. THe goblins are not near for your orbs as not indicated it, but the tree will take us across the river. That is if you are strong enough" he said quietly.

choices: "That was fun. . . can we do it again?"
11212112111.content:
You glare at the man. "Do not call me weak. It would do you well to remember that."

Before Barrack could even respond you jump onto a limp about a foot higher then him. You smile snidly at him.

The dark eyed man smiled hansomely. "Nice, but I can do one better."

You watch intently as he crouches low down on the branch like a cat readying itself to pounce. And he did pounce, leaping gracfully, and as he passed you he grabbed you and carried you to the highest branch.

You look down in wonder at how high he just jumped. it was at least 30 feet. 'Is this guy even human?' you think incrediously.

you're heart speeds up when you notice how tightly you're held against this gorgous man's chest. He looks down into your eyes, his long, slightly shaggy black hair falling in his face.

He smirks devilishly. "Did you like that?" he asks in an arrogant tone.

How do you respond?
11212112111.title: Inuhuman Hottie

choices: "Yes, that is a good idea. Let's go...I still have a job to do."
"Let's stay awhile. I'm sure one night won't hurt."
112121121111.content:
"What are you?" You demand, trying to ignore the heat that is rushing to your face. You're not sure if it is the heat of a blush or of anger. He may be attractive, but you dislike his attitude.

He laughs, allowing you to stand on the branch beside him, but still holding you so close that you can feel his heart pounding next to your own.
"It doesn't matter what I am. I am Barrack. That is all. But, you didn't answer my question."

You glare daggers at him, knowing that even if you tried, you couldn't remove his strong arm from around your waist.
"Fine...I quite enjoyed it. However, I have a mission to accomplish and I have no time for fooling around," the tone of your voice is crisp and harsh. Ice drips from your words.

You can see that your companion is shocked by your tone. Barrack's deep eyes sparkle with hurt, and he frowns softly. "I am sorry, fair one. I lost control...its just that...." He stops, unable to continue. One hand reaches up and brushes a strand of hair from your face.

You sigh, eyes closing. They open again in shock as you feel soft lips touching your own. Barrack's arms tighten around you, and you can't help but settle happily in his strong embrace, giving in and returning the passionate kiss.

The kiss lasts but a moment, or so it seems to you. The handsome man smiles at you, almost shyly. He picks you up again and leaps down to a lower branch. You still have no idea what he is, but you no longer care. You have found yourself deeply loving this mysterious man, though you just met.

"So," he clears his throat awkwardly, "Shall we continue on?"

You walk with Barrack farther till you collapse in his arms. "You are in no condition to walk farther," Barrack
says in a his soothing voice. You mumble something about a mission and fall asleep in his arms. You awake in a tree. Something smells good so you hop down from the top of the tree. Some kind of bird is roasting over the fire. you use your powers to turn up the heat the bird is soon done.

As you enjoy your breakfast and you wonder were Barrack is and you reason that he is getting more food. You smile as your thoughts return to the kiss you shared with Barrack. hot tears roll down your cheek. You look at the sword you pick it up and feel power flowing though you. The sword shines and light shoots out. When the light clears the goblins are gone. You wonder why Barrack called you princess. So you

1121211212.content:
You turn to run and take off through the trees, expecting the strange man to follow you.

"You're free to leave, but there's likely worse things than me out that way" he calls after you.

You skid to a stop, hesitating and concidering. This man might kill you, but there might also be more goblins around the forest, or perhaps something even worse and more cruel and gruesome awaiting you out there.

Finally, you admit that at least you have some experience with other humans and know that they can be negotiated with.

Reluctantly you turn back and join the man by the body of the slashed goblin.

" Why should I trust you, what's to say that you wont kill me when I have my backed turned?" you demand as he turns, expecting you to follow him.

"Nothing" he said, not bothering to turn and face you.

Now you're no better off than you were before! You're again faced with the same choices;trust this strange man, or trust the dark forest
1121211212.title: To Trust or Not to Trust

1121212.content:
Finally finding a place where the ground is in good condition, you stop to camp. The forest grows dark quickly after the sun hides, melting all the shadows into one dark blanket. Placing your orb on a nearby tree, you gather stones and wood for a fire.

Suddenly, you hear an ominous scratching, rustling sound issuing from a bush beside the tree with the light.
You place the stones and firewood down at your campsite, ignoring the sound for now, but keeping an eye in your periferal vision. After preparing the site, you slowly walk to where the orb is resting, looking into the bush.
A flash of reflection and a split second later, something jumps on your face. You step back, startled, reaching for the thing that has attacked you. The creature slips from your hands as you feel it crawling around your neck.
In less than a minute you are entwined in webs that wrap around your body. They are sticky and strong. A giant spider has chosen you as her prey, as you are wrapped in her cocoon.

It is days before you die.

Back home you do not awake. A dream? No, this was reality. The coroner stated this was the worst death he had ever seen.
1121212.title: Camped Out

112122.content:
After quite a bit of time goes by, used up by your thoughts, you decide to go west.
"Yes, West is the way to go," you say outloud to no one but yourself. "That is the way of good.....I think."
You cross your fingers in hopes that you have made a wise decision.
You journey quite a distance, staying in eye view of the edge of the swampy river. You have learned to block the stagnant stinch of the swamp out, and focus on making good time around it!
Hours later, you are still not in sight of the edge of the swamp. The sun is orange and low in the sky and the colors of the forest are starting to change. A place to camp now becomes a priority. Camping near the swamp doesn't sound like such a good idea. The stories of foul play near the swamps echo in your head.
You could continue going west. You don't have to camp now, as your orb can put off light, allowing you to travel in the dark. But do you trust this forest and the unknown inhabitants of it?
112122.title: Continuing On (F)

1121221.content:
Just as you turn your back to lay out your shelter, you hear a rustling sound. Using your new powers, you illuminate the space behind. Countless warriors armed to the teeth, riding on animals that look like wild boars!
The are transparent, but frightening and heading directly towards you. In fear, you back away, tripping over a stone you laid for the fire. You fall backwards, landing on a precariously placed stick, that peirces through you.
The spirits laugh eviliy as they pass. Your spirit joins them as you die.

Back at home you awake. You cannot speak and the only image in your mind is the warriors. You spend the rest of your life in a mental care facility, staring blankley into space.
1121221.title: Spirit Warriors

1121222.content:
You decide that it would be better to push on, remembering that orb in your pocket can light the path. The forest begins to thin out as the moon rises, casting its baleful eye across a cracked swath of desert. The forest runs in a line agaist the desert, but there are shadowy forms swinging around in the depths you don't like the look of. You put out your orb and and sit on a heat cracked rock to think. If you go out across the desert to seek the help of fellow humans, you'll only have enough water in your canteen to last maybe an day and a half. Then again you could hike in the forest and continue north alone at the mercy of the wood.

A grunt and a snort erupt from the shifty foliage. You need to decide, fast.

Stay in the forest and stand your ground.

Attempt to make it across the desert tonight.
1121222.title: Desert or Forest? (F)

choices: Go back to help the creature
11212221.content:
You have chosen to stay in the forest. You hear footsteps approaching quickly through the trees. You start moving hoping that it was just your imagination but somehow you know better. The faster you move the closer it gets. When suddenly this ugly looking elf creature jumps out behind you. You quickly reach for your orb to blind the it. The light beams so bright that in an instant the creature is unable to see you as you start to run through the forest. Suddenly you hear a voice as if it is inside of your head.

"Help me"

You think you are crazy but you hear it again.

"Please help me"

You turn around and realize the elf is calling to you.
Do you turn back to help or run to safety while the creature is down.
11212221.title: Friend  or Foe

choices: Help the poor guy out and go with him
You feel sorry for him, but you've gotta head North... Best wishes bud.
112122211.content:
"Please! Help!" the disgusting creature wimpers again. So it wasn't your imagination. You look at the creature uneasily but head back towards it. After all, never judge a book by its cover right? Just becasue this thing is ugly doesn't mean it's evil.

"Oh... I'm so glad youuze came back." said the creature with a long wet sniffle of it's nose. "I was afraid youuze would run awayz likes everyone else..."

You suddenly realize that the dirty little elf has been crying, and watch fasinated as it hastily wipes at its bleary bloodshot eyes.

"I'm NOT suppose-ed to be here. And I would have youze know that I am not myself at the moment. Quite litterally." the elf explained, while tucking a piece of matted black hair behind its oversized ear.

"What do you mean?" You say slowly. This is getting quite strange.

"I mean, that I waz turned into this stupid thing by a tall dark man with a mustach. He waz about dis big." the elf said as he jumped off a large rock, stretching its arms up as far as they would go.

"That's almost eight feet!" you exclaim. The only people that tall that you know, are basketball players.

"It doesn't matter. All tat matters is dat we find him and get him to change me back. Please will youze come with me? I don't want to go by myself..."
