Derin and the other elves lead you through the village and suddenly come to a stop. You tensen up, unsure of what is happening. You see Derin and the other elves draw out their swords and lift up their bows. Fear overcomes you, what is going on?
1311112121.title: A Sudden Halt

choices: Do not leave Deren - Stay where you are.
13111121211.content:
Unsure of what is happening, but already in support of your newfound friends, you draw your bow. Your instincts tell you these elves are your friends, and you will defend them at all cost.

The surrounding trees rustle, as an eerie tenseness embraces the village. It is the calm before the storm, you fear.
Then you hear it. The strange sound, like a bird's song. It is no bird, and the short tune is a song of death.

You adjust your eyes to the trees and see them. They are like shadows, dark and mysterious, yet strangley beautiful. Their faces are pale and the lust of blood is in their eyes. You liken them to vampires, for they do thirst for blood, and would probably drink it also. But, no, they are the dark elves of the caverns. Worse, they are here, and night is drawing nigh.

The first black arrow flies near. You and the others launch your arrows. Some dark elves fall, but few, as the arrows continue to fly.

"Elish nicah!" Deren yells to you. You interpret that to mean, "Take cover."

Chaos is taking over, as villagers run to shelter, and the warriors assemble. There is more evilness approaching, for you can hear the heavy pounding of their feet in the distance. Orcs, no doubt.
13111121211.title: Attacked (M)

choices: Try to escape while you can...
131111212111.content:
You run swiftly to the cover of a building, pulling an smooth arrow from your quiver. Behind you arrows thud as the stick into the ground erect. You string the arrow, but wait for the shot.
Around your new elf friends have taken cover also and are picking off the dark elves with well aimed shots, but with little effect. For every enemy down, several more appear to take its place. They seem to come without end.
Deep grunts and sceams grow closer. The Orcs are not far from breaking the forest cover. They were formiable enemys alone, but with cover provide from the dark elves, staying would be suicidal.
131111212111.title: Take cover now!

choices: Pick off the charging orcs and hope for the best...
1311112121112.content:
Despite your fears, you won't run like a coward.

You quickly glance out in the clearing. Deren still stand where he was before. He ignores the arrows that land all around him as he picks off the dark elves with his ancient bow. His courage gives you the strength to fight. Your fear of death is gone.

Suddenly, Deren stumbles backward, a black arrow lodge in his body. The force of the shot has driven the arrow completely through the right side of his chest. He falls to his knees. His bow drops to the ground.

At the edge of the woods, Orcs have broken the cover of the trees and are charging the city. The weigh of their steps pounding the ground can be felt from where you stand.

Deren only has a matter of seconds before the orcs will reach him. You could try to save him, but you don't know if you could make it in time.
1311112121112.title: Stay and fight...

choices: Join your brother and try to save him
Try to take down the dark elf archers
13111121211122.content:
You pull your bowstring back taut and aim at the first orc. You release the arrow flies straight into the neck of the leading orc. His head flies in the air as the arrow ends its flight in the chest of the orc behind him. Double kill.

Your skill with archery has had a definite increased from you first shots earlier that day. Now you shoot each shot with surrounding targets in mind and how to make each shot count.

You decide to try something different: you pull out and string two arrows. In the one seconds time, you picked out your targets and took aim. Almost as second nature, you released your breath to stablize your bow. The arrows had hardly left your bow as you began the process again. Two more orcs fall into pools of their own blood, dead before they hit the ground.

Unfortunately, the remain orcs have almost reached the place where Deren knees, dying slowly. You have time to take one more shot before the orcs get to him.

Your shot results in another messy double kill, but to little effect. An orc raises his iron sword as he charges to remove Deren's head.

Without warning, an elf sprints from his cover and blocks the blade with an elegant blade of his own. He deflects the blade to the ground and drives his blade home. The orc falls dead. In the same movement he swings his elbow to the side and takes down the next orc with a crush blow to the face. He quickly dispatches the orc with stab to the heart.

The elf is doing well, but his chances against the six remaining orcs who circle him, waiting for a weakness in his defense, is slim. On the other hand, dark elves are busy picking off the defenders.
13111121211122.title: Pick off the charging orcs and hope for the best

choices: Join Derin, and see his city.
1311112122.content:
Shouldering your bow you smile at Derin, "Actually, I would really love to see your city, but I have somewhere to be."

"Well", he looks disappointed, "We certainly won't keep you, but I was hoping we could show you some of the hospitality of our city. Where are you headed to if you don't mind me inquiring? Perhaps we could offer you assistance in getting there?"

You shrug your shoulders. "I don't really know where it is. I was told to go far south, to the Rivers of Dan. I had planned to follow this waterway hoping it was a tributary to the River of Dan."

Derin looks overjoyed as you join up with the other elves. "We are both in luck. It just so happens that our city is directly south of here. Therefore you can allow me to show you our city, and lose no time getting to the Rivers of Dan. We may even be able to offer you a quicker ride. What do you say?"
1311112122.title: Going to the City Anyway (M)

13111121222.content:
Joining up with the other elves, you quickly retrieve your arrows from the orc corpses and slip them back in your quiver. Derin introduces you to his scouting band, although you'll never remember all their names.

Almost wordlessly the group turns south and begins making it's way through the forest. The other elves move so silently, you cringe inwardly imagining that you'll soon be embarrassing yourself by crashing through the bushes like an drunken orc. Surprisingly enough you make little if any noise at all. You seem to . . .remember (is that the word?). . . just how to place your feet, and where to step.

You find that the scouting party (yourself included) moves faster through dense brush, than you used to move on an empty sidewalk. The party stops once at about noon to drink from cold, clear stream and nourish themselves from some flat cakes they carried in their packs. The other elves generously shared their food, and upon tasting some you found it rapidly refreshed your tired limbs and renewed your strength.

It was just around dusk in the forest and Derin made the announcement that you were almost there. Soon the forest stopped getting darker and there seemed to be a bluish, green illumination coming from up ahead.

Almost as if of it's own accord the underbrush vanished, and the trees pulled back off the trail. You looked down a gentle slope onto a beautiful city sprouting up between two hills, surrounded by forest. There are lite blue, white and green glowing globes lining the streets, and many of the homes appeared to be made in living trees. There are two or three streams and bridges bisecting the city, and several fountains sprayed water into the air. The misty spray from the fountains gave everything a fresh, morning dew apperance, but also gave it a surreal feeling.
13111121222.title: Welcome to  Ðan`na Ðale (M)

131111212221.content:
You follow the scouts into a building in the city.
"I don't think you have been here before. All new people to this city must take a test... What are your skills?" You realise that you have entered an arena. You are unsure of your current skills. You review your new life and remember yourself as a skilled fighter with melee, magic and ranging.
"I can fight." You say, building up courage.
"OK then, take this blade, and we'll see if you can slay this creature without using magic or ranged. You may throw your sword, however." One of the other elves hand you a long, thin sword. A door opens and a strange, ugly creature appears. It lunges at you, and you simply hold your sword out. It flies head first right into the sword.
"Well... That was easy." You say simply.
"What, that's what you say? That was easy? That's one of the most ferocious creatures in the land!"
"I am one of the chosen."
"What... Oh word! I think we'd better show you to... A certain someone that wishes to meet you."
131111212221.title: The Test

13111122.content:
You move silently through the thick dark forest and it is not long before you find the other two orcs. They make so much noise in your sensitive elven ears, it's not as if you could lose them.

You settle yourself behind a tree with thick brush surrounding it, well hidden, yet workable enough that you will be able to use your bow.

Taking aim on the one bringing up the rear, you wait until he has fallen behind a bit. You wait until just the right moment, then release your arrow.

Thunk! It is a perfect shot, straight in the back of the head. He never knows what hit him, and he falls forward on the forest floor, blood spilling on the precious ground.

The other orc is walking away completely oblivious that his companion is missing. You knew those Orcs weren't too smart, but you thought they would be a bit more attentive!

You line up the shot and shoot. You have natural skill with the bow, as the arrow flys silently through the air, plunging deep into the Orc's neck. He gurgles as he clutches his neck, falling to his knees. You move out from your cover, in front of him. You pull a finely formed arrow from your quiver and draw back on the bow. Your arrow is fast and sharp as it pierces the struggling Orc deep in the chest, stopping his hear instantly. He falls forward, dead.

You continue on your way, with a smug grin, feeling more confident than ever.
"That was easy," you thought.

Up a ways on the path, you come to a fork. One way leads up a steep incline. The other way leads down going toward a river.
13111122.title: Dead Orcs (M)

choices: You go and get the bag.
131111222.content:
AS you make your way to the river you hear rushing loudly, it must be a very large river.
You hear a grunt and then a groan. As you walk closer to the sounds you see a bag laying on the ground that looks quite heavy. You walk over to and you see the hilt of a beautiful sword protruding from the bag.
131111222.title: The River.

1311112221.content:
You rush up to the bag, the hilt was a buetiful gold with a ruby placed inside it. The silver blade glistens in the small amount of light peering througf the trees.

"It`s buetiful!" You thought. But then you realized, you don`t know how to use a sword! Sure, you shot arrows like Robinhood, but that was just a natural elven ability.

"Hey! Get away from my sword!" shouted a voice from the river, breaking your thought. You look over to see a knight in glistening silver armor and flowing, white hair. You could tell by his looks he was a paladin.

"Last warning," the paladin begins, pulling out a dagger, "give it back."
1311112221.title: The Paladin`s Sword

choices: You do what the paladin says
Distrustful, you keep the sword for yourself
13111122211.content:
"Okay!" You yell to the paladin. "You can take the sword, I don't want any trouble." The sword remains in the bag with only the hilt at your grasp. It is one of the most impressive objects you've seen during your brief time in this magical word.

Whoever or whatever crafted the weapon seemed to have done so by utilizing elements of pure light: a flawless omnipotent, it was glowing with a radiance that made it hard to stare at it for too long.

Even with your invitation to take the sword, the paladin maintains a large amount of space, only taking small steps.
"So you can touch it, huh? Roll it over to me." He steps forward, his long hair flowing over his shoulders. As he approaches, you can see the similarity between the armor he wears and the sword. But why does he seem hesitant?

"You deaf, boy? Bring it closer to me, no treachery or deception unless you want me to end your life."
13111122211.title: Finders versus Keepers

choices: You go back for the sword
You leave it behind and head elsewhere
131111222111.content:
You don't want any trouble with this paranoid paladin and you have your own arrow and bow to use in case there's any trouble.
"Cover all of the blade and slide it over. The sword is cursed and touching it will
make you wish you were dead."

The paladin says with his bright eyes flashing, his tone urgent and serious.
"Only a member of the Brotherhood can dispose of it properly and without grave harm."

You shrug, hoping that once this exchange is over, the paladin can take the sword and get far away from you and your path to complete this mysterious journey. You cover the blade up to the hilt as the paladin continues to keep a distance, reminding you to tie it tightly so it doesn't fall out.

"Pass it to me and we will both be on our way." He comes up more confidently so that all you have to do is push slightly towards him. Up close, something about the paladin makes you extremely suspicious.

The brightness in his eyes flickers in a supernatural way. Before he can grab the weapon on his end, you kick the bag up and the sword tumbles onto his unprotected hand.

Like a wild creature, the paladin hisses and contorts his legs and arms into twisted limbs that flail like tails. He screeches in an incomprehensible language, his hand pinned beneath the blade of the sword. You get up and run in the opposite direction as his flesh sizzles and smokes until a blinding flame spreads throughout the white haired warrior.

As you keep running, you can't help but glance back at the gruesome scene. Whatever wanted the sword was no paladin - and the leftovers are a gnarled pale being, its pseudo-armor turnt to ash. At its corpse, the sword glows wildly.

Was it truly cursed or did it fulfill its true purpose?
131111222111.title: Passing of the sword

choices: Go around him leaving him to die
13112.content:
You move into the shadows and slip quietly away from the path of the hunters. You watch as they pass you, with grunts and strange words. You can smell the stinch they leave behind, polluting the clean forest air.
You wait until they are out of sight before you return to your original path. You continue on in peace over the forest terrain. The ground is soft under your feet and you move silently and quickly through the dense trees.

Your senses now alert you to a presence in the forest. You hear a faint moan. Peering carefully through the undergrowth, you see a man lying on the ground. He appears wounded.
13112.title: A Man (M)

131121.content:
You kneel down beside the wounded man. A deep gash from a spear is across his chest and he has been beaten up quite badly. Blood is running from unknown sources on his face. He grabs your arm tightly.

"Why are you here wood elf? I am a man," he rasps.

"I was too once. Sshh now. I will try and help you."
You send him a reassuring smile. Then as if you have known it all your life you begin to chant a spell.

"Sema teoklem eshmae okat."

His wounds are visibly healing, the gash sparkling with the magic you have only just learned. You can feel the forces of nature helping to heel the wounded man, at the same time your own power amazes you. You feel strong. Slowly the feeling dies and the man is completely healed. You extend your hands and help him to his feet.

"What kind of elf are you?" the man whispers.

Now on his feet you can tell that he is quite young, but his face is weather worn and shows wisdom beyond his years. You hand him a flask of water to wash his bloody face with. He takes it and pours a small pool in his palms, rubbing his now healed face.

"I'm a good wood elf by kind now, once human. My name is Loras. You are?"

"I am Signar. A Knight from one of the not so well known cities. I am blessed with Light according to the wise wizard that visited me. I fell asleep and when I awoke, there were hunters surrounding me. They knocked me around a bit before leaving me to die," he shuddered.

"Well you are alright now Signar," you say as you extend your hand.

Signar takes your hand. Your elven senses tell you Signar is good with a pure heart. You do not know which path his journey is taking him, but perhaps you could join forces.
131121.title: Signar the Knight (M)

1311211.content:
You tell Signar of your quest and ask if he would like to join forces with you. He responds by staing that your quest are one in the same and he would gladly join you.

He says, "I owe you my life, and I'm thankful. But before we can go on our quest, I must ask you if you would help me to defeat the creature that has done this to me. It was here not long ago and should be easy to find. he also has my weapons, which may be of great aid on our quest. Would you be willing to help me face this beast"

You hesitate for a moment. Would it be wise to go after this beast with your limited supplies, or would it be better to begin you long and difficult Journey straight away?
1311211.title: Joining up

choices: You say,  "No thanks, but I can get along by myself"
1311212.content:
You stay with Signar long enough to nurse him back to health, both of you sharing your strange stories of meeting the wizard. But, his path is leading to the North and yours the South. Providing the forest or other dangers do not overcome either of you, you know you will meet again. You will both be fighting the dark forces in time.

Parting ways, you begin journeying south. You walk for hours and your feet begin to feel sore.
On a small path through the dense forest, you meet a Woodland Elf named Emor who, knowing you are the newcomer the wizard told him about, decides to be your guide and companion through the lands.
He explains you are near the elven village of Dan'na Dale, a small fraction of the way to the Rivers of Dan.
1311212.title: Emor (M)

1312.content:
You are dressed in Elven clothing, light comfortable and in the colors of the forest. You noticed that you've even been equiped with a bow and a pack of arrows, even though you've never done any archery.
Your pointed ears are sensitive, so much that you can hear an individual leaf hitting the ground. Your hearing range has also improved, and you are hearing high and low pitches that you had not noticed before. There is a constant, deep moaning in this forest that you are very aware of now.
Your sight has also improved and you are able to see much farther and with greater clarity than before. Your periferal vision has increase dramatically, and any movement threatens to distract you.
You notice smells that are new to you. You kneel down seeing the tracks of a deer. You can pick up on the deer's scent!
The most dramatic change is the 6th sense you've gained. You can feel it in your being - the oneness with nature itself. You are connected somehow, in your mind and in your soul. You close your eyes and breathe in the air, feeling the power course through you - the power of nature and all it's glory.

You stand to your feet and open your eyes. It is then when you notice an unusual rock.
1312.title: New Nature (M)

choices: Scorn the strange rock and walk away.
13121.content:
It whispers back, almost imperceptably at first, but then you can hear its quiet dialouge clearly.

It speaks to you in the elven tongue, which you understand clearly.

"Help me please. I have been trapped in this rock form. A spell by an evil spirit here in these woods."

But what can you trust in a turbulent world like this?
13121.title: This rocks! (M)

choices: Listen to the rock's instructions and help him
131211.content:
"How am I supposed to help you?" You say to the rock.
"What? You don't know? Aren't you an elf? If you aren't, you certainly fooled me, because your voice is like music, and your footsteps are so light that only another elf could hear them, but that's only if they are concentrating really hard." The rock replied,"I have nothing better to do here where I sit, so I pay attention. I'm always watchful, waiting to see if help is on its way."
You look at the rock and begin to rethink your decision. Maybe you shouldn't help it, how do you know it doesn't mean you harm.
"And what will be the outcome if I choose to help you?" You say wisely to the rock. "Tell me why you deserve to be freed?"
The rock sits there and makes no sound. A few mintues pass and finally the rock whispers, "I was once an elf much like yourself. I was was on a journey that was probably much like the one that you are on now. I know these lands very well, and if you were to set me free, I would vow not to harm you, and even further, I would travel with you, as a guide and as a companion."
"You do not know my reasoning for traveling, and you must be able to prove to me that your word is true. I've been warned that there are few that can be trusted nowadays." You reply.
"My word is as trustworthy as you are. If you can't promise your worth to me, do not ask me to do the same for you. Now, do you want to know how to help me or not?" The rock says sternly.
131211.title: Confrontation (M)

1312111.content: After following the Rocks instructions to the letter the Rock suddenly lifts into the air, starts spinning and glowing with numerous colours. After a few moments you hear a loud crack and you are blinded from the light which pours fourth from the broken Rock. When you gain back you sight you are standing before another Elf. He is a male Elf standing around 5ft tall with a slim build long silver hair with nothing else about him very decerning. "Thank you", he graciously says as he bows. "I have been trapped in that prison much like a genie in a bottle for longer than I could guess. Thanks to you I can now seek that which has I thought about every moment of my capture. But before I go I offer you a reward". The Elf holds out his hands and speaks a word which seems almost musical. In a flash images of two items appear in each of his hands. In the left is a slender sword with a silvery blade, hilt and pommel. In the right is a cloak which appears to be made of the forest. "Choose your reward rescuer and may either help you in your quest". Which do you choose.....
1312111.title: The Choice (M)

choices: You begin your journey to the River of Dan.
13121111.content: You ask him if he would like to journey with you to the River of Dan. He replies by saying "No my task was to give you a gift for freeing me from the spell.I was just sent here to help with tools for your journey." He waves at you and steps back and starts to slowly dissapear, in a matter of seconds he is gone.
13121111.title: The DIssapearance.

choices: Try to find out what has happened to the wolf
131211111.content:
You begin to travel south, towards the Rivers of Dan where the Wise Elves live. As you are walking, your sensitive elven ears pick up many sounds. You hear the howl of a wolf off in the distance. Stopping, you listen closer to the howlings. They begin to get louder. In fear, you take out your bow and fit on an arrow from the quiver strapped to your back.
You hear the wolf from behind and whirl around. The wolf does not appear to be passive or friendly towards you. Instead, it begins to stalk forward, its eyes gleaming red. You pull back your bowstring.
131211111.title: You begin your journey to the River of Dan.

choices: Let the wolf travel with you
Tell the wolf that you travel alone
1312111111.content:
You look more closely at the wolf's red eyes. What has happened to it? you wonder. You feel compelled to reach into its mind and examine it. Closing your eyes, you begin to focus as the wolf stalks ever nearer. When you open your eyes, the wolf's eyes have stopped gleaming red and have returned to a blueish color.
The wolf speaks to you in your mind. "Hello, great hero. You have freed me from my enchantment and so I owe you. Take the magical arrows which lay at my feet; they shall instantly kill a truly evil being, and return from the terrible enchantment any of nature which has been corrupted."
You pick up the arrows and put them in your quiver. "Thank you, wolf," you say. "I must be on my way; I must find the Rivers of Dan."
The wolf's face seems to light up. "I can help you, then. Will you let me travel with you?"
1312111111.title: Try to find out what has happened to the wolf

choices: You get to the south-eastern forest without incident
You encounter an orcish raiding party
13121111111.content:
You tell the wolf that he may travel with you if he wishes to. However, you also warn him that there will be danger.
The wolf travels with you for several days. You reach the Rivers of Dan and are greeted by a Wise Elf. "Welcome, travelers," he says. "We have been expecting you for some time now. Please, come inside." The Wise Elf motions for you to follow him into his tent.
When you get inside, the Wise Elf tells you, "You have been sent here for a important reason. This will be your home for a long time; a very long time. You must travel to the south east, where orcs and corrupted elves lurk. I can see that the wolf has given you the magical arrows. There will kill the orcs, but they will help the Dark Elves return from their evil enchantment."
You nod, and prepare to leave. "Very well, then. I will need a map." The Wise Elf hands you one, and you begin your journey to the south east.
13121111111.title: Let the wolf travel with you

13121112.content:
You reach for the cloak and put it on. You automatically become one with the forest.
Your new friend that was trapped in a rock begins to walk away when you say, "Wait, could you help me on my journey to the Rivers of Dan?"
"Well I have been trapped as a rock for a long time," replies the other elf, "My people have most likely forgotten about me. I will be your guide, but we must be careful. You seem to have little control of your powers. Remain hidden under your cloak of the forest. As a rock, I have seen many strangers, sights I had never expected to see in a forest. Armies filled with evil beings have been patrolling the woods. Shockingly though, the dark elves are not helping them. They seem to be trying to start a resistance to the evil armies. I will be your guide and companion. I will walk before you with the sword wielded in case we face any trouble. Now before we continue, you seemed to have little control of your powers as I mentioned before, would you like me to teach you a few tricks of the trade?"
13121112.title: A New Companion

choices: Try to give him your imput before you go anywhere
131211121.content:
Although the offer made sense, you really would rather get some answers a fast as you could.
"Would you mind showing me some things along the way?"

He smiles without issue and nods. "Ofcourse, I suppose we'll have plenty of time. We won't reach the Rivers of Dan for many weeks."
You sigh and nod now that you know for sure that there won't be an easy way out. You and this new elf would be together for a while. Which reminds you. . .
"May I ask your name?"

He smiles brightly despite his tired eyes, "No one has asked it for a very long time." His eyes slide away from you and his hand unconsciously runs through the silver tangle of his hair. The action ripples all the way to the ends and by then you wonder if you should ask again but he speaks. "Well, before I was. .a rock, I was called Linden." You test it out quietly and decide that it suits him."

"Well Linden, as the guide, what do you recommend we do first?"

You hope that even after all his time of being forced into the guise of a rock that he can still be helpful in these current circumstances.
"Actually," he begins and a seriousness comes over his graceful features, "I have some questions for you before we set out."

"Ofcourse, ask them." You lean against the tree behind you not sure of how long this will take. Nearby he mimicks your stance.

"Well, what exactly are you looking for at the Great River? The only reason I ask is that it's possible that there is another way to get what you seek."

"No, I was told that to fulfill my calling I must first go to the river." Yes, you knew it would sound strange, and random, and nonspecific, but it was all you'd been able to get sure of before your mysterious informant had taken off.
"Who told you this?"

"When I arrived there was a wizard. He told me little more than the fact there there is a war happening here, and that I may be able to resolve things."

Linden was quiet while he studied your face. It was hard to tell what his eyes were looking for and even though you know you must've looked confused he didn't stop his passive search until he was satisfied.
"I see." was all that he said before he tightened the sword at his hip. "We should be careful then. It may be that others may know of your importance. We shouldn't stay here."

The short elf turned without your leave all too confident that you would follow.
131211121.title: Head Towards River

131211122.content:
"I would like to learn how to use my powers." you said.

"Very well then. I will teach you about hearing nature and using your telepathic powers. In order to use your powers correctly you must be great at concentrating. As a dwarf it is more harder to concentrate since a dwarfs hearing is far better than a humans and I can tell you were once an ordinary human. First let's test your concentration." The dwarf says.

"How will test my concentration?" you ask.

"Let me show you." The dwarf replies as he grabs a strange leaf out of his pocket and puts it on the ground.

"Stare at this Leaf for 1 minute with getting distracted. If you can do that then I will know if you can concentrate well enough for you to use your powers correctly." says the Dwarf.

You stare at the leaf and concentrate. You manage to stare at the leaf for a full 1 minute although you were trying really hard not to get distracted by all these background noises.

"Good. You are good at concentrating and you are almost ready to test your powers but first you must decide if you want to improve your concentration or to test your confidence as you will need concentration and confidence to be able to use your powers correctly."
131211122.title: Concentration

choices: Tell him to stop precisely where he is.
Lower your bow and see if you've finally made a friend.
1312112.content:
"I have to say, you don't sound like someone who's desperate for help."
Ofcourse as you began walking away the rock cried out to you with quick apologies, but it had had its chance. Perhaps someone else would give it another.

You continue walking through the forest until you can no longer hear the supposedly bewitched speaking rock. When you feel far enough you decide to give yourself some time to make a plan. All there is so far is to go South to the The Rivers of Dan. It should be safe, or atleast safer there. Hopefully along the way you'd be able to get some answers about this war. You almost want to ask the rock if it knows anything. Maybe you could go back and bargain with it, information in exchange for salvation. It seemed fair enough so long as the rock was being honest. Then again, that idea seemed like a big 'if', but was the chance better than not knowing anything?

Not ten paces away there is a creaking up in the branches somewhere.

Your bow is in your hand and you don't even remember grabbing it, you notch your arrow and aim.

"Who's there?" you wish you could have sounded calmer, but with the wizards warning you can't help but believe that danger is too eager to find you. This was supposed to be neutral ground, but something wasn't right. Your breathing is heavy, but your arms remain steady. Even with your fresh elf ears you can't hear anything.

Just as you are about to creep forward, a voic makes itself known.

"Don't shoot. I'll come down."
As a show of good faith a bow drops to the ground and a pair of legs swing down afterwards. He grunts slightly as he manuevers himself off the branch and lands carefully. When he does his hands are before him with palms facing the sky as he approaches.
1312112.title: Forget the rock and leave

13122.content:
The rock flies a fair distance and hits a rugged tree. Exploding, the rock generates light unimaginable!
You walk slowly up to the light that is lingering in front of the tree. Being a light elf, you dim the light enough to see in. It is a strange portal, and you can sense darkness within.
Unknowing where the portal leads or what awaits you within, do you dare enter?
13122.title: The Rock Portal (M)

131221.content:
Entering the porthole, it closes behind you. A vast desert wasteland lays before you. Large sand dunes riddle the landscape. The sky is a deep red. The heat is immense as it radiates up from the ground.

It is then you feel a rumbling. Slight at first. Growing. Growing. Suddenly the ground is shaking violently and splits open. A giant worm creature breaks forth from the ground, knocking you down.
He spies you as you try to get up and run. Your weapons are useless against him and your spells are worthless in this dimension.
He swallows you up for a tasty afternoon snack!

Back at home you awake, eyes wide open.
"What a strange dream."
131221.title: Desert Dimensions

choices: You decide to begin your journey to the Rivers of Dan.
You decide to experiment with your new abilites.
132.content:
Immediatley your wish is granted and the wizard says, "Be cautious on your journey. This forest holds powers unknown to you. You have been lightly equipped in your transformation, and before you reach the edge of the forest will have opportunities to increase your skills and gain weapons. Beware of the one called Domarion, for his power is great and he seeks to destroy you."

"Before you go great wizard, I implore you, please tell me more of my mission."

"Alright, but quickly," he says as he draws closer to you.
Continuing in a low voice he shares some more information.
"A great conflict is brewing between the forces of good, which are to the North and South and the forces of evil which are to the East and West. This forest has always been considered neutral ground, and for this moment still is. But soon it will be a bloody battleground."
The wizard pauses with a sorrowful look in his eye, as if he is seeing the future.
"You have been brought here alone and in secret, chosen because of your exceptional abilities - your sharp mind, able body, and strong personality. The fate of the forest and this realm will rest in your hands, and the hands of others just like yourself, who have also been chosen."

"What is causing the conflict?" you ask, still confused.

"I don't have time to go into this now. You will learn as you travel. Be careful who you befriend in this forest. Some can give you invaluable insight and help, and others live only to decieve and destroy you," the wizard informs.

The wizard seems to fade before your eyes, leaving you alone in the forest.
You can hear his voice in the wind saying, "You need to journey to the Rivers of Dan, far to the South. There you will gain perfection in your new craft and complete understanding and direction."
132.title: Missions - Rivers of Dan (F)

1321.content:
You are dressed in Elven clothing, light comfortable and in the colors of the forest. You noticed that you've even been equiped with a bow and a quiver of arrows, even though you've never done any archery.
Your pointed ears are sensitive, so much that you can hear an individual leaf hitting the ground. Your hearing range has also improved, and you are hearing high and low pitches that you had not noticed before. There is a constant, deep moaning in this forest that you are very aware of now.
Your sight has also improved and you are able to see much farther and with greater clarity than before. Your periferal vision has increase dramatically, and any movement threatens to distract you.
You notice smells that are new to you. You kneel down seeing the tracks of a deer. You can pick up on the deer's scent!
The most dramatic change is the 6th sense you've gained. You can feel it in your being - the oneness with nature itself. You are connected somehow, in your mind and in your soul. You close your eyes and breathe in the air, feeling the power course through you - the power of nature and all it's glory.

You stand and look around, and instantly know which direction to go, for the trees seem to know the way, and they guide you gently along your path. Each falling leaf whispers a new secret in your ear. But soon a new sound is heard.
Voices - gruff and deep. You can hear the cracking of twigs underneath their heavy footsteps. They are large and their language is unknown to you. Your acute hearing allows you to follow their course, even though they are not in view because of the densness of the forest. You are on the same course. If you keep to your course, you will enevitably collide.
1321.title: the course (F)

13211.content:
You are not afraid of new challenges and are confident in your abilities. You choose to keep your course. You walk silently forward, you clothing and movements blending in with the forest around you. Your ears are focused on the voices ahead.
It is not long before they are in view. Your eyes widen as you see them. You know from your research these are Orcs. They live in the dark places, thriving on evil and violence. They are dark, greusome creatures, and are carrying swords and arrows. Judging from their complete lack of effort to be quiet, you guess they are not hunting, at least not for wild game. But they have stopped and are sniffing the air.
The breeze is very light in the forest, and blowing in your direction. Your sensitive nose picks up on their strong stinch, contaminating the forest air.
You question their purpose in this forest, knowing this is not the place they live. You are hidden well from their view, and have a moment to decide your course of action.
You could choose to attack them or you could choose to avoid them altogether. You are outnumbered but with a bit of strategy you believe you can defeat them. If you avoid them, there's the chance you will encounter them again later.
13211.title: Orc's (F)

choices: Stay in the tree & continue to shoot!
132111.content:
You decide you can take them on all by yourself. You look around and find a nice tree for climbing. You slip up in the branches with nary a sound, positioning yourself you ready your bow and take aim.
One of these seems to be the leader, so you decide to take him out first. Hopefully your aim will be sharp, and the others will be confused enough that you can take out another before they realize what is happening.
As luck would have it, they stop walking, look around and grunt to each other. They suspect something is amiss, as they start to draw their swords.
Quickly, you let go of the arrow, as it flys straight into the leaders shoulder.
"Damn" you say under your breath, since you were aiming for his head!
Quickly, you draw another arrow and aim, as one of the creatures aids the leader and the other two begin looking around. You fire another arrow at the leader, hoping they did not see the origination. This time your aim is sure, and you struck the leader directly in the heart. Life blood spills on the ground as his last cry of death is heard.
The other three creatures are looking your direction, but have yet to spot you. One begins running your way, as you draw another arrow. You quickly aim and shoot, hitting the approaching monster in the gut. He's hurt, but not fatally wounded. And the other two have spotted you!
132111.title: Attack (F)

1321111.content:
These creatures are huge and they have spotted your hiding place! You have just enough time to abandon your position and have a small head start on them. They are so large, surely they are not fast as well, and you know that you are!
Like a flash, you are out of the tree and running as fast as you can throught the forest. Unfortunately, all the comotion has attracted the attention of some more of their friends! You can see them, joining the chase, more of those revolting monsters! You are getting worried, as they are slowly gaining on you.
Up ahead, to your right, you see something....is that a horse? You can't be certain at this moment.
The monsters edge closer.
To your left there looks to be a river or gorge of some sort, but again, you are focusing all your energy on running, not looking!
A quick decision must be made or these monsters will have the best of you!
1321111.title: Run for the.....? (F)

13211111.content:
You begin to veere to the right, hoping that if it was a horse you saw you aren't scaring it away by running at it full force!
As you press on, you cannot see it anymore. The monsters are getting closer and closer. So close, you can hear their snorting nostrils huffing behind you.
Then out of nowhere, arrows start to fly! You can hear them wizzing by your head, very close, but they are not meant for you, but rather the bags of filth that are chasing you. You hear a thud directly behind you as the closest of your pursuers falls.
The horse you thought you saw earlier was no figment of your imagination, and here he is running beside you. Atop him a strong man with an arm outstretched.
Without a second thought you reach out, and he grabs a firm hold, pulling you up as you jump, and land behind him on the horse. You wrap your arms around the man and hold your head down, frightened beyond belief at this point. You are a bit surprised in your abilities as you realized - 'I just jumped on a moving horse!' Being an elf has it's advantages!

Eventually, the horse slows and the monsters are no longer in sight. You assume they are dead, or that you are so far ahead it doesn't really matter anymore. The horse is down to a walk now, as you rest your head upon the back of the one who saved you. You are well weary, and the sun is beginning to be low in the sky.
13211111.title: The Rescue (F)

132111111.content:
"We're here," you hear a soft voice say.

You lift your head as your eyes grow wide. The growing darkness of the forest reveals the soft glow of green and blue lights. You must be dreaming.
You feel a warm hand on your thigh. You look and see a handsome elf holding out his arms. He's waiting to assist you off the beautiful white horse. His long brown hair is down, with a few strands attempting to hide his emerald green eyes. He is wearing a long, forest green tunic, accented with gold. You slide yourself off the horse, into his strong arms, still convinced you are dreaming. Your knees are weak, and he keeps his arms around you, helping you stand.

"She's had quite an adventure today," spoke the one still on the horse.

For the first time you are getting a good look at the one who rescued you. His hair is golden and flows to mid-back. He's dressed much like you, in the colors of the forest - greens and browns. His eyes are as blue as the oceans back home, close to paradise to gaze into them.

"The elves certainley are beautiful," you say, shocked to hear your own voice. Did you just say that out loud? Yes you did.

The one on the horse dismounts, smiling.

"You must be weary," he says.

"Her legs are weak," the one holding you says. "If I let go, she will surely fall."

The golden haired one nodds, "Carry her to Mikia's house where she will rest."

The arms around you change position, lifting you up. The handsome brunette elf carries you, but your eyes are heavy as you fall asleep in his arms.
132111111.title: The Elven Village (F)

1321111111.content:
As you sleep, you are visited by a dream...

You are back home, lying in your bed. The morning light streams through your mini blinds. You look at the clock: 7:45am. Rubbing your eyes you rise. As you slip on your warm fuzzy slippers, you realize you are in your elven clothing. Confused, you look in the mirror, but appear "normal," except for the clothes. You grab your soft pink and green plaid robe and cover your strange clothing.
Shuffling out your bedroom door, the house is quiet and you are alone. Walking into the kitchen you open the refridgerator. The light is blindingly bright inside and a burst of hot air hits you. Shocked, you slam the door shut quickly.
Hearing a noise, you and spin around. It's the wizard!
He stands there in your kitchen in his white flowing robe and magical staff. His beard stark white, eye brows protruding from his narrow face.

"All I wanted was a glass of milk," you comment sarcastically, "but instead I get a wizard."

On the end of his wand is a dark glass ball. He lowers it and you look closely. Inside you see a group of people in a circle, arguing. In the middle are large papers with sketches. Upon further inspection, it looks to be battle plans.
The scene changes into dark elves, both beautiful and hideous at the same time, slitting the throats of the woodland elves. They have ambushed them in the forest. Orcs destroy the forest to fuel their fires for weapons: Horrible, terrbile weapons of steel and granite. A castle, black and twisted in the twilight, rises up. A dark cloud looms over it, and as it shoots a lightning bolt, a face is illuminated. A giant red goblin evily grins, lusting for blood.
You are brought back to stare at the wizard, who then turns and directs your gaze to the living room. Hearing angry voices, you inch closer to see. It is the voices of your parents, and suddenly you are a young child again.
You look around the corner just in time to see your father lob a punch, hitting your mom directly in the face. Blood spills from her nose and tears stream down her face. She turns to run, but he grabs her arm, jerking her back to him. His cruel expression is like a knife in your soul. Your watch and listen as your mom wails and begs for mercy. There is no mercy in his eyes and he gets ready to send another blow...
Then they are gone and you are looking at the wizard again. Tears flowing down your cheeks like rivers, you shake your head in disbelief.

"You were young," says the wizard sympathetically. "It was a shame you saw those things. Even now, your only memory is in dreams, because your conscious mind refuses to remember such horrid times. That day you were taken by the state and soon adopted to live a normal life."

Wiping a tear you ask, "What became of my parents, exactly?"

The wizard continued, a sorrowful expression on his face. "Your father killed your mother and then killed himself. No one had the courage to tell you the truth about them."

Your shoulders shake uncontrollably as you sob.....and awake.
1321111111.title: The Dream (F)

choices: Have breakfast downstairs in the dining room.
13211111111.content:
Upon awakening, you find yourself in a beautiful room. Glorious morning rays of sunlight are streaming through the windows with no glass. A cool, yet comfortable breeze is sweeping through, bringing a fresh scent across your nose. The bed you are lying on is like lying on a cloud. The linens are white and flowing, but warm also.
You are still taking it all in when you hear a voice.

"Did you have an unpleasant dream?"

The owner of the sweet voice comes into view, slowly walking over to you. She looks like an angel in the morning sun. Her hair is a dark brown, her eyes like jade. Her lips are like rubies and skin like porcelain. Her garments are long and flowing, in light airy colors. She wears a silver headband on her forehead.

"Am I awake?"

The elven woman sits in a chair beside your bed and places a cool cloth on your forehead. You then realize you are sweating despite the coolness of the room.

"You are awake now, yes," she replies in a melodic voice.

"Where am I?"

The woman smiles sweetly, "You are in my room, in the house of Mikia, in the village of Dora Moore. My name is Aerial. I am Mikia's daughter."

"Who is Mikia? The name seems familiar."

"Mikia is the King of this village and the elves of these woods."

A broad smile spreads over your face and you think you must be dreaming, only this time it is a good dream.
"You are a princess."

Aerial smiles and changes the subject. "You must be hungry. Would you like breakfast here or would you prefer to dine downstairs?"
13211111111.title: Upon Awakening (F)

choices: Get up and walk to the washroom on your own
Wait for Tyra to come and help you into the washroom
132111111111.content:
Aerial leaves you in the room alone to go get you soem breakfast. You sit yourself up "what in duran's name is this world?" you asked yourself. You hear the door open and see Aerial with a beautiful maid

"This Tyra, she will be the one taking care of you while you are here, I shall take my leave as my brother needs my assitance with something" and Aerial leaves.

Tyra bows "good morning my'lady" and sets breakfast on your lap. Her swift black curls bounced around as she walked. She smiled at you "it is nice to see you finally awake, you mutter weird things in your sleep"

You raise an eyebrow and shrugs and looks at the food "what is this?" and Tyra smiles

"That is Green Mint bread, Rose Blood tea, and some cooked turniped fish" Tyra told you, you smiled and starting eating

"it is delicious" you told her, she smiled brightly

"thank you my'lady, I cooked it all myself, it is a pleasure to hear that from our guest, please, make yourself at home, I will go ready the bath for you as your clothes are covered in dry orc blood, and than I will set soem extra clothing on the bed, and I will assist you in the bath as your legs still tremble" than Tyra leaves to the washroom and starts the water.

You try finishing all teh food in front of you, it was very good, espeically the tea, the name said Rose Blood, but it tasted only like Rasberries and Lemons. You finally finished your breakfast and set the tray aside
132111111111.title: Have breakfast in the room.

132111111112.content:
You walk down the wooden stairs, seemingly carved out of the very stone. You enter a large hall, mostly filled by a wooden table. Around it sit elves like you, dressed in the greens and browns and golds of nature. The scent of food enter your nose, and you realise with a pang how hungry you are.
"Come on!" Calls the handsome male elf from the day before. His brown hair shines in the morning light, the colour of the oak trees. You take a seat at the table and start to eat the wamr stew you are given. It tastes like autumn, warm and with the faint tang of bonfires. You finish it in a minute of seconds. As you finish you covertly look around the table. Most of the elves are old, the lines time has traced in their faces only showing further their beauty and wisdom. The only people your age are your two rescuers from the day before, and the princess who sits down besides you.
"So," she says, turning to you. "Where are you from." You pause before answering. Should you tell her all about the wizard, and run the risk of being thought mad, or lie to the people who saved your life and have taken you in?
132111111112.title: Breakfast

1321111111121.content:
You look into Aerial's eyes and you sense that in her lies a kindred spirit. She has a glint in her eyes, the steel normally found only in a warrior's eyes. You decide that you can tell her. But she is not the only one to consider. You turn to the brunette who must have carried you to your room last night, knowing instinctively that his gaze will not require as much of you as your rescuer's will. His emerald eyes laugh at you, drawing you immediately to him. The laugh lines around his eyes and mouth allude to the fact that he likes to laugh, and does it often. Here, you think, is another ally.

Armed with this knowledge, you turn at last to your rescuer, but you are unable to meet his gaze just yet. So you run your eyes over his atire and realize he is more formally dressed than yesterday. You suddenly feel dirty, grimy and self-concious. You rise in a hurry, mumbling some unintelligble excuse to excuse yourself from the table. As you rise, he rises with you a gesture of respect which makes you uncomfortable. You look at him to tell him directly that you do not deserve such an honor and find yourself drowning in his gorgeous blue eyes.

You sink into them, stuck by the depth of feeling you sense emanating from him. That new sixth sense comes into play and you suddenly realize that your rescuer is attracted to you. Enarmoured with you. Perhaps even, in love with you. Unconciously you smile at him, a smile made even more brillant and lovely by the fact that you are now an elven maiden. He smiles back at you and you found yourself breathless. His smile has just the right mixture of kindness and mischief and you realize that you could fall in love with him.

Aerial's voice jars you from your thoughts. "Well? Will you tell us mistress?"

"Mistress?" You repeat confused and starting to get insulted. "What?"

"Easy." Emerald Eyes says soothingly. "She meant no disrespect. Among our people it is a term of honor."

You blink and blush. "I'm so sorry Aerial. In my..." You pause, realizing that everyone is staring at you, not just your three new friends. You look at them and then glance around the diner. You remember the wizard's admonishment to trust no one. As you remember the horrors of your dreams however, you know that you will never be able to accomplish your journey without some help. And so you turn to your friends, silently granting them your full trust.

"Before I tell you, may we go somewhere less...crowded?" You ask delicately, understanding that even as you do, you will undoubtly anger and insult some of the elves present.

Aerial looks at you in surprise, then turns to Emerald Eyes. "What do you think Ranor?"

"The grove will do nicely." He says and you all get up and leave.
1321111111121.title: Allies

13211111111211.content:
Ranor leads the way and your rescuer, you can't think of him as anything else, takes up the rear. You notice as you travel through the...well city, that Aerial and Ranor are both warmly greeted by the inhabitants. You recieve many curious glances, but they are warm and welcoming nonetheless. Your rescuer recieves a much cooler welcome, with some of the looks bordering on hostility. You glance backwards in question, but Aerial who walks beside you, grabs your arm and whispers quietly, "Not here."

You itch to demand an explanation, but you remember how they willing accomadated your wishes and so you keep quiet. The rest of your journey is spent in silence as you absorb all that you can of the Dora Moore and its customs. You notice that the clothes seem to be brighter, as if they aren't worn very often, and that they are made of richer materials such as silks and one luxurious fabric that you do not know the name of. Again you have that sense that something is about to happen, some special occasion.

Ranor stops abruptly, or it seems that way because you have not been paying attention, and you run into him. He laughs softly and catches you. You see a hint of mischief and realize that was what he meant to happen. Aerial shakes her head at him and brushes past you two to enter into the grove. Your rescuer waits, a territorial gleam in his eye. You can sense the challenge in Ranor's stance and you shake your head. You, who have never had so much as a date, have two Elven warriors ready to do battle to win your hand. You think of how old-fashioned that sounds and deep down, how romantic. Still you sigh and gently disentangle yourself from Ranor.

"Come." Aerial says softly.

You turn and enter a place of enormous beauty. You feel nature rejoicing in her beauty, happy of the chance to share. Here is a place where you may come to rest and relax, to laugh and love. Here is a place of complete harmony where no evil being or thing has ever entered or may enter. A safe haven of nature.
13211111111211.title: The Grove

132111111112111.content:
"Wow." You breathe as you enter. "I've never seen such beauty. This grove it's....magical." You notice that Aerial, Ranor and your rescuer all exchange looks behind your back. Knowing that now is the time, you turn to them and ask, "Are we able to talk freely here?"

Aerial whispers a few Elven words and then nods.

You take a deep breath, and sit upon the fragrant grass. Your friends do likewise. You turn to your rescuer and look him full in the face. "First, may I ask your name?"

He is taken aback by your directness, but recovers quickly. "Heero." He answers quietly.

You smile at him and murmur, "Beautiful." Then you face the others and tell them everything that has befallen you. You tell them of the wizard, his words, your fight with the orcs, even of your dream, leaving out the details about your parents' deaths however. Their faces grow more amazed as your story continues and when you finally finish, Ranor is shaking his head in denial.

"Impossible." He whispers. Then he stands up and begins to pace. He throws glances at you as he grows more and more agitated.

Aerial watches him with a faint frown on her face. "Brother, why does this upset you so?"

You fight to keep your face impassive. Brother?! You scan both of their faces and finally notice the subtle similarities. You think back to earlier when he was challengeing Heero. He wasn't just any one. He wasn't even a normal Elven warrior which was honor enough. But a prince!! An Elven prince!! Wow.

Ranor finally whips around and confronts you. "How?" He demands. He grabs you by the shirt color and flings you against a tree. The tough bark bites into your back and you twinge with the pain. You try to reach out to the tree to ask it to soften itself, but it is as tough and unyielding as stone. You understand that you have upset their master and the forest is no longer your friend. "How can you know that! We have been so careful!"

"Sire," Heero breaks in. "look at her face. She is no traitor. She is not a spy either." He continues, answering the suspicion on Ranor's face. "The dark elves know nothing of our plans. Besides she is not evil. The grove accepted her remember? It has never failed to spot a dark elf. Her heart is pure, no matter what her reasons for being here are."

Ranor growls in your face for a moment and then releases you. Aerial looks from you to him and then to Heero. She struggles with something for a moment and then turns to Heero decisively. "Tell her." She commands quietly.

"NO!" Ranor explodes. "She is not to be trusted."

Aerial cooly meets his eyes as he trys to stare her down. You sit and watch in wonderment, understanding that some massive power struggle is going on. Aerial and Ranor in direct conflict about something, and Heero, well you aren't quite sure where Heero fits in. But you guess that he is the eyes and ears of Ranor. They've been up to something secret so perhaps that explains Heero's cool reception.

Aerial breaks eye contact and says, "Fine. I'll tell her then." Ranor opens his mouth to object, but something stops him. Aerial turns to you. "I believe your story mistress. If you do not object, I would like to give you an Elven name." You are humbled by such an honor and know that you can not talk, so you nod and she continues. "Thou shalt be known as Faereth Silverrose from this moment forward."

The name fits you well and you are honored they have accepted you, mostly.

"I am grateful to be intrusted with the honor of an elvin name. Believe me that if these strange experiences had not happened to me, but had been told to me, I would be sceptical as well. They are just as strange to me as they are to you, and I am still searching for answers. I have been sent here to help, and that is the most I can attempt to do."

You bow yourself in their presence as a sign of humbleness and respect, now knowing who they are. You vow loyalty to their people for as long as this life is yours to keep.
132111111112111.title: Power Struggle

choices: Agree to keep it a secret.
Tell him you will swear nothing and leave the room.
1321111111121111.content:
Ranor accepts your pledge with a curt nod, while Heero stares at you, enamoured. His gaze seems to penetrate your body into the depths of your soul, and you realize that he knows exactly who you are and why you are here, and that he believes you and might even love you. You blush and turn toward Aerial, who has a bemused expression on her face.

"Faereth," Ranor addresses you, "If you wish, you may remain in Dora Moore for as long as you need." Turning to Aerial, he says, "Our rescue party is departing tomorrow morning." He then strides away back toward the village.

Aerial follows behind Ranor, and Heero suddenly stands up from where he was seated on a log and starts chanting. You can only understand a few phrases, and are startled to realize that he is speaking in the elven language and you can understand it! The words that you did hear were along the lines of "Forest...burning...death...forever...blood of ancients..."

Suddenly, Heero jerks his head back, as if he has just woken up, and slips into the forest toward his home in Dora Moore. When he is about twenty yards away, you see him beckon to you with his arm. You follow behind him, and catch up quickly with your strong, lean long legs.

When you finally reach your destination, which was apparently Aerial's house, you follow him inside, and he leads you to the only room on the top floor. You both tiptoe in, and he seats you on a chair adjacent to his.

Whispering, he orders you, "You cannot tell anyone about what just happened in the forest, do you understand?"

Frightened, you nod. He continues, "I am a prophet. Not many are aware, including Aerial and Ranor. My father is the only one besides you and I who knows. I cannot risk revealing my secret. The dark elves, the orcs... they could exploit my power, and if they captured me... You must swear you will not tell!"
1321111111121111.title: The Prophecy

13211111111211111.content:
He breathes a sigh of relief. "Thank you," he says.

You nod. Probing his mind, you ask, "Why did Ranor distrust me so? And why do you trust me? Why do not all of the elves in Dora Moore like you? I sensed some enmity as you passed..."

"Ranor... he trusts no one but those in this village. He considers the others "outsiders". As an outsider, you may find reason to hurt or betray us. And I... peered into your mind. I had to prove that you were to be trusted..."

"You haven't answered my other question," I remind him. "Why do they dislike you?"

He reddens slightly. "I...I am a... a mixed-breed, some might say. My mother was a woodland elf, and my father a dark elf." Your eyes widen, and he continues. "Because of my ancestry, many elves do not trust me."

"And your parents..." you ask.

"My father abandoned my mother after he captured her and forced her to marry him. She conceived me, and he left... She brought me here, to the woodland elves. Soon after, she died."

"I'm sorry," you murmur. "Who was she?"

"She was Iandra, sister of Mikia. I am Ranor's cousin."

You gasp at this new revelation. Heero suddenly has a fit of coughing, and doubles over, wheezing. You walk over, placing your hand on his back to soothe and comfort him. You can hear his heart beating beneath your palm, can feel the blood pumping through his veins. For a moment, you have an overwhelming urge to... kiss him?

Your gentle touch seems to reassure him. After a few more moments, he stops his hacking and wheezing, and sits up straight again. "Are you okay?" you ask, concerned.

Heero nods his head. "The... the magic, some would say curse, that gives me the prophecies...it weakens my body sometimes. I can't control it... it seems to be something from my father, I think..." he says, panting heavily.

You stand up. "You need to get some rest," you order. You reach out your hand to help him up, and he grasps it tightly. He stands up, and as he does so, he tucks a strand of your hair behind your ear. You gasp with surprise, and...
You stand up. "You need to go to bed and rest," you order
13211111111211111.title: Secrets Unfold

132111111112111111.content:
Who would have ever thought you'd have your first kiss with an elf, or that you'd be one, either?! Now all of a sudden, you appear in this magical fantasy world, you get changed into an elf, you attack a couple of orcs, you get rescued by two elves, both of whom are romantically attracted to you, and then you kiss one of them!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ---------------------------------------
Kissing Heero was the highlight of your day. Scratch that: the highlight of your life! Obviously, he likes you back, because he kisses you back!

Suddenly, Ranor walks in mid-kiss. You and Heero try to pull away as fast as possible, but it's too late. Ranor sees you, and the look of hurt, disgust, and betrayal on his face says it all. He loved you, or at least was emotionally attached, and Heero was like a brother to him, and now you and Heero have been discovered kissing in an upstairs room. Yeah, you'd be pretty upset too if you were him.

Ranor stalks off downstairs again, and you and Heero follow him down. Heero then walks outside to "calm down" and you...
132111111112111111.title: To Love an Elf

choices: Tell him that you love Heero.
Tell him that you love him.
1321111111121111111.content:
You try to catch up to Ranor, who you are following, but by the time you get to the first floor, he's already disappeared. Noticing Aerial in the hallway, you ask her if she knows where he went.

"The Grove," she answers. "It's his thinking place."

You mutter your thanks, then take off in the direction of the forest. Somehow, you instinctively know the location of the Grove. (Let's face it, before now, you weren't paying attention to locations or anything.) Suddenly, you see a green and gold blur entering the forest. Knowing that it's Ranor, you run even faster (now everything is passing in a blur of color) toward him.

Finally reaching your destination, you plop yourself down on a log next to Ranor, who has collapsed in a fit of fury. As he cries tears of frustration and anguish, you put your arm around him to comfort him, but he pushes you away. Finally, after about ten minutes of total awkward silence, he looks over at you, his face red and blotchy from crying. "Why?" he asks simply. "Why?"

You don't know how to answer, so you just let your feelings flood his mind. He nods, then buries his face in his hands once again. He looks up again a minute later, then asks,"Which of us will you choose, then?"

Oh, no! I can't choose, not yet... you think. But he wants an answer now...
1321111111121111111.title: The Choice

choices: You go tell the news to Heero
You go somewhere to think by yourself
13211111111211111112.content:
" I love you." The whisper came quietly from your lips so quietly, that if he had not been an elf, he would not have heard.

Ranor's blotchy eyes widen in astonishment. You wet our lips before caressing your aching head in your hands. The foreign hair bunched under your fingers in a mass. You twist it nervously while you try to put your thoughts to words.

" But I think I love Heero too." A nervous laugh escapes before you continue. " Everything is so different here!" And the emotions are stronger; you add silently. Each minor emotion was intensified in this new body. Even meeting his eyes sent aches through your heart.

You have had enough.

" Sarn farn palan." ( This is far enough.) You say suddenly, and stand up slowly from the log. A small part of you wonders how you had come to know these words, but the other merely shrugs it off.

" Goheno nin." ( Forgive me.) The drama and sudden romance has left you floundering and frightened. You wish to make your leave before you can say ( or do) anything stupid. You have managed to create a triangle between two elves, in a matter of DAYS!

Ranor does not move but watches you with wary eyes. You look away before running off.
13211111111211111112.title: Tell him that you love him.

132111111112111111122.content: You run back to the room where you woke up, and consider all the things that happened today, all that you wish you'd done differently. You fervently hope that it's not too late to have a friendship with whichever you don't choose. One one hand, you're starting to feel like what you felt for Heero might have been pity, but on the other, what if that's what you felt for Ranor, too? But you think about all of the experiences you've had... what should you do? Who do you choose? The elven prince, or his emotionally unstable cousin?
132111111112111111122.title: Elven Pondering...

choices: Find a safe way back over the ravine.
13211112.content:
You dart left, running with all your might. Soon you are face to face with a deep dried up river bed. If you stop running, your pursuers will have you for lunch. If you continue, you'll end up dead on the rocks below.

But what if you could fly?

You quickly blurt out an elven spell calling on the birds. Thousands of birds take to flight as you leap off the cliff. The birds join together, and just like the mosh pits back home, you land on them as they cushion and carry you across the deadly terrain.

Your pursuers shoot arrows, but it is no use. You are already out of their range and on your way to safety. They dare not cross the deep ravine.

The birds let you fall once your feet are a few feet from the ground. You smile and thank them for their help.

You stand there, looking around, trying to get your bearings. You think you just travelled in the wrong direction.
13211112.title: In Flight (F)

choices: Follow the ravine back to the original point of crossing.
132111121.content:
You can sense that you are not where you need to be. You feel you must find your way back to your path, your destiny. You walk down, following the ravine. The ravine begins to shallow the further you go, but your 6th sense tells you of impending danger should you go further.
You stop, surveying your surroundings. The ravine is rocky, but not as steep or deep as it was. With your light elven feet and nimble body, you can cross this ravine.
Finding your footing, you take a step down. The rocks are supporting your weight well, and you come to the bottom of the ravine without incident. The climb up does not look so easy, but it must be done.
Carefully you climb, one hand grasping for a good grip, while the feet try to remain steady. You have done pretty well and are half way to the top. Suddenly a sound that is out of place catches your attention. It is a bird, but not one that should be here.
You look around as best you can while hanging on the ravine wall.
Duck!!
You crouch as a huge bird appears from over the edge of the ravine (the edge you are climbing on). He screaches as he passes, giving you quite a scare. Turning, you see the bird is an oversized eagle, soaring low. You watch until the bird is out of sight, puzzled. You could swear you saw a person riding on it's back!
With the eagle gone, you concentrate on climbing the rest of the way up.
Reaching the top, you stand and wipe the dust and dirt from your clothing. You can go straight ahead, or walk back up along the ravine to where you first crossed. Having no map, it is impossible to tell which way is the best.
132111121.title: The Ravine (F)

1321111211.content:
Your first instinct is to return to where you left your path and start again from there, but then you remember the orcs. Indecision haunts you as you stare at the dense forest ahead. You are beginning to panic as memory of the orcs, the puzzling bird, and the vastness of the forest seem overwhelming.
"shhhhhhh" comes a faint sound from everywhere and nowhere at once. Before you can even wonder at the sound, you realize that the forest is calming you. Ashamed at your lack of faith, you close your eyes and take deep healing breaths. You let your spirit mingle with that of the forest, feeling its deep joy and quiet sadness and you peacefully revel in that intimacy. When you open your eyes, you know exactly where to go. You know that the forest, friend and teacher, will always guide your steps if you but listen.
As you walk lightly through the woods, you hear a piercing shriek that you connect with the unnatural bird you saw earlier. Instinctively, you know that this bird is somehow connected to the battle raging between good and evil. You wonder if you should follow it to learn more of your quest, or continue toward the river.
1321111211.title: Faith

1321112.content: You watch as the wounded orc and his companion race for the tree. One of them has already notched an arrow. You decide to test your new abilities. As the orc shoots, you leap, and land lightly in another tree. The orcs look around in bewilderment. You carefully notch another arrow and take careful aim at the confused, wounded orc. Your aim is true and he drops to the ground twitching, an arrow protruding from his grotesque forehead. The other nervously looks around before racing into the shadow of the wood. You glance at his disappearing form and then along the path which you were to take. What to do?
1321112.title: The Fight (F)

13211121.content:
You hate to leave a job unfinished, so you leap down and race after the orc. It doesn't take long to catch up to him as you draw your bow.
Surprisingly, he stops and turns. He must have sensed you. You heard that the orcs were once elves, so it's possible they still have some of the elven senses.
The orc quickly draws his bow as you aim yours. Feeling confident you say, "I would not do that if I were you. For you will meet the same fate as your friends."
As you assumed, the orc does not even consider your suggestion and takes aim.
You fire your arrow before he does, and watch as it flies, nailing him between the eyes. He freezes then falls backwards, dead.
A smile grows wide on your face as you revel in your victory.
You turn to go back but stop when you hear...clapping. Someone is applauding you?
13211121.title: The Last Kill (F)

choices: Shaylynn - let's go for his heart
132111211.content:
Without thinking, you turn and shoot towards the one making the noise. Your sensitive ears picking up their exact position.
Your eyes widen and you gasp as you watch your arrow knocked off course by another arrow coming from the trees. The one your arrow was meant for is standing and smiling at you.

"Don't worry," he said with a chuckle, "I won't take that personally."
He begins to walk toward you, "My name is Zion. I am curious to know who shares my dislike of orcs."

As Zion nears, you can see that he is clearly elven. Not only from the way he is dressed, which is much like yourself, but his pointed ears are a dead giveaway. His hair is a toasted golden brown and his eyes are a nice shade of blue. He is very pleasant to look upon, and his face shows kindness, but also strength and nobility.
You have been staring at him so intently, that you almost forgot his question.

You smile clumsily, "I do. I share your dislike of orcs."

His smile broadens even more, and behind him other elves are jumping down from the trees.

"Do you have a name, or shall I choose one for you?"

Liking his suggestion you reply, "Choose one for me, for I am in a new place, a new realm. It would suffice that I have a new name as well."

He nods, "Very well then. I am fond of the names Lindell and Shaylynn. They both have meaning in the elven tongue. Lindell means keeper of the forest. Shaylynn means keeper of the heart."

The other elves begin to gather around as Zion waits for your decision.
132111211.title: New Friends & A New Name (F)

1321112111.content: "I will be Lindell..." you whisper. all the other elves bob approvingly. "Come to our ville, won't you, Lindell?" suggests Zion. you shrug, mind racing over all the possibilities.
1321112111.title: Lindell

choices: you leave in a hurry and head back the way you came from returning to the path
13211121111.content:
“That depends, are you a good elf or a bad elf” you smile teasingly and strung your bow with one of twelve ivory arrows

He smiles back and laughed with the rest of his men “you…I like”

You smiled back, before flinging the arrow, straight past his head and into the tree behind him. “Same Question”

Zion sighed “you are out numbered completely and yet you still fight back…well if it makes you feel any better, we are elves of the woods, one with nature and live to disembowel evil…Satisfied”

You shrug your shoulders before replying... “Hardly…but I think I might come with you, someone needs to protect you from the Orcs”

Zion stood opened mouthed as he watched you walk off into the forest; you smiled at yourself amused…for someone who had hardly any experience with guys you could sure leave a good impression…

Not long after Zion caught up to you.

“Why do you lead if you have no idea where were heading’

You smiled again “the trees tell me” and with that you broke into a run…before entering a small clearing… not long after the others joined you.

“Took your time” you breathed

Zion just glared at you…before smiling once again

“welcome to our home…what do you think”

“It’s nice…I like it. So now that I’ve seen your home I shall be off” you turned to leave but Zion had you by the elbow.

“Were do you think your going…at least stay for the night”
13211121111.title: go with them

1321112112.content:
Being the romantic that you are, you smile and say, "Shaylynn."

Zion looks deeply into your eyes, making you feel as if your legs would melt beneath you.

"Welcome to the realm of the woodland elves, Shaylynn."

His voice is like a dream and soothes your mind. Looking upon him, you have completely forgotten about the orc's or any other dangers of the forest. Has the name also transformed your mind? Zion's eyes hold deep mysteries, but he interrupts your thoughts, lest the mysteries be revealed.
You hear his voice in your mind. His lips do not move. "You have chosen the path of love."

Zions smiles and then says out loud, "Come. I will show you our village."

Slinging your bow over your shoulder and taking Zion's warm hand, he leads you through the forest.
1321112112.title: The Path of Love (F)

choices: Leave it - suggest going into the village.
13211121121.content:
Zion meanders through the woods until you reach a stream. Beyond that, a village glowing as the amber sun sets.

"This is our village, Dora Moore."

The other elves walk ahead into the village, as the two of you stand gazing. The village is beautiful, a marriage of the trees and houses like you have never seen before. Indescribable architecture interwoven in branches and tree trunks, make the village seem even more like a dream. Warm lights begin to appear as the shadows of the forest grow long.

Zion has filled his canteen from a cool spring in the brook. The babbling brook brings peace to your soul. You sit near the edge and remove your boots, wading your feet in the cool water. Zion plants himself close beside you. He pushes your long hair away from your face, his voice as beautiful as the brook, "Has your journey so far been a difficult one?"

Taking a deep breath and exhaling slowly, you reply, "Challenging, exciting, but I would not say too difficult thus far. I expect this is the easy part. Am I correct?"

You can feel Zion staring at you, so you turn to meet his gaze.
