"I would say yes, this is the "easy" part," he replies softly. "The path to follow after here is treacherous. We can help you here, prepare you for the rest of your journey."

You smile as a cool breeze tickles your neck. The sun has sank into the ground, pulling it's light with it. The moon is low, large, and a fiery orange. Zion is strikingly handsome in the dark amber hues of the evening. He moves straying hair away from your neck, and a chill pulsates down your spine from his touch.

"Your beauty is magic," he whispers.

"But I am the one under a spell," you add.

You hear flutes coming from the village and merry voices. You know that you must enter soon. Do you leave this moment, or do you savor it?
13211121121.title: A Quiet Moment (F)

132111211211.content:
Zion's eyes move from your eyes to your lips. You match the movement with your own eyes, as your heart beat quickens.
Slowly, he leans in, touching his soft lips to yours. Holding your breath, his tender kiss sends waves of energy through your body. You feel your body instinctively shiver as shimmers of starlight flood over you. Your mind sends visions of doves and waterfalls, both peace and passion.
The kiss is pure, and Zion pulls away as slowly and gently as he drew near.
You finally breath again, feeling like you are taking your first breath.
This is a magical moment and you don't want it to end. But the night falls, and the village awaits.
132111211211.title: The Kiss (F)

1321112112111.content:
You look into his eyes and smile gently, then turn your eyes to the village.

"Perhaps we should go to the village now," you say softly, not wanting to break the wonderful magic of the moment. He laughs softly beside you and stands up, reaching down for your hand.

"Then come with me," he says, just as quiet. You smile as you take his hand, standing up and walking into the village with him. Sighing, you look around, wanting to see the whole village, but knowing you can't stay long. Zion surprises you a moment later with a soft request; "Would you like to stay with me? I would like to get to know you better before you leave on your journey. And.. perhaps I could help you."

You turn to look into his eyes, wondering what to do. You know you want to spend more time with him, but do you dare distract yourself even more from your quest?
1321112112111.title: Entering the Village

13211121121112.content:
Your face saddens and you step away.

"i must decline Zion. My quest must not delay and i have been distracted too long already."
Zion musters a smile. " I understand. We will visit the elder..he will help you"

You and Zion enter the village leaders hut. The old elven man perks up.
"Zion? that is you yes?"

" It is."
" And you have company with you?"
" I do..a elven woman."

You step forward.
"There is a strange wind surrounding you. Most curious. You are destined for great battles and a historic destiny, but not without sacrifice and loss."
the old man frowns.

"You must continue south. More will be revealed to you there.
good luck my child."

Zion escorts you to the village gate.
" I wish you had stayed."

" Me too...but i'll be back. we'll see each other soon."
You hug Zion with tears in your eyes and continue your journey south.
13211121121112.title: another day

132111211212.content:
"I am sorry," you say, "But I'm afraid I have no time for this at the moment. Perhaps at the end of my quest we can continue this. Shall we go into the village? I have some need of provisions before I can continue my journey to the rivers of Dan."

"No, I am the one who should be sorry," Zion replies. "Come, Let's get you taken care of."

He stands, takes your hand, and helps you to your feet. You walk together to the village.

Once inside the village, you are given a knapsack filled with food and supplies for your journey. The Elves of Dora Moore also present you with the gift of an elfish sword. You thank them and turn to continue on your journey but someone stops you.

"May I accompany you on your journey?" Zion asks. "I may be able to help you understand both your own powers and the powers of the sword you now possess. I would also protect you to my utmost ability."
132111211212.title: gift of a sword

choices: Shoot the creature in the bushes...
Let it come out, but be cautious...
132111212.content:
As you turn you can only hear the clapping, but you cannot see where it comes from. You tighten your grip on your bow and begin to pull it into a shooting position. You clear your mind and focus, ready to attack if need be.
You hear the clapping once more and you reply to the applause,"Why do you hide yourself?"
No answer comes.
"Where are you hiding? Who are you?" You calmly say, not letting your voice sound as if you were afraid.
The clapping stops and you hear a rustling come from some bushes straight across from you. You still have your bow in hand and you're ready to shoot, but should you? Whatever it is in the bushes, it will not answer you. It hasn't made it clear if it means harm to you, or if you are the only one being threatening.
The bushes keep rustling and you see a hand slowly come out from it. The forest has many trees, and one grand tree hides the light from the section of the forest you are in. You cannot see it very well in the shade. What is it? You think. What is it going to do? Wait, what are you going to do?
132111212.title: Cautious Choices

choices: Run from him...remember trust no one
Ask why he roams this wood
1321112122.content: "Beautifully done." the shadow speaks in a deep, intriguing tone. "I've not seen such determination in years" The form slowly moves into the light and you can see it clearly for the first time. It's a man, human. "Who are you?" you question the creature again. You can't help but notice his lean figure, and his intensly green eyes. "I'm Chiriann, I have walked this wood for centuries now." "But you're a human...you don't look all that old." His smile is slow casual and all it once it sets off something in your 6th sence."Well, my dear, wizards are apt to live a little longer than your average human." You think you might like this guy, the confidence he radiates is something your oddly compelled to, your first instinct is to stop and talk, maybe you will find help from this enchanting wizard. You pause for a moment and suddenly you feel the urge to run...
1321112122.title: Chiriann

13211121222.content:
You know that your sixth sense is alerting you of impending danger, but curiosity overcomes the fear, and you chance a question.


"Why do you roam these woods, Wizard?" you ask, keeping your bow trained on the stranger.


"Why, to protect the path from intruders, of course." The old man chuckles, and snaps his fingers. Dozens of orcs step from the shadows. "We can't have anyone interfering, now, can we? So, what'll it be, young one? Fight and die, or submit and live?"


You allow your eyes to roam over the orcs. This could really be it, you think. All of them have bows trained on you; if you shoot one, dozens of arrows will come to rest in your body. Slowly, you look upwards. There is a tree branch only a few feet up, if you could jump quickly enough, perhaps you could make it.


Perhaps.
13211121222.title: A Perilous Choice

choices: You submit to her and discover more mysteries.
You attack her and try to fight your way out.
132111212221.content:
With a swift movement you grab hold of the branch and disppear into the massive tree above you, the tree is as dark and mysterious as the forest. The speed with which you vanished, gave you a feeling of imense pride but also intimitaded you a bit 'coz you were still to master the powers bestowed in you.

You keep running and jumping from branch to branch, you can hear the panicked voices drifting behind you, ' that was just too darn easy' you thaught. Eventually when you were convinced of your safety, you get back on the ground but still uncertain about your next course of action.

Suddenly you feel yourself loosing control, your legs start trembling, your hands are'nt moving any more, your mind can't control your body movements and before you know it, you fall straight on your face. After a few seconds of blackout, you get back on your feet.

To your surprise you see a beautiful girl standing infront of you with a wand in her hand, she looked very pissed 'but could'nt have looked prettier' you thaught. 'What was that all about" you asked her casually, as if her little attack did'nt affect you much, even though your head was aching and felt as if it will blow off any time.

"How dare you disrespect my father you intruder?" she said with a authoritative yet polite tone.
"Darn it, the whole family is on a lookout for me" you think, even tough you prefer this member of the family more tahn her father, inspite of her attacking you.
The girl comes closer to you, her mesmerising eyes are locked with your eyes and then clamly she whispers in your ear "This time you have no choice but to submit and maybe live"
132111212221.title: Jump!!!

1321112122211.content:
As you regain your balance, the girl continues to point her wand at you as the multitude of orcs surround you.
"well done Adrianna...well done."

"What shall we do with him sir?"
"Shackle her and disarm her. She can come with us as a....bargaining chip. hehehe."

You march for what seem like hours...all the while noticing the wizard and his daughter continually looking back at you and whispering.
"So much for hospitality." one orc smacks you across the face.
"Mind your tongue or you won't have one!"

You silence your lashing tongue...at least for now.
Still, you wonder why they have spared you...and where they are taking you.
1321112122211.title: not many options

choices: You walk over to the orc and pick up the sword and the bag, and then continue yo
You continue on quest without bothering to look in the bag or get the sword
13211122.content:
You continue on your path.
Your acute hearing allows you to hear the loud breathing of the orc you wounded.

You walk to the side of the path and listen hard.
You see a rustle in the bushes beside the path you draw your bow and notch an arrow into it.

The bushes part a little bit to reveal an ugly bow with an arrow in it.

You take careful aim and shoot a little below the bow sticking out of the bus.

You hear a scream followed by a crash and you see the orc fall of the ledg where the bushes were to the middle of the path.

You see a beautiful sword fall from his had and a bag fall of him that seemed a little heavy.
13211122.title: The sniper.

choices: Plant one of the seeds in the ground
132111221.content: As you walk along the path, revelling in the beauty of the woods, you begin to notice the energy emanating from the orc's bag. When you can't tolerate your curiosity anymore, you plop down in a patch of grass next to a tree and open up the bag. You see a handful of dark purple seeds inside the bag. They've very beautiful, and you're drawn to them. You try to read the energy coming off them to determine their powers, but you have little success. All you can gather is that they were enchanted recently by a very powerful human. You sigh. What should you do now?
132111221.title: The Orc's Bag

1321112211.content:
As you swallow the seed your tongue begins to burn. You fall to the ground, clutching your stomach. Little shocks like lightening run over your body, purple sparks against your fair elven skin. Your vision becomes blurry and the world around you becomes a sharp hum slowly growing louder.
You feel a hand pull you away from the ground. The sun shining from above the trees blinds you.
" Fool!" The person says, though you can bearly make out the words, " Drink this! Quickly!"
1321112211.title: Poisons

choices: Go with her to Dan'ne Dale
Ignore her and continue your journey
13211122111.content:
You grab the vile she offers and gulp it down your burning throat.
Your body instantly cools, and your stomach relaxes. You gasp for the cool air that surrounds you.
" Relax." The person says and takes your hand putting it to their chest. " Follow my breathing."
You do so and your mind begins to clear. Your senses return to you and you can smell that the person is female. Human.
When finally the seeds poisons subside, you push yourself to your knees.
The girl helps you to your feet, and you mumble a thank you.
" What ever possessed you to eat anything an orc carries?" She scorns.
You tried to shake your head, but it still hurts.
you open your eyes to look at her. She is a good head smaller than you, hair the colour of ripe wheat and eyes blue as a dark night.
You take a step forward and fall to your knees.
An odd feeling behind you makes you reach back. You jerk away your ahnd at the touch of something leathery.
" You have grown wings, Elf." The human says. " An effect of the poisons." She placed a hand on your back and helped you to stand yet again.
When you were finally able to stand on you own she collected the fallen seeds from the ground and put them back in the bag, which she then attached to her belt by her sword.
" We must take these to Dan'ne Dale. The Fox will want to know that orcs are carrying these. Come."
13211122111.title: Changes

choices: Run from the city, scared of your appearance
Swallow your fear and head forward
132111221111.content:
" who are you?" You choke out. You're voice is deeper than before, shocking you for a moment.
" The name's Hannah." She replies. " And you?"
You give your name and then ask her about Dan'ne Dale.
" It is the elven city here in the Great Dark Forest."
" But you are human."
She turns to look at you, " Your point?"
You shrug and continue to follow her.
It isn't long before you reach the city. At the thought of meeting others you become nervous and stop before you reach the city entrance.
Hannah stops and looks back at you. " Are you coming?"
132111221111.title: stranger revealed

choices: agree, and follow Hannah into a clearing, to learn how to fly
tell Hannah that we should get to the elven city first
1321112211112.content:
You swallow your fear and hesitantly follow her towards the elven city; the wind rustled threw your newly discovered wings. Only then did you take time to look at them, they were beautiful and pure white…it looked like someone had cut off a white swans wings and attached them to your back, slowly you run your fingers threw the white ruffles of feathers before turning to face Hannah.

“Hannah, are the wings a bad thing or a good thing”

Hannah turned towards you and smiled “no there not bad…just a side affect” as she spoke two wings unfolded out of know where from behind her back, “ When I yelled at you, I was more disappointed in myself for not stopping you before it happened” her voice trailed off and she smiled… “It’s probably best if you fold your wings up so people can’t see, it’s not everyday they see someone with a pair of wings”

You smile back before asking “do they work…I mean can we fly now”

Hannah laughed “sure can…if you like I can show you before we go”

You pick up the brass plaque, thinking you could use it as a weapon if there are any orcs around and a piece of aged paper falls from behind it. There are two rocks in the paper pouch. One says:

"Go West. You may wish to learn the target of your journey into this Mystical Forest, but the price of such knowledge is great, and by choosing to go West henceforth, you will immediately meet someone in your path that can explain it. The other says:
"Go East. You may wish to obtain more powers to overcome your obstacles and become more powerful as you journey into this Mystical Forest, but the price of such a power is great, and by choosing to go East henceforth, you will immediately meet someone in your path who will grant you that power. But for the bit of magic he shall give, he requires payment for Orcs are hostile, edgy creatures that like surprises. 13211122121.content:
Twigs snapped below my feet as I began traversing my westward course. Although the night air whispered cautious words I swiftly tackled the drying underbrush beneath me with ardent anticipation of the human I would soon encounter.

It had only been what felt like moments since I was a human myself and though my new powers were seductive, I longed for this human to quicken me with his mortal enchantments.

No sooner had I thought those words when I heard him. It wasn't his voice I heard but the distrust in his heart as he stood behind the trees hoping I would not catch a glimpse of him.

I did not approach him, nor did I leave, I remained as solid as the stormy steel mountains along the horizon. With a voice lyrical and clear I announced myself. "Mortal man of flesh and fear, come forth of your tree and face me here".

"I do not fear thee" he replied. He turned on his right heel and deliberately drew near. Tall and strong he approached me. His dark clothing echoed what I could hear of his heart. I maintained my position, willing my feet to grow roots. The earth seemed to accomodate and I was undaunted. "What do you want of me Elf" he asked. "I desire to know the way to my destiny" I replied. His aventurine eyes gleamed with enjoyment of my questioning as he closed in on me.

"I do not help Elves" the dark man announced, "There is nothing you could offer for my assistance". Knowing that this was the human the Tree of Destiny had promised, I raised my arms to the heavens and summoned the winds. "Elements of Air, attend me now!" No sooner had I billowed my command when the silver clouds converged and Mother Nature exhaled. The strength of her great breath sent the dark man into the air and he fell to the ground. I had finally gained his attention. "Only at my side will you gain what you seek, magick taunts you and your desire for her consort makes you weak." I continued to speak "I shall grant the desire of your heart and teach you to divine, but by the strength of Mother Earth and the creatures that inhabit her, DO NOT CROSS ME!" "Tell me dark man, will you come or no?"

"Well, since I'll have this one on my tail as long as your with me I'll just have to settle with one or the other."

He is furious that he has to take just one of us and his eyes burn a beautiful ember and you think him gorgeus in the light. You take in for once how handsome he is. His black hair shines in the moonlight, his green eyes glow, and his muscular body so full of power.

"Take me. As you said, you have no quarrel with Gawain. You can not mock him and call him a coward when he runs and then get angry when he does not run."
"Ah, you are a wise, young elf," says Lance," and you will make better company on the way back to the castle. Very well then." 132112.content:
You decide to avoid the confrontation for now. Your confidence is waivering in the site of the four Orc's. It's the first time you've seen them up close and not in a book or a movie! They are even larger than you thought and their stinch is nauseating.
You wait, unmoving, until they begin to move along. You watch them until they have disappeared from view. You now feel that it is safe for you to continue forward, and you only hope you will not have to encounter them again.
You slowly stand up, still looking in the direction they left. Taking a deep breath and letting it out slowly, you turn around.

There are 6 sharp and ready arrows pointed at you, aiming at every vital point of your body. Each arrow drawn back by an elf. The 7th elf is standing directly before you, but does not have his arrow drawn, neither bow in hand. His peircing eyes make you feel transparent. And the arrows make you feel afraid.

"Who are you?" he asks.

You are unsure what to say, as your tongue is quiet with surprise and a bit of fear. You decide honesty is the best policy - afterall, you have nothing to hide and these elves do not seem to be evil.

"I am a woman who has been chosen by the great white wizard to complete a mission. I am to journey South to the Rivers of Dan. But I am afraid I do not know much more than that."

The elf raises an eyebrow, looking at you intensly. You can feel another question coming.

"Why did you not attack the Orcs?"

You glance at the ground not wanting to admit you were afraid.

"The wizard transformed me into an elf. I was afraid and unsure of my skill. I have a bow and well crafted arrows that are sharp and sure, but have never even drawn one back. I was not certain I could fight them alone."

The elf nods as if he already knew that and motions to the others to lower their bows. A sigh of relief comes over you and you slightly relax your over-tensed muscles.

"Come with us," the elf says.

You follow, feeling confident of safety with them and wanting to know more about your mission. You seem to know they have information that will be highly valuable to you and will help determing the course of your future.
132112.title: Meeting of the Elves (F)

choices: Ask Zaron to enter with you.
1321121.content:
The elves lead the way and the one who spoke to you drops back to walk beside you. He is tall and well built. His white blonde hair seems to have strands of gold mixed in. His piercing eyes are a deep blue, that stand out against his fair skin.

"My name is Zaron, of the village Dora Moore. I am head of the scouts in this forest, who guard and protect our borders. I'm sorry our meeting was in an unusual way and hope we did not startle you too badly."

You smile and say, "Oh no, not at all," you lie. "It's completely understandable."

"You will find rest in our borders and are welcome. We can help you perfect your marksmanship and learn other weapons also. Our leader, Mikia, will have further wisdom for you to help you on your quest."

It is not long before you can see the village. The structures are made of the forest wood, beautiful and graceful arches with intricate designs. You have never seen such brilliant architecture. As you enter the village, the other elves disband and split in two different directions. You and Zaron continue to walk forward, crossing over a wooden bridge that leads to the largest tree you have ever seen. It is the entrance to the house of Mikia.
You stop short of the entrance, staring at the beautiful place, in awe. Zaron stops and turns to you.

"This is the house of Mikia. He is expecting you."

Feeling brave after having been in the company of other elves you enter the house alone.

"Would you like me to accompany you?" Zaron asks.

You look intently into his eyes. You do not want him to leave your side but you know this quest is yours.

"Thank you. But I must do this alone."

Zaron smiles slightly and nods his head.

"He has chosen wisely yet again." Zaron says before he smiles a little wider and walks toward the village.

You stand and wait and watch him walk away. You turn as the door to the house of Mikia opens. The door is a large wooden door with steel reinforcements. The wood is smooth. This house has not yet seen battle.
You step across the threshold and pause to allow your eyes to adjust to the dark but you are pleasantly surprised that you new eyes do not need to adjust.
Across the room is a large chair. The chair is vacant but you can still see the seat slowly returning to its original shape as if someone has just left it. You look around and notice no other items in this room except for the chair and a long colorful rug leading up to it.

"Amazing isn't it?"

You turn to where the voice is coming from and from across the room and behind a pillar comes a tall figure. Long hair that reaches down the back of his legs. You see by the ears and eyes that he, too, is an elf. His long robes flow ever so slightly as he walks toward you.

"Excuse me?" you ask.

"Your new eyes. You did not have to wait for them to get used to the dark. You will find all of your newfound abilities to be equally, if not more, amazing that that one."

"Yes. It did surprise me a bit. Do you know me?"

"Know you? Your arrival has been foretold by the Elders of Old. We are all expecting you."

You look at him for just a moment. By this time he has made his way to you and is standing but a distance away from you. Part of you is still apprehensive about all this but his eyes are friendly and there are no weapons about.

"Take care, my new friend. Although no weapons made by man are around you must still be cautious.
Now, come, you must be hungry after that long trip. Dine at my table and let us talk."

He turns to walk but hesitates and turns back to you waiting for you to follow.

1321121112.title: Eat your fill

13211211121.content:
"She mustn't leave yet," Zaron said, somewhat adamantly from what you can tell. "She is an infant in our world."
"She is chosen for this task." You detect the all-knowing tint to Mikia's soft, almost soothing words. "You are young yet, Zaron, as is she. She shall discover her abilities in due course. The magician knows all. That is why he chose her."
You silently step and touch on the wood of the door. Your hands begin to tingle once more, and you can feel as you are slowly enveloped by a secure blanket of wood. The door seems to welcome you as you effortlessly become one with its being, and the tree that once was merges with the elven being that is. You never have to break your concentration, still eavesdropping and becoming the wooden door. Now, however, you can see.
Zaron, his golden-white hair shining, is gesturing fluidly with the gracefulness adn ease of his speaking. "Yes, I know. The magician knows all, sees all, is never wrong, always chooses and appoints... I just am expressing my concern that she is not ready for this. By all accounts, she hasn't even spent a full day in the incarnation of an elf!"
You see Mikia raise his hand in a gesture to calm or stop Zaron. Strangely enough, Mikia's piercing gaze swivels and lands on the door--unmistakenly over you! "I agree with the magician if he believes she is ready." Mikia gave a barely imperceptible nod of the head in acknowledgement, but you caught the movement.
"How so?"
Mikia's lips turn upwards in a grimace-like smile, and, in a way, almost rueful in the bittersweet, mocking way of the elves. "She seems to have discovered, of her powers, the ability to become one with elements and figures of nature." He paused without breaking his gaze. "It is all right," he urges quietly to you. "Come forward. This is more your decision than anyone else's."
As easily as you entered the wood, you feel yourself leave, your form molding back into its soft, curving manifestation. You seem to be able to sense a deep, strong emotion from Zaron, yet you are unsure as to what it is exactly. "Why have you been talking about me?" you ask, trying to avoid Zaron's gaze. You manage to catch it anyways: awe, admiration, a strong and connective bond... There isn't much you can make of it. "If this concerns me, give me the decision to make myself."
Mikia nodded, his eyes glowing. He seems to realize Zaron's reaction. "Yes. You are a perfectly capable elf. That is why we wish to know: do you want to travel alone, or with a companion?" Mikia's stare is intent. "You are harnessing your abilities well, handling them--somewhat--appropriately." The elf smiled again. "As you may have heard, Zaron has expressed his concern that you need a companion on your journeying. The roads are hard and treacherous, especially where you must go to fulfill your task. In your opinion, with best interests in mind, would you find it easier to complete your mission were I to send, say, for example, Zaron with you as a companion and equal?"
13211211121.title: Eavesdropping

132112111211.content:
"I do not mind, it is always nice to have someone with you when you travel. Also thank you for your concern Zaron, but if we are traveling together, pay attention to your own safety as well."
"Of course." You smile at his face which held admiration still along with awe as Mikia goes to a table where a bag lay with contents surrounding it.
Mikia urges to come forth to see the contents of what lies around the bag as he asks, "We have prepared food and medicine for you, but since you both will be going now please wait while we another bag for Zaron."
"Of course, if you need me I will be at the stream, Zaron come with me."
Taking his hand you both go to the stream and you take off your boots before setting your feet in the stream. Zaron sits beside you looking intently at your face.
"What? Is there something on my face?"
"No, no, it's just I now that I look closely you look very beautiful."
"Thank you."
"Now that I remember also, I never got your name, what is it?"
132112111211.title: Yes; send him with you

1321121112111.content:
"Ashelia, but you can call me Lia."
"Well, I'm happy to meet you Lia."
"Thanks."
You lay back with your feet in the water while you stare at the sky and close your eyes. As time passes you feel yourself sleep away to exhaustion but just when you were about to fall asleep you feel something on your lips. Slowly you open your eyes to see Zaron gone, so you stand and go back to the village where you find Mikia giving Zaron two bags.
Mikia sees and says, "Come, all has been set, I wish both good luck on your journey."
"Thank you, Mikia, thank you for all your help."
"Not at all, now get going before night falls."
Zaron and you leave the village, heading straight for the forest as Zaron asks,
"Where will we go, Lia?"
1321121112111.title: Ashelia(Lia)

1321121112112.content:
"My name is Kaira," you say by instinct. You know the name is not what you were called before the wizard summoned you, but you can not remember any other name. You notice Zaron's eyes ever so slightly widen and shift from your eyes to your mouth.
"Kaira...yes, that does make sense. Now, tell me, can you tell more about a person by listening to their voice than watching them?"
"Yes," you say shocked,"How did you know?"
"Kaira means melody. Your voice and breath are very powerful and, listening is of great importance to you," Zaron said with great admiration in his voice. "Take a look at the stream, now. Sing it a light melody."
Intrigued, you stand up and walk to the middle of the shallow stream, quietly humming as you do so. To your surprise, your clothes do not get wet. The water seems to form a pocket of air that follows you. when you get to the middle, you take a deep breath. Before you realize it, you hear your own voice flowing with the water. You're voice has never sounded this sweet ad strong. Ribbons of water connect with your finger tips and you will the water to form a dome around yourself. Your tone of voice shifts sightly and your hands do an intricate dance with the water ribbons. You watch in awe as the water trickles upward, around you. Soon, you realize that the water itself is singing back to you. Not vocally, but mentally. You let your instincts take control of yourself, and you somehow manage to keep your dome intact while walking back to Zaron.
"Kaira...that was amazing," Zaron says, "I had no idea you were that powerful."
"Neither did I," you say," but I am glad we found out now while we have time to improve than when we really would need my skill, like in battle. Zaron, what is your talent? Do all elves have a special talent?"
"Not all elves have talents, no. Some are generic, just here to survive and help others survive. I have a very developed feeling sense. I can tell when people are lying by their heartbeats, which i feel though the ground they're standing on. That is why I was so concerned with your safety, because I could sense your nervousness and agitation. By the way, I am truly sorry we frightened you earlier."
Suddenly, you hear a very delicate and stealthy footstep about 2 miles to the east, and you can tell my the change in Zaron's expression that he senses it too.
"Zaron, can you tell what it is?"
"I am not sure yet, but I am almost positive it is an elf. Listen to the trees and grass around them. Can you decipher any of the noises?"
"Let me try."
You close your eyes and focus all of your energy on the strange footsteps. They are delicate, but not as dainty as a female's, so it must be a man. The forest seems to hum and glow where ever his feet touch earth, so he can not be a evil elf. You relay this information to Zaron.
His expression becomes puzzled, then he gasps.
"Kaira, we must hurry!"
1321121112112.title: Kaira

choices: Let's give him a chance. Having allies is a good investment.
13211211121122.content:
"We have to go back! We must warn Mikia!" Zaron turns around quickly, sprinting in the opposite direction with you hot on his heels. You never lost your footing, swerving from side to side through the trees. You took a moment to turn to Zaron and frowned at the worry in his eyes.

"What's wrong Zaron! I sense no evil from him!"

"You never will." Zaron announced seriously and narrowed his eyes. "This man is not evil but he is not an elf! I am unsure of what his intentions are, he is unpredictable!" Your eyes widen, for if he was not an elf what was he? Focusing on the task at hand you listened to the land and trees to try and locate the being. You concentrated on the rough lull of the trees on gasped at their worried shouts. Look out, Look out! He is nearing! "Zaro-" You called out quickly before being knocked to the ground by a green blur, and skidded across the forest floor.

"Kaira!" Zaron shouted, leaping to your side in an instant. Whispering a quick incantation, Zaron pulled out wooden lance made of many intertwined branches, it hummed with power and rattled the air surrounding it. You gapped in awe at the power you felt humming from the weapon, before shaking your head and standing up instinctively readying your bow and arrows. You set your back against Zarons, the both of you keeping vigilant.

"Zaron, my good friend! Why must you be so serious?" A deep voice echoed threw the woods, chuckling.

Zaron glared out of the clearing with a grimace. "We are NOT friends."

"Now, now, don't be so harsh! Don't tell me your STILL angry with me?" The voice spoke good naturedly, suddenly very close to you. You quickly whipped around firing an arrow at the source only to have missed by a millimeter and the bow knocked from her hands. You gasped as you were slammed into a tree a large hand gripping your face, you yelped and kicked at the attacker as you tried to gather your wits.

"Oooh? Who's this pretty miss? She actually managed to nick me......"

"Release her immediately Dalio!" Zaron demanded calmly. You wince as you felt the grip on your face tighten, breathing deeply you calmed yourself and sunk into the tree finally etting a good look at your attacker. He stood an inch taller than Zaron, with deep green eyes and a wild brown mane that spiked back. He was slightly menacing with sharp teeth and dark ruin marks etched into his arms and chest. The only clothing he seemed to have was a pair of dark green pants. You shivered slightly as his eyes lit up with interest. "Oh? I can do that to!" He announced reaching into the tree but was knocked away with a fierce blow to gut from the end of Zaron's lance.

"Enough Dalio! Why are you here? Come to destroy even more elven lives?" Zaron said grimly, as you exited the tree warily.

Dalio sighed in an exasperated manner. "That was an accident-"

"You call recklessly abusing your powers and ending hundreds of innocents an accident?" Zaron interrupted coldly. Dalio paused for a moment as if to rebuke him but stopped and shrugged. "What can I say? Us sprites like to live o the wild side." You stared at the being in disbelief , how could he brush off such serious inquiry so insensitively....and yet the forest was just as accepting to him as it was for her.

"Anyway I haven't come this far to cause any....mischief right now. I'm hear to join you on your way to the traveler."

"What?" Zaron questioned in disbelief. You stared at the sprite unsurely....maybe...if he were to come.
13211211121122.title: alert Mikia

132112112.content:
When he turns you look searchingly at him.
"Why should i trust you?"

He promply replies with, " why should you not trust me?"

" I have been taught from a young age to never trust unknown men and especially those who seem wise. For what may appear as wisdom is all to often deadly cunning."

" Do you question the Elders Of Old?", he returned sharply.

"No i question those that i do no know. I seek answers, about what my quest involves and where i truly am."

"Ahh, you speak wise wisely yourself for one so young", he replied.
His eyes twinkled as he said it and this ensues trust in you.

"I shall give you answers, but first you must understand i do not know the full nature of your quest", he said after a pause.
"Come now we must eat. Knowledge does not rest well in the mines of those who have empty stomachs."

You do feel hungry and if you want answers he will likely give them to you.
132112112.title: You decline the meal and ask for answers

choices: You continue asking questions about why your here.
You continue asking questions about the Items Of Talca.
13211212.content:
"Uh Zanon, could you come with me?" you ask looking at the elf nervously, "It's just that I'm still not sure of myself."

Zanon smiled, "If you wish," He said leading you into the chamber.

Inside was a bookshelf that had books about everything. You looked at them in awe.

"So you like books?" A voice said making you jump. Turning around you see another elf who was a little taller than Zanon. He had long blonde hair that framed his face, Mikia. Blushing you nod.

He smiled, "It is understandable," Mikia sat down on a nearby chair.

Not sure of what to do you ask, "Why am I here?"

"You are one of the chosen few who have the ability to aquire the Precious Item of Talca." Zanon explained.

"What are those?" You cound't help asking.

"They are the Items, that when brought together can Rebuild the world to the beutiful haven it once was, or they can make the whole world like the Swamp Of Ghost River.
13211212.title: Mikia

13212.content:
Unsure of what you will face, caution causes you to veer off your course, just enough to safely miss the unwelcome encouter.

Equipped with only arrows, you realize you might need some further weapons so call upon nature to provide.

You could speak to the trees and ask for a rod made of the strongest oak. This will most certainley enable you to evade in direct encouters, using your strength to keep an enemy at a distance, or flipping them in close encounters.

Or you could call upon the plants and berries, for they can produce an excellent poison. If captured, you can use your wits and stealthy nature to poison the whole camp.
13212.title: weapon call (F)

choices: Slip away and continue your trip
132121.content: Tightly shutting your eyes, you call out mentally to the trees surrounding you. A light shimmering sound ensues, and when it fades away, a sturdy rod of dark wood, covered with mystical carvings, tumbles out of the sapling near you. You run your hands over it...it definitely feels magical. Hefting your new staff, you ponder your next move.
132121.title: The Rod (F)

choices: Take the fox (you can't revive it, but you can eat it!).
Give the fox a proper burial.
1321211.content:
Moving along, you continue to track the movements of the hunters with your sensitive ears. You can hear every twig snap under heavy feet, every loud breath and word. It is likely they are being quiet, but to you they are as loud as if they were stomping and yelling in front of you.
You avoid them and listen as they pass in the opposite direction. It is then you begin to veer back onto your course.
In the distance you spot something. Upon closer inspection, you find a fox, slain by an arrow. The arrow is black through and through, no doubt belonging to those hunters. If so, why haven't they come for their prey? Are they killing for sport only?
Something deep inside turns in anger and disgust at the thought of senseless killings.
1321211.title: Prey (F)

choices: Began gathering herbs and leaves, hoping to make medicine for yourself.
Try to throw up the rest of the fox.
13212111.content:
It would be such a waste of such a fine fox, wouldn't it? You give the fox a good roast, then eat it whole. Your stomach is full, so you continue on your path.
After a while, you grow tired and slowly fall asleep. In the middle of the night, you throw up the some of the fox, groaning. It seems the fox was poisonous, or something else you ate was poison. You gasp and began choking. What should you do?
13212111.title: Take the fox (you can't revive it, but you ...

choices: Try to find the creature to apologize and ask to change you back
132121112.content:
Gagging, you stick your finger in your mouth, trying to throw up the rest of the fox.
"Not so fast, human!" A voice calls out.
"Who's there?!" You ask, looking around.
A pale humanoid fox-like creature appears before you. "You dare to kill a creature of the forest, and get away with it? Oh no, mortal! You must pay a penalty for that."
"W-what penalty?" You gulp, the taste of the fox still in your mouth as you try to not gag in front of this creature.
"By taking it's place. Forever!" It snaps it's fingers, and you curl up, screaming in agony as every inch of you suddenly feels like it's on fire. Your arms shorten and your elbows reverse direction. Your legs shorten as well, your feet stretching as your big toes slide further up your legs, your toenails stretching out, becoming sharp nails. Reddish fur explodes all over your body, and a large tail shoots out over your butt. Your ears move to the top of your head, and become pointed. You feel them swivel around, and every sound seems amplified suddenly. Your mouth and nose fuse and pull out into a muzzle, your nose turning black and wet. Your eyes change to blue. You feel yourself shrinking smaller.
The pain slowly ebbs, and you open your eyes and look around. Everything looks much bigger, including the fox creature who is now smiling at you. "There, mortal. You are now just a fox. Nobody remembers your human life, so forget trying to contact anyone. And beware of hunters if you stray from this area. I bid you good life."
The creature disappears, leaving you, a lonely fox, curled up, confused and alone.
132121112.title: Try to throw up the rest of the fox.

13212112.content:
Angered though you are, you stand there awkwardly, not knowing what to do. Finally, you decide to give the fox a proper burial.
You pick the fox up and carry it to a place with soft soil near a large tree. Using a rock, you dig a small pit. It is a good hour before the pit is dug to your satisfaction.
Intoning an elven ritual, you lay the fox down into the pit, and cover it with the crumbling soil. All the while singing softly a song of release - releasing the spirit of the fox - in the elven tongue.
13212112.title: Burial (F)

choices: Try to get information from the frog.
132121121.content:
You continue on your trek south. The terrian begins to slant and slope, making it difficult to maintain balance. The forest here is not as thick and allows for golden sunlight to filter its way through the trees. Your mood is lifted by this forest on the hills and your pace quickens, despite the steep ground. Soon your ears perk up to the sound of a stream!
A strange golden spark of knowledge flashes in your mind. You know this is Cailen Stream, Frog Haven Stream, in your tongue.
Another spark, and you recognize the stream as one leading to the Rivers of Dan.
Quickly, you follow your ears to the stream. So shallow and seemingly insignificant. You laugh at it's innocence, but know it will lead you to greatness.
Gently poking at the surrounding plants with your rod, several bronzy frogs plop into the water. Peering closely, you notice that there are shoals of tadpoles here and there. A frog lumps and hops over to you. You probe it curiously with your powers, and her movements are translated.

"May I follow you? I sense a sameness between us and I am lonely, even in this stream."

You squint at the female frog, startled.
132121121.title: Cailen Stream

choices: Get ready to face the darkness.
1321211211.content:
You smile at the golen beauty and lower your hand. The small frog leaps in your palm and you raise it to your face. Offering your front pocket, the fron slips in, grateful for the companionship.
You chuckle slightly, amused that the first companion you should find would be a frog.
"Maybe he will turn into a prince if I kiss him," you say out loud to yourself.

Continuing to walk along the beautiful stream, you find a cold spring and fill your canteen. You see other creatures of the forest coming to drink from the pure waters. This is comforting, as it tells you danger is not near.

Walking further downstream, the stream turns into a creek, gradually growing larger as you travel. As the creek grows larger, the forest begins to change and grow dark. The frog in your pocket grows restless, telling you danger is near. You stop, listening.
A bad feeling begins to form in the pit of your stomach. An evil presence draws near. You look around, your sharp eyes picking up moving shadows in the distance. Your ears focus in, barely making out the sounds of light footsteps.
Judging from the scarcity of sound and the evilness in the air, you presume them to be elves, but not the elves you are searching for.
1321211211.title: Glory Turns Ugly (F)

choices: Continue to walk through the night.
Stop for the night, set up camp.
13212112111.content:
You decide to cross the river, not exactly how you are going to do so. You pick up a fallen stick to test the rivers depth as you cross it, so far so good. Finally you get to the other side, the deepest of part of the river only have come up to your waist. You keep the stick and continue to follow the river on the otherside, but just a little into the trees so as to keep out of sight from the dark elf just in case. You feel his presence and you go still, waiting for him to pass.
Finally you feel safe again and you start to walk along the river's banks to find another spot to cross back over. Then you hear someone, friendly voices. You can feel a little bit of heat and through the trees, a short distance off, you can see a fire. You look at the sky, seeing it is getting dark. You know that you can continue on into the night, your elven sight helping you to see in the dark, but do you want to stop?
You wonder to yourself what to do?
13212112111.title: Safe walk on.

132121121111.content:
As you walk the night brings a chill and you once again consider camping. You are not too weary but are very curious as to your mission. You worry about who to trust, whether or not the frog is as innoncent as it seems, and how to deal with the numerous strangers you will encounter on your journey.
As you ponder these thoughts you realise that you are quite near to the campsite now. The friendly sounding voices you heard earlier have gone quiet. No doubt they sense your presence.

"Hello, Friend," a voice calls out. "Come and join us."
132121121111.title: To trust or not

choices: You trust them, and stay at their camp
You question them more, to prove they're not enemies
1321211211112.content:
You come out of the trees to meet the campers around the fire. You find two women and a male elf. They seemed to have been expecting you. "I heard you," the elf said. "Who are you?" you blurt out, without thinking. "We are some of the helpers the Wizard sent. By the look in your eyes, you are one, too," he added. "We were four friends, originally. But one of us has abondoned us. He chose to be a Dark Elf. Of course, he still is faithful to the Wizard. But Dark Elves do not appreciate the company of Light Elves." You nod, remembering the Dark Elf you heard passing. One of the women speaks up for the first time. "Will you stay with us?"
You open your mouth to say yes, but then you remember the Wizard's words. "Be careful who you befriend in this forest," he had said. Are these people who they claim to be- helpers sent by the Wizard?
1321211211112.title: The Other Helpers (F)

choices: Don't trust them, and try to get away before the conflict.
13212112111122.content:
You are still not sure that you can absolutely trust them. After all, the wizard said to trust no one. You decide to question them further, knowing that they could easily turn on you.
"How can I possibly know that I can trust you? After all, if you heard the wizard, you would have known not to trust anyone that you happen to come upon!"
They stare at you, trying to think of what to say to your accusation. Akward moments go by, with both you and them trying to figure out what to do next.
All of a sudden, you start to get the feeling of evil creeping up around you again. You lock eyes with the male elf, and you both jump up. The feeling was getting stronger, and the threat closer. "Well, you can choose to trust us now, or fight on your own! It's your choice!"
13212112111122.title: You question them more, to prove they're no...

13212112112.content:
You take out your rod and get into fighting stance. You can feel the dark elf coming nearer. The little frog then poked his head out of your pocket, "Why not use your bow?"
"I'm not really sure how to use it yet," you tell him feeling stupid.
The frog seemed to shrug and then slipped back into your pocket. You wait straining your ears trying to hear the dark elve's foot steps and heard nothing.
Suddenly you are knocked to the ground, great pain shoots up your arm. You have been shot obviously by the dark elf. Struggling you get to your feet and yank out the arrow crying out in pain.
You look around frantically tring to spot the enemy. The trees seem to tell you to look in their direction. You obey and spot him hidden in the shadows of the trees getting ready to fire another arrow.
This time you take him by suprise and charge towards him. You manage to hit the dark elf hard on the shoulder. He reacts quickly and whips out his knife and stabs you in the stomach. You fall to your knees knowing you have failed the wizard.
You notice the little frog hop out of your pocket and stand in front of the dark elf as to confront him. The dark elf laughs and lifts up his foot to crush the brave frog.
You can't bear to watch and turn away. You expect to hear the crushing of bones but instead you hear the cries of the dark elf.
Weakly you turn to look at what was happening. A wolf was in place of the frog attacking the dark elf merciesly. When his cries fell silent the wolf backed away and a bright light surrounded him.
When the light faded a male elf took his place. The elf approaches you and kneels down beside you. "Sleep," he whispers into your ear and you obey.
13212112112.title: An Unexpected Event

choices: You take the frog with you, maybe he can find out more information later.
You decline and go on without him.
1321211212.content:
You lean down and pick up the frog, letting it sit calmly in your hand. You look it in it's little eyes, wondering what you would have in common with a frog.
"What do we have in common?"
The Frog looks up at you and says simply, "We are both going in the same direction. I am going to find a new home, but the forest tells me that you are going on a great adventure. I would like to go on a great adventure, it sounds fun." The frog talked a lot, you noticed that much.
"Maybe you can help me in this great adventure."
"Sure." Says the frog, he sounds happy to be of help.
"What were those men that just went by here?" You decide to sit, this could take a little while, with how much the frog likes to talk.
"They were gnomes, a lot of them. It looked like they were hunting something." He answer rather simply compared to his earlier speech.
"Thank you, and did you understand them?"
"No."
"Did you see a wizard go by here earlier?" You didn't think he did but decided to ask anyway.
"No. Why would a wizard go through here? They have magic you know." You decide to stop the frog from talking before he can give you the history of the river and who passed though it from time to time.
"Well, thank you for the information." You start to put the frog back on the ground when it croaks.
"Will you take me with you?" You look at it wondering if you should.
1321211212.title: The talkivtive frog.

13212112121.content:
You look at the frog seriously. If you took her along, she could help you a lot. But that was not all...her eyes seem to hold more than usual for a mere frog.
"Come with me," you reply.
"Thank you!" she cried. "My name is Gliss by the way. What is yours?"
If it was physically possible, Gliss, the frog, would have grinned.
"I am called Amme, and I am happy to have you as my companion. I feel there is more to you than meets the eye. Would you care to reveal to me your secrets now? For I like to know with whome I travel."
Gliss croaked. "I can tell you much about this area and the creatures here. I've lived many lives and hold much wisdom. I know you are here for good and want to help you restore greatness to this land."
"How many lives have you lived and have they all been that of a frog?"
"I am on my fourth life now, although this is the first time I have been a frog. I began as fox helping steal food to give to the poor, my days finally ended by a vicious dogs teeth. I returned as horse, faithful in whatever service I was given to. My third life went a little mishappen as I came back as a human. It was in this life I was easily seduced by fruitless pleasures and gluttonys. I was murdered in a drunken brawl outside the tavern, and for good reason as I stole the butcher's wife. So here I am in my fourth life as a frog, my punishment I suppose for mucking things up.
"Well, Gliss, I am sure you have many stories to share with me, but the night is falling. How far are we from the Rivers of Dan?"
"We can reach the rivers in 24 hours without stops. I know the river well, for this was my home as a horse, serving the elven kind. The elves are magnificent, which is why I took a liking to you right away. I cannot journey that distance as a mere frog, but I would so like to see them again."
"Lead us to a safe place for the night, my friend, and we'll continue our journey at the first light of dawn."
13212112121.title: Come Along (F)

choices: Decide to give in and go with him.
Deny him and try to go the other way.
13212112122.content:
You look at the frog, pensivley. You remember he talks too much. So you decide to leave him there. "No thank you, I think I can find the way on my own." You lay him gently back in the stream.

You turn and find your way back onto your path. When out of nowhere a dark elf leaps out of the trees at you. You should have heard him, but he knows how to make less sound than you do, and so he tracked you.

In his hands is a golden arrow with a bloody tip. You notice that his shirt has blood on it as well. He must have pulled the aroow from himself.

"You thought that you would get away with shooting me, did you?!?" The dark elf waves the arrow in your face. "Well I found ya, and now you are going to see that no one shoots Gofald and gets away with it."

"But I did not shoot you." You protest hopelessly. "My arrows are not made of gold and I have no reason to harm you. So be gone from here and let me continue on my quest." You try to walk around him, but he blocks your path.

"How dare you speak to me in such a fashion. Do you not know that I am Captian Gofald Mordox of the Dark Elven Army?"

You stare at him in bewilderment, obviosly not knowing who he was.

"Since you do not know I will let you go for now, but you will follow me to the land of My Lady Queen to the South East."
13212112122.title: An encounter of the dark kind.

132121121222.content:
"Why in the world do you want me to follow you?" You ask in a more relaxed voice since you can sence that Captain Gofald does not want to cause you any harm. Well, at least he doesnt want to cause you harm at this moment because when it comes to dark elves you never know what will happen.
Captain Gofald scratched his head and looked down and kicked the musky brown soil at his feet.
"I can sence your greatness, that was why it was so easy to track you down" He said looking at you with kind eyes. As he continued to talk about your greatness you noticed a glimmer in his black little eyes. You focosed closer on the fiery glimmer and something told you that it was the fire of lies burning in his eyes.
You quickly interrupt Captain Gofald.
"Ill have to decline your invitation, I have something important to do" You quickly turn your back to him and continue down the path. You know this is not the last time you will meet this dark elf.
You let yourself relax only to be struck in the back by the arrow of the dark elf. Never trust a dark elf to any degree. Some lessons must be leart the hard way.
132121121222.title: A glimmer in his eyes

choices: You ask about the destroyed crops
You demand that the men leave the forest
1321212.content:
You decide to confront those with gruff voices that you heard. Assuming that they are hunters and determined to protect the forest from damage, you grip your staff tightly and stride quickly back the way you came.

The staff seems still alive in your hands, the energy tingling in the tips of your fingers and you practice swinging it as you walk. Though you have no training, your body seems to know how to handle the staff nonetheless.

All too soon you emerge from the brush, having angled yourself to appear just in front of whoever it is that you would have encountered

Three burly men stop dead in their tracks. All of them look quite scruffy, and very tired. "'ho's this?" One of them asked, his hand tightening on a sword, though he didn't yet draw it.

"What business have you in the forest?" you ask.

"Our business is none of yours," another man answered. "But we's 'unting. Family's 'ungry and the crops are destroyed. The game's short in the forest as well, but it's all we've got." His voice was belligerent, but that could have masked fear.
1321212.title: The Hunters

choices: Suggest they leave and find a new home.
Offer to help fight against the Orcs.
13212121.content:
The men seem rather startled by your question. The look at each other with some surprise before one of them volunteers the information.

"The Orcs attacked. Or we think t'was them. They came in the night - scores of them. We couldn't see what was going on - then the flames leapt up. We could see it sweeping our fields, and the hulking brutes that capered about. They seemed as big as the village barn. And they were everywhere. I don't know why they left the village alone..."

"T'was a message." I said softly. I was certain of it. "They mean to terrorize you."

"Well, it worked!" grunted one of the men looking away. "An' they'll be back. You mark me words. They'll be back to ravage the village..."
13212121.title: The Village

132121211.content:
You hesitate, uncertain what to say. Maybe you should help them... but you haven't been trained yet and you can't fight however comfortable the rod feels in your hand. If the orcs came by night, then they might slaugther you without you ever getting a chance at ending this war and saving the land. The men could be lying anyways.

"Why don't you find a new home? Since everything was burnt, you could start new somewhere else where the orcs can't find you. Or-" you had been about to suggest that they might want to go join the army on the good side, but you were still unsure whether they were friends or foes. "Or you could try to barricade your town." you finish lamely.

The men huffed indignantley. "And why should we leave our land when we's were here first? If you are so concerned with our safety, then you will find us a new land with plenty of fertile fields for farming and woodland for hunting. Or you will help us defend, along with your people. Otherwise you might want to take your play things and go back to your lofty tree house." The hunters laughed heartily and smugly.

"Elves always think they are better than everyone else," one muttered under his breath as he gave you a snarl.

"For an elf," one spoke up fearlessly, "you do not have much wisdom to impart or much help to offer." Then to the others he said, "let us be on our way and waste no more time on this lone fool."
132121211.title: Advice (F)

choices: Go with the men/provide veg feast
132121212.content:
"I offer you my help in defending your territory against further attacks," you say confidently, knowing you cannot let senseless cruelty go unchecked.

"You and who else?" one of the men answered.

"As many as are willing," you reply. "I will go gather others. Show me your village now."

The men looked rather surprised, perhaps not used to elves behaving in this way.

"If 'ou want ta help, 'ou will be making good use o' those arrows so we can bring back food for our families."

Being a vegetarian, you are not keen on this idea. However, you also know starving families cannot be on your head either. Reluctantly, you agree to help them hunt.

You follow them through the woods to a clearing where a heard of deer are grazing. The men silently point and nod you to go ahead and get them their dinner. Pulling back the bow was extremely difficult, as the deer are in your aim. You have never killed anything in your life and this pains you. It was nearly impossible to let go of the arrow, like an invisible force was holding it in place, unable to fly. Just before releasing, you told the deer to run. As the arrow flew, so did the deer and your shot just missed the biggest. The hunters were not impressed and in fact looked very disgruntled about this.

"Might I suggest a vegetarian feast?" you offer.

"With what?" the men huff. "Our burnt crops?"

"Of course not," you smile, remembering nature is your friend. "By the time we get to your village, we will have plenty, I promise."

The men shake their heads in confusion and disbelief. They are divided on whether or not to trust you or do their own thing.

"Elves don' normally travel alone," one huffed. "Where are ye friends?"

You smile coyly, "my friends will be here when I need them. Don't you trust me?"

The men bicker amongst themselves on what to do with you. Finally, they agree you are harmless since you can't even kill a deer, but if you don't provide the feast then it will be elf on the menu.

At this point, you become a little nervous, as you are sure they are serious. This is a perfect opportunity to leave their company. But if you are confident nature will come to your aid, there will be no harm done to you.
132121212.title: Offer to help fight against the Orcs.

132122.content:
You decide poison would be a better option right now. It is a good alternative if the bow fails you, and you will be able to hide it easily.
You close your eyes and communicate with nature - the wind carries your request to the birds who are already beginning to bring you herbs and berries, when mixed together create an instantly lethal poison.
You search your person, and are surprised to find a small vile hidden in a pouch which is strung around your waist. You find a nice sized stone and begin to crush the ingredients on top of a larger flat stone. You crush them until they turn to a slush, then force them in the vile. You are careful not to let the poison touch your fingers, for in one forgetful moment, you could poison yourself! You make a mental note not to rub your eyes or bite your nails, just in case!
You hold the vile against the dim light coming through the tops of the trees. It begins to change from a brownish color, swirling, moving, transforming, until it becomes clear, taking on the appearance of water. You open the lid to smell, but there is no odor. Even better. It's the perfect poison!
You carefully replace the lid and hide the vile back in it's pouch for now. You get up, with new confidence, ready to go forward.
132122.title: Creating Poison (F)

choices: Climb the tree to get a better view.
Take the path to the right.
1321221.content:
You can no longer hear the gruff voices and footsteps in the distance, as they have passed on to the north, so you decide to continue south on your journey to the Rivers of Dan.

As you are walking on a small forest path, a bird comes and lands on your shoulder. It sings a sweet song to you and you are in awe to be able to understand its song in a way you've never experienced before. It is comforting to have a companion now, and the bird helps guide you on your path.

Up ahead you can see that the path separates into two, with a large tree just beyond the fork of the two paths. The little bird seems to prefer the path to the right, but it also wouldn't hurt to climb the tree and try to get a feel for your location before making the final decision.
1321221.title: A new companion, and a fork in the road

choices: Leave the path to look for a way around the creatures.
13212211.content:
You see a group of very large, very ugly men (you think) with ragged clothes and custom-fitted knife-belts around their waists--with knives in them--gathered around a campfire from which a pungent aroma is rising. The smell assaults your heightened senses, and your sixth sense tells you that they are cooking themselves a small humanoid meal. You quickly turn your head away before getting a direct glimpse of what is left of their poor victim. It seems like a small meal for such a large group (there are seven of them, and only one hobbit or dwarf on the spit), and they will probably still be looking hungrily for more after they finish.
As you cautiously, quietly climb down the tree, their ugly, greedy faces assault your mind. Now what will you do?
1. Take the other path
2. Leave the path to look for a way around the creatures.
13212211.title: Munch and Brunch

132122111.content:
As you follow along the other path, the vile voices slowly die down. A chill wind causes you to shiver abrubtly as, simultaneously, the feeling of the creatures' nearness fades away. But it is a relatively still, clear day... No matter. You travel on, enjoying the slight, growing warmth of the early day. It occurs to you that you are heading South, on the way to the Rivers of Dan. This path simply seems altogether more peaceful and removed from the kind of troubles you have just witnessed. You travel, unhindered, for several days before experiencing a new, even more pleasant, sensation, one that is strangely familiar to you, even though you would swear you have never been in this part of the forest, in this forest, or even in this world before. You slowly come to realize that you are in the vicinity of your own kind now, the good Elves.
And in direct answer to your thoughts, you hear a sweet melody rise and spread around you, like a thousand crickets taking up a beautiful chorus. You recognize it as a song of welcome. You have come home. As you travel, you begin to spot strangely familiar elements. But how...? As your steps slow, your thoughts, along with your heartbeat, speed up. You have been here before. You have come home indeed. Around you the melody changes; words take shape; the words are of home, family.
Friendly forms materialize before you. As they approach, you recognize... your brother... your little sister... your parents... your grandparents!??!!
"Leuci! Welcome home!" calls your brother, "Where have you been? Are you well? Come, tell us all that has happened to you in the past weeks, and we will tell you what news we know!"
The speed of your steps doubles, triples. You first run to your brother, then hug him tightly as he whirls you around him, then you pick up your sister in the same fashion. And you cover your elderly parents and ancient(?) grandparents in kisses as they laugh with pleasure and express there relief to see that you are okay.
"When you left us, you could only say that you needed to find news of the trouble about, and it would be safest for you to go alone. We learned long ago not to argue with you when you have that tone in your voice, that look in your eyes."
This evokes from you an involuntary laugh.
"Well, come, let us talk in the comfortable shade of our lovely home! The sun will soon be high and it will grow even warmer," says your brother.
132122111.title: Home again, or for the first time?

choices: You stay in the company of the other women, to defend them if necessary.
1321221111.content:
You all walk together up the forest path, enjoying each others' company and the forest and the early day sun. When you reach the palace, you are awestruck. Nowhere before, not even in your strange, secret memory can you recall a dwelling of such beauty and grace. There are high towers that are not made of stone or metal, but if they are made of wood, they seem to be carved within the very large, living trees, even as they continue to grow straight up from the ground. The rest of the dwelling seems to be made of living things, too, for its presence does not appear to disrupt its natural surroundings, but rather to fit right in. Its colors are those of its surroundings, shades of green, blue, brown, red, and orange, and combinations thereof. The central structure is smooth--it has the look of a home (a very nice, very spacious home) within a hill, and with the dome or ceiling plucked of vegetation and with the earth patted smooth, painted with earth colors, and dried as if in a kiln, only the doorways and the windows reveal long leaves, which act to separate the interior from the outside. Upon entering, you are further astounded by the patiently-carved and carefully-stained and colored furniture, covered with cushions and cloth just as painstakingly dyed, woven, and sewn, to make the place look nearly as if it were still growing in place somehow, and everywhere as comfortable as if one where resting on the finest down.
Your brother speaks first: "I understand why you left. The elves of the South are preparing to travel to The Empire of Light, to rally forces with the good wizards there and to turn back this evil army we have sensed gathering in the West. Did you discover anything of their intentions?"
You sigh. "To be honest, Leuki, I don't recall ever leaving." Then, after another deep breath, "I don't even recall being an elf."
This evokes looks of astonishment from all your family. Then all at once they must return to their senses, because, at the same time, they all begin expressing their concern. Finally, your father, Jemmah, breaks in authoritatively. "Now we cannot all talk at once!" Then to you: "Were you hurt? Do you recall anything of your recent past days?"
"Very little," you say. "It seems as if I dreamt I was human, in an entirely different world, and in that world I went to sleep and awoke in this one again, but still as a human. I encountered a wizard who returned me to my previous self and disappeared. That was only this morning. Since then I have only been, almost by chance, making my way here. I know little more than I did when I left."
Your father, looking deeply thoughtful, says, "It could be the work of The Dark King. He may have discovered you while you were trying to gather information and sent you to that other world to forget about everything to get rid of you, since to kill you outright, as you are of noble birth, he deemed he would have to pay too high a price."
Leuki: "Then we must prepare to leave now! It is essential that we know of The Dark Army's intentions!"
"Yes, we will, my good son. But for now let us welcome home our daughter who has returned from unrembered dangers and allow her to rest and heal any injuries she may have sustained, including that to her memories."
They all begin talking at once again, this time with less surprise and more compassion in their voices. You find, too, that even when they are not speaking with their mouths you can still hear their words faintly and feel their strong emotions.
Your dreams that night are wondrous, filled with the loving faces of your family and friends and the enchanted beauty of the South woods. Then the images grow dark, even horrific, as you see the faces of your enemies, goblins, orcs, Dark elves and evil humans, and your captor himself, The Dark King, a half-elf, half-human form, beautiful to behold from a distance in all his splendid attire and inherently strong figure, but terrifying up close. He speaks to you in the dream, but you cannot hear his words. You can only see him smiling as his face dissolves and your surroundings melt away. You feel yourself falling, then you awaken with his words in your mind. You rush out of bed to tell the others.
"He has found a way to kill us! The dwarves, the elves, all of us!"
Jemmah: "Go on, Daughter, but do try to catch your breath first!"
After a breath, you continue, "Before banishing me to that other world, The Dark King told me he had found an ancient elven sceptre. One that enables the bearer to literally capture the soul of any being, and, although it was designed to save lives, it will destroy those souls captured if the sceptre itself is destroyed before those souls that are captured have been returned to the bodies of their owners."
"The Crystal Staff of the Wise Elves!" blurts Grandfather.
"What do you mean, father?" says Jemmah.
"It was a legend told to my as a child. My mother and father told me later it was just a myth, but it does exist! And The Dark King must have found a way to retrieve it from its vault! We must inform The Wise Elves before he can reach it, Jemmah, you and Leuki must come with me. My dearest Wife and Daughter, I ask you to stay here to care for little Teakin. Leuci, I invite you to join us, if you feel up to it."
Your heart is filled with an indescribable desire to stay with your mother, grandmother, and sister and spend warm moments reminiscing as the memories of your treasured past come back to you. Still, your heart burns with the desire to fight alongside your brother and father, probably for the fate of the home you love and the world in which it exists.
1321221111.title: Recalling the past, and a future threat (F)

13212211111.content:
"I will stay for now, otherwise who will defend the home front."

"Wise choice," Grandfather adds. "The Dark King may be looking for you if he suspects you know something. He'll surely expect you to travel to inform the wizards."

"Keep safe Grandfather...Jemmah," you say hugging them both. "Godspeed."

After packing food and essentials, double checking weapons, Grandfather and Jemmah head off on horseback. You stand at the door and watch until they are out of site.

"It is at least a 3 day journey to the mountains," you say to your mother.

"Don't worry for them. They'll be fine," she says sweetly.

You hope so, but a shadow of fear grows in the back of your mind. After a warm meal and bathe in the hot springs, you settle into the comforts of your bed, welcoming the sleep that came quickly.

But deep in the night you are awaken by smoke. Suffocating smoke, intense heat and the screams of your people.

In confusion you crawl, yelling for your mother. You managed to make it out of the burning house just before it collapses. Fire is everywhere. Elves are in panic mode, running in all directions. The forest is ablaze.

You call upon the clouds, as do many other elves. The clouds force themselves to join together and rain down tears, eventually putting the blazes out. You sift through the ashes and charred remains of houses, memories and many of the elves you love, including your mother and infant sister.

A longtime friend of yours approaches.

"Leuci," she says compassionately with tears flowing.

You embrace, grieving together. "We must seek revenge," you stammer through your tears.

"Revenge for what? This blaze was an accident. A mishap. It was not intentionally set."

"No. It was intentional, I know it!"

"Leuci, you are just sorrowful. The grief will eventually pass. You must remain strong for the rest of us."

You run from your friend, refusing to believe the fire was an accident. Running to your horse you find she is no where to be found. The horses ran away when the fire started. You scream in agony and pain as the extremeness of your grief hits full force. Running to the hot springs, you immerse yourself.

You drown your sorrows in nature, your first love. You drown yourself.
13212211111.title: Drowing in Sorrows (F)

13212211112.content:
While your mother and sister entreat you to stay, you are eager to join your brother and father. After all, the wizard did say you would go on a journey, and that is what you fully intend to do. After packing, you set off for the Rivers of Dan.
The four of you walk along the path that without marking out, you instinctively know is right. The bird that accompanied you earlier is still flitting at your side, though rather reluctantly. Suddenly, it begins to grow slightly, which, owing to your exceptional eyesight, you spot with ease. The bird begins to turn black and grows to the size of a raven. You feel most puzzled by this, until -
The bird's beak, now a sharp sword, pierces into your brother's back. He groans terribly and falls instantly. "Leuci! Father! Grandfather! Help!" you hear him yell, ten paces before you. You can see your father using his power to make a quick balm. Then you realise one thing.
You cannot move.
Completely paralysed, you can do nothing, not even cry out. Your eyes are frozen and you cannot breathe. You can only watch as your father revives Leuki and walks on, never noticing for a moment that you cannot follow. For an elderly elf accompanied by an ancient old grandfather and an injured child, it is surprising how quickly they disappear from sight.
Your companion looks at you with an evil glint. "Be careful who you trust," he flirts. With a quick flash he has struck you down and flies to finish the rest of your family off. A bright light consumes you and lifts your soul, returning you to your bed on earth.
You awake in a cold sweat with your concerned mother by your side.
"I just had the strangest dream," you begin.
13212211112.title: Embarking

choices: Continue as directly as possible South.
Seek more immediate help to fight the evil creatures nearby.
132122112.content:
You look for a way around the big uglies and their freshly cooked fellow. As you pass by, separated from the group by large trees and shrubs, you hear them grumbling to one another in their own tongue, yet you find you understand them in your mind:
"Orloock! Careful you don't roast the bugger too long! The last time you did the cooking, we ended up with four burnt elves and later only found two scrawny rabbits to share among us!"
"If you think you can do better, Grooler, why don't you shut that foul trap of yours and do it yourself?!"
"Arggh! You know as well as I that I can't cook! And it's not my fault we lost Belnock to those nimble little elves! How are we supposed to tell the real ones from hallucinations? Anyway, we got 'em good, in the end."
"Yeah, we did, no thanks to you, DROOLER."
"You know I hate it when you call me that!!"
A fight ensues, and another, somewhat older, deeper voice speaks out. "Knock it off, you two. We've got to save our energy for the road ahead. We have a lot of travelling to do before we reach Scaarland, and this meal will not sustain us for long. We must keep as quiet as we can, and stay on the move, always looking for food in the day and shelter before night falls."
The fighting quiets while the voice is speaking, and then starts up again. This time quite severely, like a parently scolding her misbehaving children: "I said, 'Knock it off!'"
This time the fighting immediately stops, and some unintelligible grumbling between the two begins.
(Scaarland, you think to yourself, where could that be, and what sort of evil is brewing there?)
As if the other half of your mind is answering, another thought suddenly occurs to you: (Scaarland is to the Northwest.
