The inhabitants there are forming an alliance with all the evil creatures of the forest, and plan eventually to move their growing army into The Dark Castle, from which point they will begin their attack on the forest, furthering their quest to convert all its creatures to their control, along with all of its resources, good and evil.)
These thoughts do not bring you comforting news to carry with you to the north, where you hoped eventually to go. Although perhaps this would not be news to the inhabitants of the South at all. You are, after all, a newcomer to the forest, and what is news to you may be common knowledge to others here. Still, you can't know anything for sure until you check it out further.
Will you head on to the South, to rally the forces of good to fight the growing army of evil to the Northwest?
Or will you try to find more immediate help, and stop these monsters before they can rally some help of their own against others on your side?
132122112.title: The Evil Plan Unfolds (at the corners, at least)

1321221121.content:
You quickly climb down the tree you were spying from. Your heart is racing with adrenaline. Your mission seems real now, and so does the danger you are facing. Pausing briefly to get your bearings, you walk quiety south. When you are out of the hearing rang of the monsters, you quicken your pace. You keep your ears open for other signs of life, human or not.
Running, you make good time through the forest. All that marathon training back home has done you well, but by evening, you are exhausted. You have gone as far as possible, and have overextended yourself. You find yourself dehydrated, side splitting with pain, and extremely weak. So much for pacing yourself.
The only reason you are still standing, is because you can hear water flowing. You force your legs to carry your farther, towards the sound.
The trees part to reveal a wide river. You sit on a rock, cupping your hands to sip to cool water and splashing it on your face.
You drink as much as you can handle, and lay back on the rock, falling quickly to sleep.

You enter the world of dreams, hearing voices that seem both far away and near.
"Who is she?"
"I believe she is one the wizard has brought, from the looks of her."
"She has made good time then."
"Yes, but at what cost. She's clearly exhausted."
"At least she is safe within our borders."
"Yes. She's fortunate. Let's take her."
1321221121.title: Making Good Time

13212211211.content:
When you awake, the sun is pushing it's streams of light through the trees and the windows, resting warmly upon your face. Confusion sets in as you try to remember what happened and where you are.

"Good morning."

The owner of the voice comes into view. She is dressed in robes of green and yellow. Her skin is a light chestnut color and her hair flows darkly down her back in smooth waves. Her eyes are a vibrant green - the brightest you've seen.

"My name is Nywinda, and I am your caretaker. We found you exhausted and dehydrated. How do you feel now?"

"I feel tired, but otherwise all right. I am a bit thirsty."

Nywinda smiles and hands you a large goblet of water. It is the purest, sweetest water you have ever tasted. It is cool and refreshing.

"This water was taken from the springs of the River of Dan."

Recognizing the name you start. "Have I reached my destination, then?"

"No, not yet I'm afraid. But you are not far. You have reached the elven city of Danne' Dale. Here we will train you so you can make it to your destination. From here the journey gets perilous. Fear not, for we will provide a guide for you. You will not be alone from here on out."

You smiled at the reassuring thought.
"Nywinda, can you tell me anything about why I'm here, or how I got here?"

She smiled and sighed. "The wizard summuned you, did he not?"

"Well, yes. But he did not give a lot of information."

"Neither can I, child. What I can tell you is that you will make all the difference. War is inevitable, and we need all the help we can get. So desparate are we, we summon from other dimensions."

"Why did the wizard give me a choice?"

"To determine your heart. To determine your role, purpose and destiny."

"Can I die here?"

Nywinda fell silent for a moment. "I cannot answer that. I do not know what happens if you are injured or pass on. Only the high wizards can answer that. You will meet them soon enough."

"I feel this is all a dream."

Nywinda simply smiled.
"Get some rest, dear. You will need it. When you awake again, we will have a feast prepared."

Nywinda left the room, and your eyes fell heavy as you slip into sleep.
13212211211.title: Nywinda in Danne' Dale

132122112111.content:
As you drift off to sleep, you are visited by dreams...

You are back home, lying in your bed. The morning light is streaming in through your mini blinds. Looking at the clock you realize it is 7:45am. Rubbing your eyes you arise.
Shuffling out your bedroom door, the house is quiet and you are alone. Walking into the kitchen you open the refridgerator and are surprised by a blinding bright light and a burst of hot air. You quickly slam the door shut.
Hearing a noise from behind, you spin around. It's the wizard who brought you to the forest!
He stands there in your kitchen in his white flowing robe holding his magical staff. His beard stark white, eye brows protruding from his narrow face.

"All I wanted was a glass of milk," you think outloud, "but instead I get the wizard."

On the end of his wand is a dark glass ball. He lowers it as you look closely. Inside you see a group of people in a circle, arguing. In the middle are large papers with sketches. Upon further inspection, it looks to be battle plans. The scene changes as dark elves, both beautiful and hideous at the same time, slit the throats of the woodland elves. They have ambushed them in the forest. Orcs are destroying the forest to fuel their fires for weapons: horrible, terrbile weapons of steel and granite. Ugly, evil goblins attack dwarves in the mountins, slaughtering entire families. Then a castle, black and twisted in the twilight, appears. A dark cloud looms over it and it shoots a lightning bolt, illuminating the face of a giant red goblin. He grins evily, lusting for blood.
You pull back and stare at the wizard, who then turns and directs your gaze to the living room. Hearing angry voices, you inch closer to see. It is the voices of your father and mother, and suddenly you are a young child again.
You look around the corner just in time to see your father lob a punch, hitting your mother directly in the face. Blood spills from her nose and runs down her white blouse. Your mother tries to defend herself, but your father has grabbed something in his coat. His cruel expression is like a knife in your soul. You watch and listen as your mother begs for mercy. There is no mercy in his father's eyes or the cold blue steel. Time freezes as you hear a loud bang...
In an instant they are gone and you are looking at the wizard again. Tears well up in your eyes as you shake your head in disbelief.

"You were young," says the wizard softly. "It was a shame you saw those things. Even now, your only memory is in dreams, because your conscious mind refuses to remember such horrid times. Your father turned the gun on himself, and you were taken by the state, and soon adopted."

Wiping a tear you ask, "Why did he do it?"

The wizard continued, a sorrowful expression on his face. "Who can say for certain? But you can rise above all of this, and gain justice. You will not only help others, you will help yourself."

"How is that?"

"Even if I told you, you would not understand. But you will know when the time comes."

Your shoulders shake uncontrollably as you sob.....and awake
132122112111.title: The Dream

1321221121111.content:
"What have your dreams told you?"

The soft voice of Nywinda comes to your mind as you slowly open your eyes. She wipes a tear that has made a path down your cheek.

"I dreamt of this world and then of mine. I saw the past and the present. I may have seen the future, although I'm not certain."

"Do you understand how they connect?"

"I...I'm not really sure."

Handing you some herbal tea, Nywinda explains, "The things you saw in this realm were the past, present, and potential future if we do not win this war. The things you saw in your life are true and the reason you have been chosen."

Sipping the warm tea you say, "I don't understand. What does that have to do with me coming here?"

"You have not dealt with the tradgedy life has handed you. Things that are not dealt with refuse to be ignored. You harbor an intense desire to see justice served and peace reign. But you will never find peace until you face the turmoil that came to you so early in life. This world, this realm; this is your chance to face the ugliness and hatred and turn it around, serving justice."

"Even if I face these things here, that does nothing for the world I have to return to!"

"On the contrary," Nywinda continues, "You will find that things will change if you suceed."

"It won't bring my parents back!"

Nywinda's eyes speak to your soul. Not in words, but a feeling deep inside. Somehow you understand that this quest you have been chosen for is worthwhile. If you accomplish it, things in your world will come together. The need to fulfill this mission is now burning in your soul like a blazing fire. You must finish this. It is your destiny and your world. It is your life if you do not.

"Now," Nywinda breaks the tension, "A feast has been prepared. I have set aside some garments for your use. If you choose, I could escort you down when you are ready. You may also go alone. The banquet room is at the end of the hallway. You won't miss it.
1321221121111.title: Interpretations

choices: Stop and check out the voice.
Keep walking to the banquet hall.
13212211211112.content:
"I think I can find it on my own, Nywinda. Thanks for the offer."

Nywinda nodds and turns to leave, pausing at the door.
"Please be careful making your way to the feast."

You open your mouth to ask what that meant, but she is out the door and out of view.
You find the garments left for you. A beautiful purple and gold dress, with satin and velvet cloths. It is also adorned with beads and tiny jewels. Putting it on, you admire the way it fits, making you look like royality. You brush the tangles from your hair, and it glistens in the orange sunlight.

"Ready as I'll ever be," you mutter as you turn to leave.

The hallway is extremely long. Your room is at the very end. There are many hallways branching off, and many doors - some open, some closed. You see no one in view, and hear no voices. A strange feeling grows int he pit of your stomach. You sense danger. Perhaps it's nothing, and you slowly walk down the hall.
You cannot tell where the other corridores lead, and they look much the same as the one you are walking down. Quite confusing, and you are glad you have no turns to make.
Passing by a door that is partially open, you hear a voice.

"Wait...please...will you help me?" A feeble voice asks.
13212211211112.title: The Corridore

132122112111121.content:
You stop and peer inside the room, but see no one.

"Hello? Anyone here?"

"Yes...please...I'm in here...help me."

You slowly enter the room and the door shuts behind you. You turn to see a large elf staring you down. His smile makes you uneasy.

"Well well...full of compassion. That won't get you very far, my fair maiden," he says, stroking your hair.

"Who are you?"

"Should I tell you? If I tell you, I'll have to kill you. Of course, even if I don't tell you, I'll have to kill you."

"Kill me? Why?"

The elf laughed, "So many questions! But I have not the time to answer, for there are many more to pursue and kill. I will answer you this...I am called Domarian."

You gasp as you recall his name from the wizard's warning of him. You stand unarmed and defensless. Even calling a spell would be of no effect at this point.
Damarian's eyes glow and a flash of light illuminates the room.

You wake up to the morning sun fighting to shine through the mini-blinds. You are in your own bed.
Perhaps it was all a dream.
Dare you go back to sleep?
132122112111121.title: Dream It's Over

choices: You leave the feast to thank him
Greet Nywinda and prepare to eat
132122112111122.content:
Ignoring the feeble voice you walk away as quickly as you can. Hoping nothing will jump out and chase after you. You make your way to the feast. As you walk forward you overcome loud voices from the door ahead. You walk closer to the door and lean your ear against it trying to hear what they are saying.They are too muffles to understand even for your ears. You get a tingle and hear light footsteps. You back away from the door afraid to be caught eavesdropping. But the door does not open. The footsteps stop and sound if they are behind you. You turn around to find a male elf peering at you with his arms folded.
" Are you lost? Or do you like to listen to voices beyond doors?"
" I...I was on my way to the feast" Your voice is a little shaky as you speak.
"Oh...that would be the wrong door" He smiled unfolding his arms.
You breath a sigh of relief that he is not going to get you in any trouble. He walks to you and lightly grabs your arm, making you feel a little tingly for he is kind of handsome. He leads you to an open door decorated nicely with red and gold ribbon. You peer beyond the door to the feast table. Nywinda awaits you at the front of the table, you look behind you to thank the handsome elf but he has seemed to leave quickly.
132122112111122.title: Handsome Encounter

choices: Start a conversation with Nywinda's brother
1321221121111222.content:
Well, it seems your guide didn't want to stay so there was no point rushing after him when he obviously wanted to be away. You walk into the banquet hall and smile as Nywinda comes and takes your hand.
"We've been waiting," she says and she guides you to a chair at the head of a long table. You gulp. The table stretched out for what seemed like miles, and there were easily hundreds of elves around it. They all stood and quietened as Nywinda started to speak.
"Woodland elves, I would like you all to welcome the wizard's chosen one. Our fate shall be entwined in her destiny. Soon, she will leave for her training. But tonight, we feast!" With that, Nywinda raised her goblet and down the length of the table, all the other elves did likewise.
"To the chosen one!" they cried together, then they drank. Now everyone sat down and started to eat. Nywinda was seated at your right hand, and on your left side there sat a young elven male who resembled her. Nywinda introduced him as her brother, and he smiles charmingly at you.
1321221121111222.title: The Feast

13212211211112221.content:
"Um, Hi." You say, giving Nywinda's brother a tight smile. He was rather handsome, you think, a male version of Nywinda with his finely tapered ears and green eyes.
"Hello," he replies smilling. "On behalf of all the Good Elves, Welcome." He had a slight accent, and you could not place it, but it gave his words a charming goodness, like he was singing.
"Well, I didn't really plan it," you laugh, looking at a golden cup filled with something. It was rather distracting, hearing all the coversations down the table. You focus on Nywinda's brother, "so, how do you deal with it? All the distracting things," you wave your hand vaguely.
He laughs, his eyes dancing. "don't worry, when I was a lad, my mother had to tie me up just to make sure I wouldn't run off to search for the cause of a noise I heard. Your doing better than we expected you to. The feast itself was to test you. "
"What?" you splutter, "why would you need to test me?" You wince as someone down the table laughs really loud.
"Well, there have been imposters before," he said simply.
"Oh,"you say as you glance again at the cup. "Ok, you must tell me what is in that cup, the smell is driving me crazy," you say. The smell coming out of the cup was memerizing, sweetnes like berries and the smell of crushed apples, and pine leves like the forest, and the sweet smell of rain.
Worry you didn't notice until now dropped out of Nywinda's brother's face. Happiness shone through his face.
"That, dear Chosen one, is Felvir, a drink only the good elves can smell and taste, you are indeed the chosen one." He grasped my hand and kissed it, then rose from his seat.
"Everyone, everyone!" He shouted, "she is indeed the chosen one! The One that will save us!"
He turns to me and kneels.
"Chosen, will you drink to Felvir, and honor the good elves?"
You gasp, and look out on the table, with all the expectant faces. You look at Nywinda's brother, hope in his face.
"For the Elves," he pleads, offering the golden cup.
13212211211112221.title: Start a conversation with Nywinda's brother

choices: speak to her and enquire why you fainted?
treat her like an enemy as perhaps it was she who poisoned you?
13212211211112222.content:
You continue to eat your food. It tastes tantalising...you don't remember ever having tasted aything so good. You try to focus on the others around the table but your vision starts to swim and you long to lie down. You struggle to keep your eyes open but it proves to be too much of a chore and you fall on the ground with a thud.

You regain conciousness to find a beautiful woman leaning over you... Do you?
13212211211112222.title: Tantalising food

132122112111122221.content:
"Where- why- what happened?" you ask. Your head feels giddy, but otherwise you are fine.
The voice of the beautiful woman flows over you soothingly. "We don't know yet. You passed out at the banqueting table and we had to carry you back to your room. Rest here. There are guards already investigating the incident." She smiled down at you, then went out and quietly closed the door.
You wait a while and your head starts to feel better. Did someone try to poison you? But you weren't hurt at all and the poisoner would have to be an expert to slip the poison in the food among all the elves. The food couldn't have been bad- everyone else had had the same food. Maybe it had something to do with you not really being an elf. Or maybe it was magic.
You sit up in bed and look down. You're still wearing your dress from the banquet. Your poison, knife and other personal possessions are lying on a table next to you.
132122112111122221.title: Speculation

choices: Cross the little creek and investigate the cave
13212212.content:
You have faith in your new companion, so you take the bird's advice and go on the path to the right. Even though it is possible the bird could be misleading you, your 6th sense tells you this sweet bird can be trusted.

The path winds down the hill to a small creek, where it is nice to take a drink of the cool spring water. You notice a hole in some rocks on the other side of the creek, so you wonder if there might be a cave where you can take shelter for the night. It's only mid-afternoon, but you wonder how many good safe places there'll be ahead to get some sleep. Of course there could be something dangerous in the cave as well.
13212212.title: Little Creek and and Cave Entrance

choices: You find a hidden corner and abandon your fears in sleep.
You can't take this cave anymore, and decide you MUST get to Dan.
132122121.content:
Leading to the cave is a wash of sand, very light in color so that it is almost white. You are in awe of the solemn, almost spiritual feeling of this place. The bird companion seems to feel the sacredness of the cave as well; while it has never left your side, it hasn't made a sound in many moments.

You take a quick glance in all directions, the light threatening to dazzle you if you let it become a distraction, and shrug your shoulders. Digging your fingers into the sun-warmed sands, you make your way upward, the cave looming open-mouthed above you.

Upon entering the cave, you are met by a sight you've only heard tell of; a form of ancient writing, petroglyphs etched roughly into the sandstone walls. They shine almost golden amid the soft tans of the dark cave, and you are still as you survey the writings.

Though the writings are in a form of alphabet, a type of hieroglyph too ancient for you to decipher, the stones themselves seem to hold knowledge. As if beckoned, you move forward to lay your hands lightly on the stone walls.

Immediately, a rush of visions flood you. A scattered story of a people long gone flashes across your mind, a people of peace who were obliterated by violence. These are the people who created the place. The emotions which tear at you threaten everything - you are so heartbroken, you want nothing more than to wake from this dream.

You take a step away from the wall and wipe tears from your face. Your bird companion is urging you to lie down and rest, reminding you that in the light of morning everything seems new...
132122121.title: Destiny

choices: You decide to go venturing deeper into the cave.
You decide to stay at the front of the cave.
1321221212.content:
You turn around, your vision clouded, but you can rely on you hearing to guide you back to the little creek.
         As you step outside the visions begin to fade and you lay down beside the creek exhausted.
         The little bird is beside you again drinking from the creek, and you decide to do the same.
         The cool water runs down your throat, and you can't help but think it's the sweetest water you have ever tasted.
         As you sit up again you realize that a chill has crept into the air. The sky has gotten darker, and a light breeze has picked up.
         "It must be going to rain soon", you say to the little bird beside you. "I'd better find somewhere to rest before it does."
         And then you laugh. "But this is only a dream right? So It won't hurt me to be out in rain or a storm. I will find somewhere and then I will fall asleep and probably wake up."
         As you get up, you use your new sense of direction and easily pick up a straight path to Dan.
         After about a mile or so of walking, your bird friend has disappeared and the sky is now black. The only way you can see is because of your improved vision.
         As you continue on, you spot a small cave against the side of a tall, rocky hill. You go over and investigate it, and, seeing no ancient writing, you go inside it.
It's not a deep cave from the looks of it, but it appears to go deeper into the surface of the hill than you originally thought.
         You stand there confused for a moment, trying to decide whether or not to venture deeper into the cave, or stay where you are and prepare for the storm. Something inside you is telling you to go in, but your instincts are telling you to stay put.
1321221212.title: You can't take this cave anymore, and decid...

choices: Try to talk your way out
132122122.content:
As you continue on your way, you notice that things are starting to get quiet. The little bird on your shoulder begins to hop around nervously and you get a feeling that you are being watched.
You stop walking and look around but don't see anyone near. You stand still a moment, listening to the woods, when your sharp ears catch the quiet footfall of a hoofed animal. Assuming it's just a deer, you continue on your journey.
The little bird begins to chirp loudly and bounce around even more when you come across some sort of creature seated on a rock. It looks like a man, but not a man. Parts of the body are human, such as the upper body and the sex which hung uncovered. The legs and the rest of the lower body, however, were not human. It looked more like a deer or a goats body and there were also horns and long ears that weren't human either.
You nod to the creature and try to pass by, but it jumped off the rock and blocked your path.
"Excuse me," you say "May I pass?"
The creature grins mischieviously. "I will let you pass if you can beat me at a game."
"And if I lose?" The creature just grins again. "What are you?" You ask.
"I am a Satyr." He said impatiently. "Now, if you wish to pass through, you have to beat me at a game. What will it be?"
132122122.title: To Play, or Not to Play

1322.content:
You are dressed in Elven clothing, light comfortable and in the colors of the forest. You noticed that you've even been equiped with a bow and a pack of arrows, even though you've never done any archery.
Your pointed ears are sensitive, so much that you can hear an individual leaf hitting the ground. Your hearing range has also improved, and you are hearing high and low pitches that you had not noticed before. There is a constant, deep moaning in this forest that you are very aware of now.
Your sight has also improved and you are able to see much farther and with greater clarity than before. Your periferal vision has increase dramatically, and any movement threatens to distract you.
You notice smells that are new to you. You kneel down seeing the tracks of a deer. You can pick up on the deer's scent!
The most dramatic change is the 6th sense you've gained. You can feel it in your being - the oneness with nature itself. You are connected somehow, in your mind and in your soul. You close your eyes and breathe in the air, feeling the power course through you - the power of nature and all it's glory.

You stand to your feet and open your eyes. It is then when you notice an unusual rock.
1322.title: New Nature (F)

choices: Quit playing with rocks and get on with your journey.
13221.content:
You hold the rock in your hand, watching it intently. It begins to move, gently rocking in your hand.
You are unsure if the rock is doing this on it's own, or if somehow you are.
You concentrate on the rock, speaking to it in your mind. The rock obeys, defying gravity, and rolls up your arm, behind your neck and down the other arm into your hand.
You are beginning to understand the power that you have, but only in part.
13221.title: Rock N Roll (F)

choices: Ignore the voices and continue on your path.
132211.content:
You begin your journey through the forest, very in tune with your environment. You hear every leaf fall, every twig snap. In time you will learn to tune out what you do not need to hear. You step lightly and move silently, neither harming nor disturbing anything in your path.
You stop walking. You can hear voices in the distance, but cannot understand them, for their language is unfamiliar to you. Your acute hearing tells you they are not in your path. They do not sound friendly, and you can hear their footsteps that seems heavy on the ground. You can tell by the way the ground gives and the twigs snap that they are very large, possibly double (or more) the size of you.
You could choose to go your way, but you also suspect they are doing nature harm in some way.
132211.title: voices (F)

choices: Pull out your bow and get ready to battle!
Turn around and run to wherever the road leads you.
1322111.content: You continue on your way, your new found hearing letting you know that the unknown presence is getting closer. Finally you step onto what must be a very well traveled road. But before you have the chance to look around, you hear shouts coming from behind you, further down the road, and spin around just in time to see about ten cloaked figures come running toward you. They all pull out swords as there black, powerful horses pick up the pace.
1322111.title: The over traveled road (F)

choices: Call to the nearby trees to help you.
13221111.content: Nervous, you pull out your bow and clumsily fix an arrow to it. Pulling the string back you let go without bothering to aim. The arrow propels forward and lands right in the shoulder of one of the closer hooded figures. More confident now that you have managed to defend yourself you whip out another arrow but realize too late that the pursuers are too close for you to shoot, and the running horses will be upon you in seconds. You lower your bow and quickly take a step back. A quick decision has to be made, and you are outnumbered 10 to 1!
13221111.title: First Battle (F)

132211111.content:
You are frantic as the horsemen are upon you. Strong arms grab hold, sweeping you up onto a horse. They have put a spell on you and you cannot move. So short into your journey and you have already been captured. Dispair is not far from you as you are rendered helpless.
The horses storm foward, the riders content with their capture.
It is then rain begins to fall...the rain of arrows! Arrows fly from all directions from hidden sources in the trees. The riders are picked off, easy targets for the sharp shooters.
The rider on your horse slumps forward, eventually sliding off. But you are paralyzed and cannot control the horse who is running for his life. You struggle to stay on the horse yourself, knowing death may await if you fall.
Soon, a radiant elf on a white horse joins you, matching the pace of the black stallion you are on.
He speaks in elvish...he's releasing the spell!
Your hands break free from the invisible bonds and the elf grabs you, pulling you to his horse. He brings the white beauty to a sudden halt, and you gasp as the black stallion run over a jagged cliff.
Your adrenaline was in high gear, inducing weariness as you calm. This elf just saved your life.

"Thank you," you managed to speak. "I'm sure this happens every day."

He smiled at your sense of humor. "You would be surprised at the rescues I've had to make. You were very lucky we were on the trail just then."

He turned the horse around to trot back to where the action occurred. Elves were dragging the dead men off the road, hiding their bodies. The horses had been captured, already tied to a tree, ready to be taken back to the village.

"We invite you to come with us to Danne' Dale, our village South of here. Should your destination be The Rivers of Dan, you'll be glad to know Danne' Dale is on the way. You will be safe and in good company. You will find rest for the night, food in your belly, and wine for your spirits."

Your gut feeling told you, they can be trusted. You nodd in agreement and ride with the elf to the village.
132211111.title: The Rescue

choices: Go check out the dead horsemen.
Go try to catch one of the horses (now without rider).
132211112.content:
You speak out an elven spell that instantly comes to your mind.

"manache dire mynth foe ryhma"

You wait, as you begin to feel a strange sensation course through your body.
The enormous dark trees along the road start to sway. Suddenly two large branches, on opposite sides of the road, swing down directly in front of the riders. So swift are the branches that you dare not blink for fear of missing the action!
The branches pound the first two riders, knocking them off their horses. Just the break you need as you aim two arrows and fire. The arrows peirce the heart of one rider. He lets out a terrible scream that sounds like death in your ears. He's hardly hit the ground when you fire another two arrows at the other fallen rider. The arrows take him also to his death.

The trees continue their slapping and a few more riders fall victim to the branches and your sharp arrows.
But the other riders fall back, their horses raring up on hide legs, neighing loudly.

You prepare to shoot them as well, but they are already out of range, heading the opposite direction.
132211112.title: Battle on the Road (F)

1322111122.content:
You have the feeling those riders will be back as soon as they can gather reinforcements. You don't know enough about your new powers to be sure that you can beat them. Although you know you have the power of nature on your side, you aren't sure how much control you have over it, or how much nature can do for you. Better to use your wits and prepare yourself and call on nature only in greatest need.

You look around and find the nearest horse. He looks like a sturdy beast with lots of stamina and he may come in handy.

You slowly approach him while talking soothingly. You get within arm's reach and you slowly reach out with your hand to touch him. But the horse half rears and shies, frightened. He bolts a little further down the road and then stops.

You stand still, wondering if he's leading you somewhere or if he's just scared. You decide to wait and see what he does.

When you make no move to walk toward him, the horse comes back a little ways and then stops, neighing softly. Sure now that your instinct was correct, you follow the horse. You don't try to touch him or catch him, you just follow.

He leads you off the road and you heisitate. You need to get to the River of the Dan. The road should lead you there. But in the forest you'd be lost and at the mercy of the forest, for you only have 5 arrows.

The horse neighs again and you suddenly realize, what are you worried for? You're an elf, one with nature. Just a few minutes before, trees came to your aid. As long as you respect the forest, the forest will never hurt you. It will protect and care for you, just as you protect and care for it.

You follow the horse off the road and through the woods. You travel for hours, stopping every once in a while to eat and drink. Then after you have finished drinking from a stream, you see something from the corner of your eye.
1322111122.title: The Horse

choices: Try to fight off the pursuers
13221112.content: You sprint down the path, the soft smell of pine wafting towards you, as well as the sound of the pounding horse hoofs upon the well beaten path. You look around you and notice a small shack in the distance. It does not look very inviting. It is small and black, standing in a clearing. The windows are broken and it looks ancient and unstable. You glance behind you and spot your pursuers, closing in quickly! The gap between you has gotten uncomfortably small! Make a decision and do it quickly, or the mysterious cloaked men will surely overtake you.
13221112.title: Between a Rock and a Hard Place (F)

choices: Prepare to shoot through the window.
132211121.content:
You quickly dart, like a rabbit diverting it's persuer, towards the dilapitated shack.
In the dense forest you are better able to camoflauge yourself than on the open road.
You move swiftly and silently through the forest trees and brush, making your way to the shack.
The horsemen have slowed a bit, as they are having a hard time determining exactly where you are. They have split up in pairs, combing the area.
You reach the shack and silently sneak in. It is incredibly small, with only two run-down rooms. The door to the second room is closed. It is unclear what the shack was used for, as there is nothing inside to give any clues. Only cobwebs and animal droppings occupy this small dwelling.
You gasp as your sensitive ears hear two horsemen approaching.
132211121.title: The Shack (F)

1322111211.content:
You quietly sneak to the second room. Upon first nudge, the door sticks closed. It seems to be locked, but you try again, nudging with more force this time. With a good shove, the door reluctantly opens, scraping the wooden floor and making quite a noise.
The noise attracts the horsemen, who are dismounting to enter the shack.
You make haste going into the second room, closing the stubborn door behind you. It is dark except for one window letting in a bit of the forest light. You step towards the window to take a look out, but are interuppted by a swift arm around your body and hand over your mouth.

"Don't make a sound," a voice whispers in your ear, "For you are in great danger."
1322111211.title: The Second Room (F)

13221112112.content:
You decide to obey the voice in your ear and nod to show that you understand. The person gently and silently, pulls you backwards out of the light and into a corner. Slowy the hand uncovers your mouth and the voice in your ear reminds you to keep silent with a soft "Sshhhh."
You are silent, but swear your heart is pounding so loudly half the forest could hear it. You can feel the rise of person's chest holding you, as he breaths deeply.
But over the "noise" of your own heartbeat, you can hear footsteps. The footsteps of the cloaked riders inside the other room, that sound like sledge hammers pounding in your ears. Seconds seem like minutes as the tension and anxiety build, awaiting their entrance into the room you are in.
Suddenly the door is shoved open, again scraping loudly against the splintery wooden floor. What happens next is a blur. The light from the broken out window is blocked as a figure appears, fires an arrow and disappears as quick as a blink. The effects of the arrow are longer lasting, as the first cloaked rider falls instantly with a horrific scream that chills you to the bone. Your body jerks as you cringe in fear and horror at the blood that is now spilling over the floor like a small river. You manage to hold your scream, not vocalizing it.
The second rider has his sword drawn, but hardly has time to react as the window again is shadowed by a figure with a bow. The arrow is fired quickly and sharply, and you are amazed at the incredible marksmanship as the arrow flies straight into the hood of the cloaked one. This one had no scream, but fell back in deathly silence.
The arms around you are released as you are nudged forward.

"Quickly, out the window before more of them appear," the voice commands.

Without hesitation, you go for the window, not even looking upon the one to whom the voice belongs. The window is small, but plenty big for your slender and nimble body and you slip through it with ease.
Outside, there are two strong white horses. Upon one sits an elven rider, clothed much like you with a bow slung across his back. He is holding the reins of the other horse who is currently without rider.
Before you realize what is going on, familiar arms are around you again, lifting you up on the second horse. And again, the arms are around you a third time, as the elf they belong to mounts up behind you.
In seconds both horses are off, leaving the shack to the dead horsemen, and the future to you.
13221112112.title: Shack Attack (F)

132211121121.content:
The strong white horses gallop away from the shack. You try to catch your breath from all of the excitement as the horses race through the forest. You hold tightly to the elf's tunic, although you are a pretty good rider and staying on well.
Eventually the horses slow their pace. Now is a good time to get some questions answered.

"Who are you?" you asks curiously and kindly to the one your arms embrace.

"I am Deren, of the house of Ishen. I help guard and protect the borders of the woodland elves, of which I am also."

Before he can ask your name you fire another question. "Who were those cloaked riders and why were they trying to kill me?"

"Those were servants of the dark lords from beyond the forest, from the Dark Castle in the west. Their intentions were not to kill you, but capture you. Then they would take you to the Dark Castle, get any information they could, and if they could not convert you to their side, they would kill you."

"Where are you taking me and what will happen to me there?"

"We are headed south to our village of Dora Moore. There you will meet our ruler, Mikia, who is very wise. He will answer many questions. We will also teach you skill with a sword, better marksmanship with your bow, and survival skills you'll need to complete your journey."

"How is it that you know about my journey?"

Your question goes unanswered as you come to a great river. It is beautiful and lined with lush trees, rooted deeply in the fertile soil. The forest does not seem so dark here and you take a inhale deeply the fresh air.
Right before your eyes a bridge appears. It was not there before! Crossing over, you look into the water and think you see someone watching you. But the image fades as quickly as it appeared, leaving you to wonder.

Looking up, you are entering the village.
132211121121.title: On Your Way (F)

choices: Climb the stairs as he instructs.
1322111211211.content:
The sun sinks low as you enter the village. The soft glow of the lights, a warm welcome. As you relax, you realize you are weary from an exciting day. The many questions that bounce in your mind only build upon the fatigue.
Deren pulls the reigns and the horse halts. Taking your que, you effortlessly slide off the musclar animal landing silently on the ground. Deren follows and leads the horse to water and shelter. He then leads you through the village and the elves who have stopped to look at the stranger with him. Some of the elves smile warmly, some have an expression of curiosity, while others speak to you without words.

"Welcome to Dora Moore."

"Welcome, Chosen One."

"You will find friends here, newcomer."

Deren leads you to a large tree with a staircase spiraling up and around it. The house on top is immaculate, yet ingrained with delicate architecture of great beauty.

"This must have taken years," you whisper, referring to the building of the stairs and designs.

"The elves have plenty of years to do such arts," Deren replies and motions towards the stairs.
1322111211211.title: Reaching Safety (F)

13221112112111.content:
Hesitantly, you climb the stairs to the house. The closer you come to the door of the dwelling, the more impressed with the beauty and detail you are. You turn to say something to Deren, and notice for the first time that you are alone. Looking down toward the ground, you see Deren there, and he smiles up to you, motioning you forward, into the house.

Hesitant to enter, you continue to climb the steps slowly, and stand on the branches that serve as a front "porch" of sorts, debating your next move. Again, you look toward Deren, but he is speaking to someone else. You look toward the door, and see that it is slightly ajar.
13221112112111.title: Tree House

choices: You are filled with rage and decide to try to stop them.
You are filled with sorrow, but return to your original path.
1322112.content:
You decide you have some time to spare, and you turn to the direction of the voices. You are careful to be as silent as possible as you get closer and closer. As you get closer, you realize the number of voices is increasing. You can hear another noise, the chopping of axes and sawing of saws. But the worst noise is an intense, deep groan - so loud it makes your head hurt from the pressure.

You come to the edge of the forest. Bright light shines brilliantly through the trees, or at least what is left of them!

Tree miners. They are sawing, hacking at the trees, murdering them one by one. You stand there shocked, sorrowed and angered.

But, you are obviously outnumbered - there must be 100 of them. And they are large, gruesome creatures. Thick mucus drains from their black nostrils, poisoning the very ground you cherish.
1322112.title: Tree Murders (F)

choices: You decide to go after them yourself.
You let them go - your point has been proven.
13221121.content:
Your rage is justified - they are taking the lives of your friends, the source of your power, and you take that quite personally. You begin to call upon the rocks, the trees and the birds. You softly chant an Elvin spell, releasing nature to defend itself.

In a matter of seconds, rocks begin to roll down the gentle slope towards the tree miners. Then large boulders begin to move, gaining momentum as they roll.
The trees start shaking violently, moving their branches briskly in erratic patterns.
Thousands of birds descend upon the miners, swooping down and pecking at their heads. Hawks scream and swoop down, digging their talons into the distgusting creatures' flesh, ripping them open.
Some of the greusome creatures run to the trees for protection, but the branches slap them, cutting their faces and knocking them down. Their axes and saws are powerless now, and you smile as their defeat becomes apparent.
Then the boulders begin to pound them, rolling over them like ants, crushing life and limb. The protective armour they wore was crushed into their bodies, cutting deep and wounding some even to death.

Yet some of these nasty creatures have managed to escape. They are running away from the forest, down into a deep, rocky valley.
13221121.title: nature war (F)

132211211.content:
You chase after the creatures in hopes that you can stop their hideous attack on nature. The birds; the winds; the trees and the rocks are awaiting your command.

Then one creature whirls around to look at you, and with a monstrous look on its ghastly face, casts a dark spell, and the grass before it ignites. The flames spread to a nearby tree, and those flames to another. He takes off as you are frozen with fear for your home.

The forest is on fire!
132211211.title: Flames of Wrath (F)

1322112111.content:
In a panic you call to the birds, asking them to fly as fast as they can across the canopies. The birds obey, as a multitude of them swarm over the treetops. But the winds that follow only spread the fire, allowing the flames to jump farther to more trees. This fire is not candle that can be put out by a puff of wind. You need water and you need it fast.

There is no river immediately by. You try calling water, just in case, but only streams respond. You try again, concentrating hard. You are so busy standing there with your eyes closed, you do not notice one of the monsters running up behind you.

Finally you hear water...it sounds as if a dam has broken. You open your eyes and see a large wall of water heading your direction.

You turn to run, not even thinking about calling it off. You have underestimated your own power.
As you turn, you face the monster. It barely registers, you have no reaction time. He spears you in the heart, as the world fades to black.

When you open your eyes you are back in your home, in bed. Was it all a dream? Perhaps you could dream again and make better choices.
1322112111.title: Igneous Ocean (F)

1322112112.content:
The flames start to inch their way towards you, but you cannot stop; putting those monsters in their place is all that matters! With a flick of your fingers a landslide rolls down the cliff before you, and though the heat of the flames is overcoming you, you feel this is the right thing to do.

The creatures are crushed by the boulders, and you smile in satisfaction.

Your smile is short lived at the tongues of flames lick at you, catching you on fire. You try to stop, drop and roll, but it's far too late for that. You are surrounded by the flames that are engulfing the very thing you tried to protect.

When you open your eyes, you are back at home in bed. Was it all a dream? Perhaps. Why don't you go to sleep and find out?
1322112112.title: Find Him in the Fire (F)

132211212.content:
You decide to let the few fleeing creatures go. Afterall, they got the message and you are not to be running off into the valley, when you are suppossed to be on a different course altogether. Besides, they'll have a hard time running too far from the rocks and boulders that are still after them!
You turn, wearing a satisfied smile and walk quietly back into the forest. You feel good about the difference you know you have made, and pause to say a quick blessing over the forest.

You are nearing your straying point from the path, but stop short. You saw something move. You look, and although you don't see it now, you are certain there is something or someone there. You are frozen, completely motionless, and listening. You neither hear nor see anything else, but cannot shake that feeling.
132211212.title: Spotted (F)

1322112121.content:
You are certain someone is there and you instinctively jump behind the nearest tree. Your clothing will help camoflauge you as you stay perfectly still, listening closely for movement.
The wind carries a faint scent past your nose, but you are unfamiliar.
The scent is confirmed in less than a second as a blur falls in front of you. The blur you see is an elf and he's got an arrow pointed at your head.
You were so busy hiding, your bow is not even in your hand and you are caught completely unprepared.

Without a sound three more appear around you from behind the very tree you are leaning against, arrows ready.
The elf slowly lowers his bow and the others follow.

"So you are elven then," he says. "What village and house are you of?"

You stammer for words. The sunlight behind the elves seems to make them glow. Their light hair is radiant, and the one speaking has strands of gold in his hair. His peircing crystal blue eyes await an answer from you.

You finally find some words, although you are sure they are not appropriate.

"I....I....you will not know if I tell you."

Without batting an eye he says, "Tell me anyway."
1322112121.title: Elven Surprise (F)

13221121211.content:
Your mom always said that 'honesty is the best policy', although you are not sure that applies to every situation. This time you take your mother's advice.

"My name is Sherri of the house of Waters," you use your actual first and last name, after all, it is the truth.

The golden haired elf looks at you curiously.

"I am unfamiliar with that name. What region are you from?"

You glance at the elves surrounding you, searching for signs of hostility. They seem more curious than anything, so you tell them what they want to know.

"Well, realm would be a more appropriate term. I was summoned here by a wizard to go on a journey. I am needed to help with a conflict that is brewing."

To your delight, a wide smile spreads across the golden haired elf's face. His perfect white teeth gleam like pearls and a deep peace comes over you.

"Welcome, Sherri," he says in the most melodic voice you've ever heard. "We have been searching for you. Come with us."
13221121211.title: The Truth as Best You Know It (F)

choices: Call upon nature to defend yourself yet again
Pretend trust to see what they are planning.
132211212111.content:
Sherri follows the elves. Reminding herself to remain on alert. As the wizard had warned her that there might be those who might mislead her and cause her harm. It would have been pointless to refuse to follow, if they wanted to harm her it was better to pretend to go along than to be slayed immediately.

The apparent leader of these elves walked away so confident and sure that she would follow his every order, his every request.

Back on the path they continue on their journey through the forest.

"Do you know where I'm supposed to be going?" Sherri asked. They were headed in the proper direction but that could be because they had watched her heading off this way.

"Of course." The leader answered. But he doesn't name the location of her destination and her suspicions continue to mount.

Out of the corner of her eye she notices that one of the other elves has a evil looking smirk on his face.

It is pointless to try to hide as they are more skilled with their powers than she. Are they the dark elves mentioned by the wizard? She was getting a sick feeling in her stomach and all of her instincts, new and old, were telling her that they are in fact evil.

Should she try to summon nature again to her defense? And use the rocks once again to fight her enemies?

Or should she stay with them , pretending to trust them whole heartedly for a little while longer until she knows more about there intent?

The leader stops abruptly and turns around toward her. There is a strange gleam in his eye. His companions flank him. The elf she had caught smirking is grinning evilly now, and it's almost as if they are feeling some sense of anticipation.

Well her time is up. She must make her decision now.
132211212111.title: What to do?

1322112121112.content: He turned around at stared deep into your eyes. For a split second you let your guard down and that was enough. "I see, you do not trust us, you think we could be dark elves. I assure you Sherri we are not. You will know a dark elf when you see one." he said with and odd smirk. "I do not place my trust in people so easily. Trust is earned." you said realizing he had looked inside of you, into your mind. He turned around and walked on. "We well take you to your destination, but first we should go to our village. There, you can get the supplies you will need.
1322112121112.title: Trust is Earned

choices: follow the leader to the village
13221121211121.content:
You decide to continue following the elves to their village, after all it is beginning to get dark and the forest is an unknown area. There is no conversation as you travel the path.

Suddenly your little group is surrounded by other elves. "Hello my friends, we were getting worried about you." an obviously older elven warrior said as he approached. "Hello" the leader replied, "We have brought the one we have been searching for." He turns and motions in your direction.

"Hello, my name is Sherri." You reach to shake the warriors hand, but he just stares at it, as if he doesen't know what you are doing. You think to yourself... it will take some time to loose your human instincts and learn the ways of the elf you have become.

"I am Gorth, leader of this humble village. We are pleased to welcome you here.
Come feast with us and then get yourself some rest. The days ahead will be a toll on us all" he said and then turned to lead the way.
13221121211121.title: The Meeting

132211212111211.content:
Walking into a new clearing, all you see is pure beauty. Never before had you seen anything that equalled the magnificince of this place. Seemingly built into the trees, there were the houses, quaint and perfect. The faces looking out at you were all looking curiously back out at you. Again, you had that sense that they could reach into your mind and know everything about you, instantly.

Gorth, smiling at your bewilderment, brought you to the center of the village where it seemed that everyone was gathering to feast. Here, there was every type of pure food imaginable: anything nature could provide. Many of the things on the table you had never seen before. As you sit down gather things on your plate, you look at the faces around you, at peace with themselves and nature.

No one talked much as they were eating, there was no need to. Because your powers were not so developed as of yet, you could either ask some questions of these strange creatures, or sit and enjoy the quiet for a little longer.
132211212111211.title: Follow the leader to the village.

choices: You do not trust him - Depart.
132211212112.content:
"If you would not mind, I would like for you to answer some questions for me, before I agree to join you."

The golden haired elf seems to understand and nodds for you to continue.

"First - who are you?"

"I am Deren of the house of Vale, from the elven village of Dora Moore. We are the woodland elves of this region, protectors of the forest."

Sounds good as you fire another question, "Why are your searching for me and how do you know who I am?"

"The great white wizard of this forest is summoning chosen ones from other realms. He speaks to us of the decisions that are made - who the pure of heart are, and who have faltered. We are here to help you."

"If you are here to help me, then why do you need my help?"

Deren smiles, showing his pearly whites again. "It is the high council of elves at the Rivers of Dan who need your help. We are at their service when the time comes. When you arrive there, the story will be completely revealed and nothing held back. But you will need skills to get there, which is why we are here to help you. Our village is to the south, and will not take you off course. Our leader, Mikia, can answer your pressing questions about the conflict."

Impressive. Do you believe him?
132211212112.title: Questions Questions (F)

1322112121121.content:
Two elves lead the way and one follows behind you and Deren. You use the opportunity to ask a few more questions.

"Did you see those monsters chopping down the forest?"

Deren nodds sadly, "Yes. Those were Orcs. They use the forest trees to fuel their fires. They are making weapons I'm sure. We do our best to protect this region of the forest, but today, you beat us to it!" Deren smiles in approval of your previous actions.
"We kill many of them daily, but more and more come. I'm sure we'll see more of them as the battle grows."

"When will the battles or war begin, Deren?"

"I'm not entirely sure. The great white wizard of this forest keeps us informed as best he can. He travels all over and has spies that bring back information."

"So he's one of the 'good guys'?" you ask.

"Actually, Sherri, he's neutral, which is why he is the recruiter and has not been killed yet."

"I still don't understand why I have been chosen," you comment.

Deren says nothing and as you look up you see the village up ahead.
1322112121121.title: To the village (F)

13221121211211.content:
The sun begins to set in the horizon and shadows begin to grow long. Green and blue dots of light decorate the village ahead, like a galaxy of beautiful stars.
Deren smiles as he pushes your gaping mouth closed. "There's much more to see," he says.

You follow him further down, across a bubbling brook. You can see the fresh springs fountaining up, and realize that you are thirsty.
You stop and use your hands as a cup, sipping the clean, cold water. Never have you tasted water so pure.

As you look up, Deren has waited for you, but the other elves have gone up ahead entering the village.

"I'm sure you are weary and hungry," he says. "You will find rest with us here, and tomorrow will meet with Mikia. There will be a nice table spread for us soon and you may have your fill."

Deren leads you into the village. The delicate architecture has intricate patterns formed in the wood. Houses are built within the trees, so as they seem to be one. The green and blue lights are actually fairys who's wings glow brightly and illuminate the entire village. They are small, dainty and incredibly beautiful. They smile sweetly as they pass by and you smile in wonderment.
You come to a house and Deren opens the door and motions for you to enter. Inside there are lanterns casting a yellow orange glow throughout. A spacious, yet sparsley furnished room with a large carpet in the middle. Deren leads you up some stairs to the left. They spiral up and lead to a beautiful room overlooking the village. The room has a balcony and beautiful windows with no glass. There is a very lovely bed to the side, draped in fine silks of white and mint green. It has four wooden post that are carved in a spiral pattern.
"This is your room for tonite," says Deren. "There is a wardrobe over there," pointing to a large cabinet with doors, "where you will find more suitable attire for tonite."

"What is tonite?" you ask.

"Tonite we will celebrate the arrival of so many new friends, and for the certain victory that will be for the woodland and river elven kingdoms and also for the wizards in the north."

Before you can ask further questions, Deren is out of the room calling back, "You have two hours! I will come for you!"

You lay on the soft bed, tired, and rest your eyes for a moment.
13221121211211.title: In the Village of Dora Moore (F)

132211212112111.content:
As you drift off to sleep, you are visited by dreams...

You are back home, lying in your bed. The morning light is streaming in through your mini blinds. You look at the clock; 7:45am. You rub your eyes and rise up. As you slip your warm fuzzy slippers on your feet, you realize you are in your elven clothing. Confused you look in the mirror, but appear "normal," except for the clothes. You grab your soft pink and green plaid robe and cover your strange clothing.
Shuffling out your bedroom door, the house is quiet and you are alone. You walk into the kitchen and open the refridgerator. The light is blindingly bright inside and a burst of hot air hits you. Shocked, you slam the door shut quickly.
You hear a noise behind you and spin around. It's the wizard!
He stands there in your kitchen in his white flowing robe and magical staff. His beard stark white, eye brows protruding from his narrow face.
All you wanted was a glass of milk, but instead you get the wizard.
On the end of his wand is a dark glass ball. He lowers it and you look closely. Inside you see a group of people in a circle, arguing. In the middle are large papers with sketches. Upon further inspection, it looks to be battle plans. The scene changes as you see dark elves, both beautiful and hideous at the same time, slitting the throats of the woodland elves. They have ambushed them in the forest. You see orcs destroying the forest to fuel their fires for weapons. Horrible, terrbile weapons of steel and granite. You see a castle, black and twisted in the twilight. A dark cloud looms over it and as it shoots a lightning bolt a face is illuminated. A giant red goblin evily grins, lusting for blood.
You are brought back to stare at the wizard, who then turns and direct your gaze to the living room. You hear angry voices and inch closer to see. It is the voices of your parents, and suddenly you are a young child again.
You look around the corner just in time to see your father lob a punch, hitting your mom directly in the face. Blood spills from her nose and tears stream down her face. She turns to run, but grabs her arm, jerking her back to him. His cruel expression is like a knife in your soul. Your watch and listen as your mom wails and begs for mercy. There is no mercy in his eyes and he gets ready to send another blow...
Then they are gone and you are looking at the wizard again. Tears are flowing down your cheeks like rivers. You shake your head in disbelief.

"You were young. It was a shame you saw those things. Even now, your only memory is in dreams, because your conscious mind refuses to remember such horrid times. That day you were taken by the state and soon adopted to live a normal life."

Wiping a tear you ask, "What became of my parents, exactly?"

The wizard continued, a sorrowful expression on his face. "Your father killed your mother and then killed himself. No one had the courage to tell you the truth about them."

Your shoulders shake uncontrollably as you sob.....and awake.
132211212112111.title: The Dream (F)

1322112121121111.content:
You awake with a sudden breath, feeling a tear fall from your cheek. You sit up, but here you are, in Dora Moore, in the forest that is who knows where. The dream was very disturbing, and you wish to think of it no more.
You find elven garments hanging in the cabinet. Choosing a long and flowing dress, you press the fine soft material against your face. It smells of the spring roses. Slipping it on, you look in a mirror that stands in the corner of the room. The dress is stunning and flattering; white and blue, with silver laces in the front.
Your hair is long and straight; a deep auburn, with strands of blonde, kissed by the sun. Your eyes are like emeralds that shine brightly. Your cheeks are flushed, lips full, and ears pointed! Your skin is fair and smooth, like porcelin.
Walking to a small table you pick up a brush, running it through your shiny hair. Using the silver cords on the table, you entertwine them in braids that flow down your back.

"I feel like a princess," you gleem.

Knock. Knock. Knock.

"Sherri, it is I, Deren. Are you ready?"

Opening the door, Deren is dressed differently, in long flowing garments of blue and gold. His hair is adorned with braids that entertwine with golden cords. He is absolutely incredible to behold. His smile is radiant as he looks upon you. Bowing slightly he stretches forth his hand.
You oblige, taking his hand, and he leads you out of the house, down a path through the village and into a courtyard. There is a huge banquet spread, and many others are there.
Two chairs are pulled out for you - one by Deren. The other is by an elf you have not yet met. He has dark brown hair and chocolate brown eyes. He is very handsome and there is a glint of familiararity in his eyes.
You have a choice of where to sit.
1322112121121111.title: Getting ready for the Party (F)

13221121211211111.content:
You smile politely at the stranger, but choose the chair Deren has chosen for you, for you are more comfortable with him.
The stranger is not far from you and he and Deren exchange polite glances. No harm done.

The food is exquisite, exotic fruits and vegetables adorn the finely covered tables. Flavor burst forth with each scrumptious bite of fruit. The juice of a tangerine escapes your mouth and trickles down your chin. Before you can pick up your napkin, Deren has done it for you, gently wiping the juice away. He smiles and you laugh, as he reaches to fill your glass with wine. His glance and touch made you tremble inside for a moment. You hope you did not blush.

The main course arrived, deliciously prepared. A souffle made of vegetables; one of the best meals you have had the pleasure of tasting. Desert was better, but you hardly noticed. Deren refills your glass every time it is emptied, and the elven wine is stronger that what you are accustomed to.

A voice at the head of the table does catch your attention, as he welcomes the many newcomers to the village.
"We have come together tonight to celebrate the dawning of a new age. Soon two realms will collide and fight together, ultimately saving both. We will be victorious! Tonight we celebrate the presence of our new found friends who are our honored guests and companions. Let the celebration begin."

A loud cheer arose from the elves as they got up from their seats. Flutes, drums and strings began to produce a lively melody, from the nimble-fingered elves that played them. You notice the stranger who had pulled a chair for you earlier. He is standing close to the edge of the shadows, watching.

"Care to dance?"

You look up and Deren is standing, offering his hand.
13221121211211111.title: The Feast (F)

132211212112111111.content:
You are uncertain about the dancing, but as you take Deren's hand and he leads you out amongst the others, the rest comes naturally. Your feet step lightly, in unision with the beat and with Deren's feet. You are moving so fast the world is a blur of color, happiness and laughter.
Deren spins you off, landing you in the arms of another elf. After a few beats, he spins you off to someone else. This continues through several people until you are back in Deren's arms. By now you are dizzy and having the time of your life. Deren is laughing, and the music begins to slow.
Looking around, you notice many of the elves have left. Some have gone inside to tell stories by the fire. Others have wandered off into the woods for some midnight nature walks. Some have sat back at the table, chatting, snacking and resting. There are a few couples who have chosen to dance to the slow music.
132211212112111111.title: Dancing the Night Away (F)

choices: Kiss him. You don't care about your fear.
Pull away and run. You are not ready for a relationship.
1322112121121111111.content:
You are not sure if you should dance with Deren. What if he should get the wrong idea and try to get serious? You are not sure whether you are ready for a relationship, having only just arrived in this land, but, not wanting to injure his feelings, you stay in his arms.

Despite your worries, your mind drifts, enjoying this perfect moment in time. Around the floor you drift, other couples slowy leaving, but you do not notice. In his arms you feel safe, your head resting on his shoulder, you feel his breath in your hair.

As the music draws to a close, Deren gently stops your twirling. Shifting, somewhat relectantly, he looks deep into your eyes. They are unimaginably deep, and you feel yourself getting lost in them. Feeling you cannot name are welling within you. You are scared, and you feel both attrached to him and afraid of what might happen if you show it.

At first you do not relize that he is speaking to you, and you must pull yourself back to reality. You ask him to say it one more time, gently apologizing.

"Sherri, I think I love you." A shiver runs down your spine.
1322112121121111111.title: Dance

13221121211211111111.content:
You reach up and kiss him. You feel yourself get pulled closer to him as his arms wrap around you. You deepen the kiss. He pulls away reluctantly for breath. Resting his forehead against yours, he smiles brightly, and you smile back. 'I'm scared,' You say before you realize it.

He laughs, 'That's a part of what love is.'

You giggle and kiss him again.
13221121211211111111.title: Kiss the Elf

132211212112111111112.content:
You rest your head against Deren's shoulder and together you sway to the music.You are feeling a little giddy from the wine,the twirling the kiss and Deren's admission.

You pull back a little and look into Deren's amazing eyes. "How can you love me when we've only just met?I'm not even a real elf?"

Deren smiles down at you. "It is a characteristic of our race. We fall deeply in love very quickly because of our connection to nature."

You notice that he didn't mention about your race and ask him again."What about my not being a real elf?"

Deren steps back from you and takes you by the hand."Come with me." Trusting him more than you've ever trusted anyone you follow.

Deren takes you to a clearing outside of the village. You can still hear the soft music in the distance. You look up at the stars. They're so beautiful,but they are different and it reminds you that you are not from this world.

Deren's arms encircle you from behind."Don't cry.Breath.Listen." You hadn't realised you were crying until Deren pointed it out.

"Oh Deren I . . ."

"Shhhhh.Listen. Tell me what you hear."

His gentle voice sooths you and you close your eyes.You take a few deep breaths and as you do your hearing intensifies. "I can hear the music.I can hear the breeze.I can hear us both breathing. I can hear small animals sleeping or moving about in the grass.I can hear the stream.So many wonderful sounds."

"Would you have been able to hear all that before?" Deren asked his voice barely more than a whisper.

To awed to speak you lightly shake your head.

"What else can you hear or feel that you couldn't before?" He asked as he gently moved away so that you were close but not touching.

Again you take a deep breath. "I can hear a drumming." A slight frown creases your brow. "It's a steady rythm but it almost sounds like my name."

By now Deren had moved several feet away."Listen harder and feel." His voice was still soft,but clear to your hearing.

"I think it's a heart beat.It's your heart beat." The suprise is evident in your voice."My God! Deren, you do love me.Your heart is speaking my name."
132211212112111111112.title: Love discovered

choices: You tell the wizard your story
1322112121121111111122.content:
Your breathing has depened and although your eyes are closed,you know Deren is coming toward you.

"I'm sorry Deren I. . .I'm not ready for this."

Before he has a chance to respond you turn and run back to the village.By the time you reach the accomodation you are sobbing so hard you can hardly breathe and your tears are coming thick and fast.

You collapse on the bed and cry yourself to sleep. Once again you dream of the wizard.

"Why do you come to me in my dreams?" You ask as soon as you recognise him.

"Because,my dear,to do the task that has been set,you need to face your pain and your fears or they will be turned against you."

As he speaks the world seems to blur around you until you are stood in a cemetry. It's a place you know well.To the left is a little patch of woodland. Amongst those trees are the three most important people who were ever in your life.

You shake your head vigorously."I can't do this!Not now!Please don't make me!"You grab the arm of the wizard and try to pull him in the opposite direction.

For a man who looks to be hundreds of years old he is remarkably strong. You turn and look to him with pleading in your eyes and are suprised to see tears streaming down his face.

With your mixed feelings you almost scream at him."Why are you crying,it's MY pain?"

"I'm sorry but you are an elf,and your pain isn't confined to you. It's spilling all over the place.And I'm sorry that you have to face this too." His tone told you he was genuine and so you followed.

When you got to the trees he pushed you slightly ahead. Without thinking about where you were going you followed a path you had walked hundreds of times.

After a couple of minutes you stopped at the edge of a clearing. In front of you were three grave stones.One was much newer than the other two,but it had still been there a while.

Gently,the wizard pushed you forward. As if it had a will of it's own you raise your hand to touch the first stone. You aren't crying so hard now,but the tears are still flowing freely.

You go round to the other side of the stones and kneel so that you can see all three of them."Why does it still hurt so much?"Your voice is cracked with emotion and barely above a whisper,but in the stillness he hears you.

"These are the people who made you . . ." He paused,"No,allowed you to grow into the person you are today.No matter what happens to you they will always hold a place in your heart."

Not knowing what to say you just nod and quietly cry over the graves of your mother,father and husband.
1322112121121111111122.title: Face it!

13221121211211111111221.content:
when you awake, it is the morning. You hadn't realized you had slept for so long. You had grown annoyed with the wizard so much that you had forgotten about the night before. You got up, dressed yourself and headed back to the center of the village. Everyone was up and they all seemed to be waiting for you. In the middle was Deren. He came to you.
"Are you alright?" He asked. First you were confused about what he was talking about then you realized and saw his concern.
"I'm fine," you say. Seeing that it didn't convience him, you give a quick kiss on the lips.
That worked.
"What is everyone doing?" You ask.
"We are going to start your training" Deren smiled as you looked into the crowd.
"Alright," you say, "Let's begin."
13221121211211111111221.title: Waking up

13221121211211111111222.content:
"You know as well as I do that they weren't my real parents,but they raised me.They dide in a car accident about eight years ago.I still miss them." You stop and take a deep breath.You don't want to start crying again so you try to suppress your feelings.

"Don't do that."The wizard tells you."I can feel the pain in it.Suppressing your emotions is not why I brought you here."

You nod and carry on."I should have died too.I was in the car but I had fallen asleep and when I woke I was in a hospital surrounded by nurses and doctors.Apparently being asleep was what saved my life.I was so relaxed that none of the impacts seriously hurt me."

"It's no good blaming yourself.You must see now that you survived for a higher purpose?"

"Some higher purpose?You mean a war I have no right to be involved in?"You look at him squarely and he breaks eye contact.

"These wars have been happening in all the dimensions,for want of a better word.Each of our worlds . . .swap someone who is suited for a task specific to that war." He looks back at you to gague your reaction.You are still staring so he continues."I know what you are going through.I was sent to another world once.It was much more hostile than this,and I didn't have a guide."

This suprises you."I was told you were neutral."

"Officially I am."A little smile plays at the corners of his mouth."Off the record I really hope you succeed."

For a time you sit and look at each other knowing that you have something in common.Finally you have to ask. . ."How did you get back?"

"Easily.I made the choice to.I didn't want to stay there so when my task was finished I was allowed to return home."He looked intently at you and you start to squirm."Why don't you tell me the rest now?"

You sigh deeply."I guess if I must I must."You wriggle about trying to get comfortable."After my parents died,I didn't have much motivation but a friend kept badgering me to move on with life.I went out with her a couple of times and one evening she invited me to a party.Sonia was always invited to partys.I went with her and her boyfriend Thom and felt like a complete loser when they were the only ones I knew.I spent most of the evening sitting in the window seat feeling miserable.Thats where I met Grant.He took me home and asked if we could meet up sometime.We were virtually inseperable from then."

The tears were flowing again with the memories.You didn't really mind though.It was time you said goodbye and moved on any way.

"We got married when I was nineteen,which I'll admit was young,but we both knew we wanted to spend the rest of our lives together.Anyway...We had just found out that the job Grant had been working for had become available.The only drawback was that we'd have to move across to europe.It didn't really matter to us though because we'd be together."

You look over to your new confidante and smile a watery smile."We thought we had years to spend together.We had talked about starting a family but decided to get settled in our new home first.Grant went over to get things sorted and I stayed behind to tie up loose ends.We spoke every night at the same time so that we knew when to be near the phone.One evening though he didn't ring.I knew he had a lot of meetings that day and thought he was just running late."

"I so wanted to speak to him because I had just found out I was pregnant.I knew it was sooner than we had planned but I also knew he would be as happy as me.At about two o'clock in the morning I was woken by the ringing of the telephone.I knew something was wrong.I could feel it in the pit of my stomach.It was a hospital in France.As soon as the nurse identified herself I knew he wouldn't be alright.I don't know how I knew but I did."

"The first person I phoned was Sonia.She came round and helped me pack and book air tickets,all that sort of thing.Then she drove me to the airport.I didn't sleep,I couldn't.I just had to try and get there in time to say goodbye.I loved him so much it was almost painful.I arrived at the hospital and was taken into a side room where they told me Grant had died about an hour ago."

"I was in shock.Completely.I even forgot about his child growing inside me.I was so numb.I only remembered when I started to get cramps.It took three days to miscarry our baby.The pain was unbelievable,physical and emotional.You're the only other person I've ever told."

He nods his head in acknowledgement.His company is comfort for a little while.Then he asks you what you don't expect.

"Do you love Deren?" He quietly waits for your reply.

"I cant.Every one I've ever loved has died."You almost wail your reply.

"I didn't ask can you but DO you?"

All you can do is nod.
13221121211211111111222.title: My pain

choices: go with the wizard to Deren
132211212112111111112221.content:
The wizard smiles."That's all I needed to know.Deren will be joining you on your quest."

"But I've just told you that being loved by me is dangerous,and now you're going to send Deren into as much danger as me.You can't do this."You're getting angry now and quickly get to your feet.

"I'm not doing it to get at you.He has to go.You will need him."The wizards voice is as steady as ever but you can hear he's starting to get annoyed.

"There isn't time to argue the point.It is time for you to go back.I have yet to visit Deren and let him know."He places his arm around your shoulders and guides you out of the woods.
132211212112111111112221.title: Not fair

choices: keep it shut and wait for him to leave
13221121211211111112.content:
You pull back, startled, with both your hands holding onto his elbows.
"What?"
