"I said i think i love you," Deren repeated himself one more time. His gaze never left your eyes. How could this be? You just met the guy.
"No. No! Deren, what are you thinking? You can't possibly love me. We just met." You pull back farther away from him.
"But-" He starts off.
"I can't, Deren, not right now." You turn and run to your room. Once you reach the safe comforts of your new bedroom you shut the door behind you. You slowly take in everything that has just been said to you, afraid. You heart is beating fast, half amazed and have bewildered. You don't know what to think. You go out to the balcony and look down at everyone. You couldn't see Deren anywhere. Suddenly, you hear a knock at the door.
"Sherri, open up." You think it's Deren but you not too sure.
13221121211211111112.title: Too soon for love

1322112121121111112.content:
Though you would like to slow dance, you are much too tired and decide to take a break. You sit down on a carved out bench. Sitting next to you is the stranger. You look to him and smile. He smiles back and looks away. You start to feel ackward so you try talking to him.
"Hi," you say offering your hand to his.
"Hello, i'm Chip," He says shaking hands with you. You notice he is very charming. His hand was firm and tender. You both look down at your hands and release. You give a small giggle.
He blushes. The slow song was not yet done. He looks to you and asks, "Would you like to dance, i know your tired but just this once?"
At the same time Deren appeared before you saying,
"Come on dance with me." You hesitate, looking into Chip's, now sad, eyes. You try to decide.
1322112121121111112.title: Time to rest

choices: Ask him questions about your quest.
132211212112111112.content:
Dancing has never been your forte', and you are curious about the stranger.

"Deren, I would dance, but not just yet. There is someone I need to talk to."

Deren smiled and nodded, leaving you at the table while he finds another dance partner.
You rise from your seat, feeling the full effects of the wine and use the chair to steady yourself. You manage to focus well enough to walk over to the stranger in the shadows.
The elf is watching the dancing, but speaks to you, "Welcome Sharaya."

Confused, you start to correct him, but he continues, "Sharaya means 'the one who restores' in the elven tongue." He turns to you, stepping into the light. "It is you who will restore the land to goodness and peace, and so you shall be called."

He wears what you can only describe as a tiara for men! It is like a headband that goes on his forehead, simply patterned, but beautiful. The gold shines as a passing faerie illuminates it.

"My name is Mikia, King of Dora Moore."

It is then you realize who you are talking to! You quickly bow on your knees, struggling to keep your balance (from the wine).

Feeling a hand on your shoulder, Mikia continues, "No need for bowing, Sharaya, please."

Looking up, he has his hands extended towards you. You take his hands and stand, suddenly feeling silly that you did not know who he was earlier.

"I...I'm sorry I did not realize..." you stammer.

"Please, no apology necessary. It is my honor to have you in my company."
132211212112111112.title: Stranger in the Shadows (F)

choices: You wake up in your room.
You wake up in a strange room.
1322112121121111122.content:
You stand there embarassed. You must look like a fool,unable to stand by yourself. And he saw you drink all that wine! Unsure of why, you know you wish to have this man's approval. So you stand quietly, waiting for him to speak, as you imagine a proper elveness would.

"What has happened to the spirited elf I saw at dinner?" King Maika asks. "Do I make you that uncomfortable?"

"No! It's just.."" You stammer.

King Maika looks at you with gentle eyes and you blush. This feeling is simmilar to the one you felt with Deren, but deeper somehow. You smile up at him.

"I'm embarrased." You confess. "You must think me terribly, well,"

"Uncivilized?" He supplies.

Startled, you look at him. "Yes."

"No my dear Sharaya, I do not. I merely feel you could have chosen a better dinner patner."

"Better?"

King Maika looks toward Deren. "Deren is a strong warrior, and he is very loyal to me. He serves me well. But he likes to party and he considers himself quite a lady's man. I just wish to offer you an warning. Especially in your present conditon."

You're drunk, but not to drunk to understand what Maika is saying. Strange how you think of him as a friend now and Deren as the stranger. You feel yourself sway slightly and know you will pass out pretty soon. Looking at Maika, you make a decision. You will trust him.

"Please, walk me to my room. I'm feeling a bit light-headed." You say, looking into his eyes.

"It would be my pleasure." His deep chocolate brown eyes look into yours and you feel yourself drowning. You have the feeling he's looking into your soul and you into his. You feel this bond start to form. Then-

You faint. Your last thought as you feel Maika catch you is- Perhaps it was only the wine.
1322112121121111122.title: A Lady's Man

choices: Ask the king questions on why you are here.
Wait for the king to speak to you.
13221121211211112.content:
Something about the handsome stranger intrigues you, as you accept the chair he's reserved for you. Deren smiles at the stranger and bows in respect, "My king."

You have chosen to sit by Mikia, the King of Dora Moore. Deren leans in, whispering in your ear, "A wise choice. How did you know?"

Out of the corner of your eye you look at Deren. "I had a feeling."

Deren smiles in admiration of your excellent discernment, as you both sit at the elaborately prepared table. As one person fills the glasses with wine, another brings out delectable fruits. Looking around, there are many who have gathered together for the feast. It is impossible to tell who is a visitor like yourself, and who is native.
13221121211211112.title: Sitting with the King (F)

choices: Try to speak more with the King.
132211212112111122.content:
You did not know it was the King who decided your seat, and you fight off the awkward feeling inside, trying your best to be relaxed despite it.
Your thoughts race with uncountable questions you want to ask. You don't even know which to begin with, or if you should.
You take a sip of the red wine waiting in the gold rimmed glass. It is sweet, fruity, and stronger than any wine back home.
The main course is brought, and you still have not spoken to the king. You empty your wine glass, and the king himself pours more for you.
Smiling sweetly you begin to form the words "Thank you," but the King speaks before the words leave your lips.

"It is my honor to have you sit beside me, my fair lady."

Unsure of how to respond, you speak the delayed "Thank you. But the honor is all mine sir."

The king spreads a warm grin across his face, "I cannot do what you will do, or what you have the potential to do if you make wise choices. Where I am limited, you are not. I am only a guide here, but you...you will be the savior."

You feel your face warm with his words, "I don't understand what you speak of my king, but I will try my best to accomplish what is needed." Pausing and taking a sip of your wine, you begin again, "Exactly what is it I am to do?"

The king laughs as if you have make a joke. He does not answer your question, as you both finish your meal.

Music is beginning to play and many are leaving the table. Some to sing or play instruments, most to dance.
Deren makes eye contact, asking if you want to dance.
132211212112111122.title: Dinner is served (F)

1322112121121111222.content:
Smiling at Deren you gently shake your head, "Not just yet, but do save a dance for me."
Deren smiles and bows slightly, then leaves to find another dance partner. He certainly is handsome in the moon and fire light.
Turning, you focus your attention back to the King.
"Your majesty," you start, unsure if that's how to address him, "I have so many unanswered questions. I would be greatly appreciative if you could spare a moment to answer them."
The King smiles, "I will answer what I can." He stands, offering his hand. "Come and walk with me."

Together you walk away from the music and merriment. The King leads you up a long spiral staircase ascending into a tower. He does not stop until you are standing on the top, overlooking the village. The view is outstanding, even in the darkness. The moon is full and bright tonight. Combined with your keen eyesight, visibility is substantial. You can even make out mountains beyond the forest to the north. From the tower the entire village is in view, as you watch the elves dancing below. Hearing their laughter you smile, and the King speaks.

"First, I would like you to address me as Mikia. I will address you as Sharaya, which is to mean, 'Savior.'"

"Oh great - no pressure!" you think to yourself. Out loud you speak, "Yes sir...Mikia."

Mikia's headband glows in the moonlight. The night time cast a blue light, but Mikia seems to glow from within.

"I will allow you only one question tonight, in which I will answer in great detail. The morning will have new revelations."
1322112121121111222.title: Top of the Tower (F)

13221121211211112221.content:
"Why have I been chosen?" You blurt out. "I mean, why am I so special?"

Mikia pauses a moment, looking over the landscape. When he turns to you, his face is unreadable. "You've already asked the wizard this. Are you sure you wish me to tell you?" Mikia's eyes are strangely intent as he looks down at you, as if he is trying to warn you.

You stop and think a moment, his eyes puzzling you. But in the end you wish to know the answer. Unable to bring yourself to utter the words, you nod your head.

"Very well then." The King, for suddenly he has grown remote and unaccessible, turns away. And as he starts to speak, you feel a shiver run down your spine for his voice is ancient and tells of terrible knowledge hidden within for centuries.

"You were chosen Sharaya, because of what happened to you in your past. Because of your parents violent behavior and death."

"No. NO! That didn't happen. It was just a dream!" You cry.

The King looks at you and suddenly he is Mikia again, concern and knowing in his eyes. "I knew this would be hard for you. You knew this would be hard for you. But you made your decision. There is no turning back now."

"I thought it was just a dream." Your voice is despairing now, begging him to tell you it isn't true.

"Dreams are more real than you know, Sharaya, especially for you." Mikia looks at you. Then he moves closer and holds out his hand. As he leads you to the sill and you sit, he continues. "There is more to your life than you know. Does it not strike you as odd that you fit in so well here? That you had knowledge of ancient elven spells? That trained elven warriors accepted your declaration of being elf, when you knew none of the customs or forms of address? Didn't it?"

"Yes." You admitt slowly.

"Sharaya you are accepted because you are one of us. You are an elf."

"But how is that possible? I grew up in the human world."

"When you were very young, a baby still, a prophecy was made about you. It was said you would be the savior, you alone would stand against some great evil that was to come. Immediately, evil doers sought your death. It was deemed the only choice was to send you away. You were given to a human woman along with a elven guard.

The guard died soon after of a human disease. The woman, in desperation, married a human man. She knew she couldn't care for you on her own.

The man turned out to be an abuser, but the woman couldn't leave. The man would have taken her to court and won custody of you. This wasn't an option. The woman stayed and met her death because of it."
13221121211211112221.title: The Truth

132211212112111122211.content:
"But the wizard said..."

"Even the wizard doesn't know the whole story. We have kept it hidden, trying in our own way to protect you."

"We? We who?" You ask Mikia.

Mikia looks at you and turns away. "I cannot tell you."

Sensing something more is troubling him, you walk up to him and put your hand on his shoulder. Gently turning him, you ask, "Mikia, what is it? What won't you tell me?"

Mikia looks down at you. His eyes are gentle and filled with some unknown emotion as they roam over your face. His hand comes up and traces the curve of your jaw. Still he doesn't answer you.

"Mikia?" You whisper.

Abruptly he turns away. His hands ball into fists at his side and they shake with tension. "I can't. I can't." He mumbles as if reminding himself of something. "I'm not allowed to. She isn't mine."

You stand there stunned. What is going on? Can't what? And what does he mean you're not his? You open your mouth to ask but Mikia regains his composure and turns to you. Once again, he is no longer gentle and friendly Mikia, but the cold and remote King.

"We need to finish the answer to your question. Please sit."

As you resume your seat unwilling, for you wish to understand what just happened, the King finishes your story.

"The woman hadn't known she was going to die. She had made plans, however, in case something like that happened. She'd arranged in her will, that you would go and live with a friend of hers that she trusted. The court allowed it and you were moved.

You were to young to remember what had happened or so it was thought. They never told you of your 'real' parents, they just let you think the people you live with now are your parents. They felt it would be to traumatic for you to know the true story. And it seemed that what they had assumed was true. You were a normal, healthy, well-adjusted child. Except for the nightmares.

Whether you realize it or not, Sharaya, those nightmares have helped you. They've helped you to grow into a person of strength and courage. They've helped prepare you for the terrible task that you are about to face. They've prepared you for the future."

"The future? I don't understand." You met his eyes and were relieved to see Mikia again. You were so lost and confused, you needed the strength and understanding you knew he would give.

"You must lead the battle, Sharaya. If any but you command it, the cause is lost. You will face dangers and fears just as dark and horrible as your nightmares were and worse. You must have the strength to overcome, or all will perish." Mikia's voice was different, deeper. You noticed the change in his eyes. It was almost as if the wizard were... But as soon as it appeared, the look vanished. Mikia's eyes lightened and he smiled. "I don't know where that came from. I'm sorry."

Understanding partly what you were to do and why you were chosen, you said, "Don't worry about it. Let's go back to the party."
132211212112111122211.title: Destiny

choices: Go take a walk to ponder these things.
13221121211211112222.content:
Pausing to think, you finally ask, "You call me 'Savior'. How am I to make a difference?"

Mikia smiles, "I see you are one who looks to the future. This is why you will make the difference. You strive to make things better, to make things right. Always looking for better ways to do things and better reasons for doing them. The future is what matters most to you."

Mikia leads you to an area with a small pool. It is built of stone with a height of about 3 feet. The water inside is motionless and glassy. You look to see your reflection. Your beauty is amazing in the moonlight.

But the image changes. You are wearing fine armour of the elves. A golden bow is in your hand, as you shoot a golden arrow of fire. This signals a vast army. You see some familiar faces, but mostly a mass of elves. They run full force into a dark cloud. You mount a white horse, charging before them. You join another on a white horse, a kingly elf who you have not yet seen. A king in battle with his own. He holds a banner in one hand, a scroll in the other, and he wants you to choose.
The image begins to cloud, showing various battle scenes, then fades back into the mirror it once was.

"I had a choice," you say to Mikia.

"Yes, but that one is yours to make in the future."

"What do they mean? The banner or the scroll?"

"Whichever you choose, you will be a great importance to our victory. If you choose the banner, you will stay with the army, fighting with them. The scroll - you will be a messenger and confidant to our allies in the North. Both roles are vital and will gain you great respect and honor. But they will hold very different endings, of which I cannot say."

Mikia steps away from the pool, looking into the night. The music is still going down below.

Mikia speaks without turning, "I believe you promised a dance to someone. Get some rest tonight, as the morning will come early."

"Yes, sir."
13221121211211112222.title: The Future (F)

choices: Allow Deren to travel with you
132211212112111122221.content:
You walk back down the stairwell still pondering Milkia words.

"How i'm I suppose to save this realm if I have no idea what i'm suppose to do?" you ask yourself.

You arrive back at the party and notice Deren sitting by himself.

"I believe I promised you a dance."

Deren looks up at you, smiles and holds out his hand. You take it with out even thinking.
The elven band begins to play a slow magical song. As you and Deren dance the night away, you begin to feel a oneness with him.
After hours of dancing and wine, Deren escorts you to your room. (For you are stummbling a little from the wine.) You stand in the doorway as Deren leans into your right ear and wispers, "I think i'm falling in love with you. I would like to aid you on your journey."

Staring at Deren, you lean in and press your lips to his, into a union of two souls.
Deren says his goodbye's and you shut the door to fall onto the bed fast asleep.

The morning comes quickly and you will have to tell Deren of your choice. Will you let him accompany you on your journey? Or will you continue alone?

A knock on the door shows Deren waiting with a smile.

"I am prepared to travel with you, if you wish. I know the King will grant the wish. Of course, you do have a few days to think about it, while you learn and train. I do hope you will seriously consider it."

"We will see," you reply.

The next days are filled with basic training in weaponry and tuning into your powers over nature. The elves teach you enough to get you to the Rivers of Dan. The third day approaches and the choice looms over you, as you prepare to leave.
Deren comes to you with a white horse.

"Have you decided? I would like to join you."
132211212112111122221.title: Deren, love?

1322112121121111222211.content:
"Deren, I want you to join me on my quest."
He smiles warmly.
"How may I be of assistance to you?"
"I may need advice on this journey."

You both begin to plan your journey and you show him your new skills.
If you close your eyes, you can see what is happening around the next corner.
This can warn you of enemies nearby but not natural dangers or hidden traps. Your second power is the ability to grow plants which may assist you, wherever you are.
"I also have powers" ,Deren reveals. Suddenly he transforms into a plant and then back into an elf. " I can transform into any plant, if I have the energy and strength remaining. Now shall we leave or ask for further assistance?"
1322112121121111222211.title: Allow Deren to travel with you

choices: Choose one of them strait away
13221121211211112222112.content:
You look into Deren's eyes and speak softly, "I cannot explain why, but I feel our party should be four."
Without a word he nods his understanding. Deren has lived his whole life as an elf and is therefore much more in tune with his instincts and more readily accepts feelings than you. This is something you will have to work on.

Whilst you pack you discuss the politics of the situation you will be going into at the Rivers of Dan. The last thing you want is to look like an ignorant idiot.

With your packing done you stand and stretch. "I would value your opinions on who we should take with us." You say as Deren also rises from his position on the floor.

He considers for a moment then smiles. "I think there are some people you need to meet." He leads you into the village square and sits you on the fountain edge. "There are two people I have in mind, for they both have skill with light and fire. Sit here for a few minutes and I will go get them. I advise you do not tell them you might take one of them on your quest as they will turn it into a competition." Deren smiles at you, turns and swiftly moves into the throng of people soon disappearing into the crowd.

It isn't long before he reappears. He is accompanied by two people one is a female elf who is tall, blond and willowy. The other is a squat ...person who is the stereotypical, fairytale picture of a dwarf. Broad strong shoulders, red hair and a bushy red beard.

"This is my sister Deanna." Deren began, and the small knot of jealousy that you hadn't even realized was there unraveled. "This fellow is my very good friend Thatch. We call him Thatch because it's a superstition among the dwarves that it's unlucky to reveal your true name, and when he came to us for sanctuary, he earned his way thatching our roofs."

You obviously weren't very good at hiding your confusion, for Thatch leaped up to sit next to you on the fountain rim.

"In my homeland there are very few of us who are on your side. The other side pays better." He laughed, a rich but gravelly sound. "When I became too vocal in my views of my neighbors I was.." he cleared his throat "..encouraged to leave."

Deren picked up the dwarves tale. "He came here to see if he could help at all and to escape from his disgruntled neighbors." He smiled fondly at the dwarf. "Dwarves live as long as elves so we have known each other for quite a few years now."

"Hush brother," Deanna interjected, "you talk too much!" Her voice was as soft as you had imagined and as smooth as honey.

You already had a good feeling about them both.
13221121211211112222112.title: You ask for assistance

choices: Find someone Thatch is happier about.
132211212112111122221122.content:
You look around at the village and the people in it knowing that your decisions could be what saves or destroys these wonderful people. Although you have only been an elf for a short while, and have known the people here but a few days, through your connection to nature you feel a close kinship with them.

You sigh and rise to your feet. "Is there somewhere we could go to eat and talk?"

Derren and Deanna exchange a very brief look and both nod. Almost in perfect synchranisation they turn to walk away and beckon for you to follow.

Thatch laughs and you look down as he summesaults of the fountain and delicatly lands. He raises an eyebrow at you then winks. "Let me guess, you thought because I'm short I'd be awkward?" You nod. He smiles again, "Lets catch up with the twins shall we!"

The shock registers on your face and he laughs even more heartily. "Oh my, you are so easy to suprise!" Then he turns and cartwheels after the two elves leaving you staring after.
With a shake of your head you run after the small group.

They stop outside the building Mikial took you to your first night here. "Lets go in and eat shall we?"

Thatch starts to laugh again which makes you kind of grumpy, then you realize its you he's laughing at and blush. "He didn't tell you he was a twin to the beautiful Deanna, and he didn't tell you Mikial was his father either." Thatch shook his head and clapped Deren on the back still laughing. "My friend I think you have a few explanations to make." Then he strolled through the front door with Deanna close behind him.

As Deren turns to you, you cross your arms across your chest and tilt your chin up at him.

"I'm sorry, I didn't think of it. Every one here knows so I just.." He begins, but you cut in. "You called him "My King"! ".

"In public he is always my king, at home he is Father. I guess I should've made sure you knew." He gently takes your hand and as he looks into your eyes its easy to forgive him. You smile to let him know its alright and he leads you into his family home.

While you were sorting things outside, Deanna and Thatch had prepared some fruits, meats and juices. You all sit and talk in generalities for a while, but your decision niggles at the back of your mind. You can stand it no longer and blurt out your question.

"What are your powers?" Realizing how rude it probably was to just say it like that you look at the table. "I I I mean, uh, Deren told me you both do fire and light, but he's not very good at telling me the whole story and..." You trail off in embaressment.

Surprisingly it was Deren who answered, "Let me begin. I am Deren of the house of Vale, from the elven village of Dora Moore. We are the woodland elves of this region, protectors of the forest. My Father is King of this region, Mikial of the house of Vale. I have a twin sister who is the heir to the throne as the elder of us."

If his face had not been completly serious you would have laughed at him. Then Deanna rose. "Welcome Sherri of the house of Waters, welcome. I am Deanna, daughter of the house of the Vale, ruling house here in Dora Moore." She sat down and smiled at you. "As my brother has told you, both Thatch and I have certain skill with fire and light. I also have the gift of sharing. I can, for want of a better word, dredge the minds of people around me for their thoughts, I can also tell truth from lies up to a point. This gift is somewhat inaccurate because if the person who says a thing completly believes what they say it appears as truth even if I know otherwise."

Deren cleared his throat. "Whats wrong brother? Are you worried that I might tell tales?" Deanna smiled fondly at her brother and they shared another look.

"We can also communicate with each other accross long distances, mind to mind." Deren takes a breath and then looks sharply at his sister. "Sometimes I wish we couldn't because it means she can scald me no matter where I am."

You turn to thatch. "How about you? What do you do?"

"Well Sherri that'd be telling." He winks at you and then vanishes.

"What..where di ..how did..." Then you hear him chuckling from the spot he was when he vanished.

Reappearing with a cheeky grin on his face he takes a sip of his juice. "I bend light so that I seem invisible. I can also find things." He shrugs. "If you lose something then come to me. There isn't anything I haven't managed to find yet."

This is helpful. You have one more day before you must leave but you still feel you must make your party four. "I was wondering if either of you might be able to suggest any one who might be useful to me on this trip?" You ask tentatively.

Deanna answers very quickly, but you aren't suprised. You suspect she has some of her fathers skill in future sight too.
"I think you will need our friend Thatch with you. I will remain here so that you can keep in touch with Father and I. I also think I know who you should take but I don't think Thatch will like it much."

"Why not? I get on with every one." He said indignantly.

"Flora." Was all that Deanna said but it was obvious that Thatch was not happy with the suggestion. Once he had finished ranting Deanna continued. "She has a great skill in healing and can talk to animals."

"Thatch and Flora have an unrequited love for each other, but it's very frowned upon for cross people relationships." Deren explained. "She would however be perfect."
132211212112111122221122.title: Get to know them better

choices: You brows the stable for another horse of your liking.
1322112121121111222211221.content:
You decide that unrequited love is quite a small problem in comparison to the journey you have to face, and you know you cannot let it sway your judgement because Thatch may not be able to deal with relationship problems.
"Where can I find Flora?" you ask, whilst thatch grumbles slightly to himself.
"She will most probably be in the stables, she loves the horses." replied Deanna with a knowing nod.
"Could you take me to her?" you inquired from your company, but Thatch frowned.
"Think i best miss out on this meeting, don't mind me." with that he dissapeared.
"You know she'll know you're there, masked with light or not, you can't fool nature." laughed Deren. There was an angry noise and the chair that Thatch had just disapeard from shot backwards and you heard Thatch muttering as he walked past you out the door. You looked inquisitively at Deren.
"Animals aren't fooled by Thatch's gift, they see where his aura is and can see change in the natural flow of light, Flora who can talk to the animals would be notified if Thatch walked in with us. But he wanted to come to see our meeting without her knowing." Deren filled you in, and with that You Deren and Deanna set of to the stables in the center of the village. They were huge communal stables that smelt strongly of sweet new hay and apples. They took up the entire centre of the village and everywhere you looked there were groups of Elves taking horses out to ride or hunt, mucking out, or feeding their horse. There must have been a horse for every Elf in Dara Moore stabled here, all peering doefully over the tops of half stable doors. Pleasently interested in all around them. As you walked down the corridor a feeling of comfort fell over you, though you had never riden horses before you seemed to recognise this place..
"Flora!" called Deanna. Your head shot up and before you saw an elf, much shorter than Deren and Deanna or indeed any of the elves you had seen in Dara Moore last night. Though she would still tower over Thatch. She looked over her shoulder as she was at present feeding a sugar lump to a horse and grinned.
"Deanna, Deren, and Sherri. I knew you would be coming." Her voice was light, and familiar like a soft breeze of hilltop air calling through spring flowers. She walked over, but float may be a better word, seeming hardly to touch the floor - merely thinking herself before us and arriving she danced across the floorboards as though they were cushions.
She hugged you, Deanna, and Deren and stared up intently with wide eyes that had no colour that you could grasp, merely depth and merging deep colours of the earth.
"How did you know my name?" You ask awkwardly, slightly bemused by the friendliness of the strange elf.
"Straight from the horses mouth!" she giggled and winked, tilting her head towards the stable doors. "There are no secrets from me dear Sherri, I promice, should you chose to take me I will serve you in every way possible. Be it healing or knowing. I can see your heart is pure." She bowed slightly, her voice was serious but still the endearing smile did not leave her face, and still her eyes stared intent, as though probing the very depths of your mind. You were completely at a loss for words.
"You're confusing her Flora, remember she is new to this realm." They exchanged a glance and you wished everybody would stop doing that!
"I'm sorry dear one. I am Flora, of the house of Kalen, I am a wise elf from The Rivers of Dan." She bent her head but kept her eyes intently on your own.
"The horse to your left shall be loyal to you if you would like her." she nodded knowingly and added "Her name is Kai"
You look to your left and saw a tall, towering horse. Elf size you realised, also acknowledging how tall you now were in this form. She was mainly brown, but had white hooves and a white stripe down her nose which was leaning over the side of her stable towards you, dark and intelligent eyes waiting for your appraisal.
"Hello Kai." you found yourself saying.
1322112121121111222211221.title: Meet Flora

choices: You ask Flora, you trust her after all
13221121211211112222112211.content:
You stare deep into Kai's eyes, and walk over to her. You gently run your fingers through her mane and pet the cute white stripe running down her nose. It gave added a mischievous edge to her endearing brown eyes.
"I think you're right Flora", you say while patting Kai on her back. You turn and see Flora give a deep nod of her head with a wide smile on her face, obviously pleased with herself. A thought occurs to you, and secretly smiling on the inside you stare at the ground with you palms facing the dark dirt.
"Is she trained Flora?" You don't look up to see but you hear the surprise and slight irritation in her voice as she answers.In the background Kai neighs softly in agitation.
"I assure you Kai is one of the best horses for any venture you choose-" The ground looks as if its trembling as grains of dirt pop and shuffle around, you feel a slight strain but push past it and cut Flora's speech off.
"I don't mean to offend you or Kai Flora, I'm sure she's does very well on the occasional trip through the woods, but this is a very dangerous journey. A lot of lives depend on us and I want to cover all of my bases." The pressure you felt building within your body disappears as a tiny, delicate sprout breaks through the earth. There, you think, it's not so bad once you get use to it. And its true, you feel the nagging ache disappear as you mentally relax your mind and focus on the image in your mind. It didn't feel like you were making this happen on your own accord, more like you were a vessel for the magic to flow through you. Kai continued to grumble in the background, louder this time.
"Sherri-", Deren begins with an warning lacing the calm he was trying to project. You look up at him, Deanna, and Flora and wink, then you glance at the stalk that's been growing up to your thigh. They all stare at it in awe as the stalk widens and a vine spirals upward ending in a huge and delicate flower. The colors looked like a mini sunrise exploding at your fingertips. The cool indigo blended in seamlessly with the warm purple and the tips looked like they were dipped in a rosy hue. Each petal had a pale, daffodil yellow stripe, the color of pure sunshine, running up the middle of it.
"What is th-", Deanna began still staring at the plant in wonder. You cut her off by clearing your throat, then you pluck the plant and shucking the layers of leaves off.
"I mean I don't want a dud of a horse is all", you say turning as Kai loudly neighed with indignation. You present the piece of elven sugar cane to her. She eyes it disdainfully and then nudges you none to gently with her nose, making you take a few steps back. She then turns and starts eating her hay without so much as a glance at you. You look at the other for some help. Deren and Deanna simultaneously shrug, an open look of confusion on their face. It was almost cute. You turn to Flora and she does the same but with a small smirk on her face. You go to Kai trying to pet her neck, she deftly sidesteps the gesture and faces the wall.
"Aw come on girl, it was just a joke. I was trying to surprise you with a treat-", you start but Kai interrupts you by quickly grabbing yours sleeve and pulling. You tumble against her unexpectedly, both of you arms wrap around her neck for support. Before you can figure out what's happening, Kai is gently nudging your neck with her wet, warm nose and neighing gently. The group behind you erupt with laughter and Flora finally manages to say "See, a perfect match". You giggle a little and then hold out the sugar cane for Kai to eat, she quickly finishes it. You then start braiding the flower through her mane, you hear Deren move closer to you. You can feel the warmth radiating from his hand as he's moments away from touching you. Suddenly Kai whips around, putting you behind her as she pushes Deren back with her nose. He falls to the ground and stares up in amazement as Kai paws the ground and then turns, giving him a full view of her tailend. Deanna and Flora both try to hide their amusement, failing miserably. After wiping the tears from her eyes Flora states, "Kai is very protective of her lady, and formally requests that you uh, keep your distance."
"Kai!", you exclaim putting you hands around her neck and rubbing her back gently. She answers by playfully tugging on a tuft of your hair with her teeth. "Don't try to sweet talk me sugar lips, you should apologize to Deren. He's a very good...friend", you finish uncertainly. Deren looks up from briskly dusting himself off to shoot you a questioning look, you suddenly become very interested in the subtle highlights in Kai's mane. Kai paws the ground and neighs impatiently.
"Er, Kai offers her sincerest apologies to, uh that's not a polite thing to call somebody Kai...", Flora ended weakly. Kai whisked her tail at Deren, obviously brushing him off. Deren's face filled with blood as he raised his eyebrow and opened his mouth to say something.
"I'm sure that Kai just needs time to get used to you, Deren" you interrupt trying to smooth things over. Deren closed his mouth but didn't look appeased. You turn your attention over to Flora.
"Flora?", you began uncertainly. You wanted to ask her about the relationship between her and Thatch, but you're not sure if it's the best thing to do. On one hand it would be better to get everything out in the open, you don't want any problems popping up when you're in a tight bind. On the other hand she's not exactly objective about this situation...
13221121211211112222112211.title: You accept Kai

13221121212.content:
Although it may not be in your best interest to lie to elves, your story seems pretty unbelievable. The elves may not think it amusing if you told them you were once human, now turned elf, so you have to make something up.

         "My name is Sherri, I, I'm trying to change my ways. My parents were dark elves..." you look to the ground in disgrace and hope they'll show you some pity.
         "But I don't want to be like my parents. Over time I've learned the ways of good elves and I... I ran away so I can change. I am trying to make it to the Rivers of Dan... I hear there are very wise elves there that can help me."

The elves look around at one another.
"I don't know if we can trust you," the one with the bow closest to your head says, "how will we know?"
         "You can trust me," you say, "I'm only looking for allies, not enemies."

"Well," the male elf comments, "what you've found is us, and we're-"
13221121212.title: A Cautious Choice

choices: stare back at him blankly and demand answers
132211212121.content:
-Light Elves.' He smiles down at you, and offers his hand to help you up. 'I am Mourvern of Casent, and these are my companions,' he points to the elves behind you, 'Yurlie of Gatherelle, Nerat of Hathill, and Freshnor of Laminere.' He points at each elf respectively. 'We were collecting food for our village when we spotted you. We were told to keep watch for unfamiliar characters, and you are far from familiar.' He smiles a charming smile.

You-
132211212121.title: Light Elves

1322112121211.content:
You smile at him, glad to have found a potential ally in your quest.

"It's a good thing we found you when we did." He said, "The forest can be very dangerous. There are dark elves and orcs littering the area. there are even some horrible Tree Miners..."

"We met." you interrupted.

"Did you? You are strange indeed. I think you should come with us to our village. There are some people there who would be very interested to meet you." The way he said this hinted that it was no suggestion. There might be a trap awaiting you at the village. On the other hand, there might not be, and these elves might be able to help you.
1322112121211.title: Smile in return

13221121212111.content:
"I would love to come." You say with a smile,

"Its settled then, you can help us gather food for he village, then we shall head back there and introduce you to everyone."

"Mourvern, how dare you trust a stranger. If she is telling the truth about her parents being dark elves what makes you think she's any different from them. You cannot bring her back to the village. i CANNOT stand here and watch you indanger everyone we know and love!" Nerat of Hathill says angerly.

"I swear I'm telling the truth, I want to be different from them I want to be good." You say quickly.

"You make a point, She could be dangerous..." He says while looking you up and down. "...but I have a feeling she's telling the truth. Could you give us a moment to talk in private?" He asks.

"sure" you say as you walk a couple feet away.
13221121212111.title: Follow the elves.

choices: decide to ride it out to the village and see what happens.
132211212121112.content:
Things are rather awkward for the moment, needless to say. In attempts to eavesdrop, you move only a small distance away from the arguing pair, but when Yurlie of Gatherelle and Freshnor of Laminere turn their bows on you once more and demand you stay back, you decide that staying alive is much more important than anything else. Unable to satiate your curiosity, however, you watch the two as the quiet debate unfolds. Nerat seemed quite outraged at Mourvern, and the latter seemed to get more and more on the defensive as it carried on. Well, this wasn't good. If Mourvern didn't win, what were you supposed to do? What was going to happen to you, really? Those bows didn't look friendly; execution on the spot seemed likely.

'How embarrassing is this?' you ask yourself glumly, eyes shooting to the earth beneath your feet. 'That wizard guy must be shaking his head in shame for choosing me for this. I've already blown this whole "chosen" thing he had going sky high.' When you look up again, Nerat and Mourvern are finished and walking over. The outcome was plain on their faces: They didn't buy it. Oh, fiddlesticks.

"You have the darkness in you," Nerat accused, his eyes now slits as he took me in. "I can sense it."

"How can you sense darkness when there's nothing there?" you all but cry out in your defense. "I'm not your enemy!"

"That's yet to be decided. You'll be coming to the village all right, but not as an honored guest." Was that a smile on Nerat's face? Oh, geez. This does not bode well. "Tie her up. We'll take her to Malazair of Aleanrae; he should be able to find a proper use for her."

"Wait, what? Who's Malazair? Hang on!" you say in attempts of halting the process, but it is too late: Yurlie and Freshnor have you pinned. Vines snake around your body and bind your ankles, knees, wrists, elbows, and mouth. As Nerat hauls you over his shoulder, you can't help but grimace at how hopeless this has all become. '"Chosen one" my foot.'

"Yurlie, come with me. Freshnor, finish gathering food with Mourvern. We'll meet you at the village," Nerat orders. Before Mourvern turns away with Freshnor, he looks to you with sadness in his eyes. His voice echoes in your mind, and if it wasn't for the fact that his mouth didn't move and no one else reacted, you could have sworn he had simply said it while standing next to you.

'I tried. I'm sorry. I wish you the best.'

You sigh as he vanished into the trees. Finally, you find a companion, and now he's gone. More importantly, however, your future is looking pretty bleak. This Malazair guy doesn't strike you as someone who will hear your story and heal your wounds... More of the "bang bang smash smash" type. It'll be a long walk to the village, so you...
132211212121112.title: Well, This Isn't Good

1322112122.content:
You cautiously and oh so quietly walk forward. You grab your bow and an arrow and ready yourself. Your keen eyes watch closely for any movement, but still see nothing. The light wind tickles your nose, and you sniff the air trying to pick up a scent. Nothing.
You finally reach your path, but still no signs of life.
Maybe it was your imagination, you think. There's nothing, you conclude, but you do not put away your bow, as your thoughts do not confirm what your intuition tells you.
For several minutes you continue cautiously down your path, until it happens.
You hear a voice directly behind you.
"Put away your bow, for you are in the Elven borders of Dora Moore."
1322112122.title: Hitting the Trail (F)

choices: Refuse, for your journey is long.
13221121221.content:
Elvin borders? That's a bit comforting you think. As long as they aren't dark elves that is. You take your chances, freezing where you stand and slowly lowering your bow.
Then you see them. They appear out of nowhere it seems - perfectly camoflauged in their greens and browns and greys. They move silently towards you, bows drawn in caution.
You are sure to make no sudden movements. In fact, you make no movements at all.

The one who spoke circles around you and stops to face you. He looks you up and down, quite curiously. He has a glint of recognition in his eyes, yet he questions you.

"Who are you and what has brought you to this section of the forest?"

He stands tall with long golden hair tied back. His eyes are as blue crystals, peircing and authorative. He commands your respect and attention with only a look, and you oblige.

"I am one of the chosen," you reply. "I am on a journey south to the rivers of dan."

At once the elves lower their bows, replace their arrows and sling the bows on their backs.

"That is what I thought," replied the golden haired elf. "I am Deren of the house of Lindell, apprentice to the head marksman."
He bows slightly to you in greeting, and you do the same.
"I call you friend and you are welcome in our borders. We saw your bravery with the tree miners. You made a wise choice not to pursue them any farther. You would have risked great danger to yourself and the forest."

You blush slightly, not realizing what a good thing you did.

"Come with us to our village. You will find food and rest there."
13221121221.title: Meeting New Friends (F)

choices: No! this isn't Lord of the rings
132211212211.content:
Reveling in having some company, you find yourself quite happy to be joining their party.

"We'll need to take you to see the King"

"Oh?"

"He'd be honored to help and meet a chosen one."


After two days of walking, they ran into the King and his entourage. Wearing his fighting uniform, a sword, and his cape, he looked like the grand soverign and Warrior.

"You highness..." Someone from the traveling party started, this is the chosen one on a most important quest.

"May I join you?"
132211212211.title: should he?

1322112122111.content:
"I'm sorry... I know you want to, but I don't want to put your life at risk. Though, if you really want to help me, I could use another weapon... A sword, perhaps?" You aren't trying to be greedy, but a melee weapon would be more useful for close up combat than a bow. Also, it's not much use when you're out of arrows in the middle of a stone dungeon.
"I would love to give you a sword. I'll get you a fine one. Anything to help." He turned to a nearby man. "Smith, I want you to get her a longsword. The finest you have, do you understand?"
"Yes, your highness!" He vanished. You sit down, and wait for the smith to come back. You hear something creeping up on you with your sensitive ears. One of the creatures you saw earlier is creeping up on you.
Some other elves notice this, too. You take out your bow and aim. Twenty others did the same.
"Go, or we'll fire." You say, instinctivly. The creatures raised their hands. One by one, they teleport away - Leaving the beginnings of a fire. The king whistled, and some water fell onto the flames. What you noticed that nobody else did is that the creatures reappeared right behind the king, swords drawn.
1322112122111.title: The King

choices: Shoot the creatures with arrows from your bow
With your mind, try to move the king from danger
13221121221111.content:
The fire is spreading quickly despite the joined efforts of the elves and the King’s men, and no one seems to notice the danger the King is in.
“Your highness, watch out!” You scream over the noise of the fire.
The king turns to look where you are pointing and raises his sword defensively.
The creatures circle the King and put up a ring of fire separating him from the rest of the group.
The King is greatly outnumbered, and is desperately dodging slashing swords, and the deadly fireballs the creatures are spitting towards him.
He looks tired and you know it is only a matter of time before he gets hurt.
You raise up your bow, hoping to hit a couple to help him out. As you concentrate on the creatures, a thought forms in your mind. You were able to move the rocks earlier, what if you can move the king away from the danger?
13221121221111.title: Warn the king.

choices: Go with the king, his men, and the few brave elves
Travel with the other elves towards Dora Moore
132211212211112.content:
Fixing your gaze on the King, you chant the same spell that you used to move the rocks.

Nothing happens. Confused why the spell didn't work you let loose an arrow, wounding one of the creatures. It lets out a horrible cry of pain and shrinks away from the King.

As you get ready to shoot another, you realize that your powers only work on making nature move!

Fixing your gaze on the creatures, you chant the spell again, hoping that it works.

The creature that you are looking at is forced violently backwards through the air, away from the King.

It works! You do it again and again, forcing one creature after another away from the King.

By this time, some of the men have seen what is going on and are standing outside the fire circling the King, looking on helplessly unable to get past the flames.

You try aiming the creatures outside of the fire circle so that the men can attack them.

When it lands outside of the circle, a part of the fire disappears. One of the King's men enters and drags the King away from danger.

The others are fighting the creatures. High, horrific cries echo the clearing, and they start to retreat.

After they transport away, the fire magically fizzles out. Looking around, you see them reappear on the other side of the large clearing and disappear into the dark forest west of you.

A quick discussion begins between you, the elves, and the King. The King wants to pursue the creatures and ask you and the Elves for help.

Only a few elves agree to go with the King. They all look at you waiting for your answer.
132211212211112.title: With your mind, try to move the king from danger

choices: Spit in his face in defiance.
Humble yourself and say you are sorry.
13221121222.content:
Startled, you quickly whip around and fire an arrow.
The elf ducks to miss your fire as your arrow goes soaring past him. His strong hands grab your arms, forcing your bow from your hand. He is nimble and quick, and very experienced in combat. Your bow hits the ground at your feet, and the elf turns you around holding your hands behind your back.
You now see a troop of elves standing around you with arrows ready to fire. They are dressed in forest greens and greys. Their long hair is tied back with braids or cloth and their eyes sparkle as they aim towards every vital organ in your body. With one word from the one who holds you, you would be dead, and reality stings at it slaps you in the face.

"What are you doing?" you say in your mind. "YOU are elven too! But the Wizard said not to trust anyone. But he also said there were some who could help me. Damn."

Your quiver of arrows is removed from you as your hands are bound. Suddenly you are afraid you have made a terrible mistake. You lower your head, looking at your feet.
The one who spoke has circled around as is now facing you.

"Why did you react from violent fear? We wish not to harm you." His voice is like a rushing river, powerful and authorative, but in a strange way, refreshing.

You continue to look down, speechless, unsure of why you reacted the way you did.
You feel a light hand on your chin, lifting your head. Your eyes meet the one with the voice of the rivers. His eyes are the purest, cleanest blue and they seem to shine. Beautiful they are, but also terrible and peircing, as if they are looking inside of you.

"You are torn inside yourself," he speaks again. "Did you think we were the Orcs who were raping the trees? With your sharp elvin ears, you would have heard them a mile away. What logic or reasoning told you an enemy was near? That was not your elvin sense, and certainley not good sense."

Your eyes look down in regret. As you look up again, the elves eyes have changed. You can see sympathy and compassion now. He seems to be waiting for you to say something.
13221121222.title: Bound to the Elves (F)

132211212221.content:
You cannot trust these elves. If they are on your side, why are your hands bound behind your back and your weapons stripped?

You spit in the elf's face in defiance. He does not move, but his eyes change. The compassion has left, as he wipes the spit off his face with his sleeve. He sighs and shakes his head in disappointment.
In a moment strong hands are gripping your arms and forcing you to move. You struggle, but bound as you are, cannot free yourself from their strong grips. You trudge along, scouling at your stroke of bad luck, as the elves take you off the path and into the dense forest.
You remember you have the power of nature on your side. She has come to your aid before.
132211212221.title: Bad Attitude (F)

choices: Try a futile attempt at another spell.
ooooo - Kiss him!  He's cute and close!
1322112122211.content:
You mutter an elvin spell under your breath. You are calling to the rocks and the trees.
Nothing happens.

You hear the elf with the voice of the rivers speak, "Your elvin chants will do no good."

He is walking ahead of you, and he stops and turns. His eyes gazing deep into yours he continues, "We also are in harmony with nature. We are the protectors of this forest. You are sorely outnumbered, and any spell you use against us will be of no effect."

Getting inches from your face he speaks again, soft and gentle, "We are NOT your enemy."

You can feel his breath upon your face as he speaks. It is like a cool breeze, yet your face feels hot. The warmth spreads to your neck and down your spine, finally dissapating. You are unacustomed to such strange sensations. Looking into his glassy eyes, you feel almost as if you are hypmotized. A weak feeling comes over you, and you struggle to keep standing.
1322112122211.title: Spells Schmells (F)

13221121222111.content:
In one last attempt, still disbelieving your captors, you try another spell.
You keep your gaze on the elf in front of you as you speak.
"ithna habatchne surumon eventho!"
The trees groan, but do not move. You can hear them speak in your mind.

"We have a strong alliance with the elves here. They protect us and we protect them. We cannot do as you ask."

The elf says nothing to you, only continues his gaze. You look not away, for fear it is a sign of weakness. Yet you are disappointed, and now convinced that your spells have become powerless in this region of the forest, against these woodland elves.
As you force yourself to match the elf's gaze, you feel your eyes heavy. The world begins to blacken, first from the edges, then slowly closing in. Sounds become slow and muffled as you slip from consciousness.
13221121222111.title: Nature's Refusal (F)

choices: Can the bad attitude and join him for breakfast.
132211212221111.content:
Your eyes open to behold the morning sun streaming in through a high window, creating a square yellow shape on the grey stone floor.
You are lying in a small, yet comfortable bed, wrapped in beautiful, warm blankets. The square room is small, but has a small table with a lantern, accompanied by a chair of reasonable comfort. Atop the table rest writing papers and quills, a mirror and a brush.
The door is made of hard, dark wood with steel reinforcements, hanging on the opposite side of the room as the window.
You rise up from the bed, placing your feet on the cold stone floor. Your shoes have been placed beside your bed, and you slip them on. As you stand, you realize your clothing has changed. You are now clothed in a long, flowing garment made of soft and smooth material. You cannot quite place what material it is, but possibly a combination of silk and satin! It is a beautiful gown of light blue and silver, not fancy, but well made, simplistic and elegant. Your hair is down and flowing down your back, reaching nearly to your waist.
You silently walk over to the door, but it is locked firm. The window is very high, and you can see from the size of it, you would not fit through.

Walking to the table, you pick up the mirror. It is the first time you have seen yourself since your transformation. The image reveals a beautiful woman with skin smooth and fair as porcelin, eyes sparkle and shine the color of emeralds, lips that are soft and full. Your eyebrows are distinctive, with arches that speak both wisdom and seduction. You hair is the most shocking transformation, besides the length, it is now a deep auburn, as the color of fall leaves, or in your realm, a copper penny. Streaks of blonde course through, entertwining with the red. You now see your pointed ears for the first time and you smile.

The noise of the releasing lock and opening door jerk your eyes away from the mirror.
You stand before an elf who's beauty and glory surpass the ones you saw before. He is tall with long brown hair. Gold is also in his hair, mingling and mixing in delicate braids. His robe is dark blue and green, accented with gold. He wears a dark green cloak also, fastened with a golden clasp in the form of a maple leaf. His peircing eyes are a beautiful shade of brown and his face radiates both kindness and wisdom.

You hold your breath as he speaks, "I am Mikia, ruler of the elven village of Dora Moore. You are in the dungeons now. I would like it if you were not, but that decision is yours. Will you join me for breakfast?"
132211212221111.title: Reflections (F)

1322112122211111.content:
A good night's sleep has done wonders for you. Your small, but pleasant room does not seem like a dungeon. The ruler himself has made an appearance at your door. Maybe your bad attitude earlier was not a mistake, but you feel it would be at this point in time.

You smile and bow slightly as you reply, "It would be my honor to join you sir."

He returns the smile, "I was hoping that would be your reply. We hate to keep our guest in such unsettling conditions."

"On the contrary, your kindness has been overwhelming sir," you say, trying to be humble.

Mikia opens the door and lets you pass through. He leads you down a narrow corridor, up spiraling stairs, and into a large room. The room is spacious but with only a 9' ceiling. There is a large fireplace as the focal point, with many cushioned chairs scattered about. A large, burgundy rug keeps the floor warm. As Mikia leads you through the room he explains, "This is a gathering room. Often in the evenings we will gather here to sing or tell stories."

"The elves are known for their exceptional poetry and musical ability. I hope I get the chance to experience some of that."

Mikia slowed, walking beside you, "I'm sure you will have that opportunity." He brings you into an airy, bright room. A small dining table is prepared with a variety of fruits, breads and juices.
You sit at the table with Mikia and two elven women, who are introduced as Nymitha, Mikia's wife, and Aerial, Mikia's daughter. They are pleasant and are extraordinary in their beauty.

As you are finishing your meal, Aerial speaks. "Would you like me to show you around the village?"

Seeing your surroundings would be very nice. Aerial might also have some information on why you are here and where you are going.
Mikia, on the other hand, would have more information. Maybe you should ask to speak with him instead.
1322112122211111.title: Breakfast (F)

choices: Hate (for him, or all the elves)
13221121222112.content:
Impulsively, you lean forward, and before you even know what you are doing, your lips meet his. An tingle of electricity runs down your entire body.

He pulls away, looking taken aback. You blush.

"Why did you do that?" he asks. "A minute ago you were spitting in my face."

"Um," you deserately grope for something to say, "I tripped."

"On what?" The ground you are standing on is perfectly smooth.

"Over my own feet. I'm very clumsy, you see..."

You don't think he buys it. Already you are cursing at yourself for being nasty to this elf; why didn't you notice how cute he was?

He leans forward, and for a second your heart beats faster, for you wonder if he is going to kiss you back.

But no. His blue eyes grow hard. "I don't know why you're here, or what you're trying to do, girl. But you'll find that winning my trust - or any of ours, for that matter, after the way you've been behaving - will take far more than a kiss." He spits on the ground, as if to emphasize his point, and walks away.

You are not sure which is worse - the embarassment or the rejection. It doesn't matter. You are feeling both right now, and another more elusive feeling that you can't quite seem to pin down...
13221121222112.title: Kiss the cute elf

1322112122212.content:
You trudge along, silent and bound, with a scowl upon your face. The further you go, the more weary and angry you become.
By the time you reach the village, you cannot even see the beauty for the fire in your eyes.

You are led over a stream, through the village and up stairs that are formed from ancient tree roots. They lead to an immaculate house that has some how been built in and within the trees. The architecture is delicate and reflects incredible creativity. You would be in awe if your attitude was not so bad.

The elf with the voice of rivers leads, as two others holding you guide you inside. The rest of the group remain outside. Inside is dimly lit by many lanterns along the walls. A long red carpet leads up to a large empty seat. You look out of the corner of your eye at a figure approaching. He is soon standing in front of the elf with the voice of the rivers.

The elf bows before the figure in respect, "Father and King."

Raising a hand for the elf to be at ease, he replies, "Who have you brought, my son?"

"She would not speak to me, choosing to spit in my face instead."

The figure approaches you as you see his face clearly now. His face is one of wisdom and strength. Brown eyes shine in the firelight, matching his hair. The firelight illuminates golden strands intermingled with two braids laying atop his thick long hair.

"I am Mikia, King of Dora Moore. I see that you and my son have been acquainted. What is your name, my lady?"
1322112122212.title: Going to see the King (F)

13221121222121.content:
You are in no mood for questions, and you spit in the face of the king.
You expect the king to retaliate in anger, but instead he wipes his face and turns to his son. His son has a faint smirk on his face, his expression relating the familiararity with spit in his face.
The king turns back to you, shaking his head.

"My lady," the king speaks in a voice soft as velvet, "Your stubborness will do you good in battle. Unfortunately, that time has not yet come. This is a place of peace, and we are determined to keep it that way. Perhaps some food and rest will change your views on the elves of Dora Moore."

Looking at the elves holding you, he instructs them, "Take her to Brianna's room."
13221121222121.title: Spit, Spit, Spit!  (F)

132211212222.content:
"I'm very sorry," you manage to stammer out. "It was a human reaction."

"Human?" the elf's eyes glisten.

"Yes," you reply, not willing to give too much information.

You feel your hands released as they fall to your side. You hold eye contact with the elf, awaiting a reaction.
After an uncomfortable silence the elf's eyes change slightly as a barely there grin appears on his fair face.

"You are a chosen one."

"Yes."

"Well you are in good company then," he replies as he extends his hands, taking yours in a custom greeting. "My name is Et'tal, of the house of Mikia. We were merely scanning our borders when we spotted you. My father has a comfortable house and a large table spread. You will find rest with our people. Won't you come with us?"
132211212222.title: The Nice Way (F)

choices: They were greeted by Et'tal's father
They were greeted by someone else
1322112122221.content:
"Yes, I would like to come with you. Thank you" you say, bowing your head in gratitude.

Et'tal smiled in your acceptance. "Good, you will find staying with our people to be enlightening for you and help you" he said cheerfully. "Follow us please" he said.

The rest of the Elven followed Et'tal through the forest. They walked forward as you picked up your bow and walked right behind them.

The walk must've seemed like forever. Even with your elf strength and stamina you weren't used to walking for what seemed like miles. The other Elvan seemed to be very used to it as they showed no signs of tiring. You slowed down a bit to catch you breath. Leaning your hand against a tree you panted for air.

"Huff, huff" you went as your lowered your head while you leaned.

"Are you tired milady" said the same voice she had heard before. Looking up, you had seen Et'tal, his hand extended towards you. You slowly stood straight back up. "Uh no, it just..I've never walked this much before" you said. "All you need is more practice. You are an elvan after all" he said. "Your strength and speed will keep increasing and you'll be able to walk without tiring. Its in your nature" he said.

"Uh, thank you" you said as you pulled yourself together. Soon enough you started walking again. You could feel your strength increasing after that short rest. You were suprisingly able to walk without tiring this time.

Pushing your way past some bushes, you, Et'tal and his group came across a large house. It was wooden but stood sturdily and looked very nice. "It's beautiful" you said. "Yes, thank you milady" Et'tal said. Gesturing you to come with him he said "Now, please come in". You obeyed and followed him as he opened the door and you entered. His group and himself entered afterwards as they closed the door.

Inside...
1322112122221.title: "Yes" - go with them.

choices: Decide to ask about the idea of the Chosen.
1322112122222.content:
You shake your head.

"Your offer is very generous, and I am honored. However, I have been brought here for a reason. I need to travel South to learn more of the conflict that ravages this land."

You look at Et'tal. His clear blue eyes are surprised that you would decline the request to room in the honored elven house of Mikia. You slightly raise your chin and continue to answer his questioning look:

"I may only have a small amount of time. So I need to go and act quickly." You look away as your long brown hair falls over your shoulder.

Et'tal does not speak a word, but he kneels and unties the tight knots of the bindings around your ankles.

"So you were human..." A skinny female elf steps forward from the crowd of elves with now lowered bows. "It shows."

You bend and snatch up your bow from where it had fallen in a patch of long, wispy grass. You then whirl to the impetuous elf. She is one of the few elves with blonde hair and green eyes - much different than Et'tal's brown hair and blue eyes.

The female elf studies you up and down. Her hollow face reeks of judgement, but the elf in her blood makes even her condescencion a little attractive.

"Your troupe may have startled me, but in time, I will be strong enough to help this land." You walk up to the female elf and stare her in the face.

Et'tal steps up, moving you and the female elf apart a little bit. "Please, excuse Shikar," the brown-haired elf says carefully. "The elves, as all races, have their tradition, and the idea of the Chosen is not one of them. The wizards came up with that..."

You realize that even though it was unwise to travel all the way and waste time in some elf noble's home, perhaps you could get some information before departing. Do you merely walk away since the elves are not as friendly as they could be, or do you ask for more information?
1322112122222.title: I Trust My Own Strength

13221121222222.content:
Curiously, you turn to Et'tal. "The wizards came up with the idea of the Chosen?" you ask as you remove Et'tal's lingering hand from your shoulder.

He does not notice the motion but nods to your question. "Yes. As you probably don't know, the four corners of this realm are out of balance. Evil and Good need an equilibrium, and right now we just don't have it..."

You nod, greatful for this key point of information. So as a Chosen one, I need to help restore the forces of Good and Evil to equilibrium.

"Thank you, Et'tal and Shikar. I will be on my way. It looks like I have work to do." You turn and start to head away.

You catch a glimpse of Et'tal's beautiful face surprised with arched eyebrows. As you step away, Shikar scoffs and sticks out her leg. It catches on your left ankle. The nimbleness you so recently does not matter much against those with the same skill.

As your palms hit the soft Earth, anger wells within you. You quickly look up. Et'tal is astonished at your fall. shikar merely has a smirk on her face.

"That's it you dog of an elf! Even if you don't like me because I'm a Chosen, at least you could just leave me alone. Or do you not even care about your beautiful forests?? -So much so that you would impede a girl, snatched from her world and abandoned in a forest without any direction, who merely wants to restore your land to balance with your low insults?!"

Shikar merely laughs and tosses her shining blonde hair over her shoulder. She pulls out a dagger from a brown sheath about her waist. "Want to make something of it, little girl?"
13221121222222.title: A Low Insult

choices: "I think it would be best if I go on alone, I may go where you should not.
"Come with me if you like, but don't get in my way."
132211212222221.content:
With a shrill scream, you lunge at Shikar and punch her squarely in the jaw. Maybe you're not the nimblest of elves, but as a human you weren't helpless either. Shikar topples to the ground and her dagger bounces away into the undergrowth. The other elves of the party begin to move around you in confusion. Et'tal's deep voice lets loose a quick "Oh my God!" as Shikar scrambles up and tries to football tackle you.

You lock hands with her and circle, your muscles screaming as you press forward, trying to push the girl over. But Shikar is a battle-trained elf. She is strong and will not yield. Quickly, you step back and drop on your stomach. The backward motion gets Shikar off-balance so she goes down with you. The blonde-haired elf is totally surprised. That's a novice wrestling move, not an elven tactic.

You grab her shoulders and spin her around, getting her into a full Nelson. Then you squeeze. Shikar struggles and sputters, but it's no use. She has never been in a fight like this where the use of arrows, daggers, and running was not an option.

"Am I just a stupid human now?" you demand. "I may not be so skilled now, but I will be. I am going to do something about this world."

You stand and grab Shikar's neck and toss her toward the forest. With green eyes filled with hatred and a dirt-marred face, she seethes and melts into the forest. You get up.

Et'tal has the most surprised look on his face.

"You - Shikar - How?" he stammers and looks into the woods.

"I'm sorry, Et'tal. I did not mean to be rude, I just don't like being pushed around. You rest your hand on his deltoid and turn to leave. With surprising violence, he whirls you around, and his deep brown eyes stare into yours.

"Let me accompany you on your journey!" He says dramatically.

"Wh-what?!" you stammer, in his grip. "Why?"

He relaxes his hands a little but his hold on you remains. "I, too, wish to do something about the imbalance of the land. Let me go with you and aid you on your journey."

"I..." you start to stay and look into his eyes as you recall all the events that already have occurred.
132211212222221.title: Friend and Foe

choices: Yes; there may be some other useful things I can find.
No, I must be on my way.  I don't want to cause Et'tal more problems if
1322112122222211.content:
"That may not be wise, Et'tal. With my stupidity, I may just be killed. I have no right to take you on a suicide course."

"Please! I could help you!" Et'tal's voice is honest.

"No." you cut him short. "It is not right." You take his hands from your shoulders and put them at his sides. Silently, you walk down the path and leave the troupe of elves behind.

When you are sure they can no longer see you, you exhale deeply and relax. What an event! Et'tal was a kind elf, but Shikar practically hated you! It seems that many are divided - not only with the land imbalanced - but on what to do about it!

You swiftly walk down the path, trying to make the best time. As you walk, you tune more into your heightened senses, seeing the different types of plants and animals on the outskirts of the elven province.

Eventually, night begins to fall. As you walk you spot a large tree with a hollow in its trunk. You approach the tree and murmer an Earth encantation as you pass your hands over the bark. The tree's hollow widens and you slip into its embrace. Quite comfortable and confident that nature will protect you for the night, you try to fall asleep. You slumber soundly until dawn the next morning.

As you rise, you hear a brook telling you of its location with it babbling. As some bright red birds chirp cheerfully, you find your way to the water and wash up a bit. Once done, you continue down the path for the rest of the morning.

About midday you see something uphead. On the left is a carved building of light pink stone. On the third story you see a group of elves talking. It is Et'tal and Shikar! They are with an older elf.. perhaps it is Et'tal's father? They seem to know each other very well. The lord does not see you, but Shikar does, and she sneers.

Quickly, you continue through a small elven town with buildings of wood and stone. You spot an elf in the corner of the market selling a horse. You search through one of the small pouches the wizard left you and discover some coin.

Asking the elf if you have enough to buy the horse, he nods and hands over the reins. Having a horse will definitely speed your travels.

Do you wish to explore the town further?
1322112122222211.title: The Elven Town

choices: Call on the forces of nature.
13221121222222112.content:
Shaking your head, you mount the horse and set off at a brisk pace further south. You ride for hours with only short breaks, using nature's aid for good places to rest and good food to eat.

Once during the journey you think you heard a creature in the woods and you catch the glimpse of a dark shadow. You stop and listen to the woods around you, but you cannot hear anything else and the shadow does not make another appearance. Indeed, the forces of evil run unchecked throughout the elven region.

Later on your journey, you pass other villages but decline to enter. Eventually you come to a large grassy hill - almost a mountain. You slow your horse and begin the tedious walk up the slope. Once you reach its crown, you marvel at the huge expanse before you.

Right in front of you drops a cliff of black marble as sheer as a skyscraper. Down below is a great silver river tossing and turning like a vat of mercury. The liquid extends almost to the horizon. In the distance you can see jutting rough terrain of sandstone.

You realize that to continue south as the wizard said, you have to cross the river, but how to get down to it? The cliff is... quite high...
13221121222222112.title: And on to the River

132211212222221121.content:
You dismount and face the huge river. You're a Chosen, right? You should be able to call upon nature reliably enough to aid you down this extremely... huge... deep... threatening... cliff. Right? I mean, you're an elf for a reason, right?

With a loud, almost pleading cry, you chant an incantation to bring a pillar of water up to your level. The water rises and creates a bridge onto the cliff.

Well here goes nothing... You step onto the water and it holds your weight! Tentatively, you lead the horse onto the magical bridge. Slowly, the water lowers you all the way down the cliff and sets you on the shore.

It is near dark now, and you are quite tired from that huge spell. Should you attempt another spell for the water to carry you across the great river, or should you rest for the night?
132211212222221121.title: A Great Descent

1322112122222211212.content:
Quite tired, you curl up under some beech trees, surprised at how easily sleep comes to you. The spell left you quite exhausted!

During the middle of the night, a noise jolts you awake. It's pitch black, but your elven eyes adjust almost immediately. A bit away, you see a figure with the reins of your horse in its hands. Quickly you fumble for your bow, knock and arrow, and release it. The figure ducks in a very characteristic way - almost as if you had seen the same move somewhere before.

You rise, expecting the dark blotch to flee into the night, but it doesn't. Carefully, another arrow knocked, you approach the figure. As you come closer, you recognize the same black substance you had glimpsed around you when you had been travelling through the forest.

Coming even closer yields more detail. The shadow is not an evil creature, but a cloaked figure! The person moves to lift his/her mask away.
1322112122222211212.title: A Spy in the Night

choices: Wait until the evil thing stops moving.
13221121222222112121.content:
The shadow pulls back its dark hood to reveal the deep brown eyes and tousled brown hair of Et'tal!

"What are you doing here?!" you shout. "I knew I recognized that arrow dodge!"

"I... wanted to help you, and I meant it." his voice is deep as he looks down. "That's why I did not flee. I've been tailing you for a while now."

"Why do you have my horse?" you frown as you point your angled chin at the reins in his hand.

"Your horse had wandered out into the deep woods. There are other creatures out in the night that may not harm you, but may harm your horse."

You frown. "I was very tired after doing a hard spell. I was not thinking..."

"I know. I saw." Et'tal says and flips the reins toward you. "There are few elves who can complete such a spell - you truly are a Chosen."

"Yeah, I guess..." you lead your horse back to the beech trees shimmering in the night and tie the reins to a sturdy branch. You then go back to the bed of leaves and grass you had been sleeping in and lay back down. Et'tal comes over and lay snext to you a little ways off.

Both of you are silent for a while, but eventually you speak. "The one thing that angers me is that I still haven't run into any evil creatures! I thought I was supposed to get this land back into balance, but how am I supposed to defeat evil if there isn't any evil around here?"

"Is that what the wizard told you to do?" Et'tal raised his head and asked.

"Well, I'm one of the people responsible for "resolving this conflict", and if the conflict is an imbalance in the land, that's what I should do, right?"

Et'tal didn't answer.

"Come to think of it, I learned that from you. The wizard said to travel South and then I would learn what I would have to do. I've fulfilled that part of my journey! Where do I go from here?!"

Et'tal was about to respond when there was a noise from the woods. Both Et'tal's and your ears perk up. At last! you think An evil creature to wreak some havok on!

You stand and pull out your bow. You hear a noise to your left and you whirl around, an arrow let loose into the night. But there is nothing there...
13221121222222112121.title: It's You!
