132211212222221121212.content:
You value strength, not stupidity, so you wait. Silently you close your eyes and open your ears to the night. You can hear the rustling of the trees and the water lapping against the sandy shore. You hear the creature flitting around lightly, circling you and Et'tal. The creature stops behind you, then lunges forward.

Now!

You kick behind you, turn, and hit the beast on the head with your bow.

"RAHH!" an elf shouts. You recognize Shikar at once. She shifts her hold on the dagger and swings it at you. Surprised, you jump back and try to dodger her onslaught.

Shikar cuts the string of your bow by chance and pushes you down to the floor. You scramble away as she advances.

"What are you doing?!" You shout at the blonde-haired elf.

"I am killing you, girl." she turns to Et'tal. "Et'tal! I think we've had enough of this Chosen plague, don't you agree? I have watched you tail the girl and now befriend her so that you could figure out the best way to destroy her." Shikar's green eyes flashed as she stares straight at you. "Come, let's end this."

The dagger arcs up in the moonlight. And falls down in slow-motion. Et'tal appears and lunges at Shikar, intercepting the blow. The dagger is buried in his shoulder.

Snapping back to reality, you scramble over to your bow, knock an arrow, and turn at the pair. The dagger is lodged safely within Et'tal.

"Neither of you move." you shout.

Et'tal and Shikar freeze.

"I will bury this arrow in the first one that moves. I don't understand why everyone is against the Chosen, but I will do whatever I need to do to help this land."

"Please," Et'tal sputters, blood on his lips, "I am not plotting for your demise."

"He is. His father himself wants all of the Chosen wiped out." Shikar sneers.

"Is that true, Et'tal?" you demand.

Et'tal looks down, some strands of brown hair mixed with the blood of his shoulder. "Yes, it's true."

"See?!" Shikar shouts.

"But you're wrong, Shikar!" Et'tal leans over to the blonde-haired elf. "What you do not know is that I am a Chosen one too!"

Shikar's eyes widen in surprise. "Liar. You don't believe him, do you? If you kill me, at least kill this liar as well!"
132211212222221121212.title: The Arrow

1322112122222211212121.content:
You let the arrow loose and it buries itself into Shikar. She sputters a croak and falls into the great river and floats downstream. Quickly, you knock another arrow and aim it at Et'tal.

"You have a father, how are you a Chosen?" you demand.

"He is not my father. He... adopted me when he found me abandoned in the central forest. I was... very young - almost 16. I've been with him for seven... years. He thinks that I'm... a hybrid of a dark elf and... a good elf since my magic is so powerful. But I'm a Chosen." Et'tal barely manages to get out as he takes a knee. His long brown hair falls over his face.
1322112122222211212121.title: Truth or Lies?

13221121222222112121211.content:
"Oh! I guess I believe you!" You say as you throw down your bow and run to his side. Gently you remove the dagger from his shoulder, brushing his hair from his face. Calling on Earth magic from the deep, you repair his shoulder and restore his strength.

Shaking his head, Et'tal stands and looks at you, fully restored.

"You know, there's a singular reason why I wanted to help you." he admits, "You were immediately moved to action. You wanted to get on with it and save the province! I was so young that after coming into my father's care, I never really acted. Once you know what you want to do, you just do it."

"Et'tal, you're not a weak person. I remember the zeal you had when you wished to help me. You really do want to do something..."

Et'tal nods again and continues. "On the other side of the great river there is a wizard's tower. Supposedly, this tower is where most of the evil creatures come from. My father has worked hard to eliminate those threats throughout the elven province.

You and Et'tal face the great river and chant a mantra of the Earth. The water rushes up from the sea and carries you and Et'tal into the great expanse.

The task you did not have enough strength for is much easier with two elves.

The water brings you to the flat top of a large black tower. A wizard clad in black robes stands on a pedestal in the center of the rectangle.

"I knew you would come." he says in an old, ragged voice. "Come, let's get this over with. I'm sick of those who wish to destroy the balance of this land."
13221121222222112121211.title: The Black Wizard

choices: Jump in the line of the arrow.
Jump in the line of the spell.
132211212222221121212112.content:
The old black wizard moves the cuffs of his cloak back from his wrists. "I am SICK and TIRED of you stupid elves. So blinded by your goodness that you cannot even see the damage!"

"What are you talking about? It's your evil that is polluting this land!" you accuse the old man.

He lets out a throaty laugh that grates like used sandpaper. Just then a puff of smoke turns into the wizard that originally brought you here. His white cloak shimmers in the moonlight.

"Ah, it is time." says your white wizard. "How do you like the Rivers of Dan this time of year, black wizard? Quite shiny, eh?"

The black wizard grumbles. "I ought to sick some vampyres on you, you bastard!"

"That's quite against the rules." The white-cloaked man answers back. "I got these fighers all the way from neutral ground - perfectly legal. Just because your messengers don't fare as well is no business of mine..."

"Now, you two," the white wizard turns to you and Et'tal, "dispose of this evil pestilence that poisons this land!"

Et'tal knocks an arrow and aims it at the black wizard. The black wizard prepares the spell. Simultaneously, a bolt of energy and the bolt of wood are released.
132211212222221121212112.title: Things aren't always black and white...

choices: Do whatever you will to Et'tal, black wizard.
1322112122222211212121121.content:
"No!" you scream and jump in the path of the arrow. It enters near the base of your spine and juts through your body. Sadly, the bolt of magic hit the bolt just as it was hitting you so you also get fried by the spell.

In immense pain, you fall to the ground.

"No!" Et'tal screams and runs to you.

"What did you do that for?!" the white wizard yells.

"You!..." you sputter, "You are the one!... That has forced... this world... out of.. balance...!"

"Et'tal! The white wizard screams, "Kill the wizard!"

"I will not." the elf's crystal blue eyes shift and move.

"Bah!" the white wizard says, "You have both failed me." Then he disappears.

The black wizard walks up to you. "You are indeed wise, young elf girl."

"Can you heal her?" Et'tal looks at the black wizard hopefully, "For I do not have enough power."

"No, young human in an elf's body. I only have the power to destroy. However, I can give you the power to heal her, but it will cost you."

"I would do almost anything. For she has seen the truth." Et'tal says, looking down at you, unconscious.
1322112122222211212121121.title: Et'tal's Choice

13221121222222112121211211.content:
With a puff of shimmering black smoke, the black wizard pumps dark purple energy into Et'tal's body. Et'tal screams and drops your limp body.

Then, slowly, you begin to feel your limbs again.

You lay still, slowly breathing, your eyes still closed.

"How did you know that the world was unbalanced toward the spectrum of Good?"

Coming to, you answer, "I haven't seen a truly bad creature the entire journey - until meeting the black wizard. And that wizard would hardly have been a match."

A pair of hands prop you up. You open your eyes.

A pair of piercing red eyes stare back at you. Those eyes are framed with long raven hair and an angular face, offset by pointy ears.

"Who are you?" you ask groggily.

"It is only me." Et'tal says in a more demonic voice.

"Gods!" You shout and jump from his hold. "What happened to you?!"

"I made him a dark elf." the black wizard says, "That was the only way to destroy the evil effects good has had on you... Now if you'll excuse me, I have work to do."

"But what about us? What are we supposed to do now?!" you shout at the old black mage.

"Hmm. Good point. Well, the white wizard still runs amok. Would you like to go home or would you like to bring some chaos to the province to balance things out. I can make you a dark elf too, you know..."
13221121222222112121211211.title: Metamorphosis

132211212222221121212112111.content:
You think of your home and all the things you've missed. As if reading your mind, the black wizard speaks. "There will be others to help me." he says, "The balance of good and evil is never toppled - just strained."

With a puff of that signature sparkling black smoke, you are ripped from Et'tal's embrace and thrown into grogginess. There is a ringing growing in your ears.

You reach about you, then jolt upward in bed. Your hand slams down on the incessant alarm clock. All that in a night's dream? Amazing...

That was a beautiful story, you think, and lay back down. It's a shame I couldn't stay there forever though. Missing it already, you roll over and hug a pillow sadly.

There is something strange though... The pillow is warm! You move back some blankets and gasp.

"I may not have recognized you this entire time, but now I definitely know that you are Et'tal!" you say happily.

Et'tal in a human form groggily sits up. "Huh?" he says. "Man, I've had the wierdest dream..."

"Good morning!" you chirp.

"AAHHH!" he screams, his now green eyes focus on you.

"It wasn't a dream!" you hug him. "I wonder where we'll go from here!" you muse.

You turn from Et'tal's visage. He has the same handsome, slightly stocky face, but his features are more pointed now. His glowing cat eyes, half hidden behind strands of raven hair, unnerve you.

"Screw what the white wizard said!" You decide, turning to the wizard, "I will become evil if that is what this world needs."

The black wizard takes a hand aflame with purple energy and buries it in your stomach. You feel as if you are going to die with the agony of the transformation.

Rapidly you change: your clothes change from the greens of the earth to a tight-fitting strappy outfit. Your hair turns raven, and your eyesight changes.

You no longer possess the sixth sense in tune with the Earth. Instead you can feel the dark spirits around you - which are remarkably sparse.

But you proceed, head down, heart filled with immense sorrow. Your emotional experiences have also changed with your identity. Elves experience intense grief and intense joy. It is almost more than you can bear.

"I'm not a warrior," you say outloud to whoever or whatever is listening.

You find your way back to where you left off, and continue down the path, noticing the forest is growing darker. As you walk, the darkness increases, making it difficult to judge whether you are still on your path.

"I was never meant to go to that side of the forest," you try to justify your lack of action.

Your heart is filled with overwhelming grief as you replay the horrible images in your head. You collapse under the immense strain, sobbing uncontrollably. You have denied the very thing that gives you power. You have turned your back without even attemping to find a way to help, and in doing so have rejected yourself. The groans of the trees have turned into screams and the pressure in your head is too great.

Your grief has consumed you, and it is no secret that the Elven can die of it! You lie on the ground in defeat, as the darkness surrounds you, embracing you. Your eyes close, never to open them again.

Meanwhile back in your realm, you peacefully die in your sleep!
Better dreams next time!

Footsteps answer your question-- more than a few, walking together, in what could only be called a haphazard march. From the corner of your infravision, you perceive the moving shapes they belong to. Although you can't see them as perfectly as you might in broad daylight, their grunting, gutteral speech, small stature, and low, sloping foreheads are a dead giveaway: goblins. Maybe six. four of them are leashed to a makeshift wagon small enough to traverse the tunnels, two more are sitting on it, whips in hand, shouting belligerently.

Back at home, you managed a "C-" in Spanish I. Here, a language you've never before heard from a group of creatures you've never before seen is perfectly cognizable.

"Move your arses! This shipment's due yesterday and the master'll have yea's heads if ya don't hop to!" says the master, loosing another stroke of his whip.

One of the goblins yelps and the rest redouble their efforts.

Time for fun.

141212.content:
Where a voice once was in your head, now there is silence. In fact, the entirety of the forest is silent if but for a moment. The noiselessness is unbroken until a strong gust of wind throws you off your feet and onto your back. The wind grows more and more localized, until all of the broken branches and leaves that had earlier levitated are caught up in a thin pillar of circulating air.

Gradually, the pillar takes shape. It is roughly human, at first. (This is with random twigs jutting out making the creatures form random.) As time goes on the figure defines itself. The surface of it's body becomes smooth and its earthy green and brown skin becomes firm and packed. It is a woman, shapely and strangely becoming.

How long you watched her take shape you do not know. It could have been a minute or a day, but viewing her come together seems to give you a... connection to this dark forest spirit. Reaching out a feminine hand, she helps you to her feet. The touch of her hand is coarse, like bark, but pleasurable. Natural.

"Greetings, elf. I thank you for your summons." "Who-" "I am the spirit you called out for. Of all the beings that you could have drug into your plane of existence, you unconsciously chose me. That counts for something, hmm?" All the while the talks to you the spirit is pacing circles around your body, seductively putting her fingertips next to your person, but never touching.

"I'm sure that it does, spirit of the wood. And now that you are here you are to serve me?" Her laugh is like the howling gust from a cave, deep and cold. "That is not the way of things. No... We can conjoin, though. Help each other, that is. You will act as my anchor to this world and in turn I will be your bridge to the spiritual planes. Free access to magics, elf. Through me. Can you deny such power?"

The prospect of an eternal connection to the spirit world is tempting, but potentially dangerous. "What does this imply spirit?" She seems to grow a little angry. "Only that we are each other's catalysts! Now, accept my gift or not, elf!"

1412212.content:
You look down upon the female and laugh gleefully at your prize. "what is your name girl?" you ask her in a rich tenor. She looks at you in awe now, after hearing your voice. You cock your head to the side wondering why she stares at you so. Without thinking you mentally voice your thoughts. She gapes even wider now, looking like a fish freshly caught. "I was taught that dark elves can only speak the tongue of the dead...." "Well who taught you that?" you ask. "It is taught to all our young."She quickly replies. "It is true we know the tongue of the dead, but we know many other tongues than that." "Us dark elves know many other things you OTHERS will never know unless you decide to turn."
You apply a gentle push against her mind, telling her that it would be good to turn, and that she would be wise to follow you in your journey. Your mind nags at you though, Why was she out in the forest alone? Was she spying? Why do I feel this urgency to turn her to dark elf? Do I even know how? All these questions plague your thoughts like the worms in the corpses standing a few feet away from you. You summon your power, and bid them rest again. They lie down where they are, the ground opening, accepting them in its embrace, and then flowing back over them without so much as a bare spot to show what the ground conceals under the surface. So many choices, and no map to show where they may lead.
1412212.title: The dark side beckons.

You nod to once of the undead warriors and he grabs the girl and lifts her off the ground and onto her knees. "Tie her up, we wouldn't want her getting away." You say. The undead warrior does what he is told and ties her hands together. "Now, you have one more chance...Why were you following me?" You say putting a bit more pressure on her mind. "Ne-never!" She hesitates. "Fine..." You say. You notch an arrow onto your bow and point it to her chest. You prepare to let go when she yells at the top of her lungs. "Wait! You got me...I'll tell you why I was spying on you..." She says with guilt in her eyes. "Now that's a good little elf." You say with an evil smile. You put your weapons away and sit on the ground in front of her. "Let her go, but stay by just in case she tries to escape..." You say to an undead warrior. "Yes sir." 141222.content:
The dead warrior is tall and large. His features are very distinct, yet you can't quite make out his face. But he's at your command, and that is the important thing.

"Follow me," you say to him, "And be ready for anything."

As you walk, more and more dead warriors rise up from the ground and follow you, none of them questioning your commands. In moments there is a great army of dead warriors behind you, but they are making quite a noise marching in unison.

You command them to stop with the raising of your hand. They halt immediately, and in the silence you listen. You can hear what sounds like hunters in the distance, but you know they are no threat to you and your army. From the sounds of it, there's not too many.
141222.title: the following (M)

1412221.content:
You turn to your dead army.

"It is time to fight. But this is not a fight for an army."

Immediately the dead warriors shrink back into the ground, except for 3. They are the strongest and most fierce warriors, and they stand in allegiance to you.

They follow you quietly closer to the voices you heard. You can see them now - there are 5 of them. They are quiet, but your ears are so sensitive, you can hear every move they make. They seem to have no idea you are there.
Upon closer inspection, they don't seem to be hunters as you previously thought. One is a wizard, and the other 4 are the elves that live in this forest. These elves are known for their powers and cunning ways. The wizard is white - the most powerful level. You recognize the wizard as the one who transformed you earlier!



How do you proceed?
1412221.title: hunting (M)

14122211.content:
You call upon three more warriors and tell them to prepare to attack.
You all wait in the trees, and prepare to ambush the band of people. As they walk past, you cry "attack!" and all seven of you jump from the trees.
Two of the elves are killed in the struggle, but the wizard easily banish's the dead warriors. He then turns to you, his staff raised.
"I herefore withdraw all power from you" he cries "and as you have abused it, the mission is no longer yours!"
And with that, he brings his staff down. There is a flash of light, and you wake up back in your bed.
Was it a dream? Was it for real? Who knows? Whatever it was, you are no longer part of it...
14122211.title: Ambush

14122212.content:
Only a fool would attack a white mage, even from ambush. Besides it would take an epic level of idiocy to move forward without gathering more information. Your enhanced eyes scan the area leading to the small clearing in the forest ahead. Quickly you pick out a suitable route and as an after thought you beckon your three cronies to remain behind. This was a mission of raw stealth and while your soft padded boots were more then up to the task, it was doubtful your skeletonal servants could maintain the stealth needed.

Almost holding your breath in anticipation you draw closer aware that every second you delay a piece of potentially valuable conversation is taking place.

After traversing through the shadows of tall trees, and skirting the opening in foliage, you find yourself in range, half concealed by a hollowed out tree smelling of damp earth. Ears twitching to catch the faintest sound you listen.

"...great one?" One of the figures murmurs with deep respect. Unfortunately do to your position the figures who were formally so clear in the distance are now little more then bodiless voices, reaching your senses in whispers.

"All in good time Daviil, peace will not be bought at the price of your people's lives, you have my guarantee. As we speak I have set in motion a catalyst that has within his power the ability to change the situation."

"A plague is a catalyst that has in its power the ability to change the situation, and yet I would not call that change for the better. Surely we can do more then wait for this savior to lay waste to the land."

"I agree, the goblins and our dark brethren have increased their patrols throughout the forest. We hear rumors everyday about..." Suddenly the new voice is quite. "We are being overheard."

Your blood freezes. In your current guise the five eleves might seize the initiative and attack immediately should they discover your position. Frantically your mind works over your options and just as suddenly a cool calm pervades your thoughts. You are a dark elf, not to mention the elite body guard you hold in reserve. Besides it might not even come to fighting, after all you are the catalyst the old man had sent into motion...aren't you?
14122212.title: A little bit of recon...

choices: Turn to a life of evil with your army of the dead.
141222121.content:
You stay where you are. They are your friends...aren't they?

They move closer and closer to your hiding place. They reach you.

"You!" Shouts the wizard. "your duty was not to listen in on MY private conversations!"

"but..." you start.

"No buts" says the wizard. "attack!" he yells to the elves. "He can not know what he has heard! Who knows how long he has been there!"

Immediatly, the elves advance on you.
"SRAKIHAMSU!" you yell, speaking the emergancy way of summoning the dead warriors. Dead bodies begin to rise out of the ground. They advance on the band of elves and the wizard.
There is a large fight, in which many of your dead warriors are banish'd by the wizards mighty power. However, the number of your army is too great for their small group. You over power them with ease.


Since the very person who set your mission is now dead, there doesn't seem much point in continuing.
However, it may be usefull...



What will you do?
141222121.title: Fight

choices: Onward to the Valley of Zar!
1412221211.content:
It had been a hard bought, and as the white one lets out a fiendish scream dropping dead to the ground at your feet, you feel like following him. Countless small wounds decorate your body. On one side you feel the raw terror that people in your previous society have been conditioned to feel when covered in blood and weak from the loss of it.

A darker legacy breathes through you though, while frightening it beckons with the promise of power and comfort. As before with the summoning of undead, words flow from your parched lips and a dead green aura surrounds your body briefly before focusing on your hand.

Looking at the ebony of your slender appendage, starkly outlined by the malignant energy you frown in confusion. Then in a rush you understand and stumble wearily over to the bodies of one of the elves. Yes, Yes! Breath still flowed through his frail body, even more bloodied then your own. Glazed eyes staring straight ahead had given you the impression of death but this close your supreme hearing picked up his last wheezes.

Thrusting your hand down you immerse your energy clad hand into the elf's chest. A low whine forms in the back of his throat. With an ease that surprises you, guided by the dark whispers you locate his heart and begin to drink deeply of his fading life force. Its not that much, merely a spark but its enough to put you into serviceable condition. Besides you could do it again should the need arise.

Finished you look down at your handiwork and then step back in horror. The elf's features are contorted horribly his body rigid with pain. It is as if several days have passed on the corpse and none of them pleasant. You can barely comprehend the evil that you have wrought on this once living creature. Abruptly the dark whisperings stop leaving you alone to confront your own deeds.

How could you stop this, how could you return home. This was not meant to be! Wait...

Your eyes turn to the fallen white robes of the wizard, not half so powerful as you had thought him to be. You walk carefully over to his corpse and remember. "The valley of Zar", you whisper slowly to yourself. That was where he wanted you to go. Maybe you would find your answers there. Or maybe you would find them by resurrecting the corpse....

The voice was back murmuring its approval but would the price be worth it? Already it had shown itself to be a powerful ally. Without its aid you would surely have succumb to the mage's power. Was it worth your humanity?

Immediatley your wish is granted and the wizard says, "Be cautious on your journey. This forest holds powers unknown to you. You have been lightly equipped in your transformation, and before you reach the edge of the forest will have opportunities to increase your skills and gain weapons. Beware of the one called Centurin, for his power is great and he seeks to destroy you."

"Before you go great wizard, I implore you, please tell me more of my mission."

"Alright, but quickly," he says as he draws closer to you.
Continuing in a low voice he shares some more information.
"A great conflict is brewing between the forces of good, which are to the North and South and the forces of evil which are to the East and West. This forest has always been considered neutral ground, and for this moment still is. But soon it will be a bloody battleground."
The wizard pauses with a sorrowful look in his eye, as if he is seeing the future.
"You have been brought here alone and in secret, chosen because of your exceptional abilities - your sharp mind, able body, and strong personality. The fate of the forest and this realm will rest in your hands, and the hands of others just like yourself, who have also been chosen."

"What is causing the conflict?" you ask, still confused.

"I don't have time to go into this now. You will learn as you travel. Be careful who you befriend in this forest. Some can give you invaluable insight and help, and others live only to decieve and destroy you," the wizard informs.

The wizard turns himself into fire and vanishes, leaving you alone in the forest.
You can hear his voice in the wind saying, "You need to journey to the Valley of Zar, far to the East. There you will gain perfection in your new craft and complete direction and understanding."

1421.content:
You are alone now. You look down and notice you are wearing Elven clothing, in the colors of the shadows and marshes. You wear a pack of arrows on your back, and a bow is in your hand.
Your pointed ears are picking up deep dark sounds that you have not yet identified, but that tremble inside of you in a powerful communion.
Your eyesight has improved tremendiously and you are now able to see far distances with great clarity. Your periferal vision has also improved, making a falling leaf a distraction.
You can smell things you could not before, picking out specific scents in the air.
But the 6th sense is what attracts your attention the most. You can feel a darkness in your soul, full of power. You can feel the presence of the spirits of this realm, and as you breathe in the damp dark air, you breathe in their power also.

Your keen sense of direction gets you started off to the East. The forest is dense and the path is unclear. Many vines hang down from the ancient trees, and many roots lie across your path. Something ahead catches your eye and you focus in on it, trying to determine what it is.
Suddenly you are thrust down! Quicksand!
You are sinking fast and grasp for tree roots or vines to pull you out.
You manage to grab a strong root to keep yourself from sinking further.
Suddenly a strange creature jumps down from a tree to the edge of the quicksand. He smells of dirt and has the eyes of a cat.
He does not look trustworthy, but he offers you his hand.

"Yes? What do you want?"

" I want to thank you and ask what and who are you?"

He thinks on it for a minute and gets an evil gleam in his eye. "How rude, I am the swamp lord, ruler of these lands and I could destroy you in an instant if I wished!"

" I don't believe you!"

"You insolent elf! I saved you out of kindness, I could've let you die for I am the swamp lord!"

" I thank you for saving me but I highly doubt you are a 'swamp lord'."

" I shall destroy you if you do not bow to your lord, you being a dark elf and all! Bow to your lord and master!"

You decide not to risk it and bow to him. He grins hugely and puffs himself up. You decide also, to offer your services to the swamp lord. At this he grins wider and accepts.

"Now, slave, follow behind me and we shall walk around, searching for food."

You nod to him and wait for him to lead the way. As you walk you hear a sound, the swamp king doesn't notice. All at once an elf jumps from a tree to the ground in front of you. The swamp king is startled and half yells, half stutters to you to attack this guy elf. You unfortunately don't know anything about fighting really but try to do your best. You quickly step in front of him ready to attack this elf.

"Hey, why are you obeying...that?" The elf asks in disgust.

"He is the swamp king. I have offered him my services."

The elf takes a moment and then laughs. "THAT, the swamp king? Haha! This pathetic stuttering lump is no more than a swamp devil!"

"What is a swamp devil?"

"A trickster. The thing at this moment you are trying to protect."

I jump away from it. This elf confirmed my earlier suspicions. The elf gives me a look of approval as he aims his bow at the swamp devil's heart and kills him. The swamp devil shreeks as he collapses onto the ground. I now turn my attention to this elf. He is quite handsome, in a dark rouge sort of way. His black hair, medium build, and muscular body make him this way. Then I notice his dark aura, which I also happen to have.

"Oh, pardon me, I am Belsheath, and you are?"

"Just where are you headed, good lady," the figure asks in a deep, airy voice. You hesitate for a moment.

"The Valley of Zar," you say in a cautious voice, suspicious of his intentions.

"A lady such as yourself could not possibly make it to such a far away place such as that by herself. Please allow me to lead you there, good lady, and leave the thinking to a man," he offers, a wicked smile appearing from under the hood. You watch him suspiciously, then make your decision.

You grab the creature's hand, who looks like he could blend in with vegetable roots from the coloring of his skin. He's no gem to look at, but he's strong and pulls you out of the sand.

You try to remove the muck that is now covering most of you, keeping one eye on the creature who
waits silently, as if expecting something.

As you get closer to him, you feel the spirits of the forest getting stronger and stronger.

"This is not a time to doubt what you have never seen. You must believe in those unheard of, seen unseen, good and evil."

He just starts to walk toward
1421211.title: To Ghost River

Spirit weaver leads you forward. Slowly fog surrounds you, almost to the point where you cannot see. Soon, you are by the swamp staring into the depths. His essence draws you closer. Spiritweaver held up a hand as if to signal that there would be a truce. You see the root-like fingers that pulled you from the quicksand have become rotten and darkened, the essence sapped out of them.

"I apologize for the deception." He spoke in a sad voice. Even his green eyes looked like they were draining of life by the moment. "I used a lot of my strength to rescue you because you are crucial, despite your grand inexperience and ignorance." The fog in the swamp was becoming thicker. The smells of the thick smelly bog were even more intense to you with your enhanced senses.

There was also something about this place that scared yet filled you with an alertness. Hundreds, or maybe it was thousands, of eyes blinked all around and their loud chirps and growls became louder. Spiritweaver reached into the murky waters and for a second, you thought you were about to be betrayed. Instead, he pulled up a dagger that looked like it was thousands of years ago. The blackened blade flashed dangerous as he handed you the weapon by the hilt.

"Be quick about it, young one. A sacrifice is needed for you to proceed." He looked at peace but his voice was urgent. Did he really expect you to...?

choices: ditch the bow and get a sword

"I doubt you would beleive me if I told you the truth..." you say, but trail off, trying to decide what to say next. the leader cocks an eyeborw. "Try me..." he says in a much more interested tone. "Well..." you begin nervously, "I used to be a human, but some old wizard in a white robe brought me to that dark forest just west of here and transformed me into this..." you gesture to yourself to emphisise your point. "A wizard in white 'transformed you' you say?" he asks in an almost mocking tone. you nod in reply. prayng silently that they don't figure out to what degree you were transformed. one of the other wood elves begins to laugh, bringing your attention to her. she was blindfolded with red streaks going down her cheeks. 'is that face paint or -gulp- blood?' you think, getting even more nervous. the leader speaks again now with a big grin on his face. "what's the verdict, Liara?" the blindfolded woman smiles, "she speaks the truth...heh, her predicament is an interesting one indeed. Heh heh..." you look at her in confusion. her smile becomes a large grin. "I'm a seeress dear, I can hear your thoughts." Your face goes bright red causing the others to laugh. "bring her to the city, she is one of the seven chosen of the prophecy!" the group of wood elves bring you into a collosal city reminescent of medievil london or paris you pass by a weapon shop and you stray from the group to look. the one of them, fortunately, fallows you. this place has swords, axes, all kinds of stuff
142121122121.title: confessions of a human boy turned elvan girl

1421211221211.content:
The elf watches you debate between getting a sword or keeping your bow with a smirk. You try to ignore him. Finally, you grip your bow and arrow. This is your skill. You do not know how to use a sword. Plus, you can kill long-distance with the beauty in your hands. The elf nods, respecting your decision, and walking continues. "Where are you taking me?" you eventually ask the friendly elf who followed you to the weapon store. "The castle. Hey, you're mighty lucky you told the truth. Otherwise, you'd be dead in a second, cuz Liara would know you were lying." You feel strange as you listen to him talk. You like his voice. "Speereh, hand me my ax," Liara calls to Speereh. You now notice he is carrying an ax and a sword, which must be his. You wonder why he is the one carrying Liara's weapon. But before you have chance to ask, he's standing by Liara, handing her her weapon, and asking, "Why? What's the matter? What do you see?" "Orcs. A pack of orcs are headed our way. But... They're unarmed." "Into an Elven city? How strange." "Yes. Should we try and talk to them, or prepare to attack?" "I say we do both," said Speereh. You shake your head. "Orcs are cowardly. They won't talk to us if we all have our weapons out." Liara cocks and eyebrow and smirks. "I am impressed by your knowledge." Then she addresses the group. "Let's take a vote. What do you think we should do?" After counting the hands, Liara realizes they have a tie. "She didn't vote," Speereh says, pointing to you. "Well, girl, I guess it's up to you," says Liara, looking at you.

What do you say?
1421211221211.title: keep your bow

choices: Tell the elves to hurry and get the ambush spot to face the orc party.
Change your mind and say you wish to stay behind so you can raid their homes.
14212112212112.content:
"I say we hide our weapons, and speak with them first. Don't attack unless they attack first or make a move against us."
Pausing after saying this you tighten your hand on the shaft of your bow as you think of something to say. "Also..." you cast an uncertain look at the other elves, then after taking a deep breath you continue. "We should keep a reserve of elves just in case the orcs do attack, preferably archers."

Giving you a look of respect Liara nods, a smile creeping up on her face. "Spoken like a warrior, and strategist," she says in a serious tone. She seems pleased with your reply.

Returning her smile with a grim one of your own you slowly hang your bow up on a rack nearby. "I want to be with the main party," you state, raising an eyebrow at the elven group. Quick grins flash around the circle of the stranger elves, white teeth glowing as they agree with your decision. "Brave," says a tall elf, his voice sounding as old as time itself and having a certain dignity. "Take one of the the lighter swords, a dirk, and come with us."

Holding out his hand you spy a long and slim dagger sitting in the palm of his hand. It glows faintly in the light, silver blue metal carved with strange designs. The hilt is black leather, wrapped around and slightly worn from use.

"Thank you," you murmur, awe filling your voice as you grip the handle of the dirk carefully, even reverently, and hold it in front of you.
14212112212112.title: "Let's prepare for attack!"

choices: Forcibly resist and try to escape as soon as you can.
Allow them to bind and lead you, and attempt to talk your way out.
142121122122.content:
The leader smiles nastily, the cruel grin marring his fair face.
"Just as I thought." He rises and turns to his comrades. "We have captured one of theirs. She confirms the rumor that Lord Theorn seeks to declare war on us."
They mutter among themselves. One turns to his leader. "What do we do with her?"
"We'll take her to the palace. I'm sure she has more information to share."
You try to feel their minds, but they have somehow placed barriers around their emotions and intentions. These elves, you suddenly realize, are much stronger and more experienced with their powers than you are, or will be for a while. You know absolutely nothing about them. They could be good elves corrupted by evil, even vile wizards masquerading as good elves. All you know is you probably don't want to end up in their dungeons.
You could try to fight them and make a break for it now, with the risk of them overpowering you. Or you could come quietly and try to talk your way out of your predicament.
142121122122.title: Escape?

142122.content:
You decide this little creature might be of use to you. Your long raven black hair falls in front of your face, hiding the evil glint in your eye.

"Thank you my friend for helping me," you say, as you bow slightly. "I am forever in your debt," you lie.

The creature looks at you, tilting his head to one side, his eyes squinting in what appears to be distrust. He does not speak but begins to pull back, almost like he can read your intentions.

You reach to your side, where a whip is hanging. You did not even notice it there before, coiled up like a snake ready to strike. You pull the whip out as the creature starts to turn to run. The black snake strikes, curling around it's victim like a boa constrictor, and pulling the wretched thing towards you.

"Let me go!" he screams pathetically. "Release me!"

An evil grin spreads across your narrow face as you realize the control you have over this ugly little creature. You leave him bound in your whip as you pull some strong, yet flexible, vines that are draped from the trees. You replace the whip with the vines, making a leash for the whimpering creature.
The creature scowls and howls in anguish, even though you are not physically hurting him. He is making a point to be as loud as possible, and you wonder what ears might be listening.
142122.title: Binding Up the Creature (F)

choices: Release the creature, in return for your wish
Try to capture the father as well
1421221.content:
You decide to let him howl. Who could possibly over-power your new great strengths?

To your dismay, something approaches. You violently whip around letting the intruder know you feel his presence. Although behind you, the creature lets out a whimpering sigh of relief.

A hideous Goblin approaches and announces his name is Panalia. He has come for his son.

"I will grant you one wish, if you will release him".
1421221.title: The Mysterious Intruder (F)

choices: Try to hit it away with the whip
Try to move out the way
14212211.content:
You think it over, and look back at the wiggling fool you have trapped. Smiling evily you turn back to the goblin.

"I except your offer, goblin." As you fling his son back at him. The boy tumbles and falls on the goblin. The goblin yells at him to get off. The creature obeys and stands up. You feel something is not right here. You hide your whip behind your back, you may need it.

"Well, what do you wish for my dear?" said the goblin.
Your eyes narrow as you feel the presence of dark magic and another. That is when you notice a black arrow coming towards your neck.
14212211.title: Wishes (F)

142122111.content:
SNAP! With your elvin sight and speed your whip's tail end flies through the air and snaps the arrow in half. The pieces fall to the ground and turn into a blue flame. You approach the fallen pieces as they dissappear.

Panalia and his son stand there in disbeleif. You listen for sound keeping your mind open. You hear someone approaching.

"Show yourself!" you shout into the dark.

"Well, done" say man's voice. "Well done, indeed."
A figure appears from the brush. The figure is dressed in dark flowing robes and wearing a white mask hiding his face.

"Panalia, I see you caught Akalam. Good job, as well as a very pretty dark elf." says the figure. Panalia approaches the man.

"Yes master Zarcu, the dark elf had caught the cat demon, and I was just offering her payment," said the goblin.
As they talk, you look for a way out. Focusing your 6th sense you notice that there are others in the brushes, but you are not worried you already have a plan. As you feel the dark forces of nature around, waiting for your orders.

Zarcu looks over at you. You stare coldly at him waiting for his move. His gaze goes to cat demon Akalam. Akalam's eyes narrow and growls at the robed man. Zarcu seems unaffected by the cats noise making.

"Indeed, and Panalia..." Zarcu turn his look back to Panalia, "...what did you offer the lady?"

The goblin laughed "A wish, my master, but in reality it would be same fate as Akalam."

"Is that right Panalia? Is that what the collar arrow was for? To make her one of your mindless slaves?"
When you hear word slave your rage is overwhelming. You call forth your dark powers and the quicksand that once held you, loomed up above the goblin. The goblin screamed in shear terror as the sand surrounds him, encasing him, killing him.

"No one enslaves me!" You yell at the now dead Panalia. You hear clapping and turn to Zarcu.

"Very good, M'lady, very good indeed. Your power is strong and I could use someone like you. Will you join me?"
142122111.title: A Figure (F)

1421221111.content:
You approach Zarcu.
"Before i join...i need to know.
Will i be joining you as a apprentice...or a partner?"

Zarcu smiled.
"As a partner..of course.
With your powers and mine...we can force anybody to kneel before us.
The entire world will learn to fear us!"

You smile at the thought.
"When do we start?"
Zarcu smiles evilly.

"We can start right now.
We can either start in the south.
Taking over the elven towns and cities.

OR....

We can head to the east.
Humans are weak.
Taking over their land will be easy!"

You look at Zarcu.
"My powers are not yet under control.
I need training."
He places his hand on your shoulder.
"I have many years of using dark magic.
I will tech you all that you will need to know."
1421221111.title: unholy union

14212211111.content:
A evil smile crosses your face.
Thinking about all the possibilities fills your head with malice and thoughts of death.
You face Zarcu.

"We should start in the human encampments.
We only have ourselves...and the elves are stronger and more clever than most.
If we can take the human villages and cities...we can stock up on slaves and solders, supplies, and anything else we need."

Zarcu smiles.
"Clever and powerful...we shall make a powerful pair..you and I.
Very well...we have many options on where to strike first.

A little south of here is a multitude of small villages and farms.
We could go there.
Start our reign of fear and terror.

OR...

We hit the closest major city....Veratiz.
It is the third largest human city.
Might be difficult with just the two of us....but we would surely emerge victorious."

Zarcu stares at you...bloodlust ravages his facial features.
He is hungering for the chaos that is to come.
"So...partner...
Where to first?"
14212211111.title: smart decisions first

1421221112.content:
"Filth," you spit. "Moments ago you were about to enslave me. I have no need of an alliance as you do."

Zarcu's eyes narrow. "You choose wrongly, elf."

He screams a command in a strange toungue, and a mob of dull-eyed creatures rustles out of hiding. They are moving toward YOU!

As the creatures advance, you realize the number of them. They come from all directions, from the trees, the bushes, cracks in the ground. So many there are, they seem to rain from the sky.
All paths are blocked and there is nowhere to run. You are surrounded.

"Why don't you change your mind now, my dark princess?"

You consider the choice before you. You are both of the darkness. If you join him your powers combined could be an unstopable force.
But can you trust him? Maybe he's only out for blood - yours.
1421221112.title: Refusal

14212211122.content:
As the creatures move closer to you, you draw your bow and arm it with two arrows. Quickly you realease the arrows in the direction of the cat creature Akalam. The arrows fly towards the shocked creature and stike true in the vines that bound him.
         Immediatly he is freed and he nods at you in appreciation.
You sense a creature creeping up behind you. Drawing another bow from you quiver, you thrust it backwards into the creature behind you, drawing it out to let it gly at another enemy.
         As you do this you notice that Akalam had began jumping against the tree's and attacking creature after creature with his claws outstreched. You watch as the creature kills every creature in sight, one after another.
         to say the least, you are dumbfounded. You sense two more creatures in the trees above you, and immediatly fire two arrows in quick succesion in their direction. You turn around quickly, without checking if your aim was true, and lash out the whip at three more advancing creatures, who all fall with one mighty crack of the whip.
         You and the creature, Akalam, are now alone. You turn to the creature to see it advancing quickly at you.
14212211122.title: Friend or Foe?

142122111222.content:
You stand there waiting to see what Akalam will do. His claws extend and he picks up more speed. You stand there, not fearful of his next action, but curious. He reaches you and jumps over you. You stand motionless, listening as his claws hit flesh. You turn to notice that the last one of the creatures you were fighting wasn't killed, but only unconscious, and ready to kill you.

Akalam finishes the kill and turns back to you. He stares at you oddly, unsure of what to make of you. He walks back to you and places a single claw on your cheek. You grab his paw and apply pressure on it. You look stright into his eyes.

"Don't... " you command. "I don't want to fight you."

"Then what do you want from me? First you want to capture me, then you let me go? What is that you want? Do wish to be friend or my enemy?"

You think to yourself .... What do I want?
142122111222.title: Friend or Fiend

1421221112221.content:
Alakam waits for your words....

You grin, and laugh at yourself for thinking this way, but a friend is better then enemy right now.

"I wish for your friendship, but I have werid way of showing it, no?"

The cat looks at you in disbeilf, and turns around.

"I don't believe you, but you saved me.... so I'll leave you alone. Good bye miss drow..."

Then he runs back into the forest, leaving you alone.
1421221112221.title: Friendship? Maybe not....Then Again

1421221112222.content:
A smile washes over your face. You know what you truely want. You want him dead. However he has you in a bad postion to kill him and you have to play the innocent drow game for now.

"I want your friendship," You smile.

He looks at you in disbelif and starts to walk away. Seeing your chance, you pull out your whip and wrap it around him. He is stunned and falls to the ground. You contuine to whip, watching as the blood pours out of his wounds.
You hear a faint voice, a dark power telling you to kill him. You feel your self calling dark spirts, as four black shadows emerge out nowhere. They look like transparent wolves with glowing red eyes. Their faces turn to you waiting for your orders. You smile evily, but as you give the call, another voice steps in, something you thought was gone....

Your human mind yells 'Don't!' and you stop for brief moment...
1421221112222.title: DIE!

choices: Ignore them and continue on your way
Go with them to their village
142122112.content:
You dive out of the way, and fall with a loud thud to the ground.
"Stupid fool!", you curse at the goblin, "I will make you pay for that."
Surprisingly, the goblin and his son do not seem afraid of you. You glare at them and suddenly you see your soul reflected in you eyes. The future is suddenly in front of you.
"We have been sent here to tell you not to go to the Valley of Zar", they jointly say.
You are unsure of what to do. They have tried to trick you before.
"We need your help in our village. "An arrogant beast is threatening to take away our homes if you do not pay him what he says to pay him." Please come with us."
142122112.title: The Future

choices: You call the Spirit of the Dead Branches.
You call the Spirit of the Dead Warriors.
1422.content:
You are alone now. You look down and notice you are wearing Elven clothing, in the colors of the shadows and marshes. You wear a pack of arrows on your back, and a bow is in your hand.
Your pointed ears are picking up deep dark sounds that you have not yet identified, but that tremble inside of you in a powerful communion.
Your eyesight has improved tremendiously and you are now able to see far distances with great clarity. Your periferal vision has also improved, making a falling leaf a distraction.
You can smell things you could not before, picking out specific scents in the air.
But the 6th sense is what attracts your attention the most. You can feel a darkness in your soul, full of power. You can feel the presence of the spirits of this realm, and as you breathe in the damp dark air, you breathe in their power also.

You decide you want to test the power that has been given you. You desire a guide to direct you in the path you've chosen.
1422.title: Calling Spirits (F)

14221.content:
One of the spirits you feel hovers just at the edge of your enhanced vision. Like a shadow cast by moonlight, it seems poised on the razor thin border between life and death. To your own surprise, you realize the border no longer restrains you. Life and death have become mere reflections of one another, and each is well within your grasp. Reaching across that border, you take the hand of the hovering spirit and bring it into the world of the living.

Dark as night, a woman about your own age stands before you. The blue in her eyes is so dark the color fades into the pupils instead of surrounding them. Curling waves of blue-black hair float around her face and roll down her back like smoke. Beneath a strong aquiline nose, her black lips are barely two shades darker than her ebony skin. Smiling, she reaches up a dark hand to slip her smoky locks aside and reveal one pointed ear. Her gown is woven from leaves of elm and oak black with winter decay. Most noticeable of all, you can feel a power pulsing in her that is incalculably greater than your own.

“Thank-you for calling me,” she whispers. Her voice is clear as a loon diving in the stillness of a morning bog. “How may I serve you?”

Despite the Wizard’s gift of skills and senses, a moment of confusion flows through you. It seems unreal to expect such a creature to serve willingly. Suspicion blooms in your mind.

“Who are you?”

Another smile, this one hinting at knowledge you can only dream of possessing. “I am Fantoccina. I was once a dryad. Now I am something more.”

“Fantoccina?” The name is familiar, but you cannot recall where you might have heard it.

“Yes.”

“Well then, Fantoccina, I am new and I need to learn how to master my abilities. Can you teach me?”

“I can teach you nothing. However, I can help you by summoning others like me. Among my allies are the warriors of Lugal, the witches of Ningirsil, the wizards of Dumuzi, and the spies of Dagan. The warriors are all masters of their trade and will gladly fight to the death, but those who survive will demand a night of pillage and plunder for each day of fighting. The witches will brew potions or mix powders that create sickness, spread disease, and even kill, but for each powder or potion they will require a payment of one young human male. The wizards will create earthquakes, raise fog, collapse walls of earth or stone, and generate firestorms large enough to engulf a city, but for each act of destruction they will require a payment of one young human female. Every time you summon me, I gain the right to summon you. When I call, you will give me the strength of your sword, the flight of your arrow, or the power of your magic and you will direct it as I command. Everything has a price, and every price must be paid.”

Fear rising from your belly makes you swallow convulsively. Your heart seems determined to pound its way through your breastbone. Fantocinna can bring you awesome power, but at a terrible price. “So have you now gained the right to summon me?”

“Oh yes, but only once. When I call, you will serve me as I command, and I will pay the price you require. Save this: I cannot and will not grant you the power of love. If you ask, your life will be forfeit. If you wanted love, you should never have forsaken the light.”

Something tickles at the back of your mind. Fantocinna is looking straight into your eyes, expectation and even eagerness both plain in the tension of her jaw, the tilt of her head, and the way her upper body drifts toward you. Danger, palpable as the strength of the surrounding shadows, hangs in the air between you.

“I agree. I have no need for love, only power.”

Satisfaction rolls over her in waves. Her smile is the casual cruelty of a hunter cleaning their kill. With one razor sharp fingernail, she cuts a deep wound through the center of her right palm and holds out her bleeding hand. Taking an arrow from your quiver and drawing the sharp steel head across your own palm produces a matching wound. Your heart pounds in fear and what little is left of your natural mind screams in defiance, but you stretch out your hand and the palms touch.

Blue sheet lightning flashes around the two of you. Pain like a million blades of white hot steel slices through your entire body. Inside, the complete knowledge of how to use the darkest magic, how to fight with any kind of bladed weapon, how to aim an arrow that never misses, how to stalk and destroy an enemy without their ever knowing you are there, and how to travel from shadow to shadow without ever stepping into the light, are all seared into your mind. If you had a human past, it is gone from your memory.

Fantoccina smiles an icy welcome. You have found your first ally, but you will never again have a friend.

“Once you were human,” she says, “now you are something more. Every dark elf must have a name. What will be yours?”
14221.title: Everything Has A Price (F)

choices: "Take me to the great dark Wizards."
142211.content:
You take a deep breath, then state firmly, "My name is Khasma, will be Khasma, and I wish you to believe that it always has been Khasma."

The spirit woman smiles cruelly. "Good! Now, who do you wish me to take you to?"
142211.title: Khasma (F)

1422111.content:
An evil gleam is in Fantoccina's dark eyes as she says, "Follow me."

As you follow, you wonder if choosing to see the spies was such a great idea. You begin to second guess your decision, but say nothing. Fantoccina does not seem to be a force to be reckoned with and you are sure she would be displeased if she saw indecision in you.

The forest seems to grow darker, as you follow her in strange directions. You can feel the shadows of the forest, as if thier hollow eyes were watching you. The boney shadow fingers of the trees reach out to you as you pass by.

You finally come to a large, dark tree with gnarly roots exposed on top the ground. There are no leaves on this tree, only naked branches.

Fantoccina turns to you and speaks, "Wait here and the spies will come for you. When I am ready for you, I will come to you again, so that you may carry out the task I have for you. I have fulfilled your request, and you will have to fulfill mine."

You nodd and bow slightly in understanding. Fantoccina disappears and you are left alone at the foot of the naked, black tree. Waiting.
Dark shadows grow long as the sun begins to set. Their crooked fingers threaten to grab you, but you are not afraid.
1422111.title: To the Spies (F)

14221111.content:
Night falls, but night is now your friend. Where others would see only shadows, you see a monochrome landscape of trees, undergrowth, nocturnal animals, and phosphorescent moss. Sliding down to rest among the roots of the tree, you open your magic to the world around you. Small, dark birds and squirrels dart among the branches, a silver fox hunts mice a few paces from where you sit, a family of coal black rabbits leave their burrow in search of sweet grasses, and there, just at the edge of your perception, six elf-like figures work their way slowly toward you. Curious, you study the feel of them. Their magic is obvious, but plainly they have chosen to be open and could just as easily have hidden their chakara from your enhanced perception. These, you conclude, must be the spies.

While still some yards off, five of the figures form a loose circle around you while the sixth approaches. From five feet away, a woman’s voice calls to you.

“I am Lethe, daughter of Camphor, daughter of Dagan. Fantoccina has sent us to seek the new dark-elf Khasma. I assume you are she?”

Anxiety sends shivers down your spine. Lethe’s voice is cold as a winter tomb. Perhaps it would have been better to go to the wizards of Dumuzi. Clasping your hands together prevents them from shaking as you rise to your feet and turn to face her.

“I am Khasma. I seek to learn why I have been brought to this world to fight in a war that is none of my concern.”

Lethe is long in answering and you fear you have offended her. When you open your eyes, the woman before you is a few years older than you are. Her only garment is a thin strip of leather worn as a loin cloth. On one hip hangs a full quiver, on the other a knife long enough to double as a very short sword. In her left hand is a recurved bow of layered wood and bone. Her bow is strung and she holds a single arrow knocked but not drawn. Pale brown hair tied in an elaborate braid hangs down her back. Most of her skin is exposed to the elements, but covered in a dull sheen of oil to repel insects.

“Why am I here?” you demand again, although you do not expect an answer.

“I don’t know.” She offers a half-smile of genuine concern. “However, if you return with us to our village perhaps the Master Assassin will know. She has traveled through the land and knows many things.”

Briefly, you open yourself the magic of the land once again, but you can feel no village anywhere within your limited range.

“And how far is your village?”

“Three days north through the dark forest, two if we take the path through the tree folk, but the cypress lord has declared his loyalty lies with the Wise Elves of the far south and so he will not grant us passage.”

“Can we not fight our way through?”

Lethe smiles in humor. “A joke, newcomer? Or would you really strip the bark from a tree folk?”

“Of course, foolish of me to even suggest it. Shall we go?”

She beckons you to follow and heads back the way she came. As she passes the edge of the circle created by the others, they fall in behind you. You still are not certain if Lethe is elfin, human, or something else, nor are you convinced you can trust her. On the other hand, a village will have food, drink, and perhaps a place to sleep. Tomorrow is soon enough to figure out what comes next.
14221111.title: Lethe, daughter of Camphor

1422112.content:
"I wish you to take me to the great dark wizards," you reply.

Fantoccina raises her eyebrows, "An interesting request."

An evil grin spreads across her shadowy face.

"Very well then."

Fantoccina claps her hands once and what happens next is beyond your comprehension. The forest blurs past you, yet you seem to be standing still. You feel no wind, yet the world is flying by at a speed you can only imagine, creating a kaleidescope of colors.
In seconds you are in a round, windowless, dimly lit room made of grey stone. In the center a black marble pillar stands majestic. Atop it sits a crystal ball that seems to have it's own light coming from it.
Fantoccina is not with you; it seems you are alone. You hear her voice in your head reminding you, next time you fulfill her request.
Eerie silence falls as you stand there waiting.
1422112.title: To the Wizards (F)

14221121.content: You are surrounded by a group of black-cloaked wizards. They glare at you for intruding. You scan the room quickly and notice that there is a youngster in the group who is quite bewildered by your sudden appearance. What will you do?
14221121.title: continue

142212.content:
"I am Malvagia, the Bringer of Death."

"Yes," Fantoccina smiles knowingly, "so you are."

The darkness of the forest pulses in you like life itself. You can feel each tree, each shrub, each flowering plant, the sleeping deer, the stalking panthers, the slow-moving alligators, the birds as they flit from one branch to the next. You are one with the forest and it is one with you.

You can also feel the scouting party of five humans creeping in from the west.

"Come, Fantoccina. We have work."

She bows low, her hands at her side and one leg cast behind her in a near curtsy. "As you command, so shall it be. For now."

And then she looks straight into your eyes. Her smile is predatory, the smile of a cat that has cornered a mouse. Without another word, you head to the west and she follows.

In the back of your mind the words of the Wizard that brought you here whisper a warning to head east and seek out the Valley of Zar. Your training is not complete, they seem to say, but your mind is made up and you continue west.
142212.title: First hint of danger

choices: The scouting party enters the clearing
1422121.content:
An hour or so later, you come to a small glade the human scouting party will pass through. Searching around the edges confirms what you already know, there is a large pool of quicksand on the south side, dense thorn bushes on the north. The human scouts will have to enter from the west and leave through a narrow gap of dry land on the east.

"Fantoccina?"

"Yes, my mistress?" Her tone of voice stings like hot sparks on a cold day. Compliant she might be, but never humble.

"I need three warriors of Lugal. They will fight today and recieve their night of looting three days hence."

"This will not please them, Malvagia, but they will agree."

Before her words are finished three strong men dressed entirely in chain mail appear behind her. Each is equipped with a short sword and heavy wooden shield. bits of cloth are woven into the chain mail and wrapped in every place likely to cause sound without some cushion. Opposite the short sword each wears a foot-long dagger of thin steel. Their shoulders are broad and powerful, their demeanor fierce. Two of them are in their early twenties, young, powerful, and clearly they are already veterans of several battles.

The third man is older. His hair is touched with grey, but the blue in his eyes is clear as a winter morning.

"I am Danner," he announces without fanfare. He gestures to the younger men. "Their names do not matter and each time you call their faces will change. Regardless of whether you ask for one warrior or a thousand, I will always be present and I will always command the warriors I bring. I will answer to you and only to you, even if you set someone else in charge of me. Any bargain you make will be made with me, and only with me."

"I understand," you begin. "Today we are going to kill a human scout team who has invaded the forest from the west. Three days from now we will raid a human village on the edge of the forest in retaliation. As payment for your fighting, you and your men may loot the village for anything it holds and deal with it's people in any way you see fit. I hope you do not object to killing your own kind?"

He shrugs, the two younger men look bored.

"I want you to array yourself and your men across the northern side of this clearing. Find or make something to hide yourselves. When all five scouts have entered the clearing, I will appear before them and sow confusion in their ranks. At that point, you are to attack without mercy and without waiting for my command. Am I clear?"

"Absolutely."

He grabs the younger men by their arms and shoves them off to the north side of the clearing, whispering instructions to them as they move. Before long all three have vanished beneath makeshift piles of broken branches and torn grass.

"I am done here," Fantoccina announces. "Your hold on me is broken until I call for you, then the cycle begins anew."

Her voice turns hard. "Am I clear, Malvagia?"

You smile, trying as best you can to mimic her predatory grins. "Absolutely."

And then she is gone.
1422121.title: Preparations for a skirmish

choices: Dismiss the warriors until you reach the village
14221211.content:
You feel rather than see the human scouts approach the clearing. They fan out on the edges before they enter, but there is only one way in and one way out. You know this, and they discover it quickly.

The first man enters the clearing. He wears leather armor from head to toe. He is armed with a crossbow primed and ready, a quiver of crossbow bolts on his right hip, and a dagger on his left hip. The crossbow is aimed into the clearing as he enters and he swings it from right to left and back again as he looks around. Seeing nothing, he waves behind him.

Four more men enter the clearing one by one. They are armed with drawn swords in their right hands and drawn daggers in their left hands. Each scans the clearing before he enters. The last enters when the first is halfway through the clearing and the man with the crossbow falls in behind, walking backwards with his crossbow held ready at his shoulder and pointed in the direction they enter from.

Your first arrow takes the lead man through the neck, your second hits the crossbow man in the upper arm, causing him to drop his weapon. The three warriors of Lugal spring into action between the two arrows, even though their flight is mere seconds apart.

The scouts are not caught entirely off guard. In a fierce blur of steel, one of the young warriors of Lugal fall beneath the scout's blade. Seeing his attacker is down, the scout springs at Danner.

Danner's blade opens the belly of the center scout, then turns to meet the oncoming blade of the one behind. As they begin trading strikes and parries, the crossbow man draws his dagger and prepares to strike, but your third arrow takes him through the chest and he falls to the ground instead.

Danner cuts down his opponent just as the other young warrior of Lugal takes down the last scout. With but a single glance at their fallen companion, the two come and kneel before you.

"Shall we travel with you to the village or meet you there?" Danner asks, his voice as calm and collected as a tavenkeeper inquiring whether you would prefer ale or wine.
14221211.title: Your first victory

choices: One warrior is enough.  What if they turn on you?
14222.content:
Shrieking a death incantation, you punch the ground with your fist, taking a knee. A circle of dark purple light and aura surrounds you and you hear a deep moaning. From beneath a tree, a hand shots up from the dirt. An undead warrior pulls herself out of the dried leaves.

"My name is Akinda," she croaks afer she hobbles over, "what do you wish of me, mistress?"

"Lead me in the direction of the Valley of Zar, slime." you sneer at the trapped soul.

"Yes mistress." Akinda says and begins to hobble East.

You follow the undead warrior as you ponder what other abilities you might have. Perhaps the ability to charm your enemies? Or create an army of undead? You could even rule this world! Akinda is docile enough. Perhaps you should summon more undead bodyguards.
14222.title: Turn toward the Valley of Zar

choices: Kill the boy with a globe of purple energy
Kill the girl with an arrow to the heart.
142222.content:
Your slave leads you into a clearing. On the far side, there is a collapsed hut with shouts coming from within. You approach the wreckage and order your undead soldier to remove the crumbling brick and straw. Eventually a small room is uncovered and two elves crawl out.

They are frightened by your decaying slave and scurry away from it. Before they can run away, you speak.

"WHO. ARE. YOU."

The two elves, a boy and a girl, turn to you with wide eyes, but they cannot speak.

"Come here." You command, but the two young elves are frozen with fear. You can see that they are good elves imbued with the power of light.

"I SAID come HERE!" You hurl a purple ball of energy into the ground next to their feet, and they scramble forward. The girl falls to her knees.

"Who are you?" You say again.

"I-I'm sorry. We were just dropped here by a wizard." The boy manages to stammer. "We decided to search the area when we found this house. Once we were inside, it collapsed."

"Are you Centurin?" You ask.

"Me-me? No. I'm Zarkin, and this is Delia."

"I DON'T CARE WHAT YOUR NAMES ARE!"
142222.title: The Collapsed Hut

choices: Kill the girl with an arrow to the heart.
1422221.content:
You snatch the boy's face with your hand. A steady purple glow rises from your bicep and crackles down to your palm. With a bright flash, the dark purple energy blows a hole from the boy's mouth through the back part of his head.

The girl screams. You then kneel next to the corpse and whisper a macabre incantation. The twisted elf rises and stands next to your other slave.

You turn toward the girl. You know you made a good decision to kill the boy. He was headstrong. But this girl - could she ever have the courage to aid good and stand up to you? It would best to kill her if she could. If you think her merely a weakling, there is no reason to give your growing league of dark warriors more power.
1422221.title: Women Rule Here.

choices: She's really stupid and forgot what she'd doing
14222211.content:
You remember all of the annoying stories of weaklings who eventually become strong. Besides, you'll have to kill the brat at some point. You decide to have a little fun first.

"Where are you from child?" You ask, casually examining your arrows.

"Oh, a wonderful world full of trees and animals and elves like myself. I'm not sure how I got here but..."

You get bored and take an arrow that just broke in half. You plunge the arrowhead into the girl's heart.
"Lead on slave," you command the impassive zombie. The undead spirit looks at you blankly.
14222211.title: I love arrows

choices: The spirit of dead branches leads you to the Valley of Zale
142222112.content:
"Slave, I'll not tell you again." You warn, fingering the arrowhead still wet with the girl's blood.
"Who are you? Who am I? Where are we going? What is the meaning of life?" She starts babbling inane questions, much to your annoyance.
"What the--" you sputter in disbelief.
You decide to ignore her and summon a spirit of dead branches. The branches from a neaby fallen tree disappear. They then reappear as a person made out of tree branches covered in moss.
"Lead me to the Valley of Zale," you command.
This spirit looks at you blankly too.
142222112.title: What's an elf got to do to get some help aroun

1422221122.content:
"What is this green stuff? Who are you? Who is she?" This spirit is even dumber than the first. You slap your forehead in disgust.
"Forget it. I'll find my own way," you mutter. Much to your dismay the two spirits start following you. You try to outrun them. It doesn't work. You try to get them to follow a traveling human you see in the distance. Also fails.
You get so busy trying to get rid of the spirits, you forget to watch your surroundings. You topple off a tall tree that somehow managed to grow sideways on a hilltop and look like part of the forest trail. It's a very tall hilltop. You land with a SPLAT! The spirits follow you and shatter into a thousand pieces. This is not your day.
1422221122.title: I can't believe this!

choices: Kill him with a blast of dark energy.
1422222.content:
You whip out your bow, and before you even know what you are doing or why you are doing it, you loose an arrow at the elven girl. It hits exactly where you aimed it - the heart. Her eyes widen and she lets out a startled cry before her eyes close forever and the mists of death overtake her.

The young male elf gazes in horror. "Why did you do that?" he whispers, a lone tear escaping from the corner of his eye.

You smile maliciously. "Because I could."

"What's going to happen to me?"

You sneer at him, disgusted by his lack of courage. "Sniveling brat."

He looks straight into your eyes for a second, and in that instant you see a smoldering look of hatred and defiance, before he ducks his head.

You like this. Maybe he has potential...
1422222.title: Kill the girl with an arrow to the heart.

choices: You decide to kill him, he's not worth it.
You give him one heck of a spanking and keep going with him.
14222221.content:
You decide to take him as prisoner. You grab him and yank him to his feet. You tell the zombie warrior to watch him and make sure he does what you say. He glares at you in anger and stands still, then he looks at the zombie and flinches.

"Come on."

You poke him with an arrow and he starts walking. We start heading to my original destination, the zombie leading the way. The boy trudges along, calculation on his face. You decide you really don't want any scheming, so you smack him on the back of the head. He stumbles with the force. When he gains his balance back he turns on you.

"Would you stop that! Why are you taking me with you? I have nothing of value to give you, even if I did I wouldn't."

"I am taking you with me because I feel I could use you in the near future. Why wouldn't you give me your valuables, you know I'd kill you right?"

"I know you'd kill me, but you already killed my sister! I hope you get killed in the very near future, and if not, I'll try my best to kill you myself."

"Well, your sister was of no value anyway. You just go ahead and try to kill me" You smirk and laugh at him as you prod him forward again.

He turns around again and all of a sudden you stop. You are stuck in roots. The roots now begin to swallow you up. You yell at the zombie and as soon as it realizes the boy has done it he grabs him and throws him to the ground. With his concentration broken, the roots stop moving. Unfortunately, they are still around you so you throw a purple essence ball at the roots. The roots quickly shrivel into nothing. You growl at the boy and grab his shirt. You lift him up above your head with your hand being much stronger and reprimand him like a child. Then you throw him back down since he's not too young for much damage. What to do with this annoying child?
14222221.title: Take him as prisoner

142222211.content:
Your brow furrows and you frown, your fists clenching. A globe of energy flies from your hand and strikes the boy, and he lets out a small squeal of pain before he collapses to the ground, his arms going off to the left. His eyes close and his body jerks, then lies completely still. The zombie soldier moves over to where you are and stands beside you. You are disgusted by the body and turn away, then with a thought, move back and begin to go over the boy's body. He lied to you. There is a pouch of gold coins hanging at his belt. You take the money and attach it to your belt, then kick the body, stomp on its head, and turn away.

Just as you are about to put the scene behind you completely, an arrow flies through the air and strikes your zombie soldier with such force that it is thrown backwards. Another arrow comes towards you. You leap out of the way and then three more bowstrings twang. It seems that the elves wish to take revenge. One of the arrowheads strikes you in the temple and you fall to the ground. You let out a groan of pain, and in the seconds before you are dead you can see several of the elves emerging from the bushes, looks of hate and grief on their faces.
142222211.title: You decide to kill him, he's not worth it.

choices: Your death is now dark elf!
142222212.content:
You grab the boy.
As you get ready to exact terrible punishments upon him, you stop.
You can sense other beings close by.

You begin to laugh.
" I see...you brought me South instead of East.
Clever boy...perhaps too clever."

You grab him and put your bow and arrow to the back of his head.
"Listen up elves...I know you want this boy.
Let me leave...and you can have him."

A voice responds.
"You're mad...
We know of your intent....and we will stop you here.
Dark-hearted elves are not fit to live."

You scowl.
"Make up your mind...
My life....or the boys...."

You draw your bowstring..setting the arrowtip against the young lads head.
"Time is running out..."
The voice cries out.
142222212.title: punishment in due time

15.content:
"You have made an interesting choice."

The wizard smiles and continues, "There is one more choice you have to make, and I'm sure it will be an easy one! Would you prefer to be male or female?"
15.title: Gender Smender - Just as You Are

choices: Begin your journey to the edge of the forest.
Rest beside a tree before beginning your journey.
151.content:
Immediatley your wish is granted and the wizard says, "Be cautious on your journey. This forest holds powers unknown to you. You will notice you have been lightly equipped, and before you reach the edge of the forest will have opportunities to increase your skills and gain weapons. Trust no one."

"Before you go great wizard, I implore you, please tell me more of my mission."
