"Alright, but quickly," he says, drawing closer.
Continuing in a low voice he shares, "A great conflict is brewing between the forces of good, which are to the North and South, and the forces of evil which are to the East and West. This forest has always been considered neutral ground, and for this moment still is. But soon it will be a bloody battleground."
The wizard pauses with a sorrowful look in his eye, as if he is seeing the future.
"You have been brought here alone and in secret, chosen because of your exceptional abilities - your sharp mind, able body, and strong personality. The fate of the forest and this realm will rest in your hands, and the hands of others just like yourself, who have also been chosen."

"What is causing the conflict?" you ask, still confused.

"I don't have time to go into this now. You will learn as you travel. Be careful who you befriend. Some can give you invaluable insight and help, and others live only to decieve and destroy you."

The wizard, vanishes instantly, leaving you alone in the forest.
You can hear his voice in the wind saying, "You need to journey North to the edge of the forest. There you will choose which side you want to fight for and be given clear purpose and understanding."
151.title: Mission - Edge of the Forest (M)

choices: Follow the path - you have your compass to guide you.
Cross the path only, do not follow.
1511.content:
You decide to begin your journey right away. You are not sure how long the journey is, and you are sure there is no time to lose.
You feel in your pockets, for the wizard said you have been equipped.
There is a hard, round object in your left jacket pocket. You pull it out to reveal a compass, set in a shiny gold casing. The little sun that is shining through the treetops, glistens off of it, creating a bright reflection. Attached is a gold chain, long enough to wear around your neck, or attach to a belt loop.
You explore your right pocket and find another object. You pull it out to reveal a knife. The handle is a good size, fitting your hand perfectly. It is carved from marble, but grooved perfectly for your fingers to grip. It is designed like a switchblade, but it is the size of a dagger. As you eject the blade, you see it is gold, and very sharp, as the blade gleens and glows, it's glory contrasting the dark forest.

You set your feet to walking North through the dense forest. You are still wearing your watch, and looking at the time, see that it is Noon exactly. Upon further inspection, you notice your watch has stopped.
You walk along, not on a path, but you can tell that others have also gone this direction, by the broken limbs and hair and threads left behind. You learned a bit about tracking from watching the Discovery Channel! You are not alone, and know there are others here in the same predicament as you. You wonder if you'll see them.
After a ways of walking, you come upon a path. It seems to be running east and west, but as with all paths, that is subject to change.
1511.title: Stepping Out (M)

choices: Follow the forest to the Northwest, using the riverbed as a road.
Chase the thing in the cave.
15111.content:
You follow the path going to the East. The walk is uneventful and unusually easy.
Just after sundown, you come to the edge of the forest. You seem to have exited at the wrong point. The point that you should have ended up is Northwest of here. In front of you, you can make out a dry riverbed and several caves. Toward the North you can see the last fringes of an immense swamp. To the South you see more caves and more of the riverbed.

Then you notice a pair of glistening eyeballs glowing from within one of the caverns. The thing that owns the eyeballs dashes down the mysterious cavern's corridor into the darkness.

The sun is down and darkeness is growing.
15111.title: The edge of the forest (M)

151111.content:
Forget the cave. Now is not the time to be walking into a cave. You must head to the riverbed to cross. You continue to go north west, taking in all the sights. You eventually come to the river bed.

You slowly begin to cross the shallow water and stones. You see fish swim by down the stream. When you get across, you see a figure in the distance, coming towards you. They do not look hostile.
151111.title: The Riverbed

choices: As the man approaches, realizing he is injured, you show yourself.
Keeping hidden as the man passes by, you hear horses gallopping up from behind.
1511111.content:
Not taking any chances and hoping you haven't been spotted yet, you swiftly duck into the cover of the underbrush along side the river bank. The encroaching darkness of the night and the possibility of a hostile encounter snaps you out of the hazy disorientation which has clouded your judgment since the meeting with the wizard. Your survival instincts take over. Waiting and watching, as the figure moves closer, you begin to pay attention to your heart rate and breathing. Calming your nerves, you begin to control your breathing.
The last light of the day reveals what seems to be a dark-haired man shuffling hap-hazardly thru a small clearing, most likely an game trail, leading out of the heart of the swamp. His appearance is ruffled and dirty, his clothes tattered and torn. But the one thing that stands out to you right away is the fact that this man is missing his right hand, seemingly, from about mid-forearm. Bloody bandages wrap around the stump which he cradles with his other hand against his stomach.
1511111.title: Divert course to hide.

choices: Unsheath the dagger and prepare for a fight
1511112.content:
The figure takes form as it approaches, revealing a truly beautiful creature. She is 5'2, with a slim body. Her hair is in a ponytail coming down to her midsection. She has high cheekbones, arched eyebrows and pointed ears. She is clad in a dark forest green dress and cloak with the hood down. A sword is strapped to her back along with a quiver of arrows. She carries a bow in her left hand.

"Greetings human stranger. What brings you here?"

"I am lost. Who are you?"

"I am Mephala of the House of Desirez. I am from the city of Tithinesselar. And you are?"

"I am but a stranger passing through, here to accomplish my work and be done. I am not of this world."

Her intese eyes question you without words.

"Shhhh! I here footsteps," she speaks.

You look around nervously. You don't hear anything. Then you see it. It is a brownish grey with a huge head and sharp jaws. It lumbers over, armed with long arms and foot long claws at the tips. It stands about eight feet tall.

"Behemoth!" she says.
1511112.title: Mephala of House Desirez(M)

15111121.content:
"What is a behemoth?" you ask.

"A terrfying creature. Its claws can shred metals. Fortunately, they are slow, so I hope you are fast," she says concentrated on its form in the bushes.

She pulls back an arrow, shooting it with such speed, you don't notice it go by you. It strikes the lumbering creature, who looks up, letting out a huge roar. You want to leave. You should leave. But you're not going to leave a young beautiful woman behind to get shredded to pieces.

You pull out your dagger and crouch around it. Mephala has unsheathed her sword and moved to engage it. The behemoth lifts its claws and slashes at the elven woman. She easily dodges it and slashes at the behemoth. The behemoth jumps back covering the wound on its arm. Regaining its composure, it leaps back at her.

Meanwhile, you creep up on it. Mephala is easily dodging each rake of its claws. She swipes at it again and again. The behemoth raises its claws to defend itself. Her shining silver sword clangs against the claws and her sword is thrown out of her hand. She leaps back. You're creeping closer and you see fear in her eyes.

"Look out!" she shouts above of the din of the behemoth.

She is backed up against a tree. The behemoth charges. You see what you must do. You run in front of the behemoth and stick your dagger forward. Closing your eyes, you feel your dagger stab something. But the something roars and runs into you. You are knocked back and darkness comes upon you.
15111121.title: The Behemoth

choices: Try to get in a better position to eavesdrop.
151111211.content:
You wake up to find yourself in a emerald green room. The texture of the room is delicate and looks like it has vines glued to the wall, but that is just the way the wall was made. You are lying in a bed. There is a table next to your bed holding your dagger and clothes.

"It is good to see you are awake. I never got your name," she said with interest.

"Drake," you say with a dry throat.

"Welcome to Tithinesselar. You are in the church's hospital. You took quite a blow, but you stopped the behemoth. For saving my life, you will be the guest of honor at dinner tonight," she says to you.

"So exactly where am I in this world?" you ask.

"You are in Lush, a large forest, south of where I found you. You should get some sleep," she says smiling.

She leaves and you ponder on what you are doing in this world in the first place. So far, no great mission of peril has come to you. You need some rest. You lie back in bed and sleep. You wake up at the sound of voices outside of your room. You see a group of young elven girls outside giggling. They hide back in the hallway when you look at them. Mephala steps in caring clothing.

"Be ready for dinner in two hours. Here is your clothes. The shower is across the hall. Here is a robe so the girls don't see you bare. Farewell," she says.

"Umm... Farewell," you say and she leaves.

You put on the grey robe and walk across to the shower room. You get behind one of the shower curtains and bathe. You don't know how this world has indoor plumbing, but it does and that is all thats important. You go back to your room and look at your clothes. You have black pants, a white long shirt, and a black vest to go over it. You dress, with an hour before you need to arrive.

Opening the door a crack, you peer through. Two men are talking and you can just make out their words..."the one"..."kill him"...
151111211.title: Elven Hospitality

choices: Find a way out of the city.
Stay in bed and wait for the banquet.
1511112112.content:
You slide out the door into the hallway. The men are walking down the hall and out into another chamber. You silently follow down the emerald hall. You peek around the corner and see the two men in a large room. There is an alter in the center. There is a statue of some man in robes and is adorned with flowers, spices, and other gifts all around it. There are columns and small shrines scattered around the room. You hide behind a column close by and listen.

"...human is not supposed to be here. Why did she do it?" a man in green robes asked. He was probably a priest.

A man in armor replies,"Calm down High Priest Aleubian. We don't want anybody to hear us. Mephala actually believes that this boy could save our city from the exile, Rerleth."

"That's good. I still don't see how a boy, and a human at that, could save us. But hey, if the most holy Rilifane has sent us a savior, I am all for it," says Aleubian joyously.

"Have you forgotten the laws, Aleubian? It requires that all those not of elven lineage are allowed in this city. All agressors are to be punished by death. I will go now. If you change your mind about helping me, tell me. Or I will do the deed myself and implicate you with me should I be caught. Farewell," says the man threateningly and he walks out.

What should you do?
1511112112.title: The Plot

choices: Dress quickly and hurry to the banquet hall
Take the chance to look around while everyone else is in the banquet
15111121122.content:
You return to your room and remove your clothes again getting back into the small wooden bed.

You lay there thinking over what you have just heard unable to free it from your mind.

You attempt to free yourself from the persistent repetition of the words you have just heard spinning in your mind by closing your eyes and trying to sleep.

To start with it works as you slowly drift off again into a deep slumber, but only a few minutes later you find your self being woken again by a knock at the door.

You grab your robe and wrap it around yourself as the door is slowly opened.

Enters a small quiet eleven girl all dressed in green she seems timid at first but as she draws closer you get a safe feeling about yourself.

She opens her small mouth and begins to talk to you in a soft voice.

"Are you the human people have been speaking about: she says

"Yes. Why do you ask?" you reply

"No real reason" she says and asks,

"Are you coming to the banquet"

"Yes" you reply

As you do so the little elven girl lets out a giggle and says

"Well they are already sitting down. So you best hurry"

She jumps up and skips out of the open door and you hear her slowly move further away down the hall as she clicks on the hard floor in her shoes.

You jump up quickly.
15111121122.title: Little Visitor

choices: Forget it and go to the banquet
151111211222.content: You walk over to the small side table and put on your clothes. You grab your knife on your way out the doors. You peer both ways, to see nobody in the hallway. You quickly step down the hall, only to come upon a door.
151111211222.title: Take the chance to look around while everyone e...

1511112112222.content:
You felt like you wanted to not leave everyone hanging so you left for the banquet. However you needed to confine someone in on that plot you just overheard. Since it seemed like those two were acting alone you figured Mephala would be the one to go to with this. Besides she would be the easiest to talk to since she'd most likely sit next to you.

You entered the room and saw that the table was so long it was nearly 60ft long! Mephala was sitting in the center and had saved a seat for you beside her. Weird, but you didn't care that much. She raised her glass and proposed a toast, "My friends! Let us give thanks to our honored guest, who has saved the leader of the House of Desirez!", she called out. Everyone cheered for your act of bravery.

"As a reward for his selfless act, he shall be given an invitation to join our ranks!", she continued. That was a bit unexpected seeing how you just saved her and it was simply for trying to do the right thing..and survive.

Mephala sat down and smiled seeing you next to her, "I hope you accept my invitation. It's an honor to have the leader of this house offer her personal thanks as well as extending their generosity.", she said.

"Pardon, but may we speak privately? It's extremely important.", you whispered to her.

"Now come now, we have just started our feast in YOUR honor, surely it can wait.", Mephala insisted.

"No it can't, it might involve something with traitors inside your government.", you whispered.

She then wasted no time doing as you asked of her and took you to the hallway outside the banquet. "What have you discovered making such accusations?", she said seriously.

"I overheard a priest and possibly a high ranking officer in armor.", you answered her.

"What were their names?", she asked.

"Aleubian was the priest, but the others name I didn't catch. That guy in armor seemed to be determined on carrying out some sort of scheme and I think it involves me dying.", you said bluntly.
1511112112222.title: Forget it and go to the banquet

choices: Wait for him to strike and expose his scheme
15111121122221.content:
"I know who might be behind this. My captain, Daermaethor, he's been skeptical of my methods for some time now. And he knows the priest Aleubian very well. They have been allies for decades, but treachery? This will not be tolerated!", Mephala claimed.

"Wait we don't even know what he is up to. He could be after me? Or hell, he might even try getting rid of you! We need a plan.", you insisted.

"If we could find him them we can stop his plot before it begins! Drake we should never allow the enemy a chance to attack us unless it's our only option.", Mephala suggested.

"Well either way is risky, going in without knowing Daermaethor's plan is dangerous. Things could be messy...", you pondered how to go about this.
15111121122221.title: She believes you

151111211222212.content:
"I don't like this Drake, but are you sure you want to do this?", Mephala asked.

"Trust me, it's the best way to handle this. It's also the most dangerous and vulnerable but don't worry. Remember the plan.", you signed off before Mephala re-entered the banquet.

You journeyed back to your room an took the long way back, you tried to act like you were lost which you did remarkably well at faking drawing off any suspicion. You expected a guard to block your path, a trap, or an ambush but nothing happened.

It was only where you entered the hallway where you noticed the captain scheming in the first place where things actually got moving. "Excuse me but you are hereby asked to come with us.", said an elven guard.

"Who's authority?", you asked.

"It's neither a request, nor are you allowed to know unless it's need to know.", he answered. Soon a few more of them surrounded you and you let them take you. You checked if your knife was still in your pocket and it was still there.

You then met up near the edge o the village and the forest to meet with someone wearing a green robe. He removed it from his head revealing the priest from earlier.

"Your the other one with the captain! Why'd you bring me here?", you demanded.

"Quiet! He may be listening.", he said. "Forgive my secrecy but it was practical. I know what he's trying to do and he'll strike tonight now that he's noticed your talk with Mephala. He's escalated his plans and has already set it in motion. You don't have much time!", the priest explained.

"What's he planning?", you asked more calmly but still held urgency.

"Daermaethor will assassinate you in your sleep and blame the attack on the human group we have been at war with for years. Killing you would make Mephala retaliate and Daermaethor would have you out of the way.", he told.

"Why does Daermaethor want me gone?", you asked.

"I don't know for sure but, I did notice he wanted to try and take our forces near the Valley of Nar. I have a map and detailed explanation of what lies in it. He's probably after something there and wants us distracted so that-ACK!", before he could finish an arrow hit the high priest Aleubian in the neck killing him instantly.

You ran for cover as did the other guards. You hid in the trees but knew you had to find Daermaethor and tell Mephala his plan. The arrows came from no where, they were being shot around every single direction away from you. They had to be expert marksman, whoever was shooting at you but you needed to escape!

You looked around for protection from the arrows and found a shield. You quickly grabbed it and ran for the nearest building. But you were shot in the shoulder causing you to lose the shield leaving you naked to the assassins. You then in instinct smashed through a window and hid inside the room you were in, which ironically was your room.

You ran for the doors and opened them only to find...
151111211222212.title: Paitence

1511112112222121.content:
"Hurry!", she said grabbing your arm.

You two ran to the armory but were chased by the assassins. She seemed to be faster than the average human but who cared you were losing them. You both made it to the armory and locked the door sealing the both of you inside. "We should be safe in here.", she said.

"What do we do?", you asked.

"We fight! I'm not letting my people try and attack an innocent tribe because it started from the vile depths deception. You and I have to stop him from escalating the war with the human group. Find a weapon and when I open the door we fend off those traitors and end this.", she said boldly.

You searched for something easy to use but you had little to work with. You saw a shield that could protect you from the assassins and save your life. But you wouldn't be of much use while fighting them. But the sword might be the better option since you can attack and not leave Mephala to all the work.

Which one is better?
1511112112222121.title: Choose your weapon!

151112.content:
You let curiosity get the better of you and chase the eyeballs into the cave, But not very long after entering it, it becomes too dark to see! You squint trying to see ahead of you, continuing your trek foward, and you see a light up ahead! You quickly sprint to the light to find a small opening. It appears that someone lives here.

"May I help you?" A voice questions from behind you.
"Whoa!" you turn around and stumble to the floor, surprized to see a man, with a thick, white beard, and raggity clothing.
"He must be a hermit living in this cave" You think to yourself.

"I`ll ask again, do you need anything?" the hermit impatiently asks.
151112.title: The Cave Hermit

1511121.content:
"Hmm."

The old man places a hand on his chin, looking you over. After a moment, he speaks.

"You may spend the night here, if you want to..." His brows furrow as he tilts his head backwards, keeping his eyes fixed on yours. "...but if safety is your primary concern, let me assure you there is more danger in here than there ever will be out there."

"What kind of danger?" you say.

The old man smiles creepily.

"The kind that makes jaded warriors whimper." he says.

"Can you be more specific?" you say.

"I'm afraid not." The old man places a heavy, ice-cold hand onto your shoulder. "The kind of horror that lurks in these caves will change from person to person. If you really want to know what kind of danger you will face in here, you have to ask yourself a question."

The old man puts his other hand on your other shoulder and pulls you uncomfortably close to his crinkly, white face. The stench of maggots pierces your nostrils as his black eyes boor into you.

"What is your deepest fear?" he says.

He stares at you for a moment, then he pushes you away, making you almost trip. He walks toward the lightened area of the cave, pulling a piece of bread from his pocket and taking a bite out of it.

"So, my boy, do you still want to stay in this cave.?"
1511121.title: "Can I spend the night?"

1511122.content: "I just remembered I have this Quest thing so I have to-" "No You're not leaving, You're staying here."said the hermit. So with that he pulled out a magic wand and pulled you toward him. "Now I can shrink you and let you go or simply keep you here and wait for a ransom and I will...."
1511122.title: "I was just leaving."

choices: The Hag, better safe than sorry
The lake, there's no time to waste
15111221.content: "Shrink you!" declares the Hermit. So with that he waves his wand and now you are mouse size. "Now run along" says the Hermit. Now your surely a goner. Then suddenly the wizard comes along. "What happened?" he asks. "The hermit shrank me" you reply. "This will never do" says the wizard. "I know there is a growth lake down the road but it is dangerous, or a long ways down the road there is a hag she could fix you." Which shall you go to?
15111221.title: Shrink Quest

choices: Dash off in fear of painful death.
15112.content:
Crossing the path, you continue north. Soon the ground turns soft and the trees change to grey bones.
You have entered the swamp. The wizard must have meant the end of the trees so you should continue North. There are strange, slimy things peeking from under moss-covered logs. Suddenly, an incredibly large, eccentric, slimy thing jumps in front of your path! Dragonfly-type wings protrude from his raggedy hair covered back. He is twenty feet tall and has a large, poison-spined tail. Blood covered claws and teeth glisten in the little light available. Sharp, barbed thorns poke from in between shaggy hair.

It rumbles, "I am Ahmaghan, the spirit of the river who this forest dammed up. In my anguish, I have emerged in this form from my immortal body. I need nourishment, for I have not eaten in months. Prepare your arms! No one has yet wounded me once!"
15112.title: Ahmaghan (M)

151121.content:
There is no way this can end now. You look at his blood covered teeth and claws and realize this can't end now, you still have your mission. It's coming closer and closer. It's now or never.

You quickly jump up and run as fast as you can. You don't care which direction you are going. You hear a roar from behind you. It's coming closer. You don't stop at all. You can't even feel yourself get tired. Just keep running. You look forward and see a opening in the swamp. You run faster now. You can't even hear the monster anymore.

The swamp opens to a dry riverbed. There is almost nothing here. You look at your compass to find out where you are going. It shows that you've gone in the wrong direction. There is no way that I'm going back there, you thought. There are two choices, either continue West or take a small rest after running that fast.
151121.title: Run, just run!!!

151122.author_name: Pax will not be on here!
choices: Run for the North side of the Swamp.
Hurl the switch-dagger into its mouth, attemting to destroy the shining object.
151122.content:
Steeling yourself with a grim determination, you are fully prepared to fend off the creature or die trying. As the creature floats toward you, you flip out your knife. Amazingly, it seems you have skills you didn't know about, for you are able to Bruce Lee like moves with it. After discovering these new found skills, which took a sum of 3 seconds, you concentrate on your adversary with a boost of confidence.
Suddenly there is an unbearable pain in your head, as in a vice. As you cry out, the creature is upon you, wielding a large cudgel. Ducking you flip out your knife to hamstring the mudbeast. Expecting to meet soft flesh, or mud, you are stunned when a shock is sent up your arm as your knife connects to the extremely hard body of the monstrosity. It feels like granite. Again you cut at it, to the same effect. It is just standing there, an amused smile on its face (if you can call it that).

"Why won't you die!" you scream, "Die, die, die!"

You are filled with rage as he begins to laugh. His cavernous mouth seems an endless hole. As you begin to calm, the pain in your head subsides.
'Wait, what was that... there it is again.'

A sparkle! Something is in that great crevasse. Maybe that is the source of its strength. Then again, it seems to have forgotten you. Should you make a run for it? Or hurl you switch-dagger at it?
151122.title: The Spirit of the Swamp

1511221.content:
Your courage finally melts away as the monstrosity leers at you, confident of your fate. You are no longer able to face the thing and you dash past it, deeper into the swamp.

The evil river spirit cackles with glee as he chases you. He knows the swamp well, and now is completely sure that he will have his meal.

You discover you can run as fast as any track star, but the mud and overall muckiness of the swamp slow you down considerably.

Your pursuer quickly catches you and tackles you to the ground. As it sinks its teeth into you, you hope the others survive long enough to complete the mission. Darkness mists before your eyes soon after.
*****

Your eyes jolt open as fragments of your dream remain in your mind. You look at the clock and realize that there are still several hours left before dawn. Your nightmare had shaken you, but you were disapointed with how it turned out, and you settled your head back on the pillow, determined to succeed on your next try.
1511221.title: Running is hard to do in a swamp

1511222.content:
Your switch-dagger flies unerringly towards the light, but with a flick of it's tail your hope is gone.
It looks down upon you, it's eyes flashing through colors of rage to the calm of deep ocean blue.
" You would attack me? With nothing but a knife? Are you fool or hero?" The voice rumbles so deep and your bones grate with each word that it takes you a few minutes to realize you were just asked a question.
You have come this far and it is perhaps really only a dream, but you have pride and you have chosen to remain yourself. You answer in a strong confident voice, sure of nothing but you did not run and you will not show fear now.
1511222.title: Hero or Fool

choices: Follow the compass; head directly North through the swamp.
Follow the easier path through the swamp to the North East.
15112221.content:
"I am a hero, you piece of shit, and you'd best remember that!" You snatch a sharp, gnarled branch off the roots of a dark tree and plunge its pointed stick into the roof of its mouth and into its brain.

The creature screams and explodes, green ooze flying everywhere - including on you. As the muddragon dies, you hear its grating voice issue a warning: "You may have killed this body, but my spirit will plague you all through this swamp."

"Yeah, whatever, slime breath." You retrieve your discarded knife and attach it back to your belt.

Which way do you go now? You pull out the compass and its golden sheen adamently points North. Should you follow the faerie compass or follow your own intuition?
15112221.title: My Stick, Your Mouth.

choices: Do you heed the voice and walk toward it
Do you take your slim chances and forge ahead in the opposite direction
151122211.content:
As you make your way out of the Swamp of the Ghost River and away from the evil clutches of the Dragon-fly creature, you take a quick glance down at the compass to ensure that it still functions properly. It points due North without even a hint of a waiver, so with a small measure of encouragement, you begin to hasten your step.

Before long, you reach the boundary of the swamp. In the distance you can see the majestic Cascading Mountains, but almost instantly, you feel a gust of fiercely, cold wind that seems to have come straight toward you with a mind of its own. It whips in and out of your sparse clothing until every inch of your body is covered in its frosty embrace. Just when you think you can stand it no longer, you hear a faint, beckoning call coming from a short distance up ahead to your right.

"Over here stranger."
151122211.title: A Timely Decision

choices: I don't want to be worse off.
I was born male and I chose to be a human and I'm sticking to it.
1511222111.content: You know that you will most likely either freeze to death or get mauled to death by another horrendously dastardly creature. You thus trudge through the cold wind and find a diminutive and significantly old and hairy creature bound in armor of indestructible ice merged with an odd looking type of white and black metal. "Greetings, human from another world. I am the named Chizoyahalkanforsoznfquweltreiopnmgfdv the 23rd, but you can call me Weltrei. Quickly, we must get you inside. Humans are not meant to wear that light of clothing in these conditions, let alone be in this world." Weltrei says. You scuttle quickly inside the dwarf's hidden glacier home. You notice it is self sustaining, with a garden in one corner, machines beyond your understanding in another, and a collosal study and laboratory in the next room. You are lasted down on Weltrei's couch. "Well, this must all be a big shock to you. You see, in this world, there are no such things as humans in this world. In fact all the creatures labeled beings of myth, fantasy, and fiction in your world are all in existence in this world. I know of this all because I once stumbled upon a rift and visited your worl and studied it myself. I take it you are heading to the empire of light. Well, not many people will be willing to know of humans in our world. I will explain much more later but let me ask you this question. Would you like to be human or not. I can turn you into any species the wizards can't although I can only give you clothes and weapons. No powers. If you were not human, you could be let right in. If not, even among the human like wizards you stick out like a blistered talon. Your species options include animal people such as cat people, fox people, bird people, and so on; inanimate beings such as the automaton and the golem; spirits, plant peolple; or the best of them all, dwarves. Oh and this machine here can also change you gender to female making you faster and more agile, but weaker in comparison to males, however it could be problematic for you. So do you want to stay human and/or male?" Weltrei asks.
1511222111.title: The engineer of the ice.

choices: Follow the ghostly bunny through the North East part of  the swamp.
Go to the light on your West to dry river bed with increasingly rocky terrain.
151122212.content:
You walked through the swamp. It was slowly getting dark and before you know it, your surrounding gave birth to total silence. You took each step forward cautiously. Had it not been for the previous fight, you would still be having all your travel supplies. You had to hurry and seach for source of light. As you walked, you realized that something smelled weird. You should not linger for long.

There, in front of you, you saw a small sign.

"Welcome, all ye visitors to Sands-Lot. Next exit would be another fall ahead!"

You froze for a while. What did the sign mean?

"I believe that you are lost, small boy".

You turned around and a small figure emerged from the darkness. You cocked your head to the side. The figure manifested into a bunny-look-alike creature. It's fur was as dark as the night inself, however its eyes seemed to be glowing bright, as bright as the golden sunlight. It lifted up its paw and in its paw was a small silver key. The key had an unknown language engraved on its end.

You took the key. The key felt warm. You looked at the bunny. "Thanks, but, where do I use this?"

The bunny chuckled and hopped forward, insisting that you follow him. You struggled through the slimy oil based ground. Each step you took felt like so much hard work. The bunny took few hops forward and turned to see if you had managed to follow. After some time, you reached an intersection. The bunny pointed towards the darker path. You stared at the bunny. Has it lost its mind? The other end was alot brighter.

Would you follow the strange ghostly bunny and venture deeper into the North East, or move towards the light and into the dried up river bed on your West?
151122212.title: Follow the easier path through the swamp to the...

15112222.content: The creture kills you and feds upon your flesh. You wake back up in your bed covered in cold sweat wondering was it a dream or not. Then you here the voice of the creature saying "Ummm Yummy I had forgotten humans tasted this good."
15112222.title: Fool

choices: You allow yourself to be bound.
You take a chance and make a run for it.
1512.content:
Still a bit confused from your encounter with the Wizard, you decide you would like a nap to clear your mind. You walk along until you find a nice large tree. The roots are the perfect size and shape for a resting place.
You settle down, resting your head in your hands. Your eyes feel heavy as the forest gives way to the darkness of sleep.

You awake to a group of strange creatures surrounding you with arrows pointed to your heart. They are very large, dark and ugly, with mucus draining from their flared nostrils. You can hear them breathing, which is more like a growl. Their hair is long and matted. Their black eyes are surrounded with yellow. They are so gross, even the flies want nothing to do with them. And you know you have the stinch of fear upon you.

They motion for you to stand, and you manage to pull yourself to your feet. They do not show one sign of fear of you. Then again - why would they? Twice as big as you and they outmunber you 4 to 1. One of the creatures has a rope and he reaches for your hands.
1512.title: Rude Awakening (M)

choices: You try to cut your hands free with the knife.
You do nothing, but make a mental note that the knife is there.
15121.content:
You quickly decide that you are no match for these creatures. They are huge, ugly and fierce looking. Their hands look as if they could crush your skull with barely a squeeze. You can tell that they thrive on evil and harm.
You hope that behind the greusome exterior, they have at least a slight twinge of compassion.
A creature binds your hands behind your back and the others grunt in what you percieve to be excitement. The rope burns your wrists, but you try not to cringe. Another creature ties a band around your neck, attached to a rope. At first you think they will hang you, but you realize it is a leash!
They start off, the one bringing up the rear is dragging you along. You stumble over twigs and rocks, fortunately not falling.
It is not until then you realize you have a small knife in your pocket.
15121.title: Captured (M)

151211.content:
The grunting monsters are not watching you, only dragging you behind them, like a prize they have won. You pull your jacket as best you can with your fingers to your hands to reach the pocket. Hidden inside, you feel a knife, and manage to grab hold.
It is a knife the size of a dagger, but after feeling around, you realize it operates like a switchblade. Fortunately for you, it is silent as the blade ejects.
It takes you awhile to saw through the rope. The blade is very sharp, but it's not as easy as the movies make it out to be, to cut yourself free when your hands are bound behind you!
The creatures continue to walk, paying no mind to you except for the occassional rough jerk on the leash. For that you are thankful, as the knife slices through the last of the rope. You catch it before it falls to the ground, not wanting to make any unecessary noise that might alert them to your new situation.
Now for the leash. With your hands free it will be no problem getting it off, but you take a chance of them discovering this. Once they discover you are free, you can only imagine what they will do. But, if you get to your destination with your hands free, they'll know you have a weapon, remove it, and you'll still be bound. This also might anger them further.
151211.title: Cutting Loose (M)

choices: Naw, too risky. I'll escape later.
151212.content: They seem to be hurrying toward the West. Scuffling through the thick forest on an unnapparent trail, they grunt to each other with a vile-sounding language. Eventually you all exit the forest. The terrain turns rocky and there is a dry riverbed. They turn following the riverbed North. Further and further they march, until they swerve West when the sun begins to set, casting red and orange hues onto the ground. A large rockslide filled in this part of the riverbank. The smelly captors go over the rocks with ease, like they were flat ground. Ahead, you see your chance at escape: A giant rock. Perhaps if you tripped one of them at the right moment, it would look like they tripped on the rock. When he comes down, you can kill him with your dagger and then others, dashing off before the rest know what's happening! The best direction to go would be North. You ponder this idea for a moment.
151212.title: The Riverbed. (M)

choices: Finally decide to use your pocket knife to cut your ropes to get away.
1512121.content: As the sun sets these stinky demons of doom set camp after finally exiting the rocky land. Now you find yourself sitting on your bum in the middle of a plains land being gaurded by only one of the group as the others are hunting for dinner. Your captor stares down at you with a look of extreme hunger as he licks his lips. You must think fast. How can you keep him busy untill the others come back, or how can you escape?
1512121.title: Are you delicious?

15121211.content:
You contemplate what to say as the silence drones on. Nothing outstanding comes to you mind.

"Where are you taking me?" you finally venture to ask.

The creature ignores you and goes about his business of tending to the fire.

"I wonder why they have left you with the simple business of tending the fire? Do they not trust you or value what you have to offer?"

The creature looks at you without moving his head. At least now you know you've got his attention.

"If you help me, we could overcome them. Then you could be the leader."

The creature glares at you, snarling. "How about I just kill you now and have myself a nice snack?"

"My apologies," you say quietly, wishing to stay alive.

Two by two the group comes back. They have another person with them and shove him next to you. He is also bound tightly, and apparently has been roughed up. His right eye is swollen shut and various cuts and bruises accompany him.

"Hey you okay?" you whisper to him.

"You better keep you mouth shut," he replies. "They don't like feedback."

"Is that what happened to you?"

The man turned his marked face to look at you in silence. Then with a tired sigh, lowered his head.

The creatures were talking amongst themselves, although you cannot understand them. At least you aren't dinner tonight, for they have also captured a large deer.
15121211.title: Words Are Worthless

choices: wait until your captors go to sleep
take a chance and make your escape now
151212111.content:
As your smelly captors consume their deer a slight ways from the two of you, you try talking with the other captive.
"Where do they plan on taking us?"
The man turns his good eye at you. "You mean our delightful hosts?" He grunts and tests out his bonds. "Creator knows, but I'm wagering it won't be to riches and a warm meal." Again he struggles. Useless. "Damanable demons," he curses under his breath. "They took my sword. If only we could get it from them, I'd show you why many fear me with a blade."

You are then reminded of the knife in your possesion. You tell the man this and his face lights up.
"Now all we have to decide is when we're going to make our move."
151212111.title: A Potential Comrade

choices: Alert your captors that he had escaped
1512121111.content:
Slowly, as the shadow that was night fell upon your camp, you turn to the other captive. Silently, he nods ever so slightly. Turning to take the knife from your pocket, you slowly gasp as your hand touches air. They confiscated it!
You glare at your captivators (whatever, you know, the people holding you in chains!). They are snoring loudly, blood-stained tongues lolling out of their mouth like leechs, exausted by their repletion (source for that comment = Dracula). Suddenly, you stare at your fellow captive, your comrade, who has ^your^ knife in his teeth! Cutting his bonds, he escapes, and runs swiftly and silently away. You motion desperately that he come back and free you too, but he shakes his head. So he, the one you thought your comrade, stole your last hope to save himself! Slowly, you can't believe your eyes as he crouches down on all fours, his hands hardening to hooves, and his ears lengthening.
When he is through, he is a milky-white steed, probably a Lipizzaner breed (the graceful horse used at the Spanish riding school in Vienna).
Rearing up majestically, the stallion neighs, and hooves pounding, swiftly dissapears into the night.
1512121111.title: Knife

choices: Spit in the captors' faces, briefly blinding them (hopefully)
Tell the captors a lie about where the other captive has gone and they will beli
15121211111.content:
Shortly after you fall back asleep, your captors kick you.

"Get up! Tell us where the other captive is!" As the captor talks, he spews small pieces of meat at your face. You have not said anything yet because you are still waking up from when you were just asleep. "I said, tell us where the other captive is!" He jesters to the knife in his belt.

You see it, and realize that you should do something. But, since you do not know exactly where the other captive has gone (and the captors will not believe that and kill you), you will have no choice but to take a chance. You will need to escape now. But to do so, you will need to distract your captors - then run away.
15121211111.title: They Question You

15121211112.content:
"H...Hey, idiots! Get up!" you cry over the din of your captors' snoring. "Didn't you at first have two prisoners?"
This gets their attention. You wait patiently against the tree as they scramble over each other to rise and glare at you in shock. Just you. They quickly realize the other man has escaped and their eyes turn into vicious red slits. They sound like wolves as they howl with anger--which is rather strange because they look more like boars--then three of them race down the hill. You doubt they'll catch that man--of horse. But you decide your own chance of escape has again been heightened. Four against one was pushing it, but one against one?
Piece of cake.
You watch the boar like creature pace back and forth in front of you, its stubby hairy arms behind its back. It is obviously distraught, fearful, even. You wonder why the loss of a meal would frighten the creature so. It's not like there wasn't anything else to eat in this grassland.
But as the wind rustles your hair into your face and you shake the itchy strands out of your eyes, you overhear the creature say something.
"No! No! He goes! He goes! Master kill us! He KILL us! Stupid human. Foolish Tuk and Jin! We lose him! He goes!"
You are annoyed enough as it is on having been betrayed, plus, your stomach reminds you that you haven't eaten much since your encounter with that wizard. The boar's whiney voice plays off your ears as you stew over your own problems. Finally, you can take no more of the creature's pathetic babbling.
"What's so important about me and that guy, huh?"
The creature stops whimpering to glare at you. "Quiet, filthy Human," it hisses. "Everyone who comes from Mystic Forest is brought to Master." It wipes its tears with its dirty fingers, leaving muddy tracks across its beady eyes. "Master says all Chosen die."
You roll your own eyes. "What the Hell is a Chosen, anyway?"
The creature's tears turns to laughter, a cackling, high pitched laughter that pierces your eardrums and makes you long even more to be free from your bonds. "Who Chosen?" it repeats in a sneer. "You, boy. And horse man, too. All different. All same destiny."
You scoff at the news, though in the back of your mind you are reminded of the wizard's words. He said something about there being others, right? And then he let you choose your form. Well, even though you chose to be yourself, perhaps others chose. . . . You cannot help but wonder where you tie into all this and you find yourself further engaging this creature in conversation. "So...what are our destinies, then?"
The creature looks at you strangely, as if it's seeing you in a different light. "You no know?"
"Usually, when someone asks a question, it means they don't know the answer." You quickly conclude you are speaking to the stupid one of the group. The boar creature frowns, scratching its mud caked hair then goes and puts its finger in its nose. You make a face. You are not surprised, though.
"Master kill you then before you find out."
Your heart skips a beat.
Suddenly, the image of the creature digging for buried treasure in its nostril isn't the only thing making you feel sick as a cold chill falls down your spine. You realize that your dream of adventure and romance just took a turn in the nightmare direction. Perhaps you should wake yourself up before anything worse happens?
15121211112.title: Big Ugly Reveals Your Fate

choices: (DUH!) sneak up to the knife, cut your bonds, and make a dash for it
make a dash for it without the knife. (Stupid, but it might work for you. Go for
151212111121.content:
You try to wake up. No good. Dreams are weird like that. They sometimes have to play out fully before you can get out of them. Either that, or this really isn't a dream! You quickly throw that theory away. Considering all this a dream makes you feel better than thinking the alternative. At least, if you die in a dream, you cannot die for real.
Yet, there are books you've read in Psychology class that say you can.
Forget those books The writers don't know what the hell they're talking about! Least, you hope. You cast away all doubt and speak a bit more to your smelly captive, who seems facinated at how far it can stick its finger up its nose without getting dizzy.

The creature frowns, wiping its sticky finger on its moldy pants. "Master say nothing about sewing lips shut."
Meh, was worth a try. "I can take a hint." You nod in submission and retreat into silence.
You have to think of some way to escape! You sigh and lean back against the tree, craning your neck to stare up at the stars. The way they sparkle behind the sheet of clouds make them seem like they are mocking you and your predicament.
But wait!
A sharp gleam from the ground catches your eye. You squint through the gloom of night and realize that gleam is the reflection of moonlight off metal. Can it be? Yes! It is your pocket knife! The horsey man must have dropped it when he transformed. Hallelujah!
You purse your lips and glance back to the boar. The creature lies on a flat rock, a few feet from where you sit. Drool runs down its chin and pools on the flat of its arm. Wow! He went to sleep quick! You look at the knife again, only a couple dozen paces away in the opposite direction. You smile as an idea forms in your head.
Showtime!

You decide to give up. It's just a stupid dream, anyway. You can wake up and start over, right?
But your rescuer seems determined to save you. Your chest is slapped a few times, jarring your heart back into a healthy rhythm. You then feel your mouth being pried open and moist, hot air being blown in. Once, twice, three times the air is pumped into you, but your lungs refuse to release the water they hold. You're already dead, remember. Mind over matter.
"Please, don't die. You can't!"
Her lilting voice snaps you from your stubborn thought. Pssht! Don't you realize, if you were already dead you wouldn't be thinking about already being dead? Apparently this paradox makes enough since to you, even with your mind all foggy and dazed. So on the girl's fourth attempt, your lungs finally give in and forces the water up through your mouth.
Sputtering, choking, and gasping, you flip over and spit up the water in bucketfulls. You then lay on your back in exhaustion. It took a lot out of you to allow yourself to be rescued.
Your vision is as wet as your clothes and skin. But soon the blur of your surroundings come into focus. Clothed in a simple white, grass stained dress, your guardian angel sits over you, watching and waiting for you to regain enough strength to rise. She is beautiful! Soggy long red hair falls past her shoulders. She has concerned green eyes, high cheekbones, and a dashing of freckles on her cheeks. She is everything you had been told an angel was...yet, she doesn't have wings. Or a halo. Just a simple girl?
"I'm glad you live," she says with a smile. You are speechless as her white teeth nearly blind you. "That was a nasty fall."
"You...SAW me?"
She makes a face, cocking her head. "I heard you first." She giggles and you fight to calm your fluttering heart. "Your screams were loud enough to...you know."
You find the strength in you to shrug. "If waking the dead helps prevent me from joining their ranks, then I'll scream louder next time."
The two of you laugh, then. Your eyes meet hers, and you quickly turn away, clearing your throat before sitting up to study your surroundings. You know you lay on the bank of the river the girl saved you from, but when you look at the river, you find yourself gaping.
The river is nothing more than a dry bed now!
"How...?" You bring your hand to your soggy hair and run your fingers through it in puzzlement. "I DID nearly drown, didn't I?"
The girl nods. "I saw you on top of that cliff," she says. "You seemed in trouble. I thought you might have need to jump so I gave you something to jump into."
"How?"
"I don't know, really." She frowns. "I am new to this. I still am confused."
You cannot stop staring at the dusty river. "So you just summoned a whole bunch of water into this ditch? Just like that?"
She nods. "Strange, huh?"
You furrow your brows. "A little."
Silence reigns supreme for a moment as you try to think of what to say next. Your complete and utter confusion of things puts you at a loss for words. That's a first!
A rustle from some bushes across the riverbank brings you to attention. You stare with the girl at the vegetation, praying for once something good might appear from behind those branches.
A snarling, black wolf steps out, fangs barred, nose wrinkled. Blood paints its snout and paws. It had just had a nice meal, apparently.
Maybe it is just passing through and really isn't interested in desert?
Eyes slit, ears flat against its skull, the black beast stalks across the dry river, its sight set on you. Its official. Lady Luck apparently hates your guts.

You race toward the archer just as he looses another arrow. You manage to dodge it during your sprint. With a yell, you bring your knife out and plow into the creature. The force upon which you hit sends the knife into your opponent's heart. The creature screams in agony and drops to its knees. You waste no time to watch it in its death throes. You must make it to those rocks before the other boar creatures get here!
You pick up speed as their howls of pursuit find you. Feet pummeling the grass, the night squeezing all around you like a vice, you glance down and quickly regret sewing those cool reflectors on your footwear. It was a dare at the time, a harmless joke, devised by your friends to get back at your mom after she'd repeatedly insisted you ride you bike at night with reflectors. You frown and stop running. Perhaps it was harmless at the time, but your sneakers light up like beacons now! Those creature would kill you for sure!
You sit down and begin yanking your expensive sneakers off, all the while grumbling to yourself about the store's crappy return policy.
The other three boar creatures reach their dead comrade then turn to glare out into the gloomy grassland. You freeze in the middle of untying your other shoe, but they see you. With roars of fury, they take out their bows and give you a volley. As the shafts flit by, one piercing the empty toe of the sneaker you have just taken off, you scramble to your feet and make a beeline for the rocks. The angry boar creatures' cries grow fiercer. The arrows streak down on you like fatal hail. Still, you grit your teeth in determination and push onward. You will make it through this!
There! The rocks! Can't you see them? They are materializing out of the gloom some eighty feet away now. They are tall and proud, many mighty sandstone monuments scratching the sky. They were built by nature to honor the moon. Go! Run to them! They summon you!
Your lungs burn in your chest. The arrows are flying closer. Apparently the archers are honing in on your position. It's only a matter of time before....
Your muscles and tendons threaten to quit on you. Not yet. Not now! Almost there!
The rocks are within forty feet now! Great. Keep it....
Something high pitch screams behind you, and the arrow that has honed in on your left shoulder makes contact, throwing you to the ground with the force. White hot pain courses down your left arm as you haul yourself back to your feet and continue running. The cold air beating at you makes the hot stream of blood sliding down your shoulder feel like ice water. Your arm is limp at your side, yet you concentrate on nothing else but getting to those rocks.
Twenty feet! You see a niche in the formation that you plan to hide in the moment you get there. Ten! You raise your good arm to receive the rock as you come on it. Three arrows scream behind you.
You reach a boulder in the huge rocks and bunt over it with your good arm. The bunt shoots you over that boulder and behind it. You hear the clang of arrowheads against stone as you crouch and fight to steal back the breath stolen from you. Your enemy still howls for you some distance away. You know you cannot cower here forever. They will soon give up flinging shafts at you and hunt you with their blades. Again you find yourself taking out the pathetic pocket knife and studying it. Without a REAL blade to call your own, you'll stand no chance against those creeps!
The flare of pain in your shoulder reminds you of your injury. You touch the shaft experimentally. That simple touch causes you to scream out and brings you to tears. Geez! And here you thought you could endure pain! Guess you just aren't used to having arrowheads jammed in you. You'll learn.
Exhaustion plagues you, but you cannot give in. To sleep now is to die. You look around, considering your next best move. Of course, your mind is not reacting as well as you'd like--what with the agony of your shoulder. You see the mouth of a dark cave behind you and a slight climb up. Apparently these rocks are more than they appear. But that doesn't help you. You cannot hope to climb with your shoulder as it is.
You hear the boar archers voices again. They are closer now. So they have decided to come after you, have they?
Your smile is ironic. You have to make your choice quickly, else pay the price of your hesitation. For ONCE you'd like to have some good news! Is that too much to ask?
"I TOLD you not to get them angry."
You gasp in surprise at the familiar voice and search for its master.

You frown. "Was betraying me not good enough for you," you sneer. "You have to come and rub your advice back in my face, too?"
The man shrugs. His eye is still swollen, his face still littered with cuts. "If you don't want my help, fine." He gestures calmly out across the grassy plain, where you can plainly see the distant shapes of the boar archers scrambling toward you. "Course, they're your only other alternative."
