You stand there a moment with your mouth hanging stupidly open, but for some reason you cannot say. Then it comes to you:

"I...I can't remember!"

"You cannot recall your name? No matter." He pats the white fairy bottle, and you notice that he has plenty more fairies of different colors. "Shall I grant you the wish of a name, then?"

"Y...Yes." You're failing to catch your breath.

"I shall call you Akemi, then. And what will your real wish be, my dear Akemi?"

He smiles so brightly at you and claps his hands together, as if he was praying to you. Maybe he wants you to journey with him!
15211112.title: Make a Wish (F)

choices: Stop, Soliloquy! Please free the fairies!
152111121.content:
Moments later you find yourself walking by his side, with his arm around you. It's obvious he likes you, and you're sure you like him, but you can't help wondering why that fairy is so sad. So you ask him:

"Soliloquy, what is your fairy crying for?"

"It's nothing. Fairies are depressed easily." From behind his back he grabs a bow and arrow, and apparently is not answering your question. He stops and aims for a target on the tree, smiling vainly. "Want to see something my father taught me?"

"What?"

"I'll show you, if you want."

All of a sudden all his fairies start panicking, pounding with all their might on their glass tombs. Soliloquy bites his lip and gulps; he looks worried.
152111121.title: Soliloquy's Secret (F)

choices: White, like the color of Soliloquy's robes...
Black, like the color of his bow...
1521111212.content:
Soliloquy exchanges his normal arrow with a golden one from his pack, that radiates with gold, and aims at the tree before you. He's sweating violently, and doesn't seem to want to go through with what he's doing. The fairies are all crying. And suddenly, it seems he will do the same.

"I can't," he mutters, dropping his arrow. "They did nothing to me."

You watch him sigh and open the fairy bottles, puzzled, and gasp as they flutter to the tree, now smiling, happy and free. They all roost on different branches, and their branches glow in their own colors: red, white, gold, black, and blue.

"I'm sorry Father, please forgive me..." Soliloquy prays, and then turns to me. "Akemi means beautiful, like the gold of this arrow."

You're flattered, but speechless.

"Before Father returns, pick a fairy that gold matches best with. That fairy will decide our destiny."

Still speechless.

"You don't believe me?"

"Oh, I do!" you say, and study the colors. Blue would never match, and red, too bold. Black and white are your last choices. Which do you choose?
1521111212.title: Fairies of Destiny (F)

15211112121.content:
"White," you say, gazing at the faery tree.

"White." Soliloquy smiles. "White it is."

He beckons to a faery that glows like a pearl from the moon, and she flutters closer, trilling shrilly. The three of you are engulfed suddenly in a shimmering mist. For a second you panic, but then an image starts to form in the mist. You and Soliloquy are walking down the path, when the road abruptly splits off in three directions-right, left, and one path turning straight back. An image of the wizard stands in the center of the one to the right. A swarm of multicolored faeries support an picture of an enticing faery city shining with jewels on the left path. Soliloquy himself gestures toward the U-turn, a pleading expression on his face. Then, the mist fades away with the image, and you and Soliloquy stand blinking at each other, mystified.

Then, he shrugs, clears his throat, and remarks, "Well, we had better get going. Let's bid the faeries goodbye." You incline your head toward the faeries in an expression of farewell, letting your glance linger on the one with a pearl glow.
15211112121.title: Choices galore (F)

152111121211.content:
You and Soliloquy continue on the path, but you are still mystified by the vision you have just seen. The secret of the conflict between the good and evil forces of this world are making you more and more curious too.

"What are you thinking about?" Soliloquy asks.

You realize you have been silent for quite a while now, and you long to ask him to share his knowledge with you.

"Soliloquy?" you ask, "Is there really going to be a war soon? Everything seems so peaceful and untouched here. It frightens me to think it will all fall apart soon."

"Akemi, it is a long story and one that saddens me."

He pauses for a while, seemingly wanting to share the knowledge with you but afraid to because of the sadness it brings to his heart.

He begins to tell you the story Molgaetha, the world in which you have found yourself:

"For hundreds of thousands of years Molgaetha was a peaceful land. Humans, orcs, elves, goblins, faeries, and all creatures of the Great Dark Forest lived together in harmony. Then for some unexplainable reason things began to change. All beings began to drift to the far corners of Molgaetha. The wizards settled in the far far north. The orcs and the dark elves moved to the far east. The good elves moved south. Humans inhabited the west.
The Great Dark Forest was left empty, except for the faeries that took to the trees.
The beings of Molgaetha forgot their former peace. Something happened to them as they left the Forest. Some say they were faced with a decision...a path of choices."

Soliloquy paused here as if something pained him.

Yet, he continued, "Depending on which path they chose they became either good or evil. Their memories were erased and they forgot their former friends. The peace of Molgaetha vanished forever."

You remember your vision of the three paths, and wonder if that had anything to do with this path of choices Soliloquy was talking about.

"Soliloquy, why are the faeries crying?" you ask.

"That is something I have yet to understand," he replies.

"Where are you heading now?"

"To the northern border of the Great Dark Forest. I have been sent to understand the mysteries of the Swamp of the Ghost River."

Your conversation ends and you continue to walk beside Soliloquy as you continue your path through the Great Dark Forest.
152111121211.title: The conflict revealed

15211112122.content:
"Black," you say, gazing at the faery tree.

"Black." Soliloquy smiles. "Black it is."

He beckons to a faery that glints darkly, and she flutters closer, trilling shrilly. The three of you are engulfed suddenly in a shimmering mist. For a second you panic, but then an image starts to form in the mist. You and soliloquy are walking down the path, when the road abruptly splits off in three directions-right, left, and one path turning straight back. An image of the wizard stands in the center of the one to the right. A swarm of multicolored faeries support an picture of an enticing faery city shining with jewels on the left path. Soliloquy himself gestures toward the U-turn, a pleading expression on his face. Then, the mist fades away with the image, and you and Soliloquy stand blinking at each other, mystified.

Then, he shrugs, clears his throat, and remarks, "Well, we had better get going. Let's bid the faeries goodbye."

You incline your head toward the faeries in an expression of farewell, letting your glance linger on the one with a dark gleam.
15211112122.title: Choices galore (F)

choices: I wish to arrive at the edge of the forest instantly...
152111122.content: You bite your lip thoughtfully, tugging at your hair absentmindedly. After a short reverie, you narrow your wishes down to two: To get to your destination instaneously or to have the boy free a faery, since they do look so glum.
152111122.title: Choosing a wish (F)

choices: Stay and try talking to Quarzia.
1521111221.content:
"Could you please free a fairy? That is my wish."

Soliloquy hesistates, but nods. "Which one shall I liberate?"

"The white one, the one I was about to free, please."

Soliloquy acknowledges this with a slight inclining of his head. A worried expression resides on his face, but he pries off the lid anyways.

"May I present Quarzia?"

The white one flew out, chittering incomrehensibly, an cruel glint just barely flickering in her eyes. She flutters high above you in a tree, batting her wings furiously, obviously pouting.

"Why do you capture the fairies, Soliloquy?"

"It's a long story, and the sun is starting to sink low. If you will come with me to my house, I will tell you. Otherwise, we must part. Not even I dare stay exposed to the nightfall of this forest."
1521111221.title: Faeries

choices: Answer honestly - the bird was annoying!
Lie - you were aiming for the sack!
1521112.content:
You sigh at this annoying bird. So impatient he is! You don't even know if he's lead you in the right direction.
You are tired of his flapping and pecking at your shoulder. You are sure he has broken the skin.
You find a nice stone on the ground, place it in the pocket of the sling and pull back. You take aim at the bird who is waiting, although quite impatiently.
Aim...aim...and shoot!
The rock soars through the air and thumps the bird right in the head! You are a better aim than you thought!
The bird's eyes roll back as he falls to the ground. His wings refuse to put him in flight and he lands with a hard thump on the ground.
You aren't quite sure if he's dead or just stunned, but at least he's quiet and not fluttering and pecking about!

"Stupid bird," you mutter.

It's then that you hear a woman's voice behind you. Here voice is soft and kind, but certainley questioning.

"Why have you done this?"
1521112.title: Stupid Bird (F)

choices: Finish the bird off - You believe the woman.
Try to save the bird - You do not believe the woman.
15211122.content:
Your eyes grow wide as your hear her voice. You did not realize there was someone near.
You turn around to face her. She's tall, dressed in a white and yellow robe. Her hair is golden blonde and she wears a headband of sparkling diamonds. At least they seem like diamonds! Her eyes are a fair blue, like the oceans back home.

She seems kind, and you have not the heart to tell the truth.

"I didn't mean to hit the bird," you say with an upset expression, working on briging tears to your eyes. "I was trying to hit that bag up there next to where he was perched! I'm afraid I'm not a very good shot!"

She looks at you for a moment, expressionless. Slowly an amused smile spreads across her face. She walks up to the motionless bird, kneeling down beside it.

"Is....is he dead?" you stammer.

Still looking at the bird she replies, "Unfortunatley, no. Why don't you try again."

"What?" You are completely confused.

The woman looks up at you and repeats, "Why don't you take another shot at him. You are in close range now. You could even throw the rock and not bother with the sling."

You say nothing, but stare at her shocked.

She stands and continues, "This is no ordinary black bird. This is a raven. A dark raven sent from the Dark Castle in the west. The evil forces there send ravens out, to lead trusting souls such as yourself astray. You are journeying west, towards the Dark Castle. A mile farther and you would have come to the edge of the forest, and open to attack from even darker forces. If you are wise, you'll finish this evil creature off now. When he awakes, he will surely alert his masters of your location. They will hunt you down and kill you."

You stand silent and shocked as the woman hands you a stone.
15211122.title: Stunned (F)

152111221.content:
You take the stone, but hesistate. Evil or not, you do not want to see its blood, and decide to burn it. Striking two quarz rocks together hard, you coax the sparks upon a small water-surrounded pile of leaves. When the fire is high enough, you truss the bird up with yarn and drop him in. Soon it is nothing but cinders.
The woman nods approvingly. "You understood the truth. Could you take some time off your travels to rest with my family?"
152111221.title: Burned Heretic

152111222.content:
You cup your hands protectively around the bird. "I do not believe you. What reason do I have to believe you?"

The woman smiles at you, this time with a hint of amusement. "Why would I believe that you were aiming for the sack?"

You blush, but hold your head high. "Whether I was or was not is none of your concern. I was told to be careful who I trust. This bird, however annoying, has helped me avoid many perils in this forest thus far."

"Yes you should be careful who you trust. That bird is not to be trusted. He is leading you astray. I know who you are and I know where you are to be going. If you will come to me, I will show you the way. The sun is sinking fast, and night in this forest is deadly."
152111222.title: Judgement Day

152112.content:
"A sling shot does me no good, you stupid bird," you say to the black bird.

You walk away from the sling shot towards the edge of the forest.
Suddenly you feel something hard hit the back of your head.
You turn to see a strange creature with the sling shot. He has been following you.
He fires another stone and it hits you between the eyes.
Your vision fades as you fall towards your death.

(Never refuse a weapon!)

The End.
152112.title: you are dead (F)

15212.content:
Sitting down on a large rock, you consider which direction to take. You suddenly remember reading a book about the pioneers and thier long journeys. Inspecting the rock you are sitting on, you see grass on the back of it. From your readings this means that way is north.

You waste no time in beginning your journey, pleased with yourself for recalling such useful information! Soon you come upon a well beaten path, following it as it meanders north. The forest is peaceful and calm and you wonder what could possibly be frightening about this place, except for the fact that you are alone.

You are so engrossed in your thoughts, you are startled when you notice a shadow ahead.
Creeping slowly towards it, you begin to make out an unusual form sitting on a rock beside the path. Upon closer inspection, you see it is a blue-green colored creature, only 3' tall. He is turned so his side is facing you, but he does not seem hostile. He is humming a strange little tune that seems to catch on the wind and dance to your ears.

Will you speak to the creature? Will you try to pass by, ignoring him? Maybe you should divert your course altogether.



(This chapter was altered, and a combination of several chapters...thank you to "poodle" for contributing the creature idea.)
15212.title: Sticks and Stones May Break our Bones

152121.content:
Your curiosity is overwhelming, you must see this creature, and no amount of fear will stop you. Slowly, you meander toward the 3' tall creature, trying to look nonchalant, as you are trembling with fear. He eyes you with a smile.
"Young Master, are you well today?"
"Why are you calling me 'young master'?"
"I am your trainer, yet you are my Master, Young Master." He bowed, revealing a smooth flat grayish-green top of a head.
"I am to train you all I know, if not more... I know two equally very important vital skills. I know water magic and shifting magic. Although I can try to teach you all I know, the river said this will likely not be so. This is because the river can hear a disturbance, a dark shadow coming. That shadow is coming for me. I can not resist this shadow. I know it comes for me. I will not even try [to resist]. You most likely can. But, this shadow will disrupt your training, for I will be gone. You may only be able to learn one thing. So, your choice is important. Young Master, my name is Pogrebin. Make your choice, Young Master, for much work there is to be done."
152121.title: Pogrebin

choices: Skip the lesson, you can't let the dark shadow take Pogrebin
1521212.content:
"Please tell me, what is shifter magic?" Shifter sounded very unusual whereas water sounded very common.

"Allow me to demonstrate, Young Master!" Pogrebin hopped about the clearing, appearing to zip so quickly, although he hardly broke a sweat.

Seeing the confusion in your eyes, he stopped for a moment and asked you to cup his tiny body in your hands.

"Remember, don't open your hands until I tell you," he said.

Taking him in your right palm, you covered his head with your left. So weightless was the little blue green creature was that you weren't certain that you really held him in your hands. Your palms were about to sweat when suddenly you felt a tug at your ear lobe.

"You can open your hands now, I've shifted to your shoulder, Young Master."

"So shifting is teleporting?" you asked, delighted that such a skill could be taught.

"No, no... Teleportation is different. Shifting has some common effects but it is not, is not teleportation." Poor little Pogrebin looked upset to have his magical gift misunderstood.

"I shift..." Suddenly you see a little black bird like the one that landed on your shoulder. He hovered inches from your nose before shifting into a butterfly. He landed on the rock and disappeared completely.

Finally, Pogrebin reappeared and bowed.
1521212.title: Shifter Magic

choices: Go it on your own - trust no one
152122.content:
Unsure of the creature, you divert your course as to not be detected. You go to the right, take a long loop around. Soon, you find yourself at the edge of the forest looking out into a vast array of rocky, cavernous terrain. You were instructed to go north and wait at the edge of the forest, and at the edge of the forest you were, but were you in the right location since you diverted course?

A shrill scream pierces the air, causing you to nearly jump out of your skin. Looking up, a giant bird like creature is approaching. As it nears, you can hardly believe your eyes. It looks like a Terradactil! It is approaching you at an alarming rate and you turn to run back into the forest. You run for a dense patch of undergrowth, thinking the giant beast won't be able to reach you there. You ignore the pain of the thorns digging into your skin and force your way inside the mess of vines and thin branches. The beast follows, his screech so loud it makes your ears ring in pain. He pecks at the undergrowth, gradually breaking and pulling pieces out to get to you. He is succeeding faster than you had hoped as you struggle to escape out the other side.

Finally managing to free yourself, you run farther into the forest, praying the beast does not follow. However, he sees you and immediately abandons the undergrowth in favor of chasing a tasty meal (you!). He has is just about to reach for you with his long beak as you duck, covering your head in one last feeble attempt to protect yourself.

Instead of feeling the pain of a sharp beak, you hear the beast screech and stop. Looking behind you, you see a black cloud, where the beast must be. No time to think this one through, you take your chance and run, climbing a tree and hiding among the branches and leaves. You watch as the cloud slowly dissapates, revealing a very confused bird beast. It shakes its head and turns to go out of the forest. You sigh in relief, wondering what just happened.

"Are you a fellow traveler?" a voice next to you asks, startling you again.

Turning, an elf is behind you in the tree! Your jaw drops in surprised, speechless as to what to say.

The dark elf smiles, a handsome face with piercing green eyes and blue black hair streaming down his back like a river.

"Are you okay?" he asks.

"Y..y..yes," you stammer. "I think I'm okay. Some nasty scratches perhaps. Are you a traveler?"

"Yes, I am. And you are welcome for saving your life. Do you not have any weapons or abilities to defend yourself with?"

"Um..." you begin, still feeling stunned.

"Are you making your way to the Dark Castle?"

"I was instructed to go north to the edge of the forest."

"North?" the elf asks with raised eyebrows. "I'm afraid you have veered off course, then. This is east. I expect you will be in danger here. Would you like me to lead you north? I could offer companionship and protection and then be on my own journey to the east."

"I was told to be careful who I trust," you reply sheepishly.

"Yes," he replied smiling graciously, "so was I! We are in the same boat. My name is Liam. What is yours?"

Feeling more at ease with the elf you begin to relax. "My name is Anna."

"Shall we start our journey, Anna?" the elf says, offering to help you descend down the tree.
152122.title: Divert your course (F)

choices: You choose to go back home to have a chance to find Liam
You choose to stay in this world with Liam
1521221.content:
You smile your best smile and nod your head in agreement. You can't argue with a handsome companion such as he. As you both walk through the forest, he tells you his story of how he came to be here, which is much the same as yours, however he chose to be an elf with the powers of darkness on his side. He has been experimenting and had only just learned how to do the dark cloud that he surrounded the beast with before he had to use it. He had not seen any other travelers yet, so it was a comfort to find you. He had noticed some other creatures in the forest, however, and there seemed to be no end to the surprises here. You find Liam intriguing and interesting and you love to watch him move so agile over obstacles in his path. His hooded cloak flowed behind him in waves of dark gray, so gracefully he wore it that it did not get hung up in stray branches or vines. He moved silently through the forest, careful not to disturb it. He had a beautiful grace about him that was mesmorizing. The sun was close to setting as you approached the north edge of the forest.

"Here is the north edge," he said. "Looks like a lot of swamp. I can't say I envy your path."

"I can't say I do, either! So, I hope whoever I'm supposed to meet shows up soon," you reply.

"Yes, it will be getting dark soon."

"What about you?" you ask. "You'll never make it back through the forest before nightfall."

"How about I stay with you?" he offered. "We will make a camp here together - you know, safety in numbers."

"I would like that," you reply with a grin. "I feel much safer with you around."

You and Liam gather wood and stones for a fire and it isn't long before you both are snuggled together in front of the warm flames. Liam put his cloak around your shoulders and arm around your waist to help keep you warm. There was no lack of conversation between the two of you.

"Liam, I wish we had chosen the same path."

Liam smiled and his eyes glistened in the firelight, "Yes, me too. I like you. It will be a shame to leave you in the morning."

"Is there any changing our destination?"

"That I do not know," he replied. "Maybe the wizard could, but I would not know how to summon him. For now we should probably get some rest."

You agree and you and Liam settle down, snuggled together for warmth. His warm, protective embrace leaves you feeling both energized and relaxed at the same time. It takes a while for you to drift off to sleep, but when it comes it is sweet.

The morning sun shining through the sparse trees awakens you both. You both gather fruits and berries for breakfast. Afterwards, you both walk to the edge of the forest. Swamp as far as you can see to the left and right.

"So, you were told to just wait here?" Liam asks.

"Yes," you respond reluctantly. "Not an ideal place to be just hanging around. So hopefully I'll get some instruction soon."

"Or you could always come with me," Liam suggested.

Your eyes averted to the ground. "I'm not sure. It's not that I don't want to be with you, it's more of that I don't know what will happen if I go with you."

"Neither of us knows what will happen no matter what choice we make."

"Maybe you could come with me?" you suggest.

Liam's eyes shine beautifully in the morning sun and you can sense his desire to be with you. He is toying with the thought of staying with you. His eyes are entrancing. His lips, delectible. And you can't help but switch your view back and forth between them. You naturally lean in and Liam mirrors your actions, until your lips join in a tender kiss. You feel a jolt of electricity down your spine as the energy from his kiss floods your soul.

"Wow," you whisper.

Just then, a bright light appears. It is the wizard you saw initially. He must be here on your account.

"You have made it this far, young traveler. Congratulations," the wizard spoke. "You now need to decide if you would like to join forces with the wizards or the humans."

"Are they on the same side?" you ask.

The wizard looks sad, "unfortunately, no. You will have to choose."

You look at Liam and question again, "And what side is Liam on?"

"If you choose the humans, you will be in agreement with Liam."

"Can I accompany him? Or can he accompany me?"

The wizard thinks for a moment before replying, "I could arrange this. However, I cannot guarantee protection from any misunderstandings that may occur. You would have your difficulties."

"What if I don't want to take sides?" you ask. "This is not my war. I didn't ask to come here or be a part of it. What if I choose to remain neutral?"

The wizard looks somewhat surprised. "Do you really not have the heart for it?"

"Right now, my heart is somewhere else," you say shyly, glancing at Liam.

Liam smiles and takes your hand in his. The wizard raises his eyebrows in interest.

"Liam, what are your thoughts on the matter?" the wizard inquires thoughtfully.

Liam pauses, taking it all in, before replying, "I did not expect any of this, but I cannot deny I have feelings for her. Can you not find someone else? Do you really need us for this war? And what good does it do when you don't even know what side people will choose? You work for both your cause and the cause of the enemy. What I would like is to return home to my life, as much as an adventure this is, and is appealing in many ways, I also know my life is at great risk."

The wizard nodded, "I will comply with your wishes. Confirm your wishes and they will be so."
1521221.title: Accept the elf's companionship

choices: Agree with Liam to fight w/wizards and woodland elves
15212212.content:
"Before I make a decision, I would like to know what I am fighting for. You never told me what the war was about. How can I possibly choose a side?" you ask.

The wizard nods, "Of course. The war involves everyone. The humans and dark elves against the wizards and woodland elves. It might seem I am being biased, as I am a wizard, however, I must remain neutral. The humans and dark elves are scarring the land. This world was once all beautiful and full of life. The humans have polluted it and the dark elves have stripped it. Entire river systems run dry in places. Swamps have taken over large portions, souring the land. Evil has been left to run unchecked in their territories, as they only care for themselves. The wizards have always been the general overseers, and the woodland elves the gardeners, if you will. But we all have to do our part, and there is only so much the woodland elves can do. This time the humans and dark elves have gone too far and they are gradually expanding their death into the great forest, cutting down trees, burning sections off, damaging the land further for their own selfish gain. If they are allowed to continue, the entire world will be covered in ruin in a matter of 5 years. We want, at the very least, for their boundaries to be clear and halted from expanding. At the most, we want restoration and peace. The dark elves and humans will say this is all in the name of progress and they are only doing what is lucrative and beneficial to all. The humans develop medicines that help others, however, we already have a healthy system in place. If they would stop polluting and damaging the place, they would not need medicines. They won't listen of course."

Liam scowls. "Why did you not mention this previously. I might have chose a different path."

"Your inner nature chooses your path for you," the wizard replies. "The path you have chosen suits you, even if you do not realize it."

Liam scowled again, in disbelief. "I will prove you wrong, wizard. I want to fight on the side of the wizards and woodland elves."

The wizard raised his eyebrows, "that is noble. So be it, but at your own risk. And what of you, my dear?"
15212212.title: You choose to stay in this world with Liam

152122121.content:
"I will continue on this path. Thank you for explaining what this is about. And I'm happy Liam is joining me," you smile and glance his direction. "So, what now then?" you ask the wizard.

"I will now grant you the ability to fly," the wizard says and before you can react his staff has pointed your direction and consumed you in light.

A strange tingling heat sensation comes over your body as the power of the wizard envelops you. Almost as soon as it came, it leaves and the light fades from the wizard's staff. The wizard looks amused by your surprised expression.

"Now you may journey to the far north to the wizards. You will learn things on your journey and gain skills."

The wizard produces a staff and hands it to you. It looks like a regular walking stick.

"Stay safe, my friend," says the wizard as in a flash he is gone.

You look at Liam, "well, that's that then. I guess we should be going."

"Except I'm hungry," he replied "and we have still got a long way to go. Let me find something for us to eat. Why don't you start a fire and I will come back with something to cook."

"Yeah, good idea," you say, even though you are eager to get moving away from the smelly swamp.

You obligue Liam by starting a fire and constructing a rotissery . It isn't long before he comes back with a few quail. To your shock, they have already been plucked and prepared for cooking. It didn't seem he had been gone long enough to do all of that. You aren't sure you want to know how he did it so quickly. You sit and chat while the birds are cooking, the smell of the roast makes your mouth water. It also attracts a few unexpected guests.

You hear rustling in the forest. Liam silences you with fingers to lips and peers into the forest.

"We have company," he announces.

It isn't long before the culprit of the noise makes an appearance. It is a young woman with long light blond hair and crystal blue eyes. She has a sweet face and her white clothes are dirty from her journey. She looks happy to see you, but a little wary of Liam.

"Hi, I come in peace and all that," she says. "I'm a traveler. Are you both travelers as well?"

"Yes, we are," you reply.

As you introduce yourselves, the woman, Miranda, is eyeing the food, clearly famished. Liam doesn't have a friendly look on his face. However, you see no harm, after all, you gave him a chance, so why not another traveler?

"Are you hungry, Miranda?" you ask the woman.

"Yes, very," she replies. "I haven't eaten since I came here a couple of days ago."

"You may join us," you offer. "I'm sure there's enough for us all."

Liam scowled, muttering, "hardly."

Miranda smiled feebly, slightly uncomfortable at Liam's passive objection. The quails were not particularly big, so even though there was a quail each, it didn't quite satisfy the hunger. It would have to do, however.

"Where are you journeying to, Miranda?" you ask.

"To the wizards in the north," she replies.

"That is where we are going as well."

Miranda looks puzzled, "Oh? Liam, you are going north?"

"Yes," he replies flatly.

"But, you are a dark elf. Shouldn't you be travelling a different direction?"

"I was, but I've changed my mind."

"Can we do that?" Miranda asks wide eyed.

"Why? Looking to change your course?" Liam quizzed.

Miranda shrugged, "I'm just surprised is all. I didn't expect that. So, the wizard left you a dark elf. Won't that be a complication heading north?"

"I expect it will, but if they are as wise as they say they are, they should be able to see my true intentions."

Miranda nodded in acceptance of Liam's theory as they finished up their meal.

"So, are you two okay if I travel with you?" Miranda asks. "This swamp doesn't look particularly friendly to cross. Maybe if we work together we can make it easier."

You remember your power of flight, and wonder if you will be able to carry the others across. Alternatively, there is plenty of wood to build a raft and cross that way.
152122121.title: Agree with Liam to fight w/wizards and woodland...

152122122.content:
"You know, I just want to go home," you say. "I don't want to get involved in this. This isn't my world so not my problem. My world has enough problems to deal with. I don't need additional."

You glance at Liam, who seems disappointed, especially now since he chose to go the way you were. He knows it is your choice to make, and says nothing.

"So be it," the wizard said with a hint of sadness in his voice.

He pointed his staff towards you before you even got a chance to say goodbye. With a flash of light you awoke to find yourself in your own bed.

"Wow, what an amazing dream," you say out loud to the empty room.

You turn on the television, because there is no way you could sleep after a dream like that. The news is on, showing the destruction of ancient rain forests, extreme pollution and smog in cities filled with grey ugly boxes, babies being murdered because they are not the "right" gender, people being oppressed and abused, and to top it off taxes are being raised again. You feel helpless against these things - powerless that you could make a difference. You wonder if you could have made a difference in that dream world. You think about Liam and sigh, turning off the television to try to dream again.
152122122.title: Go home

1521222.content:
"Liam, I appreciate your help and your offer of companionship. But I got the feeling this was a journey I would have to make on my own. If you could but point the way north, I will be on my way. It wouldn't be fair of me to take you away from your own journey."

You swear you saw a glint of disappointment in his emerald eyes, but he put on a brave face.

"If that is your wish, Anna. I do sincerely wish you a safe journey."

With a blink of an eye, he was gone, disappearing into the shadows that were beginning to grow long. Too much time had been wasted by you diverting your course. You would not reach the edge of the forest before nightfall now.

You run. You run because it is faster than walking. You run until the darkness consumes the forest and you can no longer see where you are going. With no choice but to stop, you do. You climb the nearest tree and secure yourself onto a large branch, figuring it is safer in the trees than on the ground.

The night brings strange noises of all kinds. Some sound human, most don't. You didn't sleep particularly well, and as soon as the morning light came, you were down the tree on your way. It was afternoon before you reached the edge of the forest and your stomach complains loudly for skipping meals. You groan as you see a swamp. As far as you know, you have travelled to the north edge of the forest. But who are you looking for? The Wizard did not say. Should you sit and wait or try to continue forward?
1521222.title: Go it on your own - trust no one

15212222.content: Seeing no one to receive instruction from, you decide time is wasting and it would be best to keep moving. Grabbing a nearby fallen branch, you test the depth of the swamp. It is not even up to your knees so you take a step. You venture farther and farther out into the mirky, stagnant mess. Suddenly, you see movement in the water. It comes from the left. Then the right. It seems to be surrounding you. Something strong wraps around your calf and yanks your leg out from underneath you. You flap about in the muck like a fish out of water, as whatever it is drags you further into the swamp. The creature is way too strong, and there is no one to rescue you. Not long after you take in the stale. stinky swamp water, the creature takes you into it's gaping mouth in one big gulp.
15212222.title: Continue to cross the swamp

choices: Hide further back in the tree.
Stick your head out further to get a better view.
1522.content:
You feel confused and tired from your encounter with the Wizard, and search for a place to rest. The large roots of the trees would make a nice spot, but you want something more sheltered. You are unfamiliar with these woods and want to be as protected as possible.

You soon come upon a large tree with a hole inside, just big enough to fit through. You decide this is perfect and crawl inside to take a nap.

Some time has past when you awaken to strange noises. As you peek outside, you see a group of disgusting looking creatures. They are dark, big and ugly. Their eyes are black as night and their nostrils flare with the evilness they breathe. They seem to be hunting, for they are armed with bows and arrows and scouting out the area. It's unclear what they are hunting for exactly, and you hope it is not you!
1522.title: Tree Nap (F)

choices: You decide to climb up in the tree.
You decide to stay where you are and wait.
15221.content:
These creatures are beyond hideous. You count 4 of them from your narrow view. You hope they have are not keen with their sense of smell, as you push yourself back in the tree.
Looking up, you see the tree seems to be hollowed out for a ways. You can fit if you tried to climb up but, you might make too much noise and attract the hunters. Of course, there is always the chance they'll find you if you don't get completely out of view.
15221.title: Tree Choice (F)

choices: Climb up a little further and look out the opening.
Stay where you are, completely out of sight.
152211.content:
You decide that the risk of making noise is less than the risk of them seeing where you are. The last thing you want is for them to find you. No telling what unspeakable horrors they would inflict.
You stand to your feet inside the tree. You reach up, feeling around, trying to find something to grab on to. To your surprise, you can feel notches carved out!
You place your hands in the notches, pulling yourself up, using the same notches for your feet as well. These have been strategically carved, especially for climbing up inside the tree. As you climb higher and higher, the inside begins to narrow. You can see places where light is shining through and realize through these holes you could crawl out on a branch. But to do that would risk being seen.
From inside the hollow tree, you can hear the creatures outside, grunting to each other. They do not seem to be going anywhere and they sound very close.
Suddenly, the grunts turn to cries of agony. You can hear rustling as they scramble around. You can't see what is happening, but it seems they are under attack! Who is attacking them? Who is winning? What is going on? Do you risk being seen to find out?
152211.title: Up Up & Away (F)

choices: Run before you are shot yourself!
1522111.content:
You climb up a few more notches and look out the opening. Your eyes widen as you look out on the strong branch. There is someone sitting on the branch with a bow and he's shooting those horrible creatures!
You look down at the creatures and see that there are more arrows coming from different directions. The arrows pierce their thick skin, as blood forms around the wounds. The aim of the arrows is sharp, hitting heads and hearts. You fail to see any misses! The evil creatures are confused and cannot determine from whence the arrows come. Even you cannot see who is shooting, or tell how many their are.
It is not long before the evil creatures lay dead on the forest floor. You stare, jaw dropped, eyes wide, until your thoughts are interrupted. You realize that now you are being watched - not only watched, stared at. You raise your head to the branch, as your are face to face with the treetop warrior.
1522111.title: TreeTop Warriors (F)

15221112.content:
"Hello Tree Warrior. I'm sorry if I disturbed you. I crawled into this tree hollow to take a nap. I thought the evil ones were going to get me so when I awoke I climbed up to get away from them. I didn't know it belonged to someone..."

You see the warrior's expression change as you speak. Your words are stopped by a hand over your mouth.

"You must be silent," a voice whispers in your ear. "There may be more of them."

You nodd in understanding and turn around to face the one who silenced you.

"Are you one of the Woodland Elves? What was that all about?" you whisper as softly as possible.

"We are the white elves of the northen realm. You need not to know anymore right now."

"I need to know if you plan to kill me."

The elf does not seem shocked, despite your directness. He does not speak to answer it. The elf on the branch has jumped off without a sound, and is now on the ground inspecting the dead bodies. Quickly more elves appear and begin to drag the bodies away into hiding.

"Stay here where you are safe."

The elf leaves you alone inside the tree as he joins the others, discussing something you cannot hear.
15221112.title: Treetop Encounters

choices: Your force yourself awake and make your way out of the tree
You go deeper and deeper into the sweet smell of sleep
152211121.content:
You aren't sure why they wanted you to stay, but perhaps they will give you some insight into your journey or provide you with valuable information. A bite to eat wouldn't be bad either.

"Well" you think "I did want to rest" so you nestle in for that energizing nap you wanted before you begin your journey.

As you begin to relax and settle in, you notice the subtle scent of jasmine. You wonder where it is coming from since you don't remember seeing any jasmine bushes around. "Gee", you think, as your mind begins to drift, "a dream within a dream" and you seem to fade into a swirl of sweet darkness.

The scent of jasmine becomes stronger, so much so that your head begins to ache and your stomach becomes uneasy. "This is not good" you think to yourself. "I have to get away from this"
152211121.title: Interupted Nap

choices: Do you peek outside through a hole and risk being seen?
Or do you continue hiding inside the trunk a hope they go away?
1522112.content: You decide to stay where you are. After all whatever is attacking them might be just be something even worse. The screaming continues outside but you can hear many running footsteps and decide that the creatures whatever they were gave up on the fight. After a few moments it goes quiet but you can still here what sounds like one persons footsteps wandering around outside. Your curiosity is piqued, after all it might be someone friendly (and it'd be mighty handy having someone that can obviously fight around) but then again it could be someone looking to do you in...
1522112.title: to Peek or not to Peek

choices: Do you wait calmy for your seemingly emminent doom are the possibility that this
Or beg for mercy like a groveling dog?
15221121.content:
You climb up as quietly as you can hoping that whoever or whatever is outside won't hear you. Reaching the hole you peer down and spot someone crouching down looking at something in the soil.
He has short tan hair and a Quiver of arrows on his back,and as you look closer you notice he has pointed ears and a a wooden bow in his hand. An elf! But is he friendly or was he sent by one of the evil forces from the west and east of the forest? You want to ponder this some more but he doesn't give you the chance. Before you have time to act the elf whirls around drawing an arrow from his quiver and fires a shot directly at you! Trying to dodge to the right it misses your head but feel it graze your shoulder and moving with incredible force it stabs into your jacket and pins you to the back of the tree trunk. Hanging there you try to grab one of the notches in the tree but none of them are the right spots to be of any help! Great now your found out, helplessly pinned to a tree, and looks like this guy is definitely not one of the friendly elves.
15221121.title: How a dart board must  feel!

choices: Leave the tree and try to make a run for it.
Put your hands in your pocket and hope you forgot something usefull in there.
152212.content:
The creatures tromp through the forest noisily. Their pudgy noses are moist with snot and their watery eyes scan the area. There is little visibility in the forest. The trees have gnarly limbs that intersect at odd angles. The branches are covered in moss and occasionally fungus. The leaves are so thick that they block most of the light. What does filter down is a hazy green glow that makes the forest shadows deeper and darker than they are.

One of the creatures stops short. His dark, thick skin shines with a slight dampness that could be sweat. A funny red hat flops sideways as he turns his head abruptly in your direction. One of his friends almost runs him over at the quick transition from walking to stillness.

Mr. red-hat looks directly at you, sniffs the air, and begins to walk brusquely in your direction. His buddies catch on and fan out behind him. They look at you hungrily and your heart leaps into your throat, beating so fast that you can feel your pulse throbbing in your ears.
152212.title: You decide to stay where you are and wait.

choices: You gallop away on his horse leaving him stranded
You help him by fighting as best you can
15222.content:
You were intrigued by these disgusting look creatures and curiousity had always been your downfall, so you stuck your head out the hole further and were spotted!

A great struggle ensued and you were roughly pulled out from your hiding place, you screamed and thrashed but these creatures were much stronger then you and then you had your first regret of choosing to be a woman, perhaps had you asked the wizard to make you a man your strength would have been enough to defend yourself against these monstrosities!

These creatures continue to breathe noisily and start to poke and prod at you, they look at you like they have never seen one of your species before. You can't stand the smell emenating from them anymore and you scream for help and punch and kick at these ugly creatures.

Shortly, you hear the sounds of horses hoofs and in a cloud of dust appears a man in a long black cloak, he jumps off his horse, and takes his dagger to the creatures, while urging you to run away....
15222.title: saved by a stranger

info.brief_description: Choose your destiny in this fantasy adventure
info.description:
This is a fantasy story - your choices will determine your fate and your destiny.
Choose your character and start reading!
You will be faced with many choices and how you "live" is up to you. There's some action/adventure, romance (or at least a chance at it), and of course, a chance for you to be a part by adding on!

***If you choose to add, please think about what you are adding. Do not add a chapter with one or two sentances - please write something with at least a little substance and meaning. I want you to add, but if it's something that is way out there or doesn't fit in the story, I will edit it (or delete, whichever the case may be). This is for the enjoyment of the entire story and readers. Thanks.***

Here is a map/layout of the area description.
You start out in the center of The Great Dark Forest.

North: The Swamp of the Ghost River. Legend has it this was once a great river, but the forest was jealous and dammed it up on two ends, creating a stagnant, dead swampland. Many disappearances have been attributed to this swamp. Inhabitants: Unknown.

Further North: The Cascading Mountains. These snowy mountains are breathtaking, but a dangerous trek. Inhabitants: Goblins and Dwarves.

Even Further North: The Empire of Light. One of the destinations - a real jewel of a city. Inhabitants: Wizards.

North East: Ending of the Swamp of the Ghost River and beginning of a dried up river bed. Inhabitants: Unknown.

Further North East: Undergound Caverns and rolling hillsides. Inhabitants: Goblins in the caverns.

East: Underground Caverns and a dry riverbed. Inhabitants: Goblins in the caverns.

Further East: Very rocky terrain that turns into deep valleys. Inhabitants: Orcs.

Further East: The Valley of Zar, one of the destinations. A place full of shadows - better watch your back. Inhabitants: Dark Elves.

South East: Forest until it runs out! Ends in a mess.....Tree Miners. Inhabitants: Orcs and Dark Elves.

Further South East: Rocky, dead terrain.

South: Lush, dense forest all the way until you reach the village of Dan'ne Dale (or Dora Moore - depending on your story). Inhabitants: Woodland (good) Elves.

Further South: Deep hills and beautiful forest (not dark). A giant, mighty river (The Great River) that splits 4 different times.

Further South: The Rivers of Dan (all the forks in the Great river), one of the destinations. Inhabitants: Wise Elves

South West: Forest that eventually ends in sharp, drastic cliffs. A river is at the bottom of the cliffs (part of the Great river).

West: Dry river bed with increasingly rocky terrain.

Further West: Drastic cliffs and more rocky terrain.

Even Further West: The Dark Castle, one of the destinations. Inhabitants: Humans.

North West: One end of the Swamp of the Ghost River and the beginning of a dry riverbed. Inhabitants: Unknown.

Further North West: Mines. Inhabitants: Goblins and Dwarves.
